Job Description:
We want to hear from you if you are a creative problem solver with a keen interest in data analytics and a drive to learn and master new knowledge and techniques. If you are interested in working as part of a high-calibre and energetic team and in a dynamic collaborative work environment with a focus on growing data and analytics capability, this role is for you.
Canberra, Melbourne, Sydney
APS Level 5 - $75,726 to $81,762 | APS Level 6 - $83,463 to $94,255 plus 15.4% superannuation
We are seeking a Data & Insights Analyst with a passion for data analytics and telling meaningful stories from insights gained with data. In this role you will work closely with a data and analytics hub of domain experts and part of a growing team of data subject matter experts within the agency.

In this role you will contribute to the delivery of the ACMA’s data and analytics projects and help us better report, derive insights and assist in making our data more accessible. You will have access to a range of datasets for analysis and reporting including consumer survey data, compliance and enforcement data from a range of industries we regulate, and spectrum data such as Radiocommunications licence data.

You will help design and develop interactive reports, dashboards and other data outputs using a variety of data sources to inform the agency and public on communications and media in Australia. You can see some of the teams’ interactive reports on the ACMA website—take a look at our Communications and Media in Australian series.

You will work as part of cross-functional, multi-disciplinary teams to deliver data action projects that solve business problems and deliver actionable insights and build reporting capability on topics such as spectrum and telecommunications performance.

You will have access to a secure cloud-based data analytics platform, which has been purpose designed and built to integrate a range of data for insightful reporting and the development of data visualisations and related products.

This role is perfectly suited for a curious and pragmatic Data & Insights Analyst with high attention to detail, and who is motivated to deliver business insights that can be used to foster data-driven decision making.

We want to hear from you if you are a creative problem solver with a keen interest in data analytics and a drive to learn and master new knowledge and techniques.

If you are interested in working as part of a high-calibre and energetic team and in a dynamic collaborative work environment with a focus on growing data and analytics capability, this role is for you.

Our ideal candidate will have experience in a data orientated role or analytics related field which will have developed their technical skills in the use of data analysis and visualisation software and database tools including PowerBI and SQL.

To succeed in this role, you will need to be able to extract, cleanse, structure and transform, analyse and translate data into easy to understand visualisations. You will need to understand data models and have experience in analysing large and small datasets to discover trends, patterns and actionable insights.

You will need to be able to communicate and engage effectively through data storytelling and synthesise and present results to stakeholders at all levels to support our regulatory decision making. You will have excellent verbal and written communication skills with an ability to document processes and explain data in a way that can be understood by non-technical stakeholders.

We are looking for a candidate who understands the value of collaboration and is able to work with various stakeholder groups. You will make an active contribution working in multi-disciplinary, cross-functional project teams to ensure data deliverables assist the ACMA to achieve its business objectives.

The successful candidate will be someone who can provide support and guidance to end-users on interactive reports and dashboards, and who can assist with enhancing existing reports or gathering requirements for new reports to be developed.

Organisation/Entity: Transport For NSW
Job Category: Regulatory and compliance
Job Location: Sydney, NSW, AU, 2020
Job Ref No: 13718
Employment Type: Permanent Full-Time
Salary Range: $103965.0-$116441.0
About us

Transport for NSW (TfNSW) is the lead agency of the NSW Transport cluster. Our role is to lead the development of a safe, efficient, integrated transport system that keeps people and goods moving, connects communities and shapes the future of our cities, centres and regions. We work with several government agencies to coordinate metro, train, bus, ferry, light rail, road and maritime services, always keeping the safety and comfort of our customers at the heart of what we do.

The Division

The Legal, Privacy and Internal Audit Branch, is within the Corporate Services division providing strategies, solutions and services that make our clients’ working lives easier and their projects more efficient and effective. Our high-performing teams work collaboratively across the organisation, partnering to provide critical advice, analysis and guidance for sensitive and complex matters.

The Opportunity

With the goal of delivering ever greater public value for the people of NSW, our branch is undergoing an organisational transformation including streamlining processes, enhancing the breadth and depth of our internal specialist skill-set and investing in our operational capabilities. With a focus on growing our Branch Operations team, we are seeking 4 x permanent Business Analysts to join our expanding team to undertake roles in process improvement/digital enablement, data analytics and human resources.

Our Business Analysts will support across our branch in process innovation, change management, resource planning and management, data analytics and business reporting. Our business analysts will undertake research and analysis on a variety of business problems and processes to assist with determining the optimal solution to meet requirements, working closely with stakeholders from across the business.

What you will be involved in

Develop process improvements to integrate new systems and processes with existing ones for continuous improvement of service delivery.
Partner with external and internal clients and stakeholders to ensure business improvements align with the long-term business strategies.
Perform regular environmental scans and research analysis and collate, analyse and provide advice for improvements that can be achieved.
Maintain knowledge of current developments in information management and champion the application of innovative techniques for storing, managing, analysing and delivering data.
Assist business as usual and project teams in problem definition, exploration of options to address these problems and propose and document potential solutions.
Manage support, maintenance, and enhancement of business processes.
Work positively as a member of a multidisciplinary team, contributing to the achievement of Branch business outcomes.

About You

You will have tertiary qualifications or demonstrated, relevant, equivalent professional experience.
You will have demonstrated experience, potentially from a consulting background – ideally in change management.
You will be detail-oriented and capable of delivering a high level of accuracy.
You will possess experience delivering on digital enablement, process automation and business process improvement experience and resource management.
You will possess analytical thinking and problem solving.
You will have the ability to work independently and contribute effectively in a collaborative team environment whilst maintaining a high level of work ethic.
You will also possess exceptional communication skills both written and verbal.

Key Knowledge and Experience
Extensive knowledge of business design and improvement processes.
Experience working in customer service and technology environments.

Want to know more?

Please click here to view a copy of the position description

Salary and Benefits

Grade 7 ($103,965 - $116,441) per annum plus superannuation and leave loading.
For more information on Employee Benefits at TfNSW please click here.

Interested?

Joining Transport for NSW, you’ll have access to a range of unique government benefits in a flexible work environment like no other. If you’re ready to step into this meaningful and rewarding role, we want to hear from you!

How to apply

To apply for this position, please submit your resume and a covering letter which identifies your preferred roles and order of preference:
process improvement/digital enablement
data analytics
or human resources

In your covering letter you will also need to answer the following two questions:
1. Describe your contribution to a change management initiative and the artefacts you prepared? (Maximum 350 words)
2. Describe a program of work or project that you had primary responsibility for delivering? (Maximum 350 words)

Apply today to register your interest!

Newly created role within our Online team, own the space and mark your footprint!
Oversee customer engagement for one of Hanes major Retail brands!
Flexible working – enjoy working from home & our Support Office
A little about us
Bras N Things is Australia's leading lingerie retailer, with more than 185 stores across Australia, New Zealand, South Africa, the USA and still growing. At Bras N Things we are committed and passionate about our Vision to “to have a global community of female confidence warriors”- this resonates in everything we do.
This is an exciting time for applicants to join our brand who are aspiring to be part of something big! As we continue to expand our footprint by exploring new markets.

CRM Analyst | Bras N Things | Alexandria, NSW
We have an exciting newly created opportunity within our Bras N things Online division for an experienced CRM Analyst to join our team!
The key areas of responsibility within this role as CRM & Data Analyst include the mining of customer data and presenting insights, reporting and database management to help drive continuous growth of the Online and Retail businesses & associated loyalty programs, as well as provide the broader BNT business with a continuous stream of customer intelligence that can be used to inform decision-making.

Your responsibilities will include:
Analyse & report insights on Bras N Things key customer metrics – purchase frequency, share of wallet and lifetime spend
Analyse and report on loyal engagement, inclusive of sign up conversions, identification, % of transactions and loyalty costs of program
Provide ongoing customer profiling to inform product, pricing, marketing, and store footprint planning decisions
Track performance of new CRM initiatives, including new journeys and A/B testing
Provide recommendations to improve existing and build new reports (documents / dashboards) to track results and provide analysis
Conducting ad hoc data-mining requests from wider business
Help identify customer segments for potential revenue generation through lifecycle targeting, product mapping, product upsells and cross-sells, basket analysis, purchase frequency and category upsell and cross-sells
Help manage the health of the database - subscription, unsubscribes, churn rate, engagement
Ensure delivery of all activity is in line with privacy policy and ACCC consumer law.
What we are looking for…

You have 2-3+ years' experience working in similar CRM Analytics role
Experience in analysing large data sets
Advanced Excel, data manipulation and reporting skills
Strong business acumen and demonstrated experience utilizing Google Analytics or similar analytical platforms
Experience using Tableau or Power BI (desirable)
Knowledge of Database languages such as SQL
You are a person who is naturally inquisitive and detail-oriented, capable of delivering a high level of accuracy
You are a strong team player but also driven and self-motivated to be able to work independently
Completion of a bachelor's degree in a data related field or similar qualification (desirable)
Our Culture
Our Culture is found in the little things…..our focus on customers, communication, team building and the respect that our Team have for each other creates an environment full of passion, proactivity and positive attitudes. We promote collaboration and a supportive environment that allows you the chance to shine! Your goals of growing your career can be realised at Bras N Things through our tailored development programs. Your success is our success!

What can we offer you?

Genuine commitment to global sustainability https://hbisustains.com/
Established and committed LEAN organization offering on-going training to all employees
Huge staff discounts across all the amazing brands in the Hanes portfolio … we're talking huge savings on Bonds, Champion, Sheridan, Bras N Things, Berlei, Jockey – and more!
Sample sales and extended family and friends' discounts
Wellness Programs – regular free skin checks, flu shots, remedial massages, Employee Assistance Program, fresh fruit delivered on-site
Access to awesome perks, including corporate discounts, novated car leasing, Employee Assistance Program, Parental Leave Program
Monthly business updates from our CEO and Senior Leadership Team, with regular presentations from our community partners
“Summer Fun” – take advantage of a half-day leave every fortnight, in addition to your leave allowance, during the summer months and make the most of the sun!
Company-wide “Golden Yarn” Reward & Recognition Program
COVID safe, flexible and relaxed office environment with sit-stand desks
“Lunch & Learn” sessions, with topics including financial management and health & wellness
CULTIVATING A DIVERSE AND INCLUSIVE WORKPLACE
Here at Hanes Brands Australasia, we are focused on cultivating a workplace that is diverse, inclusive and vibrant. In fact, we know our both workplace culture and business are only strengthened by our differences. We encourage our employees to bring their true selves to work and support them to reach their full potential both personally and professionally. Therefore, we warmly welcome people of all genders, races, ages and abilities or any other backgrounds or differences to apply to work with us.

Creating the fabric of a better life for people and the planet:
As a COVID 19 safe environment we are currently working from during the NSW lockdown. Outside of lockdown, we have broken our Sydney team into two, one team will come into the office on Monday and Tuesday and the other team will come in on Thursday and Friday. On Wednesday's, the teams will alternate where one week you will work in the office, the other from home. In these unusual times we are loving staying connected with each other via MS teams.

Job Summary:
Join our team of over 5,000 employees globally, who provide the insights through data and next generation technology that help millions of people find, buy and protect the homes they love. From the beginning, CoreLogic has been driven by a single purpose – to innovate and create solutions that solve our clients’ toughest challenges in the housing market. CoreLogic is the trusted source for property intelligence, with deep knowledge of powerful economic, social, and environmental forces that promote healthy housing markets and thriving communities.
We apply that same dedication to creating a diverse and inclusive work culture that inspires innovation and bold thinking. A place where individuals can work on small teams, feel valued, and directly impact the real estate industry. We believe our team members are the best in the business, and we will continue to recruit, retain, develop and reward our most important asset – our people!
CoreLogic RP Data is the industry's leading provider of property information, analytics and risk management services in Australia and New Zealand, serving thousands of real estate agents, developers, investors and multi-national corporations and financial institutions, including the Reserve Bank of Australia. Our main activity is the delivery of accurate and detailed property information and analytics.
In this role you will be responsible for the delivery of assigned tasks in the areas of data analysis, data extraction, data assessment, documentation and reporting.
Job Description:
A Data Analyst in the fulfillment team has a keen focus on custom data to support our clients needs. You will have a passion for accuracy and automation to drive efficiencies and process improvement across our delivery.
Delivery of custom data extracts including briefing, SQL querying, delivery and after delivery Client support
Data analysis and reporting/presentation of results
Perform as a subject matter expert on the company’s residential data assets
Stakeholder engagement of both internal and external customers
Ensure that all data assets, processes and systems have adequate documentation in place to ensure that there are no single points of failure
Residential Data Reporting on a periodic basis
Identification of data anomalies and reporting them back to the Data Quality Team
Job Qualifications:
To be successful in this role the key competencies required include:
Intermediate technical querying skills in SQL Server essential
Key focus on communication and ability to have your message heard and understood
Excellent attention to detail and focus on accuracy
Ability to time manage and escalate as needed
Delivery oriented and ability to drive towards deadlines
A detailed understanding of data and data structures
Ability to create clarity for stakeholders (technical and non-technical)
Degree qualified in a technical or business related discipline or a minimum of 12 months commercial experience

Role Title: Senior Financial Analyst, Financial Data Analytics
Employment Type: Full Time, Temporary (up to 30 June 2023)

Hours per Week: 35
Location: St Leonards

About this role
The Financial Data Analytics team is a new team and this an opportunity to be part of team that will drive financial sustainability through data insights, data analytics and data visualisations. Each day will be different as you work towards delivering various projects, whilst being part of an agile team developing financial dashboards enable our Senior Executive to make informed decisions.

Where you'll be working
The Branch and Divisions embraces a balance of working in the office and remotely. The office is the start of the art 1 Reserve Road building at St Leonards, which includes various types of workspaces and promotes collaboration through co-locating with other health agencies within the building.

What you'll be doing
There will be some “business as usual” reporting that will be used at Senior Executive meetings, but there will be a lot of new and interesting financial modelling, analytics and dashboard development.

Need more information?
1. Click here for the Role Description
2. Find out more about applying for this position

Role purpose
This position’s primary purpose is to effectively manage and maintain rate setting, margin management and rate distribution to the business within RTS and associated systems in a timely and efficient manner. Active involvement with all key stakeholders is essential. The successful candidate will also support other team members by providing data extraction and manipulation services as well as analytical support, as he grows with the role.
Key accountabilities
Manage and maintain rate setting, margin management and rate distribution
Ensure all margins are updated and correct, as advised by Head of Pricing & Commercial Operations.
Calculate all core and non-core rates within RTS and Foxweb ensuring defined schedule is followed.
Ensure core and non-core rate calculations are distributed using site manager as per the agreed schedule.
Ensure all rate sheets are saved to the intranet immediately after the rate calculation is completed.
Ensure all rate sheets are emailed immediately after the rate calculation is completed as per the agreed schedule
Ensure Salt rates are updated as per the agreed schedule; take all necessary measures to ensure rates are updated if agreed timeline is not achieved.
Ensure all ATM rates are updated as per the agreed schedule; take all necessary measures to ensure rates are updated if agreed timeline is not achieved.
Ensure all maintenance (adding of additional stores/account holders and products, moving store between site groups etc.) within RTS is completed in a timely manner.
Undertake all activities as outlined by Head of Pricing including data extraction and manipulation as well as analytical support
Analytical, Reporting and control
Assist in preparing and presenting pricing strategies to the Asia Pacific senior management team that will improve both the short-term and the long-term profitability of the company
Assist in implementation, monitoring and maintenance of all Foreign Currency pricing related activity for various online and mobile platforms, as well as for traditional retail segment
Analytical review of margin management and performance against targets
Perform regular reporting (rates/margins, rates/margins achieved, discounts given, etc.)
Maintain historic rate tables (archives)
Maintain a close working relationship with Wholesale Banknote dealers.
Confirm all Base rates have been updated and are current before commencing rate calculation.
Advise dealers of all changes within RTS.
Advise dealers of any unconfirmed variances in rates
Key interfaces/ relationships
Head of Pricing: To ensure margins and rate management is updated and amended as outlined.
Dealing Operations: To gain alignment on base rate setting and rate updates across geographies
Regular communication with: IT, Sales & Marketing
Role specific experience and skills
Essential
Tertiary qualifications in Business/Finance/Economics or other related field
Very strong analytical skills
Strong technical skills, including advanced working knowledge of Excel including VBA
Ability to problem solve
Excellent communication abilities
1+ years of experience in a similar role
Desirable
Understanding of financial markets and the impact their movements may have on customer demand
Experience with RTS within Travelex Australia
Knowledge of Access/SQL, Python, R
Experience in a medium size commercial and professional organisation which is customer and sales focused
General experience and personal qualities
Self-motivated person
Ability to work independently
Strong attention to detail
Good written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work effectively with a diverse group of people

Our Macquarie Asset Management division has embarked on an ambitious roadmap for Identity and Access Management transformation and is now seeking a Business Analyst to join our Document & Identity Governance team based in Sydney. The Identity and Access Management (IAM) team performs a vital role for Macquarie Group ensuring access is provided to Macquarie systems to the right users for the right reasons at the right time.
As a Business Analyst, you will be working with diverse stakeholders representing the asset management business, technology, and operational risk. You will perform business analysis activities for the design and onboarding of asset management applications to our IAM governance platform (SailPoint IIQ) as well as business process mapping for business Roles, Segregation of Duties (SoD) and other IAM related activities.
Your key responsibilities in this role will be:
engaging business and technology subject matter experts to gather requirements and identify strategic solutions for system integration with SailPoint
mapping business processes to build out SoD and business roles where appropriate.
ensuring all requirements are completed to smoothly transition to Design and Development phases with the MAM Technology UAM team
identifying data issues and work with appropriate resources to resolve them
developing test plans and supporting the business through execution of user acceptance test cases
To be successful in this role you will have previous experience in a similar position and possess the ability and drive to operate autonomously and coordinate multiple assignments. About the team

Deloitte Forensic is the pre-eminent forensic practice in Australia. Our team in Sydney are market leaders. Our growth has created an outstanding opportunity for someone with a hunger for success to join our market leading team in Sydney.

This role provides a great opportunity for the right candidate to work closely with market leading forensic specialists.

Enough about us. Let’s talk about you.

You are an ambitious person with a great motivation to learn. You understand that data is all around us and is in everything we do.

Have the desire to work collaboratively with clients and key stakeholders
Have excellent written and verbal communication skills
Have an enquiring and curious mind

You will participate in the delivery of a wide range of forensic services to clients across a variety of industries and sectors.

A large and diverse range of clients across a variety of industries

An energetic and dynamic environment, with approachable Partners within a flat structure
Exceptional career development in a global business
Deloitte forensic teams nationally and internationally.

Who we are:

Maltem Group is a community of 1,200+ passionate individuals dedicated to innovation, new technologies, data and digital transformation projects.
Founded in 2001 and located in 12 different countries, our footprint covers France, Singapore, Hong Kong, Vietnam, Luxembourg, Belgium, Madagascar, Mauritius Island, Morocco, US, Canada and Australia. Our expertise consists of 20 years of market knowledge in the business organization, digital practices, agile, data management and innovation.
Since 2018, Maltem Australia is a growing and multicultural data analytics and project management consulting boutique composed of 50+ highly experienced practitioners. We are working closely with clients to understand, connect, and improve organisational effectiveness, and deliver data value faster. Our aim is to support our partners in building a sustainable competitive advantage in their industry and be at the forefront of innovation and customer experience.

About the opportunity:

We are looking for a proficient Data Quality and governance analyst with Informatica IDQ Analyst hands-on experience using proven techniques and tools to measure, control, monitor and improve the quality of data needed for key business processes.
Will works closely with business partners and regulatory reporting teams to turn data into critical information and knowledge that can be used to make sound business decisions.


Responsibilities:
Good understanding of Data Quality Principles ideally in the financial sector.
As per business requirements, perform thorough data profiling with multiple usage patterns, root cause analysis and data cleansing and develop scorecards utilizing Informatica IDQ analyst.
Design and provide solutions on writing Data Quality rules.
Experience in leading the solution discussions on DQ framework implementation.
Partner with various data stewards to provide summary results of data quality analysis, which will be used to make decisions regarding how to measure business rules and the quality of the data.
Document all rules, mappings, mapplets in detail.
Document at a functional level how the procedures work within the data quality applications.
Qualifications:
Minimum of 8+ years in implementing DQ framework and Data governance activities.
Experience in BFSI domain and stakeholder management.
Experience in data quality tools, including data profiling, cleansing.
Experience in Datawarehouse modelling techniques.

Apply online! The HR team carefully studies your application under 3 days and contacts you if your profile matches one of our positions.

During the entire recruitment process, you have the opportunity to participate in events organized by Maltem and interact with consultants to learn more about us!

Sports activities that can happen after work or during the weekend (voluntary-based)
Work on our new offices at WeWork where we have some open space, free drinks, and other advantages

The possibility to work overseas for Maltem Group
The possibility to be part of advisory and greenfield project
The possibility to be mentored or mentor someone during your journey with Maltem

MLC Life Insurance. We have been protecting the lives of Australians for over 130 years. We respect the trust placed on us and the role we play in providing peace of mind for our customers. We never lose sight of it.
Our Purpose
MLC Life Insurance is one of Australia’s leading life insurance specialists and a member of the Nippon Life Insurance Group, one of the world’s leading insurers. With more about 1,500 people nationally, we believe our success is built on the unique contribution of our people. Diversity and Inclusion are core to us. We aspire for everyone at MLC Life Insurance to feel valued and respected for who they are.
The Role
We currently have two permanent opportunities in our Product, Pricing and Proposition function as a Technical and Research Analyst.

This team has a focus on building trust by developing propositions and designing and managing products that meet customer needs and deliver on our promises. In this role, you will be responsible for supporting the product research, regulatory and technical aspects to build customer trust and provide partner support.
Your responsibilities will include:
Monitoring and conducting analysis of the Australian insurance market including competitors across product pricing, features and services.
Providing periodic (and ad-hoc) updates on MLC Life Insurance’s competitive position for internal stakeholders
Supporting and conducting analysis and impact assessment of current and proposed regulatory change including communication of opportunities and impacts
Ensuring research houses accurately reflect our product features and premium rates
Assist in developing and maintaining a technical training, advice strategies and presentation library in support of key internal and external partners including advisers
Identifying and maintaining access to sources of market intelligence
Data extraction and manipulation from multiple data sources

About You
Degree qualifications in a business-related field, or equivalent extensive insurance experience. RG146 qualification or a willingness to obtain.
Demonstrated experience in an insurance or investment research, technical or data type role.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Experience in using excel, Power BI and SQL to interrogate data
Ability to work as part of a team and autonomously, to achieve planned goals and objectives
Strong internal and external stakeholder engagement
Strong interpersonal skills to influence stakeholders and resolve issues
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
Why Choose Us?
At MLC Life Insurance, you will have the opportunity to:
work with a WGEA cited Employer of Choice for Gender Equality
enjoy flexible work options and an inclusive environment where everyone is respected and valued for who they are and their unique contribution
embrace a culture of customer centricity and an ambition to be Australia’s leading, most trusted Life Insurer
access a range of benefits including competitive salary, lifestyle leave, two days volunteer leave every year, recognition of service milestones; and
wellness and lifestyle offerings including access to Uprise – our Digital Wellbeing Program, as well as discounts on a variety of lifestyle and entertainment products and services.

About Us
Questas Group is a group of diverse industrial companies providing design, sales, trade retail, service & repair, installation & commissioning and large scale projects across hydraulic, irrigation, pump and engine product lines to the mining, construction, agricultural and general industrial sectors.
Private equity backed, Questas Group operates throughout Australia and employs 700+ people. Questas Group businesses include Berendsen Fluid Power, The Hydraulic Warehouse, CCA Hardchrome, Beasley’s Hydraulic Services, Pacific Hydraulics, Water Dynamics, Malcolm Thompson Pumps, Nordon Cylinders, Swanson Industries, Meadow Industries, EPG Engines, Aussie Fluid Power, Hardchrome Sales and Rathmann Engineering.

About the Opportunity
Questas Group have recently developed an exciting growth strategy and value creation plan. As a result, we are now seeking an experienced Performance Business Analyst to support the strategic initiative owners with tracking and reporting a number of clearly defined input and output KPIs on a weekly/fortnightly/monthly basis as well as their bottom-line EBITDA impact.
This role will see you responsible for maintaining and further developing Business Performance Analytics and Dashboards currently in Power BI whilst also providing support with developing financial models and documenting business cases for new strategic initiatives.

Your responsibilities in this role will also include;
Support strategic initiative owners with tracking and documenting weekly and monthly input and output KPI scorecards (actual vs target and variance)
Document a monthly KPI scorecard for the Group Board pack
Update project plans and Gantt charts for prioritised strategic initiatives on a weekly basis
Monitor the overall progress of prioritised strategic initiatives and attend weekly or fortnightly Steering Committee meetings for each initiative
Maintain and further develop Business Performance Analytics and Dashboards in Power BI
Review and refine the performance KPIs that have been identified for the prioritised strategic growth and business improvement initiatives
Identify existing data sources in the Group ERP system and CRM system to analyse and report on agreed input and output KPIs
Develop simple, effective new data capture templates and tools as required to support performance reporting for selected KPIs that currently do not have data available
Complete ad-hoc analysis (as required) focused on sales data, operational cost data, product profitability and customer profitability to support strategic initiative owners
Develop financial P&L models with clear assumptions to forecast the monthly sales, operating expenditure and EBITDA impact associated with the prioritised strategic initiatives.

About You
To be successful in this role you will possess;
5+ years experience analysing financial, operational and sales data in a for-profit commercial business with 4+ years of experience working with a B2B industrial products/services business in Australia that operates workshops or manufacturing facilities
Bachelor Degree in Business, Commerce, Accounting, Data Analytics, Data Science or a relevant related discipline
Extensive experience developing and maintaining business dashboards in Power BI including the administration and data collection and extraction management.
Experience building clear, visual KPI dashboards in Excel and clear charts that illustrate weekly or monthly performance trends over time
Skilled in identifying and documenting clear insights from data analysis
Experience building financial models with clearly laid-out assumptions to validate expected revenue growth; cost of goods; gross margin; operating expenditure; and EBITDA
Essential to have an expertise in Power BI and experience working with other intelligence/KPI dashboard tools is beneficial
CPA/CA or working towards completion is desirable.

What's in it for you?
This is an exciting opportunity to forge a rewarding career within a growing and progressive business. This position offers an attractive remuneration package commensurate with qualifications and experience, together with a stable work environment offering potential development opportunities.

Job Description & Summary
With PwC, you’ll ignite a meaningful career while being supported by a flexible working culture, innovative learning and development opportunities and progressive policies and benefits, such as 18 weeks paid parental leave for mums, dads and foster carers (no minimum service!)
What will you create?
You’ll help Australian businesses, not-for-profits and governments create value and improve the way they work. From digitising healthcare, to creating smarter cities and igniting our start-up industry, together we build trust in society and solve important problems.
Technology and Firm Operations bring this to life by enabling the business to achieve their tech-driven goals. The work undertaken here covers a range of areas from leading and supporting the firm through the build or adoption of new technology, to protecting against risk, and delivering valuable data insights that transform our tech capabilities.
As a Senior Business Analyst | Manager 12 months FTC in our DigiTech team your impact will be seen by:
Identify, analyse and validate business benefits associated with initiatives.
Lead the development and documentation of project related initiatives such as discussion papers, feasibility assessments, business case and business requirement documents.
Facilitate user group discussions to gather inputs and analyse end user requirements.
Develop conceptual designs and functional specifications that document the desired solution behaviour.
About you

You have a minimum of 5 years experience in business analysis with at least two full cycle software implementation experiences (CRM, ERP, Practice Management systems). You will have strong knowledge and application of analysis techniques, including process modelling, facilitation, gap analysis and data analysis and familiarity with Project Management methodology (e.g. Prince2 and Scrum). You will hold an understanding of strong client and stakeholder management skills and experience.
Passionate about being at the forefront of change, you’re ready to help our Business Support team enable all areas of our firm to deliver meaningful value to clients.
You’re collaborative and enjoy working in an innovative environment. You’re a problem solver by nature and want to join a firm that values the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and stakeholders. Most importantly, you act with integrity and show care for the people you work with.
Life at PwC
Our culture and benefits are something we’re proud of, and also why we’re consistently named as one of Australia’s best workplaces. With PwC, you’ll belong to an inclusive community where differences are both embraced and the underlying driver in everything we create together.
We empower you with the technology, coaching, flexibility and trust needed to make a meaningful difference, while supporting you in bringing your whole self to work each day. We’re committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce because we know it’s only by working together that we can realise the potential of our people, clients and society around us.
We’re living this commitment through initiatives including our Reconciliation Action Plan to increase Indigenous employment and employee-led diversity networks promoting cultural, disability, LGBTI and gender equality. At our core we’re a people business, which means you’ll be supported not just in your professional development but your personal growth as well.
Rio Ogot is the Recruitment Manager for the role. As the team experience high volumes of applications, we appreciate your patience to allow for a timely and fair process for all.

Do you have an eye for detail? Are you a driven self-starter? Do you love working with big data sets? We have an opportunity for you!

Faethm is on the lookout for an Ontology Analyst to join our scaling team! Faethm’s ontology of occupations and skills is at the core of our product offering. The ongoing maintenance of our ontology is an essential activity to provide our clients with the most up-to-date insights and to provide relevant and validated data to our AI modelling. Our ontology analysts collect and collate global jobs data into standardised taxonomies. Faethm’s clients use ontology to map their workforce data and the accuracy of this mapping is essential to ensure all AI modelling is correct.

Reporting to Faethm’s Ontology Manager, the Ontology Analyst’s core accountabilities are to assist in maintaining Faethm’s Occupation Ontology, ensure all client jobs are correctly mapped to the ontology and help our clients have a smooth onboarding experience. In addition, this role will directly contribute to the ongoing accuracy of modelling used to assist with the mapping of client data. The role will require close collaboration with the Data Analytics, Data Science, Customer and Product teams.

Key responsibilities:
Assist in maintaining the integrity of Faethm’s occupation ontology including editing titles, descriptions of jobs and task data.
Research and development to ensure the ontology continues to evolve to support the breadth of our client base.
Contribute to the addition of new jobs into the ontology, ensuring the attributes, tasks and skills of new jobs accurately reflect the capabilities and activities of employees performing these jobs.
Contribute to regular updates of the ontology-based on international standards such as O*Net and ESCO.
Build and maintain crosswalks between the Faethm ontology, standards bodies and proprietary ontologies.
Ensure client workforce data is mapped to the ontology in a timely and accurate manner
Assist with resolution of client workforce data quality issues
Assist with the production of labelled training data to ensure Faethm’s Data Science models produce quality predictions.
Being available to engage with our clients and teams overseas is expected, the position is a combination of remote working and working with colleagues in our Sydney and international offices. However, for the right candidate, a fully remote setup can be discussed.


To be successful in this role you’ll ideally have:
A native level of English
Experience in managing and editing structured text
Advanced Excel skills (filtering, searching, pivot tables, formulas like v-lookups or counts)
Experience working with workforce data sets and/or familiarity working with occupation taxonomies
Knowledge and prior use of any HRMS system
Genuine interest in the future of work and emerging technology
While coding experience is not a requirement, any experience writing scripts to manipulate and manage large datasets is a bonus

While we have identified the initial responsibilities of the role, be pre-prepared for this role to evolve as products, clients, and analytics grow.

Join Faethm and you will: Work for an inventive, purpose-driven and civic-minded company with an ambitious but realisable mission and vision that tackles a very real and globally important issue. People are our secret sauce, at Faethm we pride ourselves on working hard and having fun!

What are you waiting for come and work with an amazing team of professionals, in an autonomous, agile, yet supportive, flexible and fun environment. Faethm is an equal opportunity employer. We find excellence in diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Job Description & Summary
With PwC, you’ll ignite a meaningful career while being supported by a flexible working culture, innovative learning and development opportunities and progressive policies and benefits, such as 18 weeks paid parental leave for mums, dads and foster carers (no minimum service!)
What will you create?
You’ll help Australian businesses, not-for-profit and governments create value and improve the way they work. From digitising healthcare, to creating smarter cities and igniting our start-up industry, together we build trust in society and solve important problems.
Consulting brings this to life by helping clients improve the way they operate, reduce costs, manage risks, leverage talent, or fundamentally change the way they do business. Your work here will help organisations of all shapes and sizes work smarter and grow faster.
As a Data Analytics Technical Specialist in our Microsoft Team, your impact will be seen by:
Gathering business requirements from stakeholders and translating them into technical requirements
Creating and gaining approval of design documents
Managing the technical delivery using either of Agile or Waterfall methodologies in project delivery
Oversee and implement data solutions on the Microsoft Azure platform using a combination of Azure native services or Industry solutions (XaaS)
Developing and maintain data lakes, data warehouses, data marts, and analytical models needed for business, financial and operational analysis and/or reporting
Developing highly performant, secure, reliable and scalable solutions
The work you do will vary from project to project but will typically include developing data ingestion frameworks and modules, building data models, building reports, dashboards and scorecards and doing data exploration and visual analytics using Microsoft tools and technology. Please note it is not a requirement for you to be expert in all of what is listed below, we are looking for expertise in a couple of areas and a willingness to learn and keep up to date with future technology.
Must have skills:
Expertise with Data Warehousing and data modelling design techniques and principles
Expertise with Power BI development, service configuration and deployment techniques
Expertise with DAX, M Language and writing SQL based queries
Experience with compute services using tools such as Azure Data Factory, Databricks, HDInsights
Experience with database services such as Azure Synapse and /or Azure SQL
Experience with data lakes resources using Azure Blob Storage, and Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2
Good understanding of Azure data platform architectures and design patterns
Nice to have skills:
Experience embedding Power BI into other Microsoft 365 and Microsoft D365 environments.
Experience with Data Governance techniques within the Microsoft Landscape
Experience with Data Quality techniques within the Microsoft Landscape
Experience with real time data ingestion using Azure Event Hub, Stream Analytics
Expertise with monitoring using Azure Monitor, Log Analytics
Expertise with Azure Key Vaults for credentials management
Experience with performing data migration
Good understanding of Big Data Architectures and design patterns
Performance tuning of high-volume transactions and databases
Data science expertise
About you
You have a solid background in Microsoft Azure Data Platform and Analytics stack and can use technology to solve business problems. You have demonstrated experience in implementing enterprise grade Business Intelligence, Data and Analytics solutions using various SQL Server, Azure services and Power BI and are quick to learn new concepts. You thrive in a collaborative and innovative culture and want to join a firm that values problem solvers, the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and key stakeholders.
Passionate about being at the forefront of change, you’re ready to help our Consulting team deliver practical advice that speaks straight to the heart of client business issues and deliver innovative results.
You’re collaborative and enjoy working in an innovative environment. You’re a problem solver by nature and want to join a firm that values the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and stakeholders. Most importantly, you act with integrity and show care for the people you work with.
Life at PwC
Our culture and benefits are something we’re proud of, and also the reason we’ve been named LinkedIn’s #1 Australian workplace. With PwC, you’ll belong to an inclusive community where differences are both embraced and the underlying driver in everything we create together.
We empower you with the technology, coaching, flexibility and trust needed to make a meaningful difference, while supporting you in bringing your whole self to work each day. We’re committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce because we know it’s only by working together that we can realise the potential of our people, clients and society around us.
We’re living this commitment through initiatives including our Reconciliation Action Plan to increase Indigenous employment and employee-led diversity networks promoting cultural, disability, LGBTI and gender equality. At our core we’re a people business, which means you’ll be supported not just in your professional development but your personal growth as well.

Do you have an eye for detail? Are you a driven self-starter? Do you love working with big data sets? We have an opportunity for you!

Faethm is on the lookout for an Ontology Analyst to join our scaling team! Faethm’s ontology of occupations and skills is at the core of our product offering. The ongoing maintenance of our ontology is an essential activity to provide our clients with the most up-to-date insights and to provide relevant and validated data to our AI modelling. Our ontology analysts collect and collate global jobs data into standardised taxonomies. Faethm’s clients use ontology to map their workforce data and the accuracy of this mapping is essential to ensure all AI modelling is correct.

Reporting to Faethm’s Ontology Manager, the Ontology Analyst’s core accountabilities are to assist in maintaining Faethm’s Occupation Ontology, ensure all client jobs are correctly mapped to the ontology and help our clients have a smooth onboarding experience. In addition, this role will directly contribute to the ongoing accuracy of modelling used to assist with the mapping of client data. The role will require close collaboration with the Data Analytics, Data Science, Customer and Product teams.

Key responsibilities:
Assist in maintaining the integrity of Faethm’s occupation ontology including editing titles, descriptions of jobs and task data.
Research and development to ensure the ontology continues to evolve to support the breadth of our client base.
Contribute to the addition of new jobs into the ontology, ensuring the attributes, tasks and skills of new jobs accurately reflect the capabilities and activities of employees performing these jobs.
Contribute to regular updates of the ontology-based on international standards such as O*Net and ESCO.
Build and maintain crosswalks between the Faethm ontology, standards bodies and proprietary ontologies.
Ensure client workforce data is mapped to the ontology in a timely and accurate manner
Assist with resolution of client workforce data quality issues
Assist with the production of labelled training data to ensure Faethm’s Data Science models produce quality predictions.
Being available to engage with our clients and teams overseas is expected, the position is a combination of remote working and working with colleagues in our Sydney and international offices. However, for the right candidate, a fully remote setup can be discussed.


To be successful in this role you’ll ideally have:
A native level of English
Experience in managing and editing structured text
Advanced Excel skills (filtering, searching, pivot tables, formulas like v-lookups or counts)
Experience working with workforce data sets and/or familiarity working with occupation taxonomies
Knowledge and prior use of any HRMS system
Genuine interest in the future of work and emerging technology
While coding experience is not a requirement, any experience writing scripts to manipulate and manage large datasets is a bonus

While we have identified the initial responsibilities of the role, be pre-prepared for this role to evolve as products, clients, and analytics grow.

Join Faethm and you will: Work for an inventive, purpose-driven and civic-minded company with an ambitious but realisable mission and vision that tackles a very real and globally important issue. People are our secret sauce, at Faethm we pride ourselves on working hard and having fun!

What are you waiting for come and work with an amazing team of professionals, in an autonomous, agile, yet supportive, flexible and fun environment. Faethm is an equal opportunity employer. We find excellence in diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Practice Ignition is hiring a Senior Marketing Analyst to join the Practice Ignition Global Marketing team, taking accountants and bookkeepers on a journey to move their traditional methods of client engagement to a business critical platform that offers their customers sleek and professional branded experiences, as well as automating large parts of their business including invoicing, payments and workflows.
This role is vital to the success of our marketing team, tasked with analysing marketing funnel performance, creative impact, brand health and ad-hoc research projects. You will play a key role in both examining the success of marketing campaigns, whilst strategically informing future marketing plans.
Working closely with the Chief Revenue Officer, Head of Growth Marketing, Head of Product and Customer Marketing, Finance Analyst and Chief Financial Officer you will be an active member of the Marketing team and our first dedicated Marketing Analyst. This is an exciting opportunity to build this capability, work closely with senior leadership across the business and have a massive impact on our marketing impact and business at an exciting time of growth.
What you’ll be doing?
No single day in a high-growth startup is the same but you can expect to be doing the following:
Drive insights on the impact of key marketing activities to help optimize channel mix and performance, as well as creative and social output
With a love for customer data you will assess different data sources, building shareable insights that support strategic decision making
Solve marketing problems by assessing available data and determining solutions with rationale anchored in data
Improve campaign effectiveness and develop recommendations for future campaigns
Build dashboards that are automated, scalable, and digestible
Troubleshoot legacy reporting, use data to challenge the status quo and seek to continuously improve
Support the team with setting measurable KPIs to track campaign performance across conversion, engagement and revenue metrics
What skills do you need?
Intermediate-to-strong SQL skills to be able to select and manipulate big customer datasets
Strong Excel skills (conditional formulas, pivoting, charting) and experience with data visualization tools including Tableau
Strong analytical skills with financial and commercial acumen and able to translate data into actionable insights to support strategic decision making
Building dashboards to present lots of information in digestible and scalable ways and ensure the quality of all documents and data are accurate
Prior experience as a Marketing Analyst in a SaaS organization
Experience establishing a marketing analytics function (desirable but not essential)
Who you are?
You’re extremely comfortable with ambiguity - we’re a fast growing mid-stage startup operating in a very dynamic way which means priorities and pace can change rapidly
You’re also not afraid to roll up your sleeves and get things done - you know that startups are about end-to-end execution and that no task is too big or too small
Able to create structure, organisation and process amidst the ambiguity
Great communication skills and the ability to support others who aren't familiar with data
Developed stakeholder management and influencing skills to help convince people of your ideas, or at least help them understand your point of view (which is always backed with data)
Self-starter and a team player who thrives on clear goals
Curious and willing to dive deep to uncover game changing opportunities
Our Company Values:
We are better everyday
We work without ego
We are smarter together
We hero our customer”
How do we embody these values?
We engage in robust and articulate dialogue while maintaining an open mind
We work autonomously, but also with a strong team ethic. We may reward individual effort, but we most certainly play as a team in everything we do
We have the ability to focus yet still have a laugh in high-pressure situations
We are comfortable working with globally distributed teams who bring together complementary skill sets
We are proactive learners, and encourage the continuous development of our skill-sets
We are passionate about delivering services to our customers and able to champion their needs
We are able to think creatively and develop solutions for our customers

If you have an appreciation for Data Management and are looking to build your career in this rapidly growing specialisation, there is a unique and exciting opportunity to join the Group Data Office within Macquarie’s Financial Management Group. This role will see you working closely with stakeholders across the business to identify critical data and drive effective data management across our group.
What impact will you have?
As a Data Management Executive, you will work alongside large change initiatives, guiding the implementation of our data management steps. You will build relationships with these stakeholders, helping to increase understanding of data governance and promote accountability for its ongoing implementation.
In joining the team, you will:
support the Group Data Officer in the strategy and project planning for data management processes and policies
work with stakeholders to understand their critical data, business processes and data flows & controls
be involved in documentation and data element mapping across systems (definitions, validations, lineage, and assessment of data controls)
work to implement and embed the use of new data management tools across the business
assist with designing processes and templates to facilitate effective data management.
What skills will you use?
To be successful in the role, you will possess 2 + years’ experience working with data management principles. This experience may have been gained through building data solutions, identifying data requirements or addressing data quality issues. Other key skills include:
knowledge of data management and data governance principles
prior experience translating technical concepts into business concepts
ability to produce detailed documentation – including mapping business processes and data elements
excellent communication skills and desire to partner with business stakeholders to solve interesting problems.
This is an exciting opportunity where you will find yourself involved in diverse work, utilising your strong communication skills to work collaboratively with and build relationships across multiple business groups.
About the Financial Management Group
The Financial Management Group provides financial, tax and treasury services to all areas of Macquarie. The group is focused on providing strategic analysis and advice to Macquarie's businesses and senior management, managing Macquarie's funding, liquidity and capital position, ensuring Macquarie continues to meet regulatory and compliance obligations and managing Macquarie's corporate affairs.
Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths, and in combination with our inclusive environment, it enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. From day one, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us, please apply. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways.
We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you, and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.

About Macquarie
A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.
Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups, disciplines, sectors and borders. With 16,000+ employees and offices in 32 markets around the world, we’re a truly global organisation.
You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives, ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us, you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.
Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.

Driven by a shared purpose and core values, we are one of Australia’s largest, fastest growing and most highly rated superannuation funds that exists to benefit our members. When you work for Sunsuper, every day is another opportunity to inspire and empower Australians to fulfil their retirement dreams – we think that’s pretty special.

We care deeply about our people and our teams are as diverse and unique as the members we live to inspire and empower. Our inclusive culture encourages and empowers all of us to belong, learn and connect with each other, because when you are part of the Sunsuper team, you will be valued and heard in a respectful and inclusive workplace where you can be your authentic self every day.

Flexibility is a foundation of our inclusive culture and we are committed to supporting you to make flexibility work for you, your leader and your team. At Sunsuper, we believe flexibility is for everyone, and we embrace everyone’s different personal circumstances and preferences. We support you to manage the ever-changing demands of work and personal life.

About the role
To support our success we are currently seeking a Portfolio Analyst to join the Investment Risk team in our Sydney office.

Working with members of the Investment Strategy team, other colleagues at Sunsuper and external advisors you will provide investment risk analysis and support for the development, implementation and ongoing review of Sunsuper’s investment strategy. You will also support the Investment Risk function and the Head of Portfolio Strategy with the development and management of Sunsuper’s investment risk capability within the Portfolio Strategy team.

This role is available as a permanent opportunity.

About you
To ensure success you will possess:
Tertiary qualification, preferably in finance, economics, commerce, mathematics, actuarial studies, engineering or a related discipline.
Minimum 3 years of work experience in the investment industry, and working toward post graduate qualifications.
Highly proficient with Microsoft Office applications, with relevant computer programming experience in Matlab, VBA, R, Python or related language.
Advanced analytical and numerical skills.

Our promise to you

An exciting opportunity to join the Business Improvement team sitting within the Chief Operating Office of Financial Crime & Fraud Prevention (FCFP) and is a key driver of change within the business unit
How will I help?
An exciting opportunity to join the Business Improvement team sitting within the Chief Operating Office of Financial Crime & Fraud Prevention (FCFP) and is a key driver of change within the business unit. The team works with both internal and external stakeholders to identify areas of improvement, determine root causes, and design and implement appropriate solutions.
Reporting to the Senior Manager, Process Management & Continuous Improvement you will take responsibility for both leading and supporting business-led changes impacting FCFP as the situation requires. You will partner closely with senior management as well as all levels of employees to provide analysis and advice on opportunities for improvement and assist with the delivery of sustainable change into the operational environment.
Other key responsibilities include being a subject matter expert on process management and improvement, coaching and training others in the use of process improvement tools and techniques, and driving a culture of continuous improvement across the business unit.
What is in it for me?
You will play an important and significant part in the future of a business that has been around for 200 years. Our vision is to become one of the world’s great service companies. So, we will back you in the development of your career, with internal career prospects and flexible working. You will also be backed by a fantastic team of people in a can-do, supportive structure.
What do I need?
You will bring with you, proven experience as a Business Analyst and able to display experience working with continuous improvement and problem-solving techniques/tools/methodologies as well as process modelling or mapping.
Be proficient in data collection, analysis, and reporting and comfortable in presenting to a wide range of stakeholders with the ability to simplify the complex.
Stakeholder management skills are essential to success in this role as is the ability to work a high standard at a fast pace.
Lean Six Sigma Green Belt certification desired but not essential.
What’s it like to work there?
We aim to provide one big, supportive team of people who love helping others succeed. As an equal opportunity employer, we are proud to have created a culture and work environment that values diversity and flexibility – and champions inclusion.
How do I Apply?
Start here. Just click on the APPLY button.
As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply.
The health and wellbeing of our employees is our top priority. We have developed clear standards to ensure our people are confident, safe, and healthy whether they are working from a Westpac Group site or working from home. These are based on expert medical advice and Safe Work Australia guidelines.

About this role

About us

Freedom is one of the nation's leading lifestyle retailers; we don't just sell furniture, we sell the dream! With almost 40 years in the furniture and homewares industry, we have established ourselves as a market leader, and are known for our great designs, as well as a customer experience that you will be proud to be part of.

About the role

We are now on the lookout for a Business Intelligence & Data Lead to join our team. Reporting to the Chief Information Officer, you will be instrumental in delivering our technology roadmap across BI, data and reporting, whilst managing the day-to-day tactical operations of your team.

As a core member of our IT leadership team, your key areas of focus will be:

Leadership

Providing subject matter expertise and thought leadership across BI, analytics & data management.

Maximising the capability of your team through collaborative and proactive leadership.

Operations

Defining service level objectives and performance criteria for reporting & analytics, including the underlying architecture / systems / integrations.

Managing our platforms and processes to ensure they are consistently aligned with our broader IT strategy, as well as our service level objectives.

Governance

Ensuring our data controls, master data management and BI / data governance processes are fit for purpose.

Creating a culture of business driven, self-service BI through effective stakeholder engagement and training.

Stakeholder engagement

Engaging with the wider business to align strategies and potential solutions with their needs.

Developing 3

rd

party relationships to complement and elevate service delivery to the business.

Continuous improvement

Partnering with the business to promote a continuous improvement culture.

Proactively seeking opportunities for ongoing improvements that will elevate our technology and business processes.

You are a proven leader with a strong, practical understanding of the BI landscape, including key and emerging trends, vendors, Microsoft aligned BI / data technologies and Azure. Skilled in providing fit-for-purpose solutions and structure in ambiguous situations, you thrive in fast-paced roles, and are looking for a role where you can showcase how you add value.

What's on offer?

Generous staff discounts across our brands, as well as regular sample sales at our head office.

Career development & progression – we want to see you succeed and will actively encourage you to develop your skills.

Free on-site gym and classes,

What's next?

Please submit your resume for immediate consideration –there has never been a better time to join Freedom, and we can't wait for you to be part of it.

Business Analyst
Leading Bank
Murex and FO experience a MUST
Permanent or contract
Project Description:
We've been engaged by a large Australian company to provide resources to their Murex development team working on a wide range of projects like CTB changes, risk and regulatory projects, benchmark reform, binary upgrades etc.
We require a lead Murex Front-Office Business Analyst with strong knowledge across asset classes and broad exposure to financial markets. You will be working as subject matter expert in a team of Murex Developers on a variety off tasks.
Initial project would be leading the current Murex FO development on Benchmark reform (IBOR decommissioning), Binary upgrade as well as other projects and BAU changes.
Joining this program you will have the benefit of working with an established client team, fully involved in the project initiation through to project implementation, not only for the Murex asset but also upstream systems, such as the managed market data service provider.
Responsibilities:
· You will be a FO Business Analyst focussing on Fixed Income, Credit Derivatives and/or Interest Rate Derivatives on Murex.
· This is a hands-on role combined with team/stream and client delivery leadership responsibilities.
Responsible for doing Requirement Analysis in Front Office space for various projects (IBOR, Regulatory, ..)
Be responsible for understanding the business needs, identifying business solutions and validating the pros and cons of technical solution options
Key liaison with Front Office user base and primary interface between Business and IT with respect to Murex.
Configure the application as part of the implementation. This can be related to Trade Insertion (etradepad, FDI, ..), Simulations, Curve setup, Product configuration (generators, indices, ...) etc.
Working with a Testing team to review test cases, coverage and investigate any issue they encounter.
Follow up with Murex as and when necessary to resolve bugs, issues.
Assist Automation Testing team to identify test data set and create test data required for execution of automated Onyx scripts.
Mandatory Skills Description:
Several years of relevant Murex (and/or other Primary Trading System) Front Office experience
Good/Export knowledge of at least two asset classes (Risk and Pricing) including IRD, FI, Credit, FXD, FX Cash and Commodities, of the Murex product suite.
Experienced in dealing with Risk, Product Control and Front Office stakeholders in both Markets and Treasury divisions
Strong hands-on knowledge of FO configuration: instruments, generators, curves, market data, market conventions, etc
Strong knowledge of FO modules: Simulation screens, Simulation Viewer, eTradepad, P&L notepad, market operations, etc
Good knowledge of how to analyze P&L and sensitivity issues within Murex
Knowledge of organization setup and User Groups / Access Rights
Some knowledge of Dynamic Tables,
Nice-to-Have Skills:
Experience on regulatory projects
MReport / Datamart, preTrade and postTrade workflows, and interfaces
Deeper all-round knowledge of the Murex application
