Job Title: Business Analyst - Technology, Data and Digital (TDD)
Job Description:
BAT is evolving at pace - truly like no other organisation.
To achieve the ambition, we have set for ourselves, we are looking for colleagues who are ready to live our ethos every day. Come be a part of this journey!
BAT AUSTRALIA IS LOOKING FOR A KEY ACCOUNT & REPORTING ANALYST
SENIORITY LEVEL: Entry Level
FUNCTION: Commercial
SALARY RANGE: AUD 65k – AUD70k + excellent benefits + market leading bonus
LOCATION: Sydney , Australia
ROLE POSITIONING AND OBJECTIVES
This role is part of the Marketing function.
The responsibility of the role is to assist with the delivery of the accounts volume, share and profit targets through accurate order processing and volume reporting.
Reports to: Sales & Planning Manager

WHAT YOU WILL BE ACCOUNTABLE FOR
Ensuring orders are processed on time and in full in line with cut-off times for internal and external customers
Develop and Maintain sales tools in PowerBi
Assist with Reporting generation for sales volumes out of SAP
Regular updates to relevant Account Managers, including Out of Stocks or relevant reports

CAN THIS BE YOUR FUTURE ROLE?
Do you have strong experience in PowerBi?
Do you have prior experience in an analyst role?

CRUCIAL EXPERIENCE, SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE
12 Month Experience in Analyst role
Experience within the FMCG sector
Experience building/maintaining PowerBi dashboards & tools
Proficiency in Excel, Powerpoint, Word

REMUNERATION AND BENEFITS
You will receive a competitive remuneration package between AUD 65k – 70k.
We have flexible working, great parental leave and carer's leave benefits and a positive and inclusive culture.

WE ARE BAT
At BAT we are committed to our Purpose of creating A Better Tomorrow. This is what drives our people and our passion for innovation. See what is possible for you at BAT.
Global Top Employer with 53,000 BAT people across more than 180 markets
Brands sold in over 200 markets, made in 44 factories in 42 countries
Newly established Tech Hubs building world-class capabilities for innovation in 4 strategic locations
Diversity leader in the Financial Times and International Women’s Day Best Practice winner
Seal Award winner – one of 50 most sustainable companies
BELONGING, ACHIEVING, TOGETHER
Collaboration, diversity and teamwork underpin everything we do here at BAT. We know that collaborating with colleagues from different backgrounds is what makes us stronger and best prepared to meet our business goals. Come bring your difference!

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Two of Australia’s leading telecommunication companies, Vodafone Hutchison Australia and TPG, have come together to form TPG Telecom Limited. TPG Telecom has a powerhouse of brands which include Vodafone, TPG, iiNet, Internode, Lebara, AAPT and felix. As the second largest telecommunications company listed on the ASX, TPG Telecom has a strong challenger spirit and a commitment to delivering the best services and products to our customers. We are driving competition and choice for businesses and consumers across Australia.
The opportunity
As Agile Business Analyst, you will be part of a growing Customer Experience Tribe. Joining a group of customer obsessed, commercially minded team players who love to use data to identify opportunities to solve customer problems and drive incremental value. With a deep understanding of customer needs, commercial acumen and delivery best practices, you will deliver game-changing customer experiences as a market differentiator.
Responsibilities
Create and/or document the Opportunity Canvas, Program Epics, User stories that provide sufficient detail in preparation for the regular backlog grooming sessions.
Work with the Principal Product Owner and internal stakeholders to understand business needs, identify product value, document and prioritise requirements.
Own and manage the feature-level Squad Backlog and provide the delivery squad with clarity and guidance on prioritisation at card level. This includes working with a multi-disciplinary team including a mix of on/offshore and vendor partners.
Document clear functional and non-functional requirements and processes including but not limited to business, performance, operational, system, reporting, security, scalability and / or usability requirements.
Participate in agile ceremonies i.e. estimation sessions, planning meetings, daily stand ups, showcases, and team retrospectives.
Review the functional specifications/design documentation for the Sprints and/or overall Project/Program.
Knowledge and experience
3+ years experience in a fast-paced service industry or organisation that is highly complex with rapid change.
Strong communication and proven facilitation skills across large cross-functional teams.
Critical thinking and attention to detail to write user stories, and experience working within a multi-disciplinary delivery squad (engineers, UX, quality assurance, architects etc) to align and deliver on detailed requirements.
Proven experience of data driven decision making to achieve targets and KPIs
Creative problem solving with consideration across customer, people, process and system.
Customer-centric mindset, preferably with proven examples of human-centered thinking in practice.
Benefits and perks
Flexible hybrid way of working (from home and office)
‘Stay Connected Mobile’ – Access to a free mobile plan
‘Stay Connected NBN’ – Access to a free NBN 100 plan
‘Your Leave’ - an additional 4 days of leave to be used whenever you like - every year
Access to LinkedIn Learning and Vodafone Learning platforms
Access to Corporate Partner Discounts
We are committed to attracting, developing and retaining the best people by offering a flexible, diverse and inclusive workplace where hard work is truly rewarded. You will have access to fantastic benefits, including generous leave policies, leadership development programs and opportunities to grow your career. You’ll be faced with loads of variety where no two days are ever the same in a collaborative workspace that helps drive innovation.
Interested? We are excited to hear from you!
#LI-GD1

As a Senior Fraud Reporting Analyst, you will sit in the Financial Crime and Fraud Prevention (FC&FP) Team and assist with the Westpac Group’s exposure to fraud loss while maintaining a positive customer experience.
How will I help?
As a Senior Fraud Reporting Analyst, you will sit in the Financial Crime and Fraud Prevention (FC&FP) Team and assist with the Westpac Group’s exposure to fraud loss while maintaining a positive customer experience.
You will prepare fraud performance reports that accurately reflect the impact of fraud on the Westpac Group as well as maintain the integrity of data contained in fraud case management systems and the fraud general ledger by performing reconciliations and partnering with other fraud teams within Westpac. You will also prepare financial and statistical reports on a daily, weekly and monthly basis and support the restoration of funds to customers in a timely manner.
You will understand and meet compliance/regulatory fraud reporting requirement as well as prepare and submit various reports to external bodies.
What’s in it for me?
You will play an important and significant part in the future of a business that has been around for 200 years. Our vision is to become one of the world’s great service companies. So, we will back you in the development of your career, with internal career prospects and flexible working. You will also be backed by a fantastic team of people in a can-do, supportive structure.
What do I need?
You will have SAS coding experience paired with strong excel skills and extensive accounting knowledge. You will be proficient in analysing and interpreting and translating data and have experience in producing Management Reports. Reconciliation experience is desirable and you will preferably come from a banking background (or any other highly regulated environment).
You will have a high attention to detail paired with strong communication skills. You will be able to build strong and effective relationships and be a self leader.
What’s it like to work there?
Joining the Westpac family means you will get some of the best banking, wealth and insurance benefits in the market. We back our employees by helping them work towards industry-recognised qualifications, using online learning, training modules and career planning tools for you to grow with us. We will even pay you to do volunteer or community work. As an equal opportunity employer, we are proud to have created a culture and work environment that values diversity and flexibility – and champions inclusion.
How do I Apply?
Start here. Just click on the APPLY button.
As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply.

Talenza have been engaged by one of Australia's top media organisations to find a strong Business Analyst to join a fantastic established team on a 10 month fixed-term contract
The Role
As the Business Analyst you will be responsible for partnering with the business to improve processes and products; and be a key part of the implementation of best in class technology solutions.
Who you are
A critical thinker with the ability to connect the dots and identify solutions
An effective communicator (written and verbal) who tailors ideas in ways that are appropriate to the target audience
Thorough understanding of business analysis principles and best practices, technology concepts and project management methodologies
Experience with CRM, digital products, system integrations and data management and analytics.
Excellent stakeholder Management skills and ability to manage competing priorities.
Exceptional analytical and problem solving skills
Experience and knowledge working in a Waterfall and/ or Agile environment
Be able to build strong relationships within the wider business
Ability to frame the problem statement quickly, bring structure to project and manage scope.
Previous Analyst experience in Financial Services or B2B will be an added advantage.
If you’re a great communicator, a natural problem solver and enjoy project delivery, this could be the role for you.

This is a great opportunity to work with a variety of best-in-class technology platforms and solutions within one of Australia's most well known brands!
What's Next?

Job Title: Business Insights Analyst - Specialty driven pharmaceutical business
Job Description:
What We're Like
At BIG W everyday’s a big day. For you, this could be the start of something big.
There are over 15,000 of us, in the biggest cities and the tiniest towns. And each of us has an important role to play to help make a real difference for families by providing real value, real solutions and real care.
If you have a passion for designing and delivering great customer and team experiences, a desire to join a business that is rapidly evolving into a purpose led digital retailer enabled by a great store network, and you’re looking for a place that cares about your development and growth, you could be who we’re looking for.
Strategic role contributing to BIG W’s transformation journey
Great career development with supportive senior leadership
Innovative, agile and flexible culture
The Role

The Pricing Manager (Competitive Insights & Analysis) contributes to strategy & Big W’s data-led ambition through continuous improvement and enhancements of rich data, insights & automation while ensuring the continued health of the range.

Your core accountabilities include:

Develop influencing & leadership skills to build trusted business partner relationships within the BIG W business, building key relationships with Head of D&A, Category Teams & senior leaders
Responsible for Price Competitiveness, Outlier processes and Smart Pricing opportunities outside of range review timelines
Continued enhancement of data insights that will help the business make informed pricing & promotional decisions in line with customer’s needs (KVI Models, Elasticity Models)
Ownership of pricing Master Data & processes (Matching, Competitor Insights, Database)
Ownership of reporting e2e to drive data driven insight (Index Reporting, Promo Effectiveness)
Identification of process & reporting improvements through automation & exploration of new tools (Tableau Reporting, Webscraping Software, Clearance)
Responsible for cost price analysis & mitigation including insights into commodities & recommendations
Partner with Big W X to provide detailed insights into digital price competitiveness and deliver a unified approach to digital pricing strategy
About You

To be successful in this role and thrive in our high performance culture, you will need to demonstrate the following core experiences:
3-6 year Commercial experience in Consulting and / or in Retail in a line (Buying, Pricing, Replen Planning) or analyst role
Business Transformation experience is desirable
Strong Analytical & Presentation skills
Proficiency Microsoft Office (Excel & PPT)
Ability to work in an incredibly fast paced environment and comfortably conduct analysis at varying levels of complexity
Stakeholder management - able to positively engage and influence through relationships
You’ll be curious with an eye for the bigger picture and you will have the willingness to learn. You will deliver through collaborating with our team, listening to our customers, passionate about the retail market and of course - you have to love your numbers and analytics.
What's in it for you?
An attractive remuneration package including base, super and bonus
Opportunity to collaborate with some of the brightest and best minds in Australia both across BIG W and Woolworths
Opportunity to join the most engaging team in the business
Tech options - Woolworths is the largest employer of Google Apps in Australia, are early adopters of Agile and have BYOD options too
An exciting career - as our business grows, so do the opportunities for our people
Flexibility and work-life balance policies that will help you thrive
#LI
Joining the Group
As part of the wider Woolworths Group, we care deeply about creating a workplace where our team members feel valued, respected and empowered. We are committed to providing equal opportunity regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation or life stage and we are proud to be recognised as a Gold Tier Employer in the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTQ+ inclusion.
As our Group continues to evolve, innovate and support our communities, we encourage our team members to do the same with their own careers, by providing ongoing opportunities to grow and make a real difference.
If you meet a number of the requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application. You can learn more about working with us on LinkedIn or via https://www.linkedin.com/company/big-w/?viewAsMember=true . #LI #work180
Our Talent Acquisition Team and Hiring Leaders kindly request no unsolicited resumes or approaches from Recruitment Agencies. BIG W is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Job Title: Systems and Business Analyst - Governance Risk and Quality
Job Description:
$100-110K PKG
Top-tier brands
Great Training by Best Practice Team
Only 1-2 days in the Office per Week

Seeking ANALYST (Category Analyst, Category Executive, Insights Analyst, Sales Analyst) for category position. Open to agency or supplier side candidates. Great team and strong mentors with mapped out progression to Category Mgr. Contact Philip on 0425 237 423 / philip@touchpointexecutive.com.au

The Business Solutions team of this Federal Government Agency in Sydney is looking for a Business Analyst/Project Coordinator where you will play an integral part in helping the Technology and Digital Branch to document, scope and analyse new business initiatives, problems and opportunities that can be solved with technology solutions
As a Technology Business Analyst and Project Coordinator you will work closely with the Business Solutions and Architecture team to:
Assist in the initiation of new projects through establishing initial requirements and project initiation documentation. This will assist Business and IT Managers in evaluating the scope and validity of IT projects, their dependencies and required effort before greenlighting new work.
Elicit, analyse, and document business and functional requirements for system redesign and development. Gather and document detailed specifications on business processes and workflows as needed.
Build relationships through liaising with stakeholders, software developers, vendors, and technology teams to clarify requirements and design solutions.
Use requirements and business needs to establish IT solutions, whether through discussions with appropriate IT personnel (Development Lead, Solutions Architect, Security Lead) or investigating new technologies and conducting proof of concepts (POCs) to recommend new solutions to IT Management.
Undertake research and conduct objective, critical analysis to draw accurate conclusions that recognise and address business needs and issues.
Prepare business cases and project documentation that describes and justifies the technology initiative.
Assist with Testing and QA as a Business/IT representative where needed.
Write User Stories and acceptance criteria that are easy to understand, helping to groom product backlogs and performing testing support when needed
Develop in-depth Subject Matter Expert (SME) knowledge in areas assigned and sharing this knowledge with other team members.
Be a technology evangelist by informing and training the wider staff on new products and functionality.
Essential Skills and Experience:
Proven experience as a business analyst working with innovative technologies such as machine learning/AI and/or data driven technology initiatives
Experience working in a government context
A proven ability to translate and document stakeholder and business needs into solution, functional and non-functional requirements and user stories
Demonstrated facilitation and stakeholder management skills, including strong influencing, communication, and negotiation skills.
Comfortable working with people across all levels of an organisation, including senior executives.
Strong problem solver with good conflict management skills
Excellent presentation and both written and verbal communication skills.
Excellent organisational, time management and project coordination skills
Familiarity with Agile and Waterfall methodologies and DevOps
Strong understanding of cloud computing and software development
Desired
Experience working in a similar field to regulation, investigations
Experience with research (e.g., user research, technology research, sandbox testing)
Experience working in the technology sector
Understanding of government procurement approaches
Strong understanding of cyber security principles
Experience in management or project management
Please note that this role requires applicant to have Australia Citizenship and the ability to obtain a Baseline clearance.

Global biopharmceutical company with excellent pipeline
Drive commercial analytics and insights
Collaborative and inclusive culture

This niche biopharmaceutical company are pioneers and leaders in driving innovation in neuroscience and discover, develop, and deliver worldwide therapies for people living with serious neurological and neurodegenerative diseases. Supporting their business within operational excellence, they have an exciting opportunity for an experienced commercial Business Analyst to drive analytics across the business.

Reporting to the Head of Strategy and Operational Excellence, your responsibilities will include:
providing analysis and reporting of market performance for the company's key brands across ANZ
supporting the development and execution of Field Force Effectiveness reporting; proposing and implementing enhancements to CRM data
providing ongoing budgeting, forecasting and demand planning
collaborating with your sales, marketing, medical and finance cross-functional teams
working on market research projects relating to current and pipeline products
As the successful candidate, you will have:
degree qualifications in Finance, Business, Economics or related fields
proven background in commercial analytics or Business Analysis within the pharmaceutical industry
strong analytical and problem solving skills
proven track record of performing complex statistical analysis ideally within a specialty driven market
This is a great opportunity for an experienced Business Analyst to take the lead and to drive commercial insights cross functionally, working in a team with dynamic leaders and exciting existing and new launch products.

To apply for this role please submit your application in WORD format by clicking 'apply'; or contact Nicola Hurst on 0429 901 885 for further queries. Confidentiality is assured.

About Uniting:
At Uniting, we believe in taking real steps to make the world a better place. We work to inspire people, enliven communities and confront injustice. Our focus is always on the people we serve, no matter where they are at in their life.
We are Imaginative, Respectful, Compassionate and Bold.
About the Opportunity:
This role is responsible for the maintenance and support of Uniting’s Client Management systems, including technical functionality and program implementation. You will consult, design, develop and configure business solutions to support service streams and programs, and create reports and interfaces to fulfill business requirements for data capture and reporting. This role together with colleagues the Care and Clinical Governance team ensure key Uniting Client Business systems are operating effectively, efficiently, and align with best practice principles regarding business system governance and controls. The role will support Service Streams to standardize system functionality and reporting to align with operational procedures. Located in North Parramatta Campus with plenty of on street parking.
Key Accountabilities:
Strong team member who is ready to accept responsibility and be accountable for your actions, be eager and willing to engage openly with the team and key stakeholders; collaborate and deliver sound sustainable solutions to support service delivery.
Drive your curiosity to explore current systems and processes to learn about Uniting’s services and clients to apply your skills and expertise to promote new solutions within the limitations of the organisations operational sphere.
Actively contributing to Governance, Risk & Quality priorities aligned with meeting and achieving Uniting’s Strategy.
Contribute to a safe and supportive working environment that is inclusive of all staff celebrating their nationality, cultural background, LGBTI status, abilities, gender, and age.
Qualifications and experience:
Bachelor qualification in a relevant field or equivalent experience with a minimum of 2-3 years’ experience as a technical analyst in Information Technology and Solution implementation. Experience in a complex organisation NFP, Community Services and Health sector would be greatly advantageous.
Key Capabilities:
Demonstrated ability to work effectively within a cohesive team environment and contribute to the team’s performance through continuous improvement activities, processes. Ability to work independently and skilled in prioritising workload and carrying through tasks to their formal conclusion.
Proven technical experience and delivery across business applications/systems scoping, test methodologies and documentation, controls, designing business solutions and interfaces aligned to Government, Program and Uniting requirements.
Experience with using SQL to query databases, providing extracted information to meet user requirements and capability in developing Crystal Reports.
Strong analytical and conceptual skills with a process-driven approach to solving complex issues-problem management through to resolution. Proven quality business writing skills and verbal communication skills, including expertise and confidence in developing and finalising specification requirement documentation.
You are organised, systematic, thorough, accurate and disciplined in your approach.
Some exposure to formal project management methodologies such as Agile methodology will be advantageous and an interest to develop and apply these disciplines. Previous experience within an ITIL framework would be welcome to further build controls and practices. Experience at navigating a complex organisation, forging relationships with stakeholders at various levels of an organisation and managing through influence.
Passion for social change and creating an organisation of influence for the most disadvantaged.
To apply for this exciting role, please attach your CV and cover letter and apply today!
As an organisation, Uniting celebrates our diversity and welcome all people regardless of ethnicity, faith, sexual orientation and gender identity.
Employment with Uniting is subject to satisfactory background checks which include a National Police Check and Reference Check and a Working with Children Check.

READY FOR ANYTHING


At IAG, we live and work by our purpose to make your world a safer place. We are motivated by a unique culture that celebrates honesty, creativity, empathy, equity and collaboration. We call it the IAG way, and it means we all share a ‘ready for anything’ mindset that sets the tone for positive actions and positive outcomes. We put heart into everything we do which guides us to create amazing things for our customers, our people and our communities.


We’re brimming with ideas, ambition and a readiness to apply bold thinking and risk awareness to make a difference where it matters most.


As the largest general insurance group in Australia and New Zealand, we own some of the region’s most trusted brands, including NRMA Insurance, CGU, SGIO, SGIC and WFI. We are ready for anything.


The Role


Are you interested in using AI and data analysis to improve customer experience? Do you want wish to develop a career in Data Science with an organisation that actively supports learning? IAG might be just the place!


We’re looking for a budding Data Scientist to join our established and highly collaborative Analytics team. In this role you will work under the mentorship of one of our Senior Data Scientists to infuse AI into IAG’s business operations. You will be given the opportunity to be involved in the end-to-end analytics lifecycle; from AI concept, model build and deployment of advanced analytical models in programming languages such as SQL, R & Python. If you have a curious mindset with some exposure to advanced analytical models and are eager to progress in the data science world then this will be an amazing opportunity to propel your career!


Key Responsibilities

You will prototype, update and test advanced analytical models under the direction of a data scientist and lead within your team.
You will contribute to building tools and processes supporting the activation of claims analytics within IAG.
You will work with data scientists to produce datasets for use in analysis and model training.
You will contribute to analysis seeking to understand claims processes and the impact of changes to the claims experience that IAG can make, with a view to aiding critical business decisions.
You will conduct preliminary analysis to test hypotheses and assumptions for proposed machine decisioning products and process changes and monitor the impact of changes implemented.

Skills & Experience

Degree qualification in a related field; e.g. Statistics, Data Science, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Physics or other relevant technical field.
Elementary programming and statistical modelling experience (including experience with modelling software such as R and Python).
Knowledge of analytics and data processing technologies and architectures is desirable.
Ability to communicate with technical and non-technical audiences is desirable.
Problem solving skills and with a curious mindset are desirable.

Ready for anything? Let’s talk.


IAG rewards and recognises its people with generous benefits, career development opportunities and real work-life balance. Employees also enjoy 13% superannuation, up to 50% insurance discounts, flexible work and leave options, generous parental leave and return to work programs, various corporate partner discounts and a people-focused culture that celebrates achievements big and small.


Creating a workforce that actively embraces diversity, inclusion and a sense of belonging is key to our success. Work independently and able to follow instructions from Senior IT Technicians
Create & maintain jiras in order to assist with quick incident resolution
Initiative and enthusiasm and the ability to identify and prioritise issues and provide appropriate resolutions

About the opportunity
An exciting opportunity exists for a Business Analyst, ideally with Microsoft Dynamics 365 experience to join the Forensic & Analytical Science Services (FASS), Information Communications Technology Team for a period of up to 5 years.

Forensic & Analytical Science Service (FASS) specialises in providing independent and objective forensic analysis to the criminal and coronial justice systems, as well as quality scientific analysis that contributes to community health and safety. Our services include illicit drug analysis, forensic and drug toxicology, chemical criminalistics, forensic biology and DNA, forensic medicine, environmental toxicology, and environmental microbiology.

Being part of NSW Health Pathology means you’re helping create better health and justice systems every day.
We operate more than 60 laboratories and around 200 collection centres across NSW and conduct over 60 million tests per annum. Our network of pathologists are supported by scientists, technicians and support staff who quickly and accurately assess samples so clinical teams can make the best possible treatment decisions for patients. We encourage our staff to be involved in research and innovation opportunities to help create safer, healthier communities.

9 day fortnight
Generous salary packaging options and other fringe benefits
Corporate wellbeing programs, including the Fitness Passport
Learning and development opportunities, including in-house training with RTO My Health Learning

The Business Analyst is responsible for the effective provisioning of relevant and accurate analysis of current and proposed information systems, projects, policies and procedures, supporting the delivery of services and projects within the Forensic and Analytical Science Service (FASS).The Business Analyst will work closely with the business leads initially with our Forensic Medicine Department to deliver a state wide Forensic Medicine Information System.

Demonstrated experience in project management, and ability to balance complex and multiple issues whilst managing project scope, along with demonstrated experience in Gap Analysis, Requirements Management, Business Process Re-engineering and Business Analysis.
Demonstrated experience in liaising effectively and working collaboratively with a range of business stakeholders to facilitate co-operation, support and establish strong effective working relationships in achieving agreed outcomes.
Proven organisational and time management skills with the ability to prioritise, multi task, take initiative and meet strict timeframes within a complex, challenging and changing work environment.
Understanding of the software development lifecycle and experience in project management methodologies such as Agile, Prince2 and SCRUM, as well as experience in project management tools such as Atlassian Jira and Confluence.
Well developed functional understanding and experience of application architectures and their inter operability such as Microsoft Dynamics 365 & Power Apps across health/pathology and/or corporate environments.

Who we are and what we do

While you may not have heard of Audinate, our products might be more familiar to you than you realise. Used by leading pro audio brands globally, our digital audio networking products and technologies are found in thousands of products, from microphone systems in stadiums to AV connectivity solutions in commercial buildings.

In the entertainment industry alone, our impact has been far reaching. From playing a small part in performances by the likes of Paul McCartney, Bruce Springsteen, Elton John, Bob Dylan and more, to receiving an Emmy Award in recognition of our contribution to AV connectivity, we continue to push boundaries into the future.

What you’ll be working on

As a result of ongoing growth, we are now recruiting an experienced Business Systems Analyst to assist with the strategic and tactical development of business software and systems. This will involve working cross-functionally to help define initiatives and strategies, analyse requirements, document designs, and deliver application and system solutions.
You will collaborate with product managers, software architects, Dev Ops & business system owners as well as working with internal customers such as finance, sales, product delivery and the executive leadership team, you will determine customer requirements, set priorities, determine product featuring, examine and document process work flows, etc. to align internal systems with external products and services
This is a role that will include interaction with global teams and requires a strong ability to communicate effectively with various business and technical teams. The right candidate is someone who loves solving complex problems and has a proven track record of being able to successfully identify a solution, prepare a plan, and execute it with strong results.
This is a full-time position located at our office in Sydney, NSW Australia.
Responsibilities:
Using Agile methods, work cross-functionally with various stakeholders, and both in-house and remote offshore teams to determine needs and requirements
Working with product managers, software architects, devops and business systems owners, lead the ideation, technical development, and launch of innovative projects combining data, design sense, and empathy towards Audinate’s internal & external customers
Build and maintain a transformational roadmap and ensure development connects to user needs and business goals

Participate in the product development process as the voice of internal systems and drive development of tools; integrations and process supporting business outcomes
Build use cases and user stories and communicate them effectively
Assess and mitigate risks, resolve bottlenecks, serve as an escalation point of contact, anticipate and access trade-offs and balance business needs with technical constraints
Obtain and integrate user feedback into product requirements to ensure products satisfy user needs as well as wants
Make informed product decisions leveraging quantitative and qualitative data

What we’re looking for

B.A. or B.S. degree or equivalent related experience
5+ years of experience in business analysis in IT or software products.
Experience with the integration and process work flow mapping of Salesforce, NetSuite, or other related CRM, Accounting, and ERP systems preferred.

What you’ll experience with us

When you join us in our brand-new office in Surry Hills (that’s right, brand new in August 2019) you’ll be joining a global team of talented and passionate people who work hard together and enjoy it!

In addition to a competitive salary, annual bonus and equity incentive plan, you’ll have the opportunity to truly make a difference in our growing organization. You’ll also experience our diverse, values-based culture and a range of benefits such as flexible working hours through to volunteering leave and social activities.

Overview
The Review Delivery Team has responsibility for the data management, production and distribution of over 20 million communication and correspondence items annually.
This is a key role within the Review Delivery Team, and is responsible for annual and interim Fund review processing and member statement production.
The purpose of the role is to test and run annual and interim system reviews, maintain data mapping and business rules based on Fund statement requirements, and test that the statement output accurately meets requirements and is delivered on schedule.

Key Accountabilities and Main Responsibilities
Ensure that allocated review tasks are completed in line with the agreed review timetable.
Prepare and execute data test scripts and manage the resolution of items through relevant stakeholders.
Conduct scheduled system testing prior to review date to ensure processes run correctly and timely.
Run system review processes in production and provide relevant data files to the Mail House.
Manage the resolution of any issues in test or production system review processing.
Liaise with the Mail House to resolve any queries regarding data and/or files.
Record and reconcile output based on system review records, data files, Mail House lodgements, etc.
Support the identification of changes in Fund statement data and conditional requirements.
Review statement requirements and ascertain if changes are required to mapping/business rules.
Document and maintain the statement data mapping and business rules in line with Fund requirements.
Manage the versioning and provision to the Mail House of the data mapping and business rules.
Resolve any queries from the data Validation Reports and ensure that reports are error free.
Coordinate with the Mail House the transfer of PDF files and raise requests to upload files to TRIM.
Communicate status and participate in stakeholder meetings as required
Facilitate raising/resolving Work Requests for statement production and review processing as required.
Experience & Personal Attributes
Strong organisational management and multi-tasking skills
Ability to priorities, organize and forward plan to meet at times very stringent deadlines
Attention to detail and accuracy
Work collaboratively and proactively with Service Delivery Manger, internal work groups and third parties.
Positively contribute to improving the way we operate with innovation and the use of best practice processes
Sound communication and problem management skills
Good knowledge of superannuation and pension business desirable
Proven experience or aptitude in translating needs into requirements documentation
Working knowledge of Link systems and business processes desirable
Proficiency with Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, V & H lookups, and formula utilization) Word and Outlook
Ability to write/tune SQL for data analysis and validation
Shares expertise and learning across the team and encourages others to do so. Consistently seeks feedback on own performance.
Thinks and acts strategically in relation to problem solving and cost savings

As part of the Behavioural Risk division of Macquarie’s Risk Management Group (RMG), the Risk Culture team assist Macquarie businesses to determine the soundness, and enable the alignment, of culture to drive good risk outcomes throughout Macquarie Group Limited. A sound risk culture has been integral to Macquarie’s risk management framework since inception and continues to be of high importance to the Group.
The primary function of our team is to apply our well-developed assessment process and undertake independent risk culture reviews across the operating and central service groups to identify the relative strengths and areas for development within a business or function. These findings and accompanying actionable recommendations are shared with senior management to effect positive change.
Risk culture is an exciting area to work in, with growing global recognition that risk cultures are fundamental to their long-term success. In addition to on-the-job learning and working alongside a team of experienced subject matter experts, you will also benefit from a supportive team environment which values diversity and inclusion, workplace flexibility and continued learning opportunities.
To drive a strong risk culture, you will have opportunities to enhance the risk culture assessment methodology and act in an advisory capacity to Macquarie businesses where the team’s expertise will lead to better risk outcomes. You will also be expected to support continuous improvement initiatives to drive greater efficiency and effectiveness across the team and the wider Risk Management Group division.
The team consists of members with varied backgrounds and welcomes diverse perspectives. As such, we value hearing how you could apply your previous work experience to further enhance how our team operates. While the role is Sydney-based, the role will at times require overseas travel (in line with governments’ health guidance) due to Macquarie global business operations.
As a Risk Culture Senior Analyst you will be pivotal in supporting risk culture reviews applying professional judgement and relevant experience to our review process. You will develop surveys, including customised questions, that will effectively assess risk culture, manage the online survey process (through Qualtrics) with a focus on end-user experience and critically analyse survey output (quantitative and qualitative) and presenting findings in an insightful way using a range of software (e.g. PowerBI and Excel).
Other Responsibilities include:
Transcribing behavioural interviews to a high standard, and depending on your level of experience, being the lead or secondary interviewer.
Triangulating survey, interview, and organisational data to assist in developing risk culture insights and recommendations
Supporting and facilitating the presentation and reporting of key findings to senior management.
To be success in this role you will have relevant education and experience at least two years post-graduate in human behaviour (e.g. psychology, behavioural science) and/or business and finance (e.g. economics, human resources, consulting). You will bring strong attention to detail and data literacy skills, working with both quantitative and qualitative data and strong verbal and written communication skills to assist in delivering risk culture insights and working within a collaborative team environment.
You will also bring sound Excel and PowerPoint skills to analyse and present findings in informative ways and a desire to continually learn and develop your skillset across a broad range of subject matters. Your sound time management skills and experience with a range of other visualisation and statistical software (e.g. PowerBI and SPSS) will set you up for success in this role.
If you are interested in this exciting new opportunity, apply today via the links provided.
The Risk Management Group (RMG) is an independent and centralised function responsible for objective review and challenge, oversight, monitoring and reporting in relation to Macquarie’s material risks. RMG designs and oversees the implementation of the risk management framework. Its divisions include Credit, Market Risk, Regulatory Affairs and Aggregate Risk, Financial Crime Risk, Compliance, Operational Risk & Governance, Behavioural Risk, Enterprise Support and Internal Audit.
Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.
Macquarie is an equal opportunities employer and does not discriminate on the grounds of age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, gender identity, marriage, civil partnership, pregnancy, maternity, race (including colour and ethnic or national origins), religion or belief.
We facilitate a range of flexible working arrangements within our teams. Talk to us about what flexibility may be available.

About Macquarie
A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.
Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups, disciplines, sectors and borders. With 16,000+ employees and offices in 32 markets around the world, we’re a truly global organisation.
You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives, ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us, you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.
Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.

rd

party relationships to complement and elevate service delivery to the business.

The safety and wellbeing of our employees and potential employees are important to us. Our external candidates will have the choice to either interview in our offices or via Zoom. Not only do we wish to protect the health and safety of our people, we want to assure candidates that there is no expectation from REA to meet face-to-face. A virtual interview will not adversely impact your application. If you have any questions or concerns, this can be discussed through the screening process.
We are considering candidates based in Melbourne or Sydney for this role.
We’re REA
An Australian start-up success story we’re quietly proud of.
From a garage in Melbourne to the global stage is an achievement we’re humbled by. Our idea to put pictures of houses on the internet has blossomed since 1995, and we now have businesses across Australia, Asia, India and North America.
Our purpose is to change the way the world experiences property. No matter where you’re at on your property journey, we’re here to help on every step – whether that’s buying, selling, renting or renovating.
Some of our brands include realestate.com.au, realcommercial.com.au, spacely.com.au, Flatmates.com.au, Smartline.com.au and Proptrack.com.
Where the PropTrack team fits in
REA is evolving how it leverages data and technology to deliver benefits for customers. After the acquisition of Hometrack Australia in May-18 (recently re-branded into PropTrack). Since this time the business has continued to grow, underpinned by an expanding set of services and capabilities we bring to our customers.

What we’re doing
PropTrack’s Commercial team is the face of the PropTrack business. This role sits within the Client Analytics Solutions function, forming part of the customer-facing Commercial team.
The Client Analytics Solutions has become an important, unique and in demand offering of PropTrack in market, as a result we are now looking for an experienced data & analytics professional who can interface with our customers to help consult and solve analytical problems.
What you’ll be doing
While no two days are the same, typical responsibilities and activities will include:
Liaising and working collaboratively with PropTrack’s customers to help solve analytical business problems.
Working with customers on tasks from a wide breadth of analytical domains including modelling, data mining/analysis, reporting and data visualisation.
Presenting complex analytical outputs and results to all levels of an organisation.
Presenting and engaging with prospective PropTrack customers to identify opportunities.
Working with commercial leads and account managers to support client requests and working across a wide range of teams within REA to service these requests.
Bringing domain expertise to help in the design and build of new products and solutions to support PropTrack’s property analytics products, platforms and custom solutions in line with the growth strategy.
Building a deep understanding of PropTrack’s products and enabling clients to optimise and make the best use of PropTrack’s current data analytics products and platforms.
Building deep relationship with key stakeholders within the Financial Services clients (Senior Manager to analyst levels).
Who we’re looking for
Commercial orientation – commercially savvy, able to bring the best outcomes for the benefit of PropTrack business and clients alike.
Creative and analytical thinker - an ability to work through complex problems collaboratively, and to find practical and viable solutions to meet client needs and wants.
Client Focus - a mind-set that is always client first, and a proven track record in managing customer experience initiatives.
Domain Knowledge - A deep understanding of several or all of the following: data analytics, the property market, property data, property valuations, home lending and retail banking.
Technical knowledge Understanding of common modelling techniques such as sampling, logistic regression, linear regression, decisions trees, neural networks and time series analysis and experience of working in a data-rich environment with data mining techniques and predictive analytics, with use of tools such as SQL, R, Python. Knowledge in common data visualisation tools such as Tableau is also highly desirable.
Relationship Influencer – the ability to build strong relationships with peers within in organisations, to solve problems and perspective of clients for mutually beneficial outcomes.
But we don’t just look for someone based on their skills and expertise. It’s our connection, acceptance and genuine care for each other that makes REA a great place to work. That means you also need to be:

Savvy minded and have the ability to think a little left of field / outside the box
A strong and creative communicator
Friendly, approachable and have good relationship management skills
An avid supporter of our fully inclusive culture - we celebrate difference and ensure that everyone belongs
The REA experience
The physical, mental, emotional and financial health of our people is something we’ll never stop caring about. This is a place to learn and grow. We’re committed to your development – both professionally and personally. Your experience with us is something we take seriously.

We offer:
Onsite/online health and wellbeing programs, including yoga and meditation classes
Because We Care program which includes volunteer leave and community grants, to ensure you have the opportunity to give back to your community
Hack Days so you can bring your big ideas to life
An additional day of leave just for your birthday
A flexible working environment meaning we strike the balance of what you need and what works for the business (and yes, our leaders fully understand the flexible working policy)
A hybrid approach to the future of work - https://www.rea-group.com/blog/the-way-we-work-at-rea-a-hybrid-approach/
Industry leading gender-neutral parental leave

Oh, and by the way:
At REA we value diversity and inclusion in all forms. Gender, religion, ethnicity, LBTGIQ+, neurodiversity and so much more. Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalized folks tend to only apply when they check every box. So, if you've got the must-haves, dedication and enthusiasm to learn but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch. We'd love to have a chat and see if you could be a great fit.

Company Description

Deep Blue Company (DBC) is a fast-growing Australian owned scale-up consisting of Conveyancing.com.au and Rapid Building Inspections, two leaders within their respective fields. With our focus on the sale and purchase of property connecting people, systems and data across the pre-sale, building inspections and conveyancing process through to settlement, DBC are proudly a disruptor in the industry; delivering innovative, digital and high-volume solutions to the Australian residential property market.
What's the opportunity?
With multiple exciting new business initiatives underway, we are seeking a Lead Business Analyst (BA) who thrives in an Agile, product-driven scale-up/start-up environment to lead a small team of BA's within our DBC technology team. This newly created role will see you supporting our wider business teams and the broader technology team by efficiently unpacking and documenting requirements for complex business problems, partnering with vendors and a number of stakeholders across our brands. Your role will be essential in our ability to deliver projects and tasks to the correct scope, and on time.
About the role
Effectively lead a team of up to 6 direct BA reports and own our overall documentation set to support a range of projects including new product development, tech transformations, migrations, client onboarding and product enhancements
Lead requirements collection workshops, ensuring that documentation outputs are of the highest quality across the BA team
Build relationships with Product Owners, UX/UI Designers, Developers, Testers and Architects and influence stakeholders to achieve the best outcomes for the business
Support shape technical solutions to problems including recommending tools, technologies and processes.
Your skills & experience
Experience leading a team of Business Analysts in a similar product-driven scale-up/start-up with clear knowledge of best practice BA principles
Working with Agile team across multiple locations
Leading and coordinating workshops, documenting specifications, process mapping, providing ongoing reporting and updates to both business and technical stakeholders
Knowledge of technical product development for both greenfield and existing products
Being an influential business leader with relevant qualifications and certifications
What's the offer?
This full-time position can be based out of either Sydney or Melbourne, pays a competitive salary based on your relevant skills and experience, offers flexible working options and will see you making a truly significant impact across our teams. You'll set the tone for how we approach and deliver our business analysis capability, and have the support from a genuinely collaborative leadership team.
Next Steps
If this Lead BA role sounds like an opportunity you'd excel in, please apply now and take the next step in your BA career within a progressive and innovative scale-up that values your development, wellbeing and success.
As an equal opportunity employer, Deep Blue Company embraces diversity in our teams through fair community representation of gender, age, culture, thought and work arrangement.
NOTE: To be eligible to progress in your application, you must be permitted to work in Australia on an unrestricted basis. Applications from agencies will not be accepted at this time.

Job Description & Summary
With PwC, you’ll ignite a meaningful career while being supported by a flexible working culture, innovative learning and development opportunities and progressive policies and benefits, such as 18 weeks paid parental leave for mums, dads and foster carers (no minimum service!)
What will you create?
You’ll help Australian businesses, not-for-profits and governments create value and improve the way they work. From digitising finance functions, to partnering with new and exciting ASX companies as they grow, together we build trust in society and solve important problems.
Trust & Risk brings this to life by helping clients improve the way they operate, reduce costs, manage risks, leverage talent, or fundamentally change the way they do business. Your work here will help organisations of all shapes and sizes work smarter and grow faster.
As a Senior Manager in our Data Assurance team your impact will be seen by:
Working with the Partners, our other team leaders and broader Trust & Risk teams on projects to establish and build trusted relationships with client executives.
Management and delivery teams through excellence and innovation in data analytics-backed project delivery.
Leading small to medium teams (typically 5 to 10 people) to design, build and deliver innovative solutions for the nations biggest Financial Institutions.
Establish and develop key client relationships.
Taking a business led approach to analytics, blending your commercial understanding with your analytical experience and consulting mindset to ensure that the insight we develop can truly be used by our clients to add value to their organisation.
Helping manage and energise, cross competency teams for client project delivery.
Supporting growth of our team through sharing your analytical expertise and understanding.
About you
You have a background in data analytics and will have qualifications IT/ Computer Science and/ or Accounting, Commerce, Finance or similar. With 5 to 10 years of professional experience leading small teams, you are passionate about problem solving, learning and applying your skills in data cleansing, wrangling, manipulation and visualisation/analysis. As well as hold an understanding of key data analytical tools and techniques.
You will need to be hands-on and have experience developed in a consultative environment, be able to maintain a business perspective and delve into a detailed solution level as needed. You will have the ability to work in and lead teams to understand client commercial and technical objectives from stakeholders and translate those into a solution design. You will have demonstrated skills in building personal networks, hypothesis-based problem solving and the ability to execute actions effectively.
You will have good communication, presentation, project management and time-management skills, as well as being able to collaborate with end users, engineering teams and management.You will have the ability to handle multiple or large projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment. Both enthusiasm and drive are key in a leadership role in our team, helping shape and develop its future.
Strong understanding of databases is essential as you will be able to collect and analyze complex datasets. Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy - data is often sourced from multiple systems (think transactional, application, security logs, CRM, ERP, etc). Intermediate experience with SQL and MS Excel is required, other experience with Python, R, SAS, data modelling, Alteryx, Tableau (or similar vis), GIT, JIRA, etc. all highly regarded
Experience in product management concepts or solution design/delivery and experience with cloud data engineering (AWS, Google Cloud etc.) is desirable. Experience of business development, proposition and proposal development is desirable.
You are passionate about being at the forefront of change, you’re ready to help our Consulting team deliver practical insight that speaks straight to the heart of client business issues and deliver innovative results.
You are highly collaborative and enjoy working in an innovative environment. You’re a problem solver by nature and want to join a firm that values the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and stakeholders. Most importantly, you act with integrity and show care for the people you work with.
Life at PwC
Our culture and benefits are something we’re proud of, and also why we’re consistently named as one of Australia’s best workplaces. With PwC, you’ll belong to an inclusive community where differences are both embraced and the underlying driver in everything we create together.
We empower you with the technology, coaching, flexibility and trust needed to make a meaningful difference, while supporting you in bringing your whole self to work each day. We’re committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce because we know it’s only by working together that we can realise the potential of our people, clients and society around us.
We’re living this commitment through initiatives including our Reconciliation Action Plan to increase Indigenous employment and employee-led diversity networks promoting cultural, disability, LGBTI and gender equality. At our core we’re a people business, which means you’ll be supported not just in your professional development but your personal growth as well.
Wiona Court is the Recruitment Manager for the role. As the team experience high volumes of applications, we appreciate your patience to allow for a timely and fair process for all.

Job Title: Senior Finance Analyst (12-month fixed term), Port Kembla NSW
Job Description:
Job Description
At BlueScope, we create and inspire smart solutions in steel, strengthening our communities and helping build a better future. Our steel has shaped everything from hospitals and schools, bridges and stadiums to fences and homes – influencing the way we live and work, now and in the future.
The Opportunity
Come and discover the opportunity to join our International Trade Affairs Team as a Finance Analyst based in Port Kembla NSW. The International Trade Affairs Team has responsibility for the planning and execution of BlueScope Australian Steel Product’s anti-dumping and fair trade initiatives.
In this unique role, supporting the commercial services trade remedies work, you will provide financial recommendations and insights to maximise success in ensuring imported steel competition is conducted on a fairly traded basis.
What Will You Do?
As a trusted business advisor, you will:
undertake data analysis and modelling for pricing and cost trends across the Australian businesses, as well as globally
develop an in-depth understanding of, and commercial implications and opportunities for, the application of the rules-based anti-dumping framework
prepare and respond to government inquiries relating to fair trade matters
present data analysis outcomes and research findings to external domestic and international government bodies
prepare and respond to government inquiries relating to fair trade matters.
identify and implement activities to improve trade-related financial processes.
More About You
As an experienced finance professional looking to expand your knowledge and skills in a unique role, you will bring:
tertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline
CPA/CA qualifications or currently studying towards
proficiency in MS Office suite and ERP systems
an ability to work cohesively with cross-functional departments
The BlueScope Difference
A career at BlueScope provides the opportunity to make a difference – to you, to your team, to our customers, to transforming products, processes and brands, and to an organisation intent on shaping a better built environment for all our communities. At BlueScope, you will:
make an impact both within the organisation and in the broader community
create and deliver innovative products and solutions that shape the world we live in
grow on a path of continuous learning and development
enjoy the sense of belonging that comes from working with people who genuinely look out for one another
We’re dedicated to supporting our people - keeping one-another safe, rewarding successes, and helping individuals grow. We foster workplace flexibility and an inclusive work environment that welcomes people of all backgrounds. We’re committed to climate action and to helping shape a better future for all our communities; we are committed to Our Purpose, Creating Strength.
Come and discover us at bluescope.com/life-at-bluescope/. Together we can make a world of difference.

Infrastructure projects
Initial 6 month contract
Immediate start

Our client is the leading transport agency in New South Wales and they are currently seeking a Risk Analyst experienced in Road or Rail Infrastructure projects for an initial 6 month contract.

The role provides specialist advice on the application and use of safety risk assessments and requirements of the TfNSW Safety Management System and statutory obligations, including documentation and reporting.

Key accountabilities
Provide Project Teams and AEOs expert advice on risk management to ensure integration with requirements and support of TfNSW safety change management and operational safety risk management policies as well as the overarching Safety Management Systems in place.
Provide advice and support to internal staff and AEOs on the requirements of the Operational Risk Management System throughout the design, development and implementation phases of project management for new and/or upgraded assets.
Provide risk management advice to support and enable the achievement of effective risk-based decision making and the delivery of defined business outcomes.
Prepare reports to meet statutory obligations, internal requirements of the ASA and TfNSW, and Independent Verification Reports as required by the Safety Management System.
Deliver risk training material and assist in the development and review of various competency standards related to risk and oversee the delivery of training to staff throughout TfNSW and AEOs.
Essential requirements
Relevant tertiary qualifications and/or experience in a discipline relevant to the identification, assessment and control of risk.
If you are interested in a confidential discussion regarding this role, please click "Apply Now" or call 0282524001.

Senior Supply Chain Analyst to join the Business Analytics Team
Training and leadership development
Ongoing incentives with team based workplace that supports flexibility and inclusion
About the Company
A National Transport & Logistics company focused on customer service with a priority being the customer experience. The business is working towards a fully supported regional network model to be the best carrier out to regional Australia with full visibility.
About the Role
The Senior Business Analyst role is pivotal in identifying and developing platforms and metrics to understand; business and operational trends, process improvement opportunities and challenging the status quo through data and operational knowledge to drive business profitability.
The role will involve a high level of collaboration working in all areas of the business providing analytical support in a financial, operational and commercial capacity.
Your duties will include:
Demonstrating proven analytical skills with a 'can do' attitude – we're looking for someone who can propose, document and deliver;
Sourcing, collating and interpreting data from multiple sources to support and develop business case modelling, dashboards and reporting
Conducting analyses and process evaluations to deliver insights, identify risks/opportunities and support commercial and operational decision-making
Development and enhancement of reports and dashboards for key stakeholders
Working with internal and external parties to understand and develop business solutions
Engagement of key stakeholders to validate project findings, volumes and other associated costs, revenues and business impacts
Identifies levers and targets to achieve best practice and control within operational processes
The successful applicant will demonstrate the following skills and attributes:
Tertiary qualification in Business/ Logistics / Engineering / Business Analytics or other related disciplines
Excellent commercial and business acumen
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (written and verbal)
Highly developed Analytical skills (3+ years’ Analytical experience in a similar role)
High level of attention to detail and accuracy
Detailed knowledge of supply chain industry, strategic drivers and finance
Demonstrated ability to assimilate highly complex information, analyse problems, make sound judgement and develop appropriate solutions
Stakeholder management skills, including ability to gain buy-in and influence stakeholders
Extensive experience in SQL, Power BI
Experience in predictive analytics, AI would be well regarded.

Next steps
If you are ready to submit your resume please select “Apply Now”.

Date: 28-Jul-2021

Location:
Western Sydney, NSW, AU

Department: Internal Client Services

Description:
Job Requisition ID: 18621

What will your typical day look like?

You will be:
Designing and developing SQL and BI solutions

Establishing and managing effective, customer focused working relationships with business users to deliver solutions

Collaborating with business and IT project managers to estimate, plan, and prioritise development tasks

Collaborating with architects and specialists to address business needs and design solutions to complex requirements

Deloitte ITS is seeking to fill a position for an experienced BI Developer with comprehensive knowledge and understanding of enterprise business intelligence architecture to work closely within the Information Technology Group.

Enough about us, let’s talk about you.

Advanced / Expert MS BI Developer on SSIS, SSRS, SSAS

Why Deloitte?
At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. About HelloFresh
Here at HelloFresh, we're passionate about bringing dinner inspiration to everyday Australians. With 9 years of service under our belt, we are the market leader in the growing world of meal kit delivery services, operating in 15 different countries.
As we continue to deliver fresh, seasonal ingredients and delicious, wholesome recipes to our customers, we see our inspired community of empowered home-cooks continue to grow, and you could be a part of it!
Are you energetic and motivated with a team focus? Do you thrive in a dynamic, high-growth environment? If you're looking for a role that lets you make an impact every single day, we'd love to hear from you.
Job Description
We are hiring a Junior Menu Data Analyst to join the Menu Planning team based in our Sydney Head Office.
This is an exciting role and a chance to engage in complex commercial and analytical business questions while building your analytical skills.
You will provide data-driven insights to inform and drive improvements across our business. These insights will lead directly to business outcomes and you will be a central part of improving our product.
As part of a fast-paced team you will have the opportunity to work on a range of projects combining an understanding of various metrics and data sources to help inform decision making. This is an exciting chance to build your technical and analytical skills and have an immediate impact.
You will...
Contribute to the Menu Planning roadmap, balancing regular reporting, automation and strategic projects / analysis
Use data extraction programming languages and visualization tools (SQL, Tableau, Excel) to extract the data and provide accurate reporting
Ensure on-time delivery of analysis and follow-up with stakeholders
Take a logical approach to problem solving
Be confident supporting and challenging team members in the ideation, implementation and review of data-related requests
Work in a cross functional team supporting Product, Marketing, Supply Chain, Finance and other departments
You have...
A Degree preferably in Business, Data, Computer Engineering, Science or Economics
Preferred full-time work experience in consulting, data or commercial roles
A strong analytical and business-oriented mindset
Experience in using SQL, and Tableau. Excellent knowledge of GSheets.
The ability to coordinate a project from start to finish and deliver on time
Excellent interpersonal communication skills with both technical and non-technical individuals
You are...
Data-driven in your approach
Highly motivated by a fast-paced culture of continuous feedback, growth and healthy debate
Able to conceptualise complex business questions and processes into simple analytical models
Able to interpret data and provide key commercial insights
Proactive, confident and able to quickly build a network of key stakeholders
What you'll get in return...
The chance to have a significant impact on one of the fastest-growing global technology companies in an exciting growth phase
Company discount - 70% off HelloFresh boxes
Flexible working arrangements
Flat hierarchies, constant learning with room for personal growth
Free access to Headspace
HelloFresh Academies - monthly internal learning & development
A diverse and vibrant international environment, with offices in 15 countries
Duration: 12 Months (Maternity leave cover)
Start Date: Immediate - can wait a notice period
Location: Chippendale Head Office - currently working from home
Duration: Full time role. You must have the right to work full-time in Australia
We are committed to building and nurturing an inclusive community for our employees. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age or other legally protected status.
To put it simply, everyone is welcome at our table.
Important: Please be aware of the current travel restrictions. Australia has now officially closed its borders for anyone not holding an AU passport or Residency. This is a drastic measure installed by the government to reduce the chance of COVID-19. Therefore at this stage we are only considering applicants who are currently based in Australia and who are eligible to work full time.

PowerBI Data Analyst
The PowerBI Data Analyst in our Group IT team plays a critical role designing, implementing and supporting analytics solutions including self-service in QlikSense and PowerBI.
Design, test, implement and maintain business intelligence models, reports and dashboards
Support implementation of Data Governance (Definition, Quality, Lineage, Modelling, Access)
Identify improvement opportunities, make recommendations and work to implement them
Location: Sydney, NSW.
At Evolution, we’re passionate about Our Culture and Values.
Evolution Mining is a leading, growth-focused globally relevant gold company. We were created in late 2011 and operate five wholly owned mines across Australia and Ontario, Canada.
About the role
The PowerBI Data Analyst, will support in the planning, design, development and deployment of operations and use case driven business intelligence models, reports and dashboards, leveraging a hybrid ecosystem of on-premise and cloud-based data source systems, to serve analytics models.
Other key result areas in this position include:
Planning and deploying systems in a high availability architecture, utilising DevOps and Agile principles and practices.
Ensuring documentation of respective technical systems and infrastructure are in place and kept up to date.
Designing, implementing, maintaining, testing, and remaining up to date with latest developments in relation to information systems and related technologies.
About you
The PowerBI Data Analyst will have at least 3 years’ experience working with Business Intelligence / Data warehousing systems and applications (PowerBI and Qlik preferred).
It is important that you have/ or can demonstrate:
Excellent collaborative interpersonal communication and team interaction skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to a range of audiences.
Strong analytical and problem-solving capability, with the ability to multi-task.
Able to apply expertise and technology, to deliver results and meet stakeholder expectations.
Practical knowledge in two or more of the following platforms would be advantageous: PowerBI, Azure Data Lake, Azure Analysis Services, Apache Spark, Docker Containers, DevOps, Kubernetes
Closing date: 12th August 2021
