Do work that makes a difference
We currently have an exciting opportunity to join the Enterprise Data Office team. A key focus of the role will be to guide, support and work with the central Data and Analytics team to simplify, standardise and automate key data processes. Provide data management service and solutions to support analysis and research relevant to the Bank's core functions. Support the Enterprise Data Office to embed and improve data management best practices in the RBA. This is a 10-Month Fixed-Term Contract.
Responsibilities will include:
Work with business subject matter experts to understand and document existing data management processes and practices and to identify opportunities for improvement
Provide process management subject-matter guidance to re-design, simplify and standardise data management and analytics processes, and automate using modern data tools
Promote the adoption of modern data management and analytics tools and practices throughout the organisation
Contribute to the improvement of policies, systems and processes, ensuring the integrity, accessibility and suitability of information, as well as solutions resilient to changes in technology and operating environments
Engage and educate stakeholders about the value of data management and data technologies

Your team
This role is part of the Corporate Services Group. The Corporate Services Group is responsible for the effective provision of information technology, workplace (asset management, facilities management, building security, and procurement) and data management services to support the delivery of the Bank’s policy, operational and corporate objectives.

Your background
To be successful in this critical role you will possess:
5+ years experience as a business analyst in large data related projects, ideally in the financial services industry
Experience in process reengineering and documentation
Understanding of programming language concepts such as R or Python, understanding of ETL, database concepts and SQL
Understanding of Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence concepts and architectures with experience of software development lifecycle in this context
Prior exposure to data management frameworks such as DAMA DMBOK or equivalent
Excellent written and verbal communications skills. Strong stakeholder management experience

Your development & career
Working for an organisation that truly makes a difference to the Australian people, we can offer development and career opportunities in a collaborative environment that supports people’s growth, wellbeing and promotes flexibility.
Why RBA?
The RBA pursues national economic policy objectives and undertakes a range of associated activities in financial markets and banking. It also issues Australia's banknotes and operates infrastructure critical to the payments system, all of which contributes to the welfare of the Australian people.
Our people have a critical role to play in achieving these objectives, whether directly or in a supporting capacity. As a values driven organisation, our people conduct themselves with a high degree of integrity, while striving for excellence in the work they perform and the outcomes they achieve. We encourage intelligent inquiry, we treat one another with respect, while promoting the public interest in our efforts.
The Reserve Bank of Australia is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace and encourage applications from experienced candidates seeking workplace flexibility.

Advertised29 Jul 2021

Customer data savvy wanted
Permanent full-time Contract
Join an organisation committed to creating spaces where communities thrive

We have an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst – Customer Intelligence to join the team on a permanent full-time contract.

As the Analyst, you will contribute to a high-performance team by performing analysis, providing data insights, solving problems, and building solutions for Stockland through customer data and research.

Key Responsibilities:
Proactively support and collaborate with the analysts and data scientists to provide the marketing team with timely and accurate insights to support decision making.
Support and lead initiatives to improve customer centricity in Stockland with other members of the analytics team and the Marketing Leadership Team.
Develop dashboards and embed advanced analytics solutions built by the analytics team to extract value from the insights by applying them to customer-related processes marketing decision making.
Manage quantitative and qualitative data collection and data quality improvement initiatives, including ongoing surveys, that enable a deeper understanding and the potential for targeting improvements. Manage includes, but is not limited to, project scoping, survey design, working with stakeholders, suppliers & agencies and delivering recommendations.
Manage the growth and development of the Stockland research community, as well as utilizing it for research purposes.
Assist with the integration of new data, research tools, digital marketing tools or platforms into the marketing tech stack.
Proactively manage risk for Data Privacy regulations, working with the broader marketing team to drive best practice for the proper collection, storage and use of Customer Data.
Participate in the set-up of objectives and metrics for the measurement and optimization of campaigns, customer conversion initiatives, or referral initiatives.
Work with internal business stakeholders to identify research needs and design, execute and communicate appropriate research solution to give the business guidance/recommendation etc. based on customer insights.
Maintain strong working relationships with external suppliers and internal stakeholders to deliver data and research projects to a high standard, on time and on budget.

What are we looking for?
At least two years’ experience in a marketing, data analysis or research related role.
Experience with SQL is highly sought after. Basic experience with programming languages like Python or R is non-essential but desired.
Experience with designing and scripting surveys, as well as analyzing results from qualitative research
Demonstrated skills in communicating insights and recommendations.
Appropriate tertiary qualification (e.g., marketing, commerce)

The Stockland Proposition
At Stockland we are a community delivering outcomes that benefit the community at large. We work collaboratively and inclusively, building strong working relationships. Our portfolio is diverse and so are the opportunities for professional and career development. We are committed to providing our people with broad experiences to build a successful career.
We recognise the importance of flexibility and work life-quality and over 80% of our employees have informal or formal flexible work arrangements. Additionally, Stockland has a strong commitment to achieving the best outcomes through an inclusive and collaborative culture. Our customers come from diverse backgrounds, and we want our teams to reflect this.
We offer competitive remuneration and benefits. Benefits include free to access or subsidized lifestyle, health, well-being and financial services products.

Due to the nature of this role, we can only accept applications from Australian Citizens, Permanent Residents or Open Work Visa holders with more than 12 months validity from their role start date.

Apply today – Stockland – it's your place.
Agencies should note that unsolicited resumes will not be accepted for this position and Stockland will not pay any fees related to resumes that are submitted directly to hiring managers and not through our approved process. Where appropriate, the Careers @ Stockland Team will work with our preferred panel of agencies to source candidates for roles. Please submit any queries relating to the approved process of submitting candidate resumes or Stockland’s preferred agency panel to careers@stockland.com.au

Join an Insurance leader that is driven by data
Work with in-demand tools and technologies - Google Analytics, PowerBI & more
Monitor and analyse our SEM, an area with our richest data sets
The Opportunity
At Greenstone, we are truly analytics driven business, with analytics driving and informing decisions across all aspects of the business. In this role you will be responsible for monitoring and analysing our Search Engine Marketing, an area that has some of the richest datasets for analysis. What someone has searched for, where they are located, what time of day it is, are they searching from a mobile or computer - these are all import factors that can be used to predict how likely someone is to purchase a product from us, and thus how much we should spend on advertising to them.

Greenstone is a large business with multiple brands, but we don't silo our marketing activities. You will need to determine if and how ads from our own competing brands should be shown to potential customers. You will also work with our existing machine learning models and provide input on the development of new ML models. In this role you will have the opportunity to work with some of the most sophisticated data-driven marketing in Australia, you won't simply report on the performance of our search marketing, but rather be a key player and defining that performance.

What are we looking for?
Tertiary qualification in a relevant Actuarial Studies, Mathematics, Science, Engineering or Statistics discipline
Experience (typically 4-6 years) in a similar insight driven data analytics area
Strong experience in SQL and either Python / R / SAS
Strong experience in visualization tools such as PowerBI or Tableau
Comprehensive understanding of MS Excel and other applications within the MS Office suit
Strong conceptual, problem solving and analytical skills
Strong communication and stakeholder management
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Knowledge of Digital Channels (SEM, SEO, FB, EDM)
Knowledge of Web Analytics Tool (Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics)

Desirable
Exposure to digital marketing campaigns and profitability
Our Promise to Our People
We are passionate about our core values of Customer First, We Care, One Team, and Results Driven, which define how we approach our work. We recognise that our colleagues are the key to our success. That's why you can expect to be rewarded for the hard work you put in through job satisfaction, career development and the fantastic range of benefits we offer:
Fantastic employee benefits including flexi days, flexible working, annual $1200 travel/parking allowance & more
Hybrid Office and Work From Home model
Company funded paid parental leave benefit (18 weeks!)
State of the art building facilities including a dedicated & subsidised on-site company cafe (weekly free lunch) & on-site gym
Health & well-being initiatives and programs
Opportunity to take part in in-house leadership & emotional intelligence workshops
Quarterly award functions and a grand annual conference to recognise our people
Retail discounts e.g. movie tickets, Taronga Zoo entry, live shows + more
Morsl market (a fully automated self-serve, food and drink marketplace with a wide variety of meals, snacks and drinks)
Who is Greenstone?
Greenstone distributes insurance products under trusted brands such as Real Insurance, RSPCA Pet Insurance, Guardian, Medibank, Woolworths, Guide Dogs Pet Insurance, Kogan Life Insurance, Australian Seniors Insurance Agency and Choosi.

We are the leading distributor of direct Insurance products in the Australian insurance market. Since launching into the Financial Services sector in 2007, Greenstone has experienced a commanding volume of growth being recognised for our credible brands, customer focused values and people-driven work culture.

We are passionate about our core values, which contribute towards the positive culture that supports our employees, our customers and our community.

Great central location in Norwest Business Park, Bella Vista - only a short walk from Norwest Metro station (also direct bus access from Parramatta and Blacktown).

With the exceptional circumstances being experienced globally due to COVID-19 (Coronavirus), Greenstone is working hard to support all our candidates and new starters during these critical times. Please be aware that our entire recruitment processes will be conducted virtually. We are also accredited as a Covid-safe workplace by NSW Government.

Apply Now
If this role interests you, we would love to hear from you! Please apply now or email recruitment@greenstone.com.au

www.greenstone.com.au

Job Title: Lead Data Analyst/ Data Delivery Lead
Job Description:
Be part of the Risk Finance Treasury (RTF) Data Platform focussed on delivering an integrated Corporate Services data platform providing a single source of truth for timely and accurate data.
Deliver data outcomes to a number of regulatory & compliance programs/initiatives within Risk, Finance & Treasury domains in the Bank & also contribute to strategic uplift journey towards platform’s desired state.
Do work that matters
As a Lead Business Analyst you will liaise with critical internal & external stakeholders, conduct complex data requirements gathering sessions and lead data discovery/analysis activities required to inform the platform’s scope of change for new programs/initiatives.
You will also play a critical role in ongoing engagements with project/initiative stakeholders & coordinate delivery across multiple squads contributing to the overall outcome. Monitoring project progress day to day and building relationships with your colleagues, product owners & delivery leads will be key to your success.

On any given week your work will involve
Leading data analysis & data discovery activities for new programs/initiatives, coordinating with product owners, SMEs, data analysts with performing impact assessments, data discovery, data lineage, current state & gap analysis for complex data requirements.
Effectively collaborate with multiple technical and non-technical groups of stakeholders, and work well with a range of internal cross functional teams.
Reviewing data analysis or data modelling performed using the Ab Initio toolkit (or similar)and other technologies like Cloudera Hadoop, Teradata, Tableau.
Assess and document the current state of data architecture and processes to identify and recommend improvements, including application of User and customer journeys.
Lead requirements elicitation, including workshops to capture requirements. Constructively challenge stated requirements.
Define problems and opportunities. Perform business & technical data analysis that can be used to support or challenge business outcomes.
Contribute to assessment of dependencies and associated risk and compliance implications of requirements and solutions.
Effectively communicating requirements to stakeholders, managing conflicts, issues and changes in order to ensure that stakeholders and project team members remain in agreement on solution scope
Planning and coordinating delivery across multiple squads delivering towards an outcome
Adoption of best practices & processes on requirements elicitation, translation to systemic specifications, documentation, and communications with business stakeholders as well as delivery teams.
What you will need to succeed
Risk Mindset –All CommBank employees are expected to proactively identify and understand, openly discuss and act on current and future risks
Domain expertise in Ab Initio & Data experience (Science, Analysis, Discovery, Lineage)
Experience as Senior or Lead Business Analyst/Data Analyst in large Data projects or platforms
Experience within Financial services preferred, ideally with exposure to the Risk, Treasury and Finance data domain.
A flexible agile mindset in playing hybrid roles, experimentation and continuous improvement and pragmatic approach to project delivery
Strong communication, negotiation and facilitation skills, with proven ability to influence stakeholders
Agile delivery experience
From here you’ll go
This role is something you can really own and deliver. It will be a challenging and exciting opportunity that will be very rewarding throughout. If you are a Senior Business Analyst with proven experience performing complex data related functions and activities, would love to hear from you. Apply today!

Description:
A dynamic environment which will provide you with a platform to build your career
Flexible work arrangements - work in a way that suits you best
World-class learning and leadership programs
Do you want to help some of the largest, most interesting organisations in the world imagine and deliver the future of risk analytics?

Companies face a period of unprecedented complexity, including regulatory change, business disruption, emerging technologies, and ever-increasing customer expectations. Deloitte is here to make an impact that matters by helping solve complex risk and regulatory issues for our globally strategic clients. Our work extends across the full lifecycle of financial services, to transform complex business requirements into practical, implementable solutions. By re-imagining the way organisations can quickly identify, evaluate, manage risk, and deliver on regulatory change, we create:
a more transparent, efficient, and compliant world that ultimately ensures customers get fair outcomes
opportunities for our clients to take risks, so that they can grow and transform in a responsible way
In response to the growing demand for our team’s Risk Analytics services, we are looking to hire data scientists to join our National team, delivering market leading advice and practical data solutions that make a material impact to our clients, our people and society. We are looking for Data Scientists with 2-4 years’ experience either in-industry or with professional services firms, both globally and here in Australia.

We don’t just work with our clients to manage the downside of risk through leading data analytics solutions - we help them understand and seize the opportunities it presents too, helping them accelerate their growth or gain a competitive advantage.
If you’re an ideas person, problem solver and a hands-on doer, who loves to collaborate, you’ll thrive here.

We invest in our people, so you will have access to leading training and development opportunities, allowing you to develop both personally and professionally.

Some of the work we do includes:
Design algorithms, develop scripts and documentation for bespoke data solutions and models to solve complex regulatory, conduct and compliance problems using analytical tools and techniques.
Transform the ways clients leverage people, technology, data, business processes and controls, to better manage risks and optimise processes
Support the delivery of projects across a range of industries focusing on providing our clients with evidence based actionable insights to reduce risk and improve compliance
Working both autonomously, and closely with colleagues, Senior Data Scientists and Managers to deliver data solutions to clients
Taking ownership for the delivery of data analysis activities within a stream of work to deliver project goals
Devise and deploy effective communication strategies and supporting materials
About the team
People working across a wide range of industries and the public sector, our team advise, implement, and deliver analytics to support decision-making. Our team is an inclusive, dynamic, and growing team committed to driving innovation, delivering client outcomes, and making an impact that matters. The strength of our team lies in the diversity of the background and skillset of each member, fostered in a collaborative environment.

Enough about us, let’s talk about you.

You are someone with:
Artificial Intelligence, Statistics, Data Science, Applied Mathematics or Computer Science related degree OR prior data analytics and/or consulting experience
Knowledge of data mining algorithms, statistical and machine learning methods, best practice data transformation and validation techniques
Programming skills in languages and tools such as SAS, R, Python, SQL and SSIS
Data visualization skills, including design, build and communication of data insights using reporting tools such as Power BI, Tableau and QlikView
Ability to thrive working in a team environment and serving clients with distinction
Highly developed communication skills
Strong attention to detail with a curiosity to understand data
Ideally, a keen interest in third party datasets, emerging analytics tools and technologies within the risk and regulatory compliance
Experience in developing/validating/monitoring Credit Risk Models (PD/LGD/EAD), and / or IFRS9 models, and an understanding of Capital Adequacy (APS112/APS113) and prudential standards, guidelines, and reporting requirements will be valued, but not mandatory
Why Deloitte?
At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia’s borders. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in a variety of ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.

We’re committed to continually building a safe and respectful workplace, where all our people feel appreciated and accepted. Through the creation of endorsed employee-led diversity networks which promote cultural, disability, LGBTI+, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and gender equality, we’re leading the way to shape an environment where everybody can thrive.

We are proud to have been recognised for our efforts in inspiring change and accelerating progress – check out our careers site for recent recognition in this space.

We're scaling up our Customer Insights and Marketing Analytics team at THE ICONIC and we're on the hunt for savvy insights professionals to come and join our high-performing team. You'll be surrounded by like minded colleagues who are customer obsessed data-lovers and are always striving for growth through continuous improvement and learning.
As Customer Insights Analyst, you'll be a core member of the team and in this newly created position you will play a pivotal role in shaping how customer data is harnessed through all levels of the business. The work itself is varied and interesting from supporting BAU analysis, refining and building new processes, engaging with cross-functional teams on projects and exploratory analysis to surface new action focused insights. What's involved…
Leverage our wealth of customer data to build self-service reporting tools and dashboards that are automated, scalable and easily digested to enable informed business decisions
Develop a robust understanding of our customers to provide strategic input on marketing activities and onsite experience
Improve legacy reporting, use data to challenge the status quo and seek to continuously improve
Transform analytical output into actionable and results-oriented insights
Prioritise and respond to ad-hoc analytical requests from internal stakeholders
About you…
Intermediate-to-strong SQL skills, comfortable manipulating large and complex datasets
Advanced Excel skills and confidence with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI
Ability to manage priorities and thrive in a dynamic fast-paced environment
A love for continuous learning
Very organised, structured and process driven
Great communication skills and the ability to support others who aren't familiar with data
Google Analytics & GTM experience desirable
Facebook Ads Manager experience desirable
Marketing and/or retail experience is desirable but not essential. Experience working with customer data is highly regarded
Life at THE ICONIC...
Our culture of learning is an environment that supports and encourages the collective discovery, sharing and application of knowledge. This helps us to continually improve, achieve goals and attain new possibilities every day. From our ways of working and collaboration to our growth mindset and sustainable approach, we each add unique value and have an incredible amount of fun doing it! Job Title: Business Analyst for Non Financial Risk Data
Job Description:
This is an exciting new opportunity to assist in defining the future of Data and Business Architecture/Solutions in our Risk Management Group Data team.
In this permanent role you will work with stakeholders across the business and technology to develop a deep understanding of the growing data, analytics and automation needs of different risk functions as well as support the design and build of business solutions to cater to the requirements of each risk function. You will be assisting in managing projects as well as documenting business and functional requirements for risk’s data use cases and work with the tech architecture to develop technical solutions.
You will also be responsible for:
Working on solutions for strategic remediation of Data Quality issues across the broad Risk Management Group
Working on producing data model designs to ensure higher collaboration and efficiency in data usage across the Group’s functions
Being the representative for the Risk Management Group representing all Risk functions in enterprise programs and to ensure that RMG requirements are catered to
Assisting in ensuring all the data relevant to our risk function is brought under governance
Translating business solutions to tech solutions and work with tech delivery teams to deliver the required outcomes for our Risk Functions.
To be successful in this role you will possess vast experience in working with data and solutions in an Investment Bank, ideally as a business/technical analyst or a business solutions architect. Exposure to Risk Management will be highly advantageous.
CFA (any level) or FRM certification is desired but not mandatory.
Possessing a computer science or finance related degree is advantageous. You will be passionate about the potential application of cloud based big data technologies and hold an inquisitive mindset with a genuine desire to understand and solve problems.
About the Risk Management Group
The Risk Management Group (RMG) is an independent, centralised unit responsible for ensuring all risk across Macquarie are appropriately assessed and managed. Its divisions include Behavioural Risk, Compliance, Credit, Financial Crime Risk, Internal Audit, Market Risk, Operational Risk, Regulatory Affairs and Aggregate Risk, and RMG Enterprise Support.
Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.
We recognise that flexibility comes in a variety of forms. Talk to us about what flexibility you need.
If you are interested in this exciting new opportunity, please apply directly.

About Macquarie
A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.
Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups, disciplines, sectors and borders. With 16,000+ employees and offices in 32 markets around the world, we’re a truly global organisation.
You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives, ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us, you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.
Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.

Trendpac is a family-owned FMCG filling manufacturer located on the Central Coast of NSW. We pride ourselves in delivering quality products to our customers who are major national supermarkets.

Our production runs over 7 days on a 24 hours basis to ensure we are meeting our customer's expectations. Our team consists of more than 200 and we are working towards embedding our family values into all we do, every day!

We are seeking a team member that resonates with our values of:

Belonging, Loyalty & Respect, Honesty & Ethics, Forgiveness & Praise, Ambition & Humility, Tolerance & Compassion, Responsibility and Honour.

As our BI Data analyst, your role is to consult with business executives and key stakeholders to develop, implement, and improve the data management and reporting function of the organisation. Experience in, or exposure to, manufacturing/FMCG/equipment automation will be well regarded but is not essential. Experience with MS Dynamics / Navision would also be very well regarded.

To achieve this, the primary duties in this role would include:
Support and development (including troubleshooting and dealing with vendor partners) of the company's Business intelligence and data warehouse systems including data architecture, data integration, high availability, security, and data privacy.
The continuous evolution of our data strategy by keeping the pulse on current technology and methodology and by effectively utilizing consulting partners when necessary to achieve new functionality.
Act as the subject matter expert on data for the organisation
Develop efficient processes, procedures and standards practice to streamline the delivery of reporting
Implement machine learning frameworks to increase predictive intelligence of forecasting
Improving business profitability by developing Analytics to enable the development of optimal pricing strategies, overhead allocation and reduction model and fine-tuning of marketing strategies.
Develop the Business Intelligence strategy for the migration towards a smart factory (Industry 4.0) through data analysis and integration into strategic and operational activities.

To be successful in this role, you will also need to have:
Strong Data Management, Data Warehouse Design and Data Architecture skills
Strong working knowledge in Microsoft Azure technologies such as Azure Data Factory, Azure Storage, Azure Databricks and Azure SQL database
Technical skills on Microsoft on-premise BI stack (MSBI): SQL, SSIS, SSRS, SSAS and SharePoint.
Excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills to consult, liaise and negotiate with a wide range of stakeholders.
Commercial experience with a focus on an understanding of business problems, hypothesis formation, feature engineering & predictive modelling
Extensive experience in developing and implementing data analytics solutions.
Strong working knowledge of BI/data warehousing best practices.
In-depth knowledge of applicable data privacy practices.
Demonstrable experience implementing data governance, process management and data quality assurance.
Track record and methodical approach in project management and execution.
Excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills to consult, liaise and negotiate with a wide range of stakeholders.
Exceptional customer service orientation with extensive experience working in a team/ collaborative environment.
Bachelor’s Degree in Information Systems (preferred)

If you meet most of the above criteria, we would love to hear from you!

Job Title: Global Investment Research, Equity Research, Industrials, Analyst - Sydney/ Melbourne
Job Description:
MORE ABOUT THIS JOB:
YOUR IMPACT
Are you passionate about research and generating investment ideas? We’re looking for a professional to join our Industrials sector team in Sydney/ Melbourne to develop valuable insights and investment ideas for our clients.

OUR IMPACT
From macroeconomic forecasts to individual stock analysis, our team develops tools and insights to help shape investment strategies for clients and the firm. Our analysts work on client-focused research in the equity, fixed-income, currency, and commodities markets, mining big data that enters markets around the world each day to identify game-changing insights. You’ll be part of a team that is intellectually curious, creative, analytical, and passionate about performing market research.

RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS:
RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS

Working closely with the Senior Analyst and members of the A/NZ Industrials team, the role of the Business Analyst is to:

Building strong industry knowledge across multiple industries
Building, maintaining and updating company and industry models
Interpreting industry data and conduct cross company and sub sector data analysis
Providing support to single stock research analysts
Communicate with the equities sales force and traders, clients and company managements

SKILLS & EXPERIENCE WE’RE LOOKING FOR

1-3 years relevant work experience in investment research, comparable business/financial/consulting experience preferred
Natural curiosity, critical thinking, logical thinking
Strong financial modeling and analysis experience
Working knowledge of accounting, finance, and valuation
Meticulous attention to detail, strong analytical and organizational skills
Demonstrated ability to think laterally and exercise good judgment
Ability to multi-task, to work independently and across numerous teams
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Bachelor’s degree required, preference for commerce/engineering/science
Exposure to Transport and/or Infrastructure sectors an advantage, but not essential

ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS

At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.

Who is Equifax?
Equifax is a leading global data, analytic and technology company, supporting customers across 24 countries. We have been serving the Australian and New Zealand markets for over 60 years. Through continuously adapting to our environment, not only have we remained a market leader, we drive and challenge ourselves to do better to help our customers live their financial best.
Our people are what makes us great at what we do - we see every member of our team as an integral piece of a jigsaw. We celebrate differences and recognise that each person brings with them unique talents and perspectives. We provide our people the support and flexibility to manage their work-life balance. At Equifax we genuinely care about our people and our ability to come together as #OneEquifax.
The perks of being an Equifax employee within the Data & Analytics team?
There are lots of perks of being an Equifax employee – we offer additional leave days as we recognise the importance of taking time out, whether that’s to catch up on some rest, celebrate a birthday, or give back to our community by volunteering. We are committed to the wellbeing of our people and provide them with discounted health cover through BUPA, access to comprehensive hearing services and discounts, and offer 24/7 support through our employee assistance program. Our leadership team fosters a culture of ownership, they will lead, coach, mentor and listen. We support one another to feel confident to speak up and hold each other accountable to work with integrity.
Our success is our people, for we are truly united by our purpose and are encouraged and challenged every day to bring new ideas to help our customers make more informed decisions. Our outcomes focussed culture encourages thought leadership and innovation to ensure our ongoing success.
We are supportive and revel in working together on exciting projects. We see ourselves making an impact by utilising cutting edge/statistical modelling tools across hundreds of rich data assets and collaborating with some of the best data minds in Australia. Working within our diverse D&A team will provide you opportunities to gain exposure across all phases of the D&A lifecycle and work with some of our largest blue-chip customers.
What you’ll do:
The Big Data Platform Analyst is responsible for ensuring overall performance, availability and fitness of the big data analytic ecosystem of data, applications, tools and environments essential for Equifax Data and Analytics operations.
This team member will analyse platform performance, coordinate activities with Administration, IT and D&A teams to implement new and improved platform functionality and systems to ensure continuous performance of applications critical for D&A success.
Further, the team member will support certification of different parts of the Big Data chain, validating data, flow, and functionality to ensure the tools and data are largely fit for purpose. They will work with various teams to gather testing requirements, as well as build monitoring suites.
This individual must have a balance of strong technical skills and business acumen to elevate performance & quality to the highest level for the company. The individual will leverage data analysis skills and ability to learn quickly in fast evolving technology environment.
What are we looking for?
Bachelor’s Degree required preferably in Computer Science, Engineering or Statistics
2+ years Big Data skills including Hadoop, Python, Linux, BigQuery, GCP dataflow, SQL or equivalent
Experience with data analysis and problem solving with big data
Data mining skills and experience with BI tools such as Spotfire, Tableau or equivalent
Complex problem-solving skills to identify technical performance gaps and develop solutions
Ability to resolve complex issues through active listening and interpretation
Excellent observational skills to validate data
Writing skills, to communicate information effectively to technical staff, managers, and users
Organizational and project management skills
Extra points for any of the following:
Applicable advanced degrees and certificates
Experience in the disciplines of data quality, data governance, data integration and data management
Success attributes of an Equifax employee; does this describe you?
Accountable
Brave
Curious
Collaborative
Individualist
Trustworthy
Dedicated
At Equifax, there is no such thing as the 'perfect candidate'
Seeing responsibilities and competencies laid out on paper can be confronting. At this stage of the application process, sometimes imposter syndrome can creep in and mess with our confidence. Please know, we list these items to give you an opportunity to show us your potential and how you can grow and transform with us.
Your ability to demonstrate that you possess/have the real potential to develop the required capabilities, knowledge, experience and qualifications to perform in our roles is what we would like to hear from you. Where possible, you should support your claims with specific examples of what you have done and how you did it.
However you identify, and whatever background you bring with you, please apply if this is a role that would make you excited to come to work every day!

We Dream. We Design. We Deliver.
This is the place where you’ll be hands on. Where new ideas are welcomed and expected.
At every level – and in every role – we’re doers and builders. Not Managers and minders.
hummgroup (ASX-HUM) is one of Australasia’s most successful and enduring fintech organisations with a proud legacy of rewriting the playbook for digital spending. We help people buy everything, everywhere, every day. Our product ecosystem of buy now pay later, credit cards, and business financing products has been designed around the core needs of today's shoppers, retailers, and small and medium enterprises.
What's so exciting about this role?
Be part of a forward thinking team who are responsible for protecting hummgroup and its customers from fraud by data analytics, optimising fraud systems and providing insights through timely reporting. This is an end to end, hands on role, working across all our products.
What does an average day look like?
No day is average at hummgroup, but here’s an idea of what you can expect to do in this role and what you will be responsible for:
Analyse fraud trends and implement detection strategies balancing fraud risk and customer friction
Optimise existing detection strategies to ensure effectiveness and efficiency is maintained within expectations
Engage in projects to assist with testing and change management activities
Complete data analysis to assist in business decisions
Develop accurate and clear reporting that supports effective oversight of fraud performance
Work unsupervised and under challenging deadlines
Prioritise workload and proactively call out delays
Who will thrive in this role?
You are analytical and curious, and put that to use by driving great customer experiences and profitable growth for humm. You can manage a busy workload of top priorities and can be relied on to deliver end-to-end. You are someone who believes in the strength of good relationships. You are flexible, driven and passionate about customers; you can operate in and contribute to a fast paced and dynamic environment.
We’re also looking for someone who brings:
1+ years' experience using data analytics tools such as SQL, SAS or R
1+ years' experience developing application and transactional fraud rules (Digital and card channels preferred)
Advanced verbal, written and numeracy skills
A demonstrated ability to work with business stakeholders to resolve issues
Data analysis and data insights
Data visualisation skills (Power BI preferable)
Tertiary qualifications in mathematics, statistics, computing, science, engineering or actuarial studies (highly desirable).
And did we mention that we are working in a super-fast-paced environment where change is the only constant? We really mean it so experience working at pace is essential. If this sounds like you then we would love to hear from you!

The Data, Research and Publications branch provides key support services to the Official Secretary to achieve priorities for this Royal Commission.

You have demonstrated experience in:

Data& Decision Science

See yourself in the team:
We live and breathe in CBA value of Care, Courage and Commitment . The Data & Decision Science (DDS) team is responsible for leading the delivery of world-class data, analytics and technology capabilities to improve the financial well-being of our customers and communities.

You
You are analytical, strategic, and a forward thinking creative-problem solver, capable of working both within a team and independently

About us
Over the next 40 years, Sydney’s population is projected to swell to over 12 million residents and regional NSW will accommodate an extra 700,000 people. Transport for NSW is delivering an unprecedented $72.2b investment into a truly game changing Future Transport strategy which will bring together several?modes and cutting edge?technologies to deliver satisfaction and safety for our customers while supporting a rapidly growing economy.

The Division
We are a trusted partner to our clients, within Customer Strategy and Technology, developing and delivering smart, integrated and sustainable data platform which enable data-driven decisions to benefit our customers and communities.

The opportunity
Right now, we have an exciting temporary opportunity (until 30 Jun 2022) for a Technical Business Analyst to join us in Data & Systems Integration team and provide analysis, technical specifications and advice to support the translation of business requirements to data modelling and/or business intelligence solutions to ensure the correct solution design and implementation.
You will play a pivotal role in conducting analysis, evaluation of functional and non-functional requirements and documentation of technical specifications while also act brand ambassador for the Advanced Analytics & Integration branch.

What you will be involved in but not limited to:
Translate business requirements into technical specification including data models and functionality of end user apps (e.g. Business Intelligence solutions).

Job Title: Senior Finance Analyst (12-month fixed term), Port Kembla NSW
Job Description:
Job Description

At BlueScope, we create and inspire smart solutions in steel, strengthening our communities and helping build a better future. Our steel has shaped everything from hospitals and schools, bridges and stadiums to fences and homes – influencing the way we live and work, now and in the future.
The Opportunity
Come and discover the opportunity to join our International Trade Affairs Team as a Finance Analyst based in Port Kembla NSW. The International Trade Affairs Team has responsibility for the planning and execution of BlueScope Australian Steel Product’s anti-dumping and fair trade initiatives.
In this unique role, supporting the commercial services trade remedies work, you will provide financial recommendations and insights to maximise success in ensuring imported steel competition is conducted on a fairly traded basis.
What Will You Do?
As a trusted business advisor, you will:
undertake data analysis and modelling for pricing and cost trends across the Australian businesses, as well as globally
develop an in-depth understanding of, and commercial implications and opportunities for, the application of the rules-based anti-dumping framework
prepare and respond to government inquiries relating to fair trade matters
present data analysis outcomes and research findings to external domestic and international government bodies
prepare and respond to government inquiries relating to fair trade matters.
identify and implement activities to improve trade-related financial processes.
More About You
As an experienced finance professional looking to expand your knowledge and skills in a unique role, you will bring:
tertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline
CPA/CA qualifications or currently studying towards
proficiency in MS Office suite and ERP systems
an ability to work cohesively with cross-functional departments
The BlueScope Difference
A career at BlueScope provides the opportunity to make a difference – to you, to your team, to our customers, to transforming products, processes and brands, and to an organisation intent on shaping a better built environment for all our communities. At BlueScope, you will:
make an impact both within the organisation and in the broader community
create and deliver innovative products and solutions that shape the world we live in
grow on a path of continuous learning and development
enjoy the sense of belonging that comes from working with people who genuinely look out for one another
We’re dedicated to supporting our people - keeping one-another safe, rewarding successes, and helping individuals grow. We foster workplace flexibility and an inclusive work environment that welcomes people of all backgrounds. We’re committed to climate action and to helping shape a better future for all our communities; we are committed to Our Purpose, Creating Strength.
Come and discover us at bluescope.com/life-at-bluescope/. Together we can make a world of difference.

Job Title: IT Digital Business Analyst / Product Owner
Job Description:
12 MONTH CONTRACT + EXTENSIONS
GREAT ENVIRONMENT, LOTS OF DIGITAL PROJECTS
AUSTRALIAN CITIZENS ONLY


My client is looking for a multi-faceted, digitally focused team player who enjoys wearing many hats, and would like to be involved in a wide array of BAU and project initiatives that help Australians have safer experiences online. You are someone who rarely says, “that isn’t my job” and enjoys working to support your teammates, being a proactive problem solver and learning about new technologies.


As a Digital Business Analyst, you will

be responsible for understanding my clients strategic imperatives to ensure products deliver maximum value to the end user and your stakeholders.
be a proactive problem solver highly skilled in identifying, documenting, and analysing business processes, using agile thinking to identify what needs to be done to achieve goals and doing it
act as the coordinating body between the business and various technology teams to translate requirements into IT deliverables
lead engaging workshops to elicit business requirement and deliver quality artefacts that help progress projects or design thinking in the right direction
be comfortable project coordinating smaller initiatives through to their final state
become a subject matter expert on my clients services, undertaking research, stakeholder analysis and interviews to understand the needs of business stakeholders and our end users. You will use that knowledge to work collaboratively across the office to support delivery of high-quality solutions

As a Product Owner you will

act as the product owner and scrum master to remove blockers during the sprint cycle
act as the point person for questions from the dev team and business
manage sprint planning and backlog grooming activities to ensure developers have what they need to deliver optimally
use Jira and other digital tools to manage day-to-day activities
Essential Skills and Experience:
Proven experience as a business analyst for digital projects, products and/or services
Experience working in a government context
A proven ability to translate and document stakeholder and business needs into solution requirements and user stories
Demonstrated facilitation and stakeholder management skills, including strong influencing, communication, and negotiation skills.
Comfortable working with people across all levels of an organisation, including senior executives.
Strong problem solver with good conflict management skills
Excellent presentation and both written and verbal communication skills.
Excellent organisational and time management skills
Creative thinker with a vision and an attention to detail
Familiarity with Agile and Waterfall methodologies and DevOps
Understanding of agile development methodologies, the software development processes, system administration of web-based systems and experience in using data tools such as Power BI to prepare reports
Deep understanding of digital technology and design thinking
Experience with data capture, analysis, visualisation, and strategy
Strong understanding of cloud computing and web development

Employment Type: Temporary Full Time - up to 5 years
Position Classification: Health Manager Level 2
Remuneration: $98,105.44 - $116,361.04 per annum plus superannuation
Hours Per Week: 38
Requisition ID: REQ245968
Location: Lidcombe
Applications Close: 8 August 2021 – 11.59pm

About the opportunity
An exciting opportunity exists for a Business Analyst, ideally with Microsoft Dynamics 365 experience to join the Forensic & Analytical Science Services (FASS), Information Communications Technology Team for a period of up to 5 years.
Forensic & Analytical Science Service (FASS) specialises in providing independent and objective forensic analysis to the criminal and coronial justice systems, as well as quality scientific analysis that contributes to community health and safety. Our services include illicit drug analysis, forensic and drug toxicology, chemical criminalistics, forensic biology and DNA, forensic medicine, environmental toxicology, and environmental microbiology.
Being part of NSW Health Pathology means you’re helping create better health and justice systems every day.
We operate more than 60 laboratories and around 200 collection centres across NSW and conduct over 60 million tests per annum. Our network of pathologists are supported by scientists, technicians and support staff who quickly and accurately assess samples so clinical teams can make the best possible treatment decisions for patients. We encourage our staff to be involved in research and innovation opportunities to help create safer, healthier communities.

What we can offer you
9 day fortnight
Generous salary packaging options and other fringe benefits
Corporate wellbeing programs, including the Fitness Passport
Learning and development opportunities, including in-house training with RTO My Health Learning
What you'll be doing
The Business Analyst is responsible for the effective provisioning of relevant and accurate analysis of current and proposed information systems, projects, policies and procedures, supporting the delivery of services and projects within the Forensic and Analytical Science Service (FASS).The Business Analyst will work closely with the business leads initially with our Forensic Medicine Department to deliver a state wide Forensic Medicine Information System.

Interested in joining Australia’s largest public pathology service? Apply now by addressing the following questions:
Relevant qualifications in Information Technology or equivalent work experience in a project management or business analysis role. Industry recognised certification such as Prince2, Agile
Well-developed written and interpersonal communication skills with demonstrated experience in consulting with a variety of stakeholders to document business requirements, define non-functional requirements, data models, future state visioning, functional design and work directly with business teams to translate these requirements into IT solutions.
Demonstrated experience in project management, and ability to balance complex and multiple issues whilst managing project scope, along with demonstrated experience in Gap Analysis, Requirements Management, Business Process Re-engineering and Business Analysis.
Demonstrated experience in liaising effectively and working collaboratively with a range of business stakeholders to facilitate co-operation, support and establish strong effective working relationships in achieving agreed outcomes.
Proven organisational and time management skills with the ability to prioritise, multi task, take initiative and meet strict timeframes within a complex, challenging and changing work environment.
Understanding of the software development lifecycle and experience in project management methodologies such as Agile, Prince2 and SCRUM, as well as experience in project management tools such as Atlassian Jira and Confluence.
Well developed functional understanding and experience of application architectures and their inter operability such as Microsoft Dynamics 365 & Power Apps across health/pathology and/or corporate environments.
Demonstrated capacity to adopt and model the NSWHP RITE values of Respect, Integrity, Teamwork and Excellence.

Commercial analytics and modelling with R, SQL, some Python and cloud
Potential to add a large strategic impact on e-commerce and business!

We are hiring for a very cool, very impactful data and analytics team that does e-commerce operations analytics for one of the biggest online retailers in Australia. Job Type: Full-time

About AMP Capital
AMP Capital is one of the largest investment managers in the Asia Pacific region. Part of the AMP Group (until operational separation by end of 2021 and demerger in 2022), we share a heritage that spans over 160 years.
Our home strength in Australia and New Zealand has enabled us to grow internationally, and today we have operations established in the Middle East, China, Hong Kong, India, Ireland, Japan, Luxembourg, the United Kingdom and the United States. We also collaborate with a network of global investment partners, leveraging our shared capabilities to provide greater access to new investment opportunities.
Our asset class specialists, investment strategists and economists work together with the aim of delivering strong investment outcomes for clients. That is why our clients trust us to invest money on their behalf, across a range of single sector and diversified funds.

AMP Capital Vision
AMP Capital’s Vision is to be a pre-eminent global investment manager. AMP Capital Real Estate has a well-developed sustainability framework including Fund ESG Strategies with detailed sustainability objectives and targets. An overview of the Sustainability Strategy at AMP Capital Real estate can be found here.

About AMP Capital Real Estate

This role is based within the AMP Capital Real Estate Business. AMP Capital Real Estate has approximately A$25 billion of Assets Under Management across circa 90 properties, managed by approximately 600 staff.

Purpose of the role

The purpose of the Sustainability Analyst role is to support the Sustainability Manager – Investor Relations & Reporting and work with the Sustainability Team to gather and visualise ESG data and transparently disclose our performance to our stakeholders, including Fund Managers, Real Estate Senior Leadership, our Investors, and as part of public reporting. The role will help position us as a market leader in the gathering, analysis, visualisation and reporting of sustainability in our real estate business, and support the implementation of the same ESG data gathering and reporting structures in the Australian and Global Infrastructure business units.

Main focus areas

The role will refine and improve our ESG data gathering process, introducing as much automation as possible and provide support as required to the Sustainability Manager – Investor Relations & Reporting and with the Sustainability Team. Our vision is to develop a system that will facilitate systematic and regular ESG data gathering, with a common central storage platform, and which an be readily visualised and analysed, so it is possible to evaluate ESG performance at the asset level, fund level, business unit level or portfolio wide level.

Duties will include:
Data gathering process and system development and execution: refine and improve our existing system for gathering, managing and visualising ESG information. Develop and implement a data gathering, visualisation and reporting system architecture, which may include:
Online forms (using existing systems e.g. Property Assist, Switch Automation, Sharepoint or Excel) to gather all relevant Asset level ESG data, currently being captured in Asset ESG Forms
Automating the process of ingesting and storing the asset level ESG data into a central storage location (e.g. Snowflake), with a logical data storage structure
Develop appropriate ways to visualise ESG information that can be readily filtered for the relevant audience e.g. the level of an asset, a fund, or a business unit (i.e. office, logistics, retail, alternatives as well as the top level entities within Private Markets Co, i.e. Real Estate, Au Infrastructure, Global Infrastructure and Infrastructure Debt)
Coordinate data gathering from asset management teams and other internal stakeholders such as workplace health and safety team, asset tech team, people and culture team along with the sustainability team
Work with external service providers and consultants to coordinate data gathering across multiple software platforms (e.g. Kinesis, Switch Automation, Foresight, Property Assist, Kinect Energy) and ingest and organise the data centrally
Support the Sustainability Manager – Investor Relations & Reporting to respond to ESG queries from investors, including compiling and presenting relevant data and drafting text responses, and provide the information to the relevant fund manager or investor in a timely and engaging manner
Support the Sustainability Advisors of O&L and Retail in maintaining up to date Asset ESG plans for every asset, and help them in requesting data on a regular basis (e.g. to produce monthly updates for senior stakeholders within each business unit)
Carry out data validation and assurance to support annual external audits of our ESG data
Support the sustainability team to produce the Annual Sustainability Report, GRESB response, NGERS submission, UNPRI survey, quarterly fund reports, and quarterly board reports and other internal and external sustainability reporting obligations.
Use outputs from the data platforms to support the production of relevant and engaging material e.g. reports and case studies
Any other real estate ESG tasks as required.

Knowledge and experience

Qualifications
Degree or other relevant qualifications in Data Science, Data Analytics, Computer Engineering, Science, Accounting & Finance or other relevant translatable discipline or combination of relevant qualifications and on the job experience

Experience
2-5 years post qualification experience desirable but will consider more or less.

Knowledge of and preferably experience in:
Data analysis and visualisation
Quantitative analysis skills – e.g. for calculating fund energy, water waste stats, area weighted averages
Data assurance and validation
Data system architecture & data management
Sustainability reporting
Commercial Real Estate
Property Management & Operations
Highly proficient in Excel, Word
Familiarity with Tableau, Snowflake, Alteryx desirable

The Data Analyst works within the digital technology team, supporting many stakeholders inside, including Digital Product, Content & Innovation, and outside external partners.

What will you do?
Surface data in BigQuery for use across analytics, business reporting, and AI/ML projects
Produce regular reports for external partners
Troubleshoot reports for inconsistencies and work with stakeholders to improve data collection
Produce BI reports for internal stakeholders, primarily Digital Product, Content & Sales
What do you need?
Strong SQL, Python & BigQuery/Firebase (Google) skills
Strong understanding of Data Modelling
Knowledge of Data Architecture
Strong understanding of data visualization tools (PowerBI)
Stakeholder management, requirement analysis skills
Excellent communication and negotiation skills
Excellent Presentation skills
Verbal, nonverbal, written communication skills
Business acumen and mindset
The essential technical skills are SQL, Python, and BigQuery.

What's in it for you?
A permanent role with a client on a journey of full digital transformation.
Very competitive salary package
Sydney CBD location with WFH 1-2 days per week
excellent company culture with entertainment nights provided regularly
work in a newly established digital data function team

The Division
The Customer Strategy and Technology team within Transport leads the development of long-term, multi-modal strategies, plans and policies across NSW. We leverage data and insights, implement new technologies, drive innovation and build partnerships to provide customer-centred solutions.

The NSW Government has a vision for vibrant and growing regional economies, providing NSW residents with more jobs, greater opportunities and better quality of life. Selection Document – APS 6 Revenue & Cost Analyst
Eligibility
Please note that this opportunity is open only to Australian Citizens. The successful applicant must have,
or be willing to undergo a security clearance to the level of Baseline Vetting as a condition of employment.
To satisfy character requirements all AFSA employees must undergo a police records check. Where a
person has received a redundancy benefit from APS agency employment and their corresponding
redundancy benefit period has not expired, they may be ineligible for employment.
About the area
The Internal Client Services Division is responsible for delivering a range of business and enabling
services that support the Australian Financial Security Authority purpose through partnering with
business divisions that regulate Australia’s personal insolvency and personal property securities
programs. The division provides professional services and leadership that promotes the efficient and
effective operations of the agency whilst ensuring compliance with commonwealth legislation, polices
and guidelines and promoting integrity, accountability and transparency.
Purpose of the position
The purpose of this position is to provide the ‘story’ of AFSA’s financial landscape through the provision
of past, present and future financial intelligence and analysis. The key output from this role is to provide
digestible analysis and recommendations relating to AFSA financial sustainability through its cost
recovery programs, including pricing strategies, revenue analysis and forecasting.
Working with the Assistant Director, you will steward the finance function in developing costing and
pricing methodologies that support AFSAs outcome and its resource decision making. This position
provides compelling information, not just data, and will lead the agency is optimising its financial
information and sustainability.
Key Accountabilities
The major areas of accountability and the required outcomes of the Revenue & Cost Analyst include the
following:
Provide specialist advice and guidance on financial sustainability as it pertains to cost modelling, cost
recovery and pricing strategy.
Demonstrated ability to provide specialist advice for compelling, well written analysis, insights and
recommendations to AFSA executive that helps inform strategic discussions.
Using cost and revenue modelling data, assist AFSAs service transformation program through the
optimisation of efficient and effective service channels.
Improve resource allocation and provide service/product costing through assisting in the delivery of
the fully effective costing models including the delivery of the Cost Recovery Impact Statement
process.
Undertake research to ensure AFSA remain contemporary in its application of cost modelling, pricing
strategies and activities.

Selection Document – APS 6 Revenue & Cost Analyst
Contribute to the continuous improvement of finance policies, processes and practices to ensure
efficient and effective finance operations.
All duties will be performed in accordance with:
the APS Values, Code of Conduct and Employment Principles
WHS obligations, taking responsibility for own health and safety and that of others
AFSA’s risk management framework and relevant legislation, including guiding others to identify and
mitigate foreseeable risks.
Skills and Capabilities
Navigates ambiguity
Demonstrates proactivity, emotional intelligence and self-direction in the face of uncertainty or new
situations. Deals with issues that cannot be resolved immediately with high levels of persistence and
resilience. Applies a solution-focussed approach to solving problems.
Fosters high performance
Holds self and others responsible for achieving results and agreed outcomes. Strives for continuous
improvement by identifying better ways of working or opportunities to contribute to the work of others.
Encourages and supports openness, persistence and genuine debate around critical issues.
Examines and evaluates information and data from a wide range of sources to make
evidence-based decisions
Draws on information from diverse sources and uses experience and organisational/environmental
awareness to analyse what information is important and how it should be used in the decision-making
process.
Collaboration and engagement
Embraces a diversity of people and opinions and facilitates an environment for the open exchange of
ideas. Engages different perspectives, experiences and techniques when analysing complex problems
Research & Analysis
Identifies, collates, analyses, synthesises, retrieves and applies detailed and specific information from
different sources to factually support decision-making on a best course of action, likely outcomes and
high level recommendations.
Qualifications, accreditations and experience
• Chartered Accountant (CA) /Certified Practicing Accountant (CPA) qualification preferred but not
mandatory.
Demonstrated experience with activity-based costing and interpretation of financial analysis is highly
desirable.

Pricing Analyst - Technical Division | NSW – Sydney

A chance to start your career within a well-respected & highly skilled team
Work on end-to-end pricing as well as broader project work
Entry level role perfect for a Graduate with D/HD grades
How far can you go with the support of leaders who want to bring out the best in you?
Our Technical Division is responsible for pricing, portfolio management, reinsurance and underwriting services. We support our distribution and other key stakeholder functions through improvement of the product and pricing framework for all of the Allianz General Insurance portfolios.
We are looking for a Pricing Analyst to join our successful pricing team in the Technical Department. As part of this high performing team you will be reporting to a Pricing Lead and you will be expected to provide support for:

Perform pricing analysis, reporting and modelling to analyse the portfolio and pricing performance.
Provide insights from analysis and modelling to support pricing recommendations and commercial considerations to achieve strategic objectives.
Implement best practice pricing models, including claims, quote conversion, customer retention and pricing scenarios, using specialised software.
Implement initiatives to support continuous refinement of pricing models to ensure accuracy and reflect best practice frameworks
Incorporate knowledge of pricing methodologies, concepts and Allianz products into analysis.
Identify opportunities to improve existing processes and approaches.
Perform the controls outlined in the pricing governance framework and ensure adherence to all governance frameworks relevant to the pricing process.
You will get exposed to numerous opportunities to develop and learn in a friendly and supportive environment. To be considered and successful in this role you must demonstrate:

Degree or Masters in Actuarial Studies with Distinction or High Distinction grades; academic transcript to be attached to the application.
MS Excel skills at an advanced level with experience in using SAS, Python, R or SQL valued.
Ability to quickly build and maintain strong business relationships with internal and external stakeholders, demonstrating exceptional customer service.
Strong time management and organisation skills, with the ability to multi-task and prioritise your work, whilst working in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to speak with clarity and impact.
We want people with the right attitude (hungry to succeed, customer-obsessed and goal-oriented) and exceptional communication skills. We want employees who are ambitious to learn and build themselves a career in insurance; specifically, with this role, we want someone with a keen interest in data and working with large data sets.

Link Group is a leading fund administration and share registry specialists. We are a market leading provider of technology-enabled administration solutions, continually developing our offerings to expand with our clients' needs. Since our inception, Link Group has been entrusted by clients to handle sensitive data in a secure and confidential manner. Our core businesses of fund administration and securities registration are complemented by our expertise in digital solutions and data analytics.

Our Corporate Markets division provides clients with a comprehensive corporate markets offering that connects issuers to their stakeholders. Our teams combine a wealth of industry experience with a rigorous focus on client management to deliver a premium service underpinned by market leading digital technology provided by our Technology & Operations division.

Job Title: Analyst Risk and Control Advisory and Delivery
Job Description:
Do work that matters
RBS Data & Decision Science (DDS) is the centre of excellence for data and analytics capability within the Retail Bank delivering exceptional data driven innovation to Retail customers. A department of 600+ staff, DDS leads the design and delivery of data, data science, modelling, insights, and analytics driving customer contact strategies, product pricing, business performance management, fraud and financial crime detection, and business performance management across all Product, Channel and Support functions in the Retail Bank.
In the Risk Control Advisory Delivery Analyst role, you will be a trusted business partner who is responsible for identifying potential risks, recommending solutions and conducting control testing for the DDS business. With DDS providing key analytics capability and delivering innovative ideas for the Retail Bank, this role will enable you to make a tangible difference in enhancing the financial wellbeing of our customers.
See yourself in our team
The DDS Risk & Control Advisory & Delivery team is responsible for ensuring that strong controls are in place and decisions are well informed, timely and socialised for the DDS business. They achieve this through providing an end to end risk and control service, including the effective design & implementation of controls, ensuring the operational risk & compliance frameworks are effectively implemented in their BU’s and also ensuring the DDS leadership team has the right level of comfort and governance within their risk environment. This role will report to the Senior Manager.
Reporting into the Senior Manager Risk and Control Advisory and Delivery, you will contribute to Line 1 Risk activities across the portfolio and embed a sound risk culture within the business.

On any given day this role will cover:
Risk Management: You will provide risk advice and consultancy services to the business and support them to design and implement controls to enable better risk and compliance outcome.
Risk Governance: You will support with the preparation of risk reporting packs, ad-hoc presentations and maintenance of the DDS Risk and Control Profile.
Controls, Issues and Incidents: You will identify and initiate actions to remediate risks, incidents and issues and to strengthen controls.
We’re interested in hearing from people who possess:
1+ year demonstrated experience in Operational Risk, Compliance and/or Audit is highly desirable
A proactive and results driven mind-set, with the ability to analyse processes and quickly identify risks to recommend appropriate actions, and design appropriate controls
Ability to prioritise tasks and meet required deadlines for tasks
Strong verbal and written communication and presentations to stakeholders
Intermediate to Advanced Excel and Powerpoint skills for reporting tasks

DESCRIPTION
About The Company

About The Role

Creating and maintaining models by leveraging skills in accounting, finance, and economics

At least 2 years of Reporting Analyst experience

Experience working in a Manufacturing and/or Operations Industry is advantageous

mx51 is a payments-as-a-service solution for banks, non-bank acquirers, and other merchant service providers. We are building a payment platform that allows merchants to accept payments in-store, in-app and online, whilst consolidating all their data on a real-time business management dashboard.
We've just secured our Series A (led by Mastercard) and are about to kick off on an incredible growth journey. We're looking for driven people to join our team, help scale our operations and create positive merchant experiences through our multi-channel solution.
About the role
We have an incredible opportunity for a driven Data Analyst to join our growing Data team. In this role, you will play a critical role in partnering with our business and proactively bring data forward to help solve real business problems and ultimately deliver value to our customers.
You will be responsible for delivering analytical solutions and insights though data analytic techniques to support the strategic needs of mx51, whilst working closely with our team to translate our data into meaningful insights that add value to our business.
To be successful for this role, you will have a knack for designing and developing analytics solutions, reporting, dashboards and data visualisation, whilst also have a keen interest in research and utilising market 'best practice' to improve and optimise the way we use our data at mx51.
Responsibilities
Proactively partner with different teams to build in-depth knowledge of our products, how they contribute to it and understand how data relates to it (i.e. who consumes it, and for what purpose)
Work closely with teams to clearly define and understand reporting and data requirements as well as presenting findings, insights and recommendations as the subject matter expert
Contribute to the design, development and implementation of data models leveraging tools and methodologies to drive improved business decisions and insights
Build, maintain and deliver analytics solutions, reporting & data visualisation, working with data engineering where needed
Prepare, deliver and update reports to support teams to understand how to utilise data to improve their processes and decisions
Adapt quickly and effectively to changes in priorities by responding to requests for additional adhoc reporting
Create and maintain required documentation
Organise workshops and demos to improve data literacy across the business
Requirements
Fluency in SQL; we use Snowflake but experience with Redshift, BigQuery, PostgreSQL would be sufficient
Experience building dashboards in Tableau, Power BI, or similar
Experience or interest in dbt or other SQL-based transformation tools
Data wrangling skills in Python (preferred) or R
Good understanding of statistics; relevant STEM degree is a plus
Strong verbal and written communication skills to interact with stakeholders
Interest in future transition into data science is welcomed
What we offer
You will be joining an incredible team who are committed, customer focused, adaptable and curious. Our innovative culture gives you opportunities to make real contributions that will shape the future of the business. In addition to a fun and flexible work environment, we also offer competitive salary packages, an Employee Share Option Plan (subject to invitation), salary sacrifice options, social events and paid parental leave.
To apply for this role, you must have current permanent working rights in Australia (Australian citizen, New Zealand citizen or Australian permanent resident).
Direct applicants only. mx51 does not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from agencies.
mx51 is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for this role without bias to race, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability or age.
