At Canva, we create tools that empower the world to design. Our mission is to democratise design and empower creativity for anyone and everyone, on every platform! Inspired by a team of talented thinkers, an amazing culture and remarkable growth trajectory – we’re out to change the world, one design at a time.
Since launch in August 2013 we have grown exponentially, amassing over 60 million active users across 190 different countries who have created more than 2 billion designs. We are one of the world’s fastest-growing technology companies and we have only achieved about 1% of what we are capable of!
About the Vendor Risk Analyst
At Canva, we utilise a substantial catalogue of third-party products and services to support both our product and our operations. As a Vendor Risk Analyst, we will be looking to you to ensure that we work with our vendors in a manner that maintains the security of the information assets of Canva and its customers, while supporting the rapid growth of our operations. Working within Canva’s wider risk & compliance and security ecosystems, the right candidate will have the opportunity to grow their career as a risk professional in one of the most exciting technology companies in Australia.
The successful candidate will have the option of being based out of our Sydney office, or being fully remote within Australia.
About the Security Group
The Security Group is responsible for protecting Canva systems and data from information security threats. Our teams work together, and with other groups, to deliver preventive and detective controls and processes that reduce security risk. The group runs programs across Identity and Access Management, Application Security, Governance, Risk and Compliance, and Threat Detection and Response domains.
Key Responsibilities
Working with staff from all around Canva to evaluate risk relating to new and existing vendors.
Liaising with Canva’s vendors to evaluate security postures.
Escalating identified risks to various stakeholders.
Identifying and implementing measures to improve our vendor risk management processes.
Collating data for management reporting
Required Experience
Familiarity with operational risk management and information security concepts.
Experience liaising with internal and external, technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Experience prioritising and progressing multiple simultaneous pieces of work.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
A high level of attention to detail.
A continuous improvement mindset.
Beneficial experience (not required, but helpful)
Experience with Atlassian Jira, Confluence.
Familiarity with industry IT risk management and security certifications and standards (ISO 27001, SOC 2, PCI DSS).
Benefits & Total Rewards
Competitive salary, plus stock options via our ESOP plan
Flexible daily working hours, we value work-life balance
Breakfast and lunch prepared by our wonderful Vibe team
Onsite-Gym and Yoga Membership
End-of-Trip Facilities: Bicycle parking and showers
Vibe and Thrive Allowance to support health and wellness
Generous parental (including secondary) leave policy
Pet-friendly offices
Internal Coaching and Employee Support Programs
Sponsored social clubs, team events, and celebrations
One of our core values at Canva, “Being a force for good” means we are actively working towards a world that isn't just good for a small few, but one that’s good for everyone. We believe deeply that bringing together diversity of thoughts, perspectives and expression is key for building the best product for our equally diverse community. To achieve this, we need to constantly work towards making Canva the best place to work, for everyone. Even if you feel you don't tick every box, we encourage you to apply and give yourself the opportunity to be considered for this role or any other suitable roles at Canva!
We mean it when we say we want to create a workplace that you love coming to. Our culture is unlike anywhere else and our offices are designed with workspaces for every mood, to help you do great work. At Canva you can be part of a company that is growing rapidly, building a product that users really love. If you're seeking professional growth and want to help build out our suite of large, distributed, cloud-based applications that delight our millions of individual and business users alike - then apply now to be considered for the position!
Sorry, we will not accept CVs from recruitment agencies. Please apply directly to be eligible.

Contribute to the development and bring analytical ideas for one of Australia’s largest insurance providers

About Us

We’re an evolving organisation, one that’s as supportive and socially conscious as it is agile and explorative. Our DNA of commercial mind and social heart captures who we are at our core.

Working within our Workers Compensation team you will work with a diverse mix of inspired, inquisitive, and growth focused people who really care about making a difference for people and the NSW community. You will have a mind for getting things done and a heart for people and you will set the bar high through the quality of the work you do and the people-oriented decisions you make.

About the Role

As Customer Insights Analyst you will be report to the Customer Lead, Product Design and work collaboratively with internal stakeholders and project teams to identify and deliver customer insights to stakeholders that are timely, actionable and which facilitate customer-centric decision-making and drive improvements in customer experience.

Identify, analyse and interpret trends, patterns and stories told through the available customer data to support the development of insights that can inform change.
Work closely with key stakeholders to build knowledge and understanding to drive continuous improvement in the quality and relevance of insights reporting.
Work collaboratively with the broader Customer and Community Team teams to leverage information and insights across different business areas to help drive the strategy to deliver better customer outcomes and experiences.
Contribute to and support the production of insights reporting that delivers value and continues to evolve the organisations understanding of its customers.
Project manage new quantitative & qualitative customer research studies from understanding needs to scoping requirements through to data collection and reporting.
Educate & advocate for the CXM platform and provide support for stakeholders (in person, phone & email) in using dashboards and interpreting results.
Develop and evolve working practices and tools, to drive continuous improvement and increase the value of insights to stakeholders.
Develop and maintain strong working relationships with key stakeholders.

About You

Agency experience will be well highly regarded for the role.
Relevant tertiary education, or equivalent knowledge and skills acquired through extensive practical quantitative research experience.
Experience with usage of research data analysis packages (e.g. Q,).
Strong experience in compiling and analyzing customer data.
Proven track record of communicating customer findings to stakeholders.
Experience with Customer Feedback Software e.g. Qualtrics.

Strategy. Operations & Supply Chain Analyst

Here at Liquor Loot, we are passionate about showcasing and featuring great spirits from around the world through our brands Whisky Loot and Gin Loot. Our Strategy & Operations team empowers the company through insights, analysis, and thought leadership. As part of our Operations team, you will help scale our most impactful processes and initiatives.

The analyst will be tasked with identifying operational weaknesses, digging deep into the data to surface critical findings that will improve and innovate new processes, and manage our supply chain, including maintaining warehouse inventory levels and production schedules.

What You'll Do:
Develop & Optimize Business Processes - Scale new and existing processes to allow the business to operate efficiently; analyze the operations to track and improve metrics and profitability.
Analytics - Analyse and create demand forecasts, manage inventory projections and evaluate supply chain constraints for new and existing projects.
Strategy & Research - Explore business cases for new products or expansion regions, make recommendations to which projects the team should prioritize, and set a timeline to reach goals.
Product Improvement - Proactively search for product improvements that lead to better customer experience and/or increased profitability.

What You'll Need:
We’re looking for someone with a quantitative background, ideally a Bachelor's degree or Master’s degree in engineering, mathematics, finance, economics, etc.
You will have at least two years of experience in a high-performance startup, focusing on strategy, operations, or analytics. We will also consider candidates with less experience if they demonstrate strong abilities in quantitative fields.
You will demonstrate strong business judgment and critical thinking skills to use data to develop tactics and make decisions.
You will be required to thoroughly document businesses processes, including training the team and demonstrating continual process improvements.
You must be comfortable taking the initiative in a constantly changing work environment while maintaining flexibility, a collaborative attitude, and great attention to detail.
Curiosity is required. Every day will bring a new challenge across different aspects of the business. You will need to learn quickly and take ownership of problems.
Management quality - You will need to feel comfortable being the go-to person to solve other team members' problems through critical thinking and data analysis.
SQL, Python knowledge is a plus but not required.

Sounds like you’d be a good fit? Check out what we provide our passionate people.
An organization that is experiencing incredible growth.
An organization with an entrepreneurial mindset and a fast-paced environment.
Coffee on Cue Beans, spirits on-demand, and at-cost whisky & gin for staff.
Parking on-site (first-in, first-served).
A flexible work-from-home policy and casual work environment.

In your application, please provide a cover letter answering the following question:
Why are you interested in this role at Liquor Loot?
Read our role criteria. With this in mind, what's a professional achievement of yours that demonstrates to us that you have what it takes to succeed in this role?
Tell us a bit about you, the human, outside of work?



About Liquor Loot:

Back in 2017, Whisky Loot set out to shake up Australia’s online Whisky Market. We’ve come a long way since!We’ve become one of the country’s top eCommerce players, with a proven track record of growth, a world-class digital platform and second to none customer experience offering. Behind the scenes, we’re a world-class team of creatives, strategists and innovators, and we’re on the hunt for like-minded people to jump on board.At Liquor Loot, we do things a little differently - which means we expect a lot from our employees! We want people that bring great energy, that have a long-game focus and are always curious to find new angles and approaches to the way we work. We don’t play by the rules. We push boundaries. We think big. We stay curious and driven. Together, we embrace challenges and learn new things. All this, for one purpose to provide our customers with an amazing experience that supports the distillery industry.If this sounds like an ideal fit for you, we can’t wait to meet you and look forward to your application.

Evolving Transport

Transport for NSW is delivering an unprecedented $72.2b investment into a truly game changing Future Transport strategy. We are also evolving, bringing together new and existing transport modes, cutting edge technologies and getting smarter at how we do it. We are changing to deliver more connected journeys, greater satisfaction and safer transport for our customers, both now and for the future.

The Division

The Regional and Outer Metropolitan division is focused on understanding the particular needs of regional communities across NSW and delivering customer-centred integrated transport services and infrastructure.

The opportunity

We have a Permanent Full Time Opportunity for a Business Analyst to join the Customer Service Experience and Planning Branch in the Regional and Outer Metropolitan division. The purpose of the branch is to develop the short to mid-term customer service strategy, charter and service blueprint for differentiated customer groups with the intent of uplifting the customer experience and attracting citizens. It will evolve key enablers for customer driven data and insights, customer technology uplift and more efficient service delivery.

The role will be working within a newly established function and as such will be a part of building the team approach and culture. Comfort and experience in working with uncertainty will be key to success in the role.

This role is responsible for undertaking research and analysis on a variety of business problems and processes to assist with determining the optimal solution to meet requirements, working closely with internal and external stakeholders.

This position accommodates remote and flexible work practices across NSW, with the opportunity for you to work out of your nearest Regional or Outer Metropolitan office.

What you will be involved in

The successful candidates will develop process improvements to integrate new systems and processes with existing ones for continuous improvement of products. Additionally, this role will be accountable for;

Partnering with external and internal customers to ensure business improvements align to the long-term business strategies;
Performing regular external environmental scans, conduct research and collate, analyse and provide advice for improvements or strategies that can be achieved;
Maintaining knowledge of current developments in information management and champion the application of innovative techniques for storing, managing, and delivering data;
Assisting business as usual and project teams in problem definition, exploration of options to address these problems and propose and document potential solutions;
Managing support, maintenance, and enhancement of business processes;
Working positively as a member of a multidisciplinary team, contributing to the achievement of Branch business outcomes.

About you

This is an exciting opportunity in a developing business area – giving you the ability to help shape the approach and culture of the team. The ability to work flexibly across functions and being comfortable in uncertainty is a must. A demonstrated ability to co-design own work practices in an adaptive and iterative manner will be key to your success.

We are looking to unlock ways we can improve the transport experience of the people of New South Wales. You will need to have a strong focus on end users and the ability to work with multiple, complex sets of information to uncover key insights and growth opportunities.

We are looking for customer centric, dynamic and design thinking Business Analyst with demonstrated experience in business improvement processes and design. Possessing exposure to business operations, you will be adept at analysing and reporting information, presenting data in a logical fashion as well as process mapping. Commercially aware, a customer service and technology or a procurement background or exposure working in this space previously would be viewed favourably.

You will have strong communication (written and verbal) and decisions making skills, be adept at managing key project stakeholders have the ability to build positive relationships across the business ensuring success when working in this large and operational organisation. Appropriate tertiary qualifications or demonstrated, relevant, equivalent professional experience is required.

It is essential that as an integral part of a customer focused part of the business you will model the behaviours aligned with excellent customer service in all aspects of your professional engagement.

This is an exciting opportunity to be a part of a growing Division that values regional NSW and strives towards excellent outcomes for regional communities!

Salary and Benefits

Transport Grade 7 ($103,965 - $116,441) + Super

Interested?

Joining Transport for NSW, you’ll have access to a range of unique government benefits in a flexible work environment like no other. If you’re ready to step into this meaningful and rewarding role, we want to hear from you!
To apply for this position, please submit a resume and answer all questions within the online application portal.

Role Title: Senior Analyst Information Management
Employment Type: Full Time, Temporary (up to 30 June 2023)
Role Classification: Crown Clerk 9/10
Remuneration: $111,077 - $122,404 p.a. (plus superannuation and annual leave loading)
Hours per Week: 35
Location: St Leonards
Requisition ID: REQ247993
Closing Date: 11:59pm, Thursday 16 August 2021

About this role
Interested in applying your exceptional data analysis and communication skills to ensure medicines are used safely? Seeking a role with variety?

Where you'll be working
The Office of the Chief Pharmacist provides oversight of pharmaceutical and medicines policy development for the NSW Health system, including monitoring trends and liaising with relevant federal agencies. Officers provide strategic advice to the Secretary, Minister and Government on pharmaceutical regulatory policy, and expert advice and input for health systemwide and cross government initiatives.

What you'll be doing
This role involves:
Identifying and analysing trends and undertaking analysis to support the development, implementation and monitoring of Quality Use of Medicines and regulatory strategies and policies.
Managing data requests and providing advice on data management, data quality issues and data interpretation in relation to data collections in the Office of the Chief Pharmacist and Pharmaceutical Regulatory Unit, and developing and maintaining documentation in relation to these data collections.
Preparing high quality, accurate and timely written advice including reports, briefs, policy, guidelines or discussion papers to inform new policy and strategies or respond to requests.
Managing content on the relevant pages of the NSW Health website for the Office of the Chief Pharmacist.
The skills and knowledge we are looking for
To perform the role successfully, you should ideally have (but not necessarily all of) the following:
Database management skills and working knowledge of MS Access.
Data analysis skills (extract, manipulate and summarise data) and proficiency in the use of statistical packages such as SAS, R or Python, and in MS Excel.
The ability to automate data extraction and create bespoke reports would be highly regarded.
Some knowledge of the design of research studies to advise on the appropriateness of data collections for use in research.
Writing skills and the ability to clearly describe data and present findings, both quantitative and qualitative, to different audiences (such as Executive Management, state and federal agencies) to help inform strategies and policies.

Sydney
Permanent
About the Firm
MinterEllison is renowned as one of Asia Pacific's leading legal and consulting practices. What sets us apart is that we are driven by a strong sense of purpose: we endeavour to build authentic and enduring relationships with our clients, our people and our communities. Through our leading-edge innovation and our collaborative legal and consulting specialists, MinterEllison is redefining the boundaries of what it means to be a law firm.
MinterEllison was placed in the top 25 best workplaces in Australia and in LinkedIn’s 25 Top Companies in Australia for 2019—the highest ranking of any law firm.
Lawyers Weekly has ranked MinterEllison as the most attractive law firm of choice for 2019 and 2020 as voted by our Peers.
Purpose of the role
An exciting full-time permanent opportunity has arisen for an experienced Continuous Improvement Business Analyst to join our Digital team to work on large scale projects within the firm. MinterEllison is undergoing large scale digital transformation in the Legal Operations space and this role will contribute to the effectiveness of multiple projects and initiatives to achieve the firm's strategic goals. Based in either Sydney, Melbourne or Brisbane you will have the opportunity to collaborate with stakeholders across all verticals of the firm and will be instrumental in preparing project opportunity assessments, project scoping, technology solution design, test planning, business change planning and delivery.
The Role
In the Continuous Improvement Business Analyst role you will have the opportunity to manage the delivery of multiple streams of work to ensure successful implementation of new processes, systems and work practices, in support of the firm's strategy.
Collaborate with stakeholders across all verticals of the firmto identify, prioritise and plan priorities for improvement
Review processes and make recommendations on optimising efficiency within legal operations,
Utilise 'as is' and 'to be' process maps to inform and identify how various current and potential technology solutions can be leveraged to optimise efficiency
Perform analytical work as required – including data gathering, data, process or financial analysis, development of cost benefit analysis, development of business cases and business requirements documentation
Manage building & testing workflows in Minter Ellison process automation tool
Maintain project documentation and reporting regularly and transparently on progress
Collaborate with the Project Management Office team in order to manage interdependencies, and achieve shared objectives for improvement of the firm
More About You
We welcome applications from experienced Business Analysts with a strong background in process/continuous improvement projects. We do also welcome applications from people with:
3-5+ years experience in a related Continuous Improvement/Business Analysis role, with demonstrated ability to map, analyse and improve processes,
Effective relationship builder with strong stakeholder management skills to influence internal and external stakeholders and process owners.
Influence stakeholders and process owners to adopt new work practices
Translate and produce detailed system requirements whilst explaining these to business and technical teams
Strong written and verbal communication skills, including ability to summarise information succinctly and draw out key conclusions to influence stakeholders
Solution oriented mindset with strong conflict resolution skills skills to help identify, communicate and resolve issues;
Innovative mindset with innate ability to drive continuous improvement across policy, process and systems;
Proactive team player who is results-oriented with a client service focus mindset
Qualifications or knowledge of best practices in lean six sigma, project management, or change management would be well regarded.
Experience in legal or professional service firm would be well regarded but not necessary
Who We Are

We make diversity in all its forms central to collaboration. We know that when we bring together diversity of thinking, skills, experience, gender identity, backgrounds and orientations, we get better results. This is why we offer agile and alternative working options to encourage balance, wellbeing and support for sustainable ways of working. We offer up to 20 weeks paid parental leave for the primary carer within the first 24 months following birth or adoption, and a range of social, financial and health benefits, including free gym membership – all with no minimum tenure.

We welcome applications from people of all ages, cultural backgrounds, genders (including if you identify as transgender or gender diverse), sexual orientations, as well as people living with a disability or who have family or carer responsibilities. We particularly encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people to apply for roles with MinterEllison.

We are recognised as a WGEA Employer of Choice for Gender Equality in Australia and hold Gold employer status with the Australian Workplace Equality Index (AWEI).

How To Apply

We love to connect with you directly, so please submit your CV and cover letter for consideration by clicking on the 'Apply' button below.

If you would like further information, to tell us about any adjustments you might require through the recruitment process or if you are trans or gender diverse and want a confidential discussion, please contact Alexandra Hussain, Resourcing Solutions Consultant at alex.hussain@minterellison.com

Agency submissions will not be accepted without prior express approval from the MinterEllison recruitment team. All agency candidates must be submitted through our on-line portal to be valid.

Join a team responsible for providing expert advice in the area of climate risk
Play a key role in ensuring regulated entities manage the financial risks of a changing climate
Join a genuinely flexible, family friendly and inclusive culture with hybrid office and home working
The effects of a changing climate pose financial risks, as well as provide for new business opportunities, to all APRA-regulated entities. These financial risks will continue to be a focus of APRA’s efforts to increase industry resilience, and to ensure effective action is taken to manage these risks.
The Climate Risk team provides expert advice on the management of climate change financial risks to APRA supervisors, and engages domestically and internationally on climate risk. Its key focus is the understanding, governance, management and disclose of these risks by APRA-regulated institutions.
We’re looking for analysts to join the team, where you will:
Play a key role in contributing to APRA’s development of relevant prudential standards, guidelines and methods to assess and influence the climate risk policies and practices of APRA-regulated institutions
Promote best practice in the industry, work closely with key stakeholders and peer agencies both domestically and internationally
Represent APRA at international bodies, and coordinating APRA’s response to relevant international work
Maintain a network within the Australian and international industry, including stakeholders outside APRA’s regulated entities
Scope and develop APRA’s policy framework in relation to climate risks
Provide internal coordination of APRA governance bodies

Lead project and other ad hoc initiatives, leveraging an aptitude in strategy, critical thinking and innovation
You are someone with:
Excellent business writing and verbal communication skills, with the ability to synthesise large amounts of information and identify emerging risks as they relate to the financial system. The capability to exercise sound judgment and problem solve while being able to work collaboratively with stakeholders at all levels of the business, in a professional team environment. A positive mindset and willingness to offer new ideas and a fresh perspective.
Undergraduate or higher qualifications in a finance-related discipline, or in a quantitative or business strategy discipline with application to climate risk and finance, are essential. Prior experience in insurance underwriting, banking & risk, investment, or modelling of physical and transition climate risks would be beneficial but not essential.

Our story
As a start-up business inside one of Australia's largest retailers, WooliesX aims to bring the best of Woolworths to our customers, powered by our team, technology and data. To achieve our customer 1st strategy, we have combined the Digital, eCommerce, Customer Loyalty and Financial Services businesses to transform the customer experience under one banner - WooliesX.
Having been awarded the Canstar Blue Award for No.1 in Customer Satisfaction for online groceries, and more recently being voted the most popular Loyalty Program in Australia, we’re proud of the work we do and are being recognised for delivering innovative and best in class service that is convenient, frictionless and personalised to our customers.
With an industry leading technology team, backed by analytics, we’re resourceful and willing to experiment. Our agile teams are empowered to innovate and deliver an awesome experience for our customers - no matter whether they choose to shop in-store, or online.

How we roll:
A start-over helping transform our digital practice and disrupt Woolworths and the market, we’re made up of smart people with smart ideas. We’re proud of the work we do and want to be known for delivering exceptional client experiences.
We’re resourceful, inventive and willing to experiment; with the autonomy to doing things our way which have a real impact. We’re a new team with great work life balance.

The brand new site has been designed to support flexible working with different spaces for different activities such as collaboration, brainstorming or just chilling out.
At WooliesX, we also believe in flexible working, and our teams also have the option to work from home or our corporate head office in Bella Vista.

About you:

Demonstrated analysis experience delivering innovative initiatives \

Job Title: Data Analytics and Business Intelligence Lead
Job Description:
Flourish Australia has an excellent career development opportunity for a Data Analytics and Business Intelligence Lead to join our Support Hub team located in Sydney Olympic Park!
Flexible working from home arrangements are available and will be agreed with the successful applicant. The position is full-time working Monday to Friday and is classified Level 5 on the Flourish Australia Enterprise Agreement (2018).
About the Opportunity
The Data Analytics and Business Intelligence Lead is responsible for leading and developing Flourish Australia’s data analytics, data visualisation, and data governance activities.
The position supports the monitoring and evaluation activities of Flourish Australia, establishing and maintaining best practice data quality and governance processes. It ensures compliance with privacy legislation and involves working collaboratively with managers to ensure data capture and collection operates effectively across all Flourish Australia’s programs.
The position will include but is not limited to:
Ensuring data quality and integrity, including data cleansing, across all Flourish Australia’s data capture and collection systems
Extracting and analysing large data sets, including combining datasets from more than one source
Producing charts, dashboards and reports that are simple, visually appealing and easy to understand with a focus on providing business insights and actionable results
Working closely with the Senior Leadership Team, Professional Practice Manager, Managers and support teams to develop and deliver data informed evaluative and improvement processes
Identifying key metrics and data insights to assist with organisational decision making and continuous improvement
Contributing to the development and improvement of data capture and collection systems
Supporting Flourish Australia’s Monitoring and Evaluation Framework, including creating data reports and visualisation that achieves the objectives of the Framework
Assisting with the preparation of data reports for funding bodies against funding and performance agreement requirements
Please find further details in the position description attached here.

Selection Criteria
Essential:
Tertiary qualifications in information technology, mathematics, data analytics or a related field.
At least 5-years of relevant experience in data identifying, measuring, monitoring, data cleansing and reporting using PowerBI, Tableau or similar software.
Advanced knowledge of contemporary data analysis, statistical, process improvement and data visualisation approaches.
Advanced technical skills using analytical tools such as SQL, Python, Minitab, SPSS and Excel.
Well-developed analytical, research and consultation skills, and the ability to use evidence to inform decision making.
Sound communication skills including the ability to write reports, present to and engage with staff.
Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively and autonomously with internal and external stakeholders, with the capability to build and maintain positive working relationships.
For further information, please contact General Manager, Business Excellence, Mohammed Alkhub E: mohammed.alkhub@flourishaustralia.org.au
About Flourish Australia
Flourish Australia is one of Australia’s most experienced community mental health organisations. For over 60 years, we have provided individual support to people with a lived experience of a mental health issue for them to live purposeful lives. Our vision is to create communities where everyone’s mental health and wellbeing flourishes.
Our services are comprehensive and our proven approach is highly personalised because each person’s experience will be different and their needs, as an individual, are unique. We start by fully understanding an individuals strengths, the challenges they face and what flourishing looks like for them. Together we set goals, connect individuals with the right people, support services and opportunities to meet their needs.
Everyone who works at Flourish Australia is dedicated to providing people experiencing mental health issues with the day-to-day support and encouragement they need to create a rewarding life for themselves in their community.
Our positions are open to all suitably qualified applicants. We have a strong commitment to the participation of people with lived experience of mental health issues in our workforce. We value diversity and encourage applications from suitably qualified people from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Island backgrounds, people from CALD and LGBTI communities and mature age candidates.
All appointments with Flourish Australia's Mental Health Services are subject to an NDIS Worker Screening clearance, a National Criminal History Check, a Working With Children Check, previous employment reference checks, satisfactory Australian residency status and other background checks.
About the Benefits

Family-friendly and flexible working conditions

Tax-Free Salary Packaging available up to $15,900

Long Term Program
Great Rates

To implement and delivery Cognos related solutions and to ensure that the Cognos applications are robust, user friendly and deliver the desired benefits to the organization

Participates in implementation of Cognos applications / upgrades to the business
The Core Technology
Strong experience in IBM Infosphere Datastage v11.7
5 years’ experience in ETL design, development, implementation and support
Experience in data analysis, data modelling, data integration, data warehousing and database design.
Experience in Cognos BI (v10.2+) or Cognos Analytics (v11) (Preferred but not essential)
Experience in Microsoft Azure and Business intelligence stack (Preferred but not essential)
Strong experience with SQL and Relational Databases (SQL Server)

Job Title: Trade Desk Analyst (x 2) - Chi-X Australia - Financial Market Operations
Job Description:
Market Ops / Trade Desk
High Frequency / Low Latency Tech
Chi-X Australia Expand via Cboe Acquisition

Trade Desk Analyst - Limelight People are supporting Chi-X Asia Pacific growth plans in Australia and are searching for several Trade Desk Analysts to join their growing business.

About Chi-X® Australia and Chi-X Asia Pacific;

Chi-X Asia Pacific is one of the most successful alternative market operators in Asia Pacific, with offices in Australia, Japan, Hong Kong and the Philippines.

Chi-X Australia (CXA), the country's second largest securities exchange achieving an 18.6 percent total market share, offers trading in all Australian-listed securities, as well as the exclusive trading of CXA quoted warrants and ETFs.

A major announcement occurred on June 30th 2021 with the acquisition of Chi-X Asia Pacific by Cboe Global Markets, Inc. Through ownership of Chi-X Asia Pacific, Cboe gains entrance into two of the world's largest securities markets – Japan and Australia – to establish a significant presence in the Asia Pacific region for the first time.

Trade Desk Analyst - The successful applicant will have a unique ability to monitor and analyse complex financial (trading) data identifying behaviours, patterns and events which require investigation. Your analysis and investigation work will provide crucial market insights to senior management across the business.

Trade Desk Analyst - Key Responsibilities:
Monitoring and analysis of financial market data
Dealing with customers / market participants
Analysis of market behaviours and events
Technical Customer Configuration (new participants)
Running data queries and running reports
Contribute towards leading business improvement initiatives particularly product enhancements.
Liaison with onboarding, connectivity and trading issues with current and potential participants, market makers and vendors.

Trade Desk Analyst - Key Requirements:
Unix Shell
SQL Queries
Data Analysis
Advanced Excel
Financial Services (Capital Markets experience)
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Strong oral and written communication skills
Tertiary qualified and/or other related industry qualifications
Experience with Financial Markets Protocols (FIX, OUCH) – (desired)

To discuss, please contact Ian Gingell at Limelight People: ig@limelightpeople.com.au

About Chi-X® Australia and Chi-X Asia Pacific
Chi-X Asia Pacific is one of the most successful alternative market operators in Asia Pacific, with offices in Australia, Japan, Hong Kong and the Philippines.
Chi-X Australia (CXA), the country's second largest securities exchange achieving an 18.6 percent total market share, offers trading in all Australian-listed securities, as well as the exclusive trading of CXA quoted warrants and ETFs. Chi-X Australia (CXA) is a regulated stock exchange committed to transforming, improving and growing Australia’s securities and derivatives markets. Chi-X has experienced strong and sustained growth and has achieved significant milestones including gaining over 20% market share, $3.8 billion traded in value in equity trading and up to 50% of the Australian ETF market (trading and reporting). The Chi-X investment products platform offers a range of unique products exclusively traded on Chi-X, including Funds (ETFs & Quoted Managed Funds), Transferable Custody Receipts (TraCRs) and Chi-X Warrants. For more information visit: www.chi-x.com.au.

About Cboe Global Markets, Inc.
Cboe Global Markets (Cboe: CBOE), a leading provider of market infrastructure and tradable products, delivers cutting-edge trading, clearing and investment solutions to market participants around the world. The company is committed to operating a trusted, inclusive global marketplace, providing leading products, technology and data solutions that enable participants to define a sustainable financial future. Cboe provides trading solutions and products in multiple asset classes, including equities, derivatives and FX, across North America, Europe and Asia Pacific. To learn more, visit www.cboe.com.

Job Title: HRIS Admin HR Data Analytics HR Admin Western Sydney (TC) [JOB # 1861]

Due to continued growth, we are seeking a proactive, results focused person who can administer, analyse, manage and report on HR data as well as provide HR administrative support when required.

Based out of St Mary’s, you will report to the GM Talent Management (Australia), with a dotted reporting line to the Global HR Data Manager (based in the US) and will work closely with the HR Business Partner (based out of St Mary’s).

The key duties of this role is outlined below but not limited to:
HRIS Data Administration - Manage data, security and reporting of the HRIS (SAP SuccessFactors) through routine processes.
HRIS Support - Manage IT ServiceNow ticket HRIS service requests, coordinate assignment with global HRIS business analysts, and manage and monitor case resolution.
HRIS User Training - Provide HRIS training to support HR super users, managers, and employees across Australia and Asia.
HR Data Analysis & Reporting - Collate, report & present dashboards of HR data across multiple systems, including turnover, head count, absenteeism, compensation, demographics, performance, and engagement.
HR Administration - Provide support to the regional HR team for specific administrative processes.
To be considered for this role you must have the following key experience and attributes:
Demonstrated experience in HRIS system SAP SuccessFactors or equivalent. Other HR systems experience an advantage including Qualtrics and SurveyMonkey
Experience within an International organisation is highly advantageous
Demonstrated expertise with HR data analysis, metrics, reporting and presentation
Experience to build out skill set in PowerBI highly regarded
Strong administrative skills with advanced MS Office skills including Word mail merge, Excel Pivot tables and PowerPoint presentations.
Work in a timely and organised manner with clear and concise communication to ensure that all parties are on the same page

A high level of emotional intelligence, tenacity, resilience, a personable nature, good influencing skills, patience and a sense of humour
Highly organised, sense of urgency, ability to prioritise, multitask and follow up all actions by using your calendar system
The ability to be autonomous and take ownership
This role will suit someone who is looking for that next challenge where you can bring your analytical expertise, your data management skills and your HR administration experience to work with both a Regional and Global team.

If you are looking for a role where you will be challenged and rewarded, then please apply on-line attaching your resume in word format.

The successful candidate will need to undergo a pre-employment medical, drug and alcohol test and have a clean valid police check completed within the last 6 months.

Due to a high volume of applicants, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

About us
At Transport, we’re passionate about making NSW a better place to live, work and visit. Our vision is to give everyone the freedom to choose how and when they get around, no matter where they live. Right now, we’re delivering the largest infrastructure program Australia has ever seen – to keep people and goods moving, connect communities and shape the future of our cities, centres and regions. At Transport, we’re also committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible workforce, which reflects the community and the customers we serve.

The Division
The Regional and Outer Metropolitan (ROM) division is focused on understanding the particular needs of regional communities across NSW and delivering customer-centred integrated transport services and infrastructure.

The Opportunity
Right now, we have an opportunity for a Transport Analyst to join the Planning and Programs Branch based in Sydney CBD. The Transport Analyst role leads the analysis of data to identify network and service performance deficiencies and prepare studies/reports which support the development of the transport system to improve customer experiences and outcomes.
Some of your key accountabilities will include:
Lead the analysis of data to identify road safety, transport and traffic management, network management and deficiencies, service performance, and preparation of studies/reports which support the development of the network to improve customer outcomes.
Assess and evaluate the performance of network related project options using appropriate analysis techniques, tools and procedures.
Contribute to program development by providing high-level analytical services.
Build and review traffic models to support planning and programs project teams to deliver key network initiatives.
Lead network performance monitoring and reporting across the region as well as providing information and advice to the Manager for input to media and ministerial enquiries.
Work collaboratively with specialist teams within the matrix branch structure and across divisions to ensure the best possible planning outcomes.

About you
You have an affinity for transport and a passion for delivering better outcomes for regional NSW customers.
You know analytics – its second nature! You have extensive experience using data analytical techniques and tools to provide powerful insights to inform key decision making.
You can take end-to-end responsibility for a body of work, managing client expectations and deliverables whilst your data interpretation and communication ability, allows you to deliver effectively to a broad range of stakeholders. Success in the role will require collaboration with client groups and team colleagues, as well as other data custodians and specialists, to ensure we work effectively to meet client needs and solve challenging briefs.
You hold the appropriate tertiary qualifications and/or can demonstrate extensive experience in mathematics, geospatial analysis, engineering, transport modelling and/or data analytics.

About Us

Exciting opportunity for an experienced Data Analyst to:
Join a team specialising in the development of data pipelines, reporting and analyses of cancer and healthcare data. The work of the team informs decision making and drives meaningful changes to the NSW cancer healthcare system

Where you’ll be working
The Cancer Institute NSW is the NSW Government’s cancer control agency, established to lessen the impact of cancer across the state.
Working at the Cancer Institute NSW means joining a team of committed and dedicated staff who are proud to be a part of the Institute’s purpose of overseeing and accelerating the effectiveness of cancer control in NSW.
The Cancer Institute is a collaborative working environment that encourages diversity and inclusion in how we work and the way we work together. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples are strongly encouraged to apply. Greater consideration will be given to suitable applicants, in order to improve access to employment and career opportunities (GSE Rule 26).
What you’ll be doing
In this role you will utilise your analytical skills to contribute to the development, implementation and maintenance of the Institute’s data assets, reports and reporting systems.
You will have demonstrated experience in working with medium to large complex data sets such as linked state and commonwealth administrative data sets.
Essential to the role will be your ability to work effectively as a team player and collaboratively with specialist statisticians, epidemiologists within the Cancer Institute NSW.
You will have strong data wrangling and programming skills in SAS, SQL or R with a suitable qualification in public health, statistics, data science, informatics or a related discipline.
For your application to be considered

Your resume (maximum five pages)
A covering letter addressing the Essential Requirements, as outlined in the Role Description
A response to the Pre-screening Questions, as outlined below.
Essential requirements
Tertiary qualifications in health information management, statistics, data science, informatics or a related discipline
Detailed knowledge of analysis techniques and programming tools such as SAS, SQL or R
Demonstrated skills and experience in manipulating, summarizing and interpreting medium to large sized, complex datasets
Experience in automating processes and systems beneficial
Experience in working within the health sector as a data analyst highly regarded

Company Description

As Australia’s own global real estate success story, the Colliers brand was established in Australia in 1976. With 2000 people operating from 23 Australian and 26 New Zealand company owned and affiliate offices, we provide a full range of professional services for real estate investors, owners and occupiers across transactions, advisory and management.
In 2021, we continue to build on a track record of revenue and profit growth, and have been widely recognised for our enterprising culture by the likes of:
The Australian newspaper - ranked our ANZ business as the 20th most profitable enterprise in Australia, measured by return on shareholder funds.
Aon - Best Employer in Australia for four years running.
LinkedIn - “Top 25 Companies where Australia wants to work”.

Job Description

At Colliers, we’re continuing to invest in our highly regarded Property Research team based in the Sydney CBD.
This key role will report into the National Director of Research and be responsible for assisting in all aspects of research across the Office property sector, nationally, with a specific focus on the NSW Market.
This role is also responsible for assisting in internal and external presentations to clients, and the promotion of the Colliers profile through marketing and PR activities. Integral to this key role is the ability to ensure collection of high quality data on relevant sectors.
Some of the Key Responsibilities include:
Collection of data, preparation of reports and providing research support to internal and external stakeholders.
Play a significant role in the delivery of the National & NSW component of Office Research and Forecast Reports on a biannual basis.
Carry out analysis of sector data on a quarterly basis to produce Industrial sector market commentary for internal and external distribution.
Manage the quarterly data collection of comparable sales and leasing evidence, property market trends and general property information of National and NSW Office sectors.
Pro-actively engage in production of thought leadership style research, with a focus on (but not limited to) the Industrial property sector.

Qualifications

Your relevant tertiary qualification will be supported by 3 - 5 years proven experience in a research role – either from a property firm, financial institution, council or government. In particular you will be strong in and enjoy:
Statistics/econometrics/mathematics
Formulating opinions and writing commentaries and summaries
Cultivating internal relationships
Working with and analysing data to produce quality insights
Developing your skills using data visualisation tools and producing high quality dashboarding (desirable but not essential).
Furthermore, you will be someone who enjoys networking and can demonstrate a drive to get things done, with a service first orientated approach.

Additional Information

Please apply with your CV or call Lydia Masterson on 02 4702 0129 for more information.
Please be advised that applications will only be accepted directly rather than via recruitment agencies.

Company Description

As the world's leader in digital payments technology, Visa's mission is to connect the world through the most creative, reliable and secure payment network - enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive. Our advanced global processing network, VisaNet, provides secure and reliable payments around the world, and is capable of handling more than 65,000 transaction messages a second. The company's dedication to innovation drives the rapid growth of connected commerce on any device, and fuels the dream of a cashless future for everyone, everywhere. As the world moves from analog to digital, Visa is applying our brand, products, people, network and scale to reshape the future of commerce.
At Visa, your individuality fits right in. Working here gives you an opportunity to impact the world, invest in your career growth, and be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace. We are a global team of disruptors, trailblazers, innovators and risk-takers who are helping drive economic growth in even the most remote parts of the world, creatively moving the industry forward, and doing meaningful work that brings financial literacy and digital commerce to millions of unbanked and underserved consumers.
You're an Individual. We're the team for you. Together, let's transform the way the world pays.

Job Description

The Analyst, Visa Consulting & Analytics will work on consulting engagements for Visa clients in Visa's Australia, New Zealand and South Pacific region, enabling portfolio growth and improved profitability in clients' payment card businesses. Typically 2-4 months in duration and running in parallel, potential projects could include portfolio management diagnostics, assessments of digital product and marketing strategies, product design and launch, development of industry landscape evaluations and best practices, and optimisation of client customer experience and supporting processes. The Analyst will be responsible for supporting components of client engagements. Typically, this will involve the Analyst interacting with the project team (including Visa and client members), gathering and managing project inputs, analysing data to form conclusions and recommendations, developing compelling project reports and supporting the execution of recommendations. The full range of responsibilities are detailed below:
Responsibilities-Support the preparation of client proposals and project plans, identifying dependencies, roles and responsibilities, scope and deliverables. Prepare project materials including interview guides, data requirements, concepts, frameworks. Collecting and analyse inputs such as client information, data, processes, policies, competitive and environmental information. Conduct industry research, drawing on Visa and partner resources as well as colleagues to identify global best practices and distil insights relevant to the client problem at hand. Create, develop and maintain models, contribute to IP creation and standardised VCA offerings. Continuously build knowledge, surface new insights, and contribute to thought leadership pieces. Identify solutions and recommendations that address client objectives and result in performance improvement. Create compelling presentations to illustrate findings, ideas, recommendations within consulting engagements and more broadly

Qualifications

Analysts are expected to have 2-3 years of fulltime work experience after university graduation. The ideal candidate will be interested in the payments industry and keen to work alongside an experienced team in gaining a deeper understanding. You will be intellectually curious and data-driven, always seeking to understand and solve complex challenges. Contributing to strategic engagements and influencing client outcomes is a key motivation for you.
Specific skills and experience you will bring are:
Superior analytical and problem solving skills, with demonstrated intellectual and analytical rigor
Strong team orientation, collaborative, diplomatic, and flexible, able to work effectively in a matrixed organisation
Interest in developing presentation skills, building on strong oral and written capabilities
Self-motivated, results-oriented individual with the ability to progress multiple analyses concurrently
Experience in and passion for the power of analytics to inform and drive strategy and tactics, and proven ability to generate insights from data
Strong detail orientation, ensuring the highest level of quality/rigor in reports and data analysis
In addition, you will ideally bring the following:
Experience in financial services (banking, payments, investments)
An understanding of statistical analysis, modelling, scoring schemes, etc.
Financial modelling experience, including scenario analysis, business case development, financial statement modelling, market sizing and opportunity prioritisation
Team-based/cross functional collaboration skills and the ability to work with different teams such as client relationship, product, and innovation teams.
Strong undergraduate academic accomplishment
Program/Project management skills including the ability to contribute to multiple projects running in parallel
Analytical and research skills including desktop research and stakeholder interviews to synthesise materials on a variety of topics.
Technical Skills including facility with the MS Office suite of products (primarily Excel, Word, and PowerPoint).

Additional Information

Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Job Title: Assistant Evaluation Analyst x 2, Clerk Grade 5/6
Job Description:
Assistant Evaluation Analyst x 2

Duration: 2 x Temporary full-time appointment up 1 July 2022 with the possibility of extension.
This is a great opportunity to make a positive difference to student education across NSW in an innovative and dynamic environment. We are seeking a highly motivated Assistant Evaluation Analyst to join the Quality Teaching Practice Unit and its commitment to deliver on the executive priority to amplify the best practice of outstanding teachers.

The Assistant Evaluation Analyst reports to the Evaluation Analyst. This role assists with data analysis to support the evaluation of all programs in the Quality Teaching Practice Unit.

We are seeking an experienced Assistant Evaluation Analysts with:
The ability to deliver quality services independently in a fast-paced environment
Ability to gather and analyse data using qualitative and/or quantitative techniques
Proficient in the use of Microsoft suit programs, such as PowerPoint and Word.

Your role will be vital in supporting the business unit in delivering and achieving its executive priority commitments. You will be highly collaborative, self-motivated and will thrive working as part of a high-performing and driven team in representing the organisation in an honest, ethical and professional way.

About the Department of Education
We ensure young children get the best start in life by supporting and regulating the early childhood education and care sector. We are the largest provider of public education in Australia with responsibility for delivering high-quality public education to two-thirds of the NSW student population.

For more information about the Department of Education, please visit NSW Department of Education

About the Quality Teaching Practice Unit
The Quality Teaching Practice Unit sits within Learning Improvement, a division of the Department of Education. Our work is centred on the Executive Priority to amplify the best practice of outstanding teachers. We identify and mobilise expert teachers from across the state, to create and deliver high-impact professional learning which is strategically scaled across the system. Our ultimate goal is to drive improved and equitable student learning outcomes, by deepening teaching practice.

We are a vibrant and multi-disciplinary team that uses diverse project methodologies including human-centered design, prototyping, research, data analysis and responsive evaluation. Our environment is agile, fast paced and innovative, with never a dull moment as we deliver evidence-informed resources and professional learning for teachers.

Senior Reporting Analyst
Work as part of a high profile team responsible for high value investment decisions for large rail freight provider
Work for a stable, leading business that is an essential service
Opportunity to sharpen and/or develop your skills in reporting, modelling and digital finance
Permanent North Sydney based role
Pacific National is committed to diversity in our workforce and encourages women and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people to apply.
About the role
The Senior Reporting Analyst will be responsible for producing the monthly capex report within leading rail freight provider, Pacific National. The role will be accountable for ensuring that the capex reporting process occurs seamlessly and that the report contains information on how the project portfolio is tracking against budget in relation to spend amount, timing of delivery and the benefits to be received.
The role will also extend to helping drive efforts at improving the systems and processes used to budget for, track and report on our projects leveraging spreadsheet automation, standardisation, and new Digital Finance tools. In addition to increasing the efficiency of reporting and generating additional insights for the business, as part of the broader Group Finance team, the Senior Reporting Analyst will support the other members of the team including assisting the Investment & Valuation Management team with analysis, research tasks, and financial modelling support.
Key responsibilities include:
Accurate preparation of month-end group capex report for presentation to the Executive and Board
Ownership of the project tracking framework including working with key stakeholders to improve process and framework and investigate alternative IT systems
Assist in the coordination of the annual capital budget process and liaise with other departments to ensure there is clarity on the budget process requirements
Manage the collation of inputs for other departments and help develop new systems for collating capital budget information and improved forecasting
Work with the rest of the Investment and Valuation Management team to ensure the necessary outputs from the capex budget can be fed into the valuation model efficiently
Ownership of the capex reporting model which includes updating the model for monthly actual results and quarterly/annual forecasts, undertaking comprehensive financial variance analysis and preparing commentary for business unit and group reporting
Accountable for continuously improving month-end capex reporting processes, identifying issues and resolving them
Valuation and investment analysis including working with members of the Investment and Valuation Management team to ensure all internal investment proposals submitted to this forum are supported by a concise and robust business case along with appropriate financial analysis
Support for Digital Finance implementation projects across the broader Group Finance team including Cloud based planning tools and Reporting/dashboarding using BI visualisation tools.
About you
Ideally, you will have experience with corporate reporting and have a keen interest in learning new technologies and embracing Digital Finance. Any exposure to investment analysis will be highly regarded, as will strong financial modelling and numeracy skills.
The ideal candidate will also possess the following skills, experience and attributes:
Strong stakeholder management skills with excellent written and verbal communication skills
The ability to manage large datasets and complex financial models
Enthusiasm for improving reporting, learning new technologies and embracing Digital Finance
Ideally exposure to Power BI and building dashboards
Commercially aware with a high level of initiative and pro-activity
Proactive in developing relationships across the business
The benefits
We value diversity, inclusion, collaboration and the contribution of each of our employees. Working for us will enable you to take ownership of your career and gain access to the following benefits:
Opportunities for growth and career development
Access to mentoring programs
Flexible working arrangements (subject to business needs)
12 weeks paid parental leave for primary carer at full pay following 12 months of service
Opportunity to purchase additional annual leave
Provision of Salary Continuance Insurance
Novated leasing and discounts on selected health insurance funds, travel, gyms, retail brands, vehicles and more.
About us
Pacific National (PN) is the largest provider of diversified rail freight services in Australia. We haul a variety of freight including coal, intermodal containers, steel, and a range of bulk commodities and materials that keep the region’s economy, businesses and households running. We operate nationally with approximately 3,500 staff in over 90+ sites across Australia.
Join us as we continue to transform our business and shape the rail freight industry, to achieve our vision of becoming Australia’s recognised leader for safe, innovative and sustainable rail freight solutions.
We are seeking applicants who share our values: safety, integrity, accountability and teamwork and live these values through open and honest communication and respect.
Closing date
Applications close on 17th August 2021.
Next steps
Are you ready to be part of our future?
To apply, please click on the 'Apply' button below and follow the prompts.
To find out more about Pacific National, our benefits and opportunities we offer, visit our careers page: www.pacificnational.com.au/careers
Home Safely Every Day – Pacific National’s top priority is getting you home to your family safely every day.

To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Marketing
Job Details
We are looking for true all-stars with a passion for Marketing to join our best-in-class Field Marketing Operations.

Seeking an experienced person to support the Digital Marketing & Digital Analytics teams in providing insights, data analytics, reporting, responding to requests for data, and ensuring data integrity between multiple data sources.
This critical role will deliver the business analysis and optimization necessary for the company to reach its objectives. You will work directly with digital and marketing teams to understand and deliver key reporting and recommend enhancements to optimize visibility and results for Salesforce.com.
The scope of the role will also include analysis, reporting and creation of executive level presentations for Salesforce.com. Responsibilities will increase as the Contractor demonstrates success in understanding processes, methodologies and systems and shows initiative in tackling more complex projects.

Some things you will be doing:

Inbound onsite analytics
Analyze inbound traffic and site performance weekly. Proactively provide insights into strengths/weaknesses, including:
Channel performance
Media landing page performance, split by channel
Campaign performance for traffic on-site (e.g. SEM engagements performance, campaign factors, etc.)
Inbound digital journeys insights
Google Analytics media attribution and insights into cross campaign / channel performance
Digital customer journeys from media entry pages (when someone enters via, e.g., our paid landing page, what does that journey look like)
Attribution from channel / tactic to engagement
Digital audiences
Digital segments for onsite analysis in Google Analytics
Google Audience analysis ( in-market / affiliate)
Support for the SEO keyword audience funnel measurement
Adthena management
Help bring together offsite and onsite data to provide insights into performance fluctuations (weekly stakeholder comms, digital steerco, QBRs, MPRs, etc.). This includes:
Maximise ROI on this tool, helping first to set up automated insights and then transforming those insights into proactive deep-dives
Use Adthena data to add offsite insights to onsite performance
Proactively surface Adthena data to drive insights into competitor analysis
Proactively surface opportunities by region for SEM and landing page performance
CRO / Optimization
All of the regular analytics then feed into a CRO program, including:
Proactively suggest CRO opportunities for media landing pages from performance insights uncovered in regular deep-dives
Coordinate media CRO tests focusing first on paid (vs onsite performance only), factoring in channel(s), spend and creative
Knowledge and Skills Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Mathematics, Computer engineering, or Data Science.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Enthusiasm for learning new skills and tools.
Must be able to work well in a team environment.
Strong Excel skills. Ability to work with pivot tables, analyzing large tables of data, comfortable using Vlookup and other data analysis formulas, strong aptitude for correlating data and finding critical data trends.
PowerPoint/GSlides. Strong ability to distill data analysis, insight and other key findings into executive level presentation briefings
Experience using Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, and Optimizely
Experience using Business Objects and other Business Intelligence tools (i.e. Tableau).
Experience with SQL.
Ability to understand the business and anticipate data needs.

Role: Business Analyst – Strategy and Performance
Salary: SNSW Grade 7/8 – The package includes base salary range of $92,788-$109,396, plus employer's contribution to superannuation and annual leave loading.
Status: Full Time/ Ongoing
Location: Haymarket


Service NSW is making it easier for people and businesses across NSW to access government services. Since launching in July 2013, we have successfully transformed and streamlined NSW Government service delivery with cutting edge digital solutions and an award-winning culture of passion and teamwork.

Our customer-centric solution offers simpler and faster access to government transactions through our digital channels, a 24/7 phone service and an expanding network of service centres. We currently partner with over 50 agencies to offer over 1,000 NSW Government transactions.

About the role and team:

We are seeking a business analyst to support the development of Strategic Plans for our division, provide our executive with a meaningful view of business performance and to support complex problem-solving on operational business issues. In this role, you will use a variety of methods and data sources to address greenfield business briefs, and work cross-functionally with stakeholders across the organisation to deliver sound recommendations in a fast-paced environment.


You will be working with a dynamic, multi-disciplinary team who values diversity of thought and promotes collaboration. We constantly look for ways to improve and we are quick in evolving our way of working. We welcome applicants from a range of disciplines. The critical requirement is a demonstrated history of achieving business outcomes in a fast-paced and constantly changing environment, often working with limited information.

In this role, you will:

Contribute to the development of Service Delivery strategies, plans and associated documentation
Work with stakeholders to understand and analyse solutions to business problems
Collect, collate and analyse data from diverse sources
Develop presentations, papers and briefing notes
Assist with the coordination and facilitation of working groups or project teams to achieve business outcomes

To be successful in this role you will demonstrate:

Commercial awareness with strong problem-solving skills and can formulate solutions in an ever-changing and highly fluid environment
An ability to thrive in a collaborative environment and your capacity to develop long-term productive working relationships with key stakeholders
Strong project management skills with a particular focus on taking ownership of the tasks or outcomes assigned
Strong analytical skills, with the ability to evaluate numerical data, extract pertinent facts, draw logical conclusions and generate actionable insights to present to senior management
Competence in developing professional and attractive presentations for a diverse range of audiences
Strong verbal and written communication skills.


What would be highly regarded, but not essential:

Experience in a ‘big four’ consulting firm
Tertiary qualification in a related field such as business, strategy, mathematics, or economics at a top-tier institution
Knowledge of quantitative research techniques such as statistics, applied mathematics or data modelling

To apply: To apply for this opportunity, please provide a copy of your CV and a cover letter (no more than 2 pages) highlighting how you meet the above criteria.

Closing Date: Monday 16 August 2021 09:59 Sydney Time

Salary Grade: Grade 7/8 with the base salary for this role starting at $92,788 per annum plus superannuation and leave loading.
