Job Title: Customer Experience - Systems and Process Analyst
Job Description:
About ALG

Australian Learning Group (ALG) is a registered training organisation that has been offering high-quality vocational education and training for over 15 years.

We believe in nurturing and empowering people on their path to more meaningful careers, providing the right opportunity for our students to learn, transform and evolve while pursuing their passion.

We are currently seeking a CX Systems and Process Analyst to join our Sydney team, to deliver responsibilities across ALG and our sister entity Ikon Institue of Australia.

About the role

Showcasing your passion for customer experience design, you will identify, investigate and solve systems and process issues within the ALG and IKON businesses.

With the core focus on identifying improvements to systems that impact our students, this role will be critical in driving the digital experience of all ALG and IKON students.

Being a national role, you will be responsible for internal engagement as well as working with external vendors who provide solutions for our business.

About you

You are passionate about customer experience and use your analytic skills (with a strong focus on data) combined with process design to innovate the student experience.

You have strong interpersonal skills, excellent communication and work well in a team as well as autonomously. You have the ability to think strategically to plan and deliver projects.

Key responsibilities
Design and curate the ALG and IKON student experience
Lead discussions and execute on improvements to the student experience
Work with the current suite of systems within the business and optimise functionality to deliver on the current capability of these systems
System implementation spanning from first use through to day to day optimisation
Reporting and analysis to measures success of each system
Identification of new solutions to drive improvements in the customer experience
Liaise with current and future systems vendors to ensure solutions meet business requirements
Creation and management of the systems map that underpins the ALG and IKON processes
Management of current and future system budgets
Use feedback from students and staff to identify continuous improvement areas
Manage administrative duties with efficiency and accuracy
Qualifications and skills

3+ years in a business analysis role
Exposure to and working knowledge of customer experience design
At least 1+ years experience in data analysis on the PowerBI platform
Demonstrate ability to independently plan, run and monitor projects
Initiative and the ability to use the information available to make sound decisions
Able to work under pressure and remain calm in stressful situations
Ability to maximize the results with resources available.
Why join our team
A fun and diverse team
Employee benefits
Supportive and collaborative work culture
Learning and development opportunities

Know more about ALG at ALG - Who we are!
Diversity & Inclusion
We celebrate our diversity and strive to reflect contemporary Australian society in order to better serve our students. We welcome and encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, culturally and linguistically diverse people, people with disabilities, sexually and gender diverse people, people with lived experience of adversity and from people of all ages.
About UCW
Both ALG and Ikon are a part of the ASX-listed UCW LimitedGroup, which owns and operates a portfolio of tertiary education businesses, with a current focus on Health and Community Services related fields of study in both the international and domestic student market.
Be part of our team:
Please send your resume and a covering letter summarising your relevant skills and experience
If you have any questions regarding the role, please write to Bonnie.Ballete@alg.edu.au
We are only able to consider applicants with the right to live and work in Australia
Only shortlisted candidates will be notified of the outcome of their applications

At Canva, we create tools that empower the world to design. Our mission is to democratise design and empower creativity for anyone and everyone, on every platform! Inspired by a team of talented thinkers, an amazing culture and remarkable growth trajectory – we’re out to change the world, one design at a time.
Since launch in August 2013 we have grown exponentially, amassing over 55 million active users across 190 different countries who have created more than 5 Billion designs. We are one of the world’s fastest-growing technology companies and we have only achieved about 1% of what we are capable of!
About the team
The Commercial Finance team are the trusted co-pilots to our many different business units, delivering key financial insights to help them achieve their goals which in turn drives the success of Canva. We’re a highly visible team, and the work we do has a huge impact in shaping both the strategic direction and day to day operations of Canva.
As part of this team you will have the opportunity to gain experience working at the headquarters of one of the world’s fastest growing tech companies; your work will impact millions of Canva’s global users.
About the role
The primary role of the Senior Analyst - Marketing Effectiveness will be to play a pivotal role in shaping marketing strategy through experimentation and insights. The role will also answer critical questions about where the next best source of growth will be and help to shape the direction of a new function that will play a huge role in realising Canva’s growth ambitions.
What you'll do:
Play a pivotal role in shaping marketing strategy
Sit at the intersection of marketing, strategy and data
With the Marketing Finance Lead, creating a vision and roadmap for the function’s growth and evolution
Build relationships with key stakeholders and conduct listening tours - familiarise yourself with how digital SaaS marketing works, how we measure performance and define success, the different growth levers that exist
Work with marketing finance & marketing leadership to develop a tracking framework that drives performance discussions & where/what we should be investing in next
Build and own the underlying scenario model that links strategic goals with operational KPIs and provides different investment scenarios to help inform strategic direction
What we're looking for:
At least 2 years of relevant experience in a management consulting or strategy-driven teams
Strong business acumen coupled with problem solving creativity and pragmatic commercial judgement
Experience with analysing large volumes of data and building forecast models, and turning numbers into actions
A strong communicator (both written and verbal), able to clearly articulate complex insights and take others along the journey
An exceptional business partner - your stakeholders love you, and you’re comfortable building relationships with finance and non-finance stakeholders of any level
Growth mindset, life-long learner that is always looking to grow the impact they have
Someone who doesn't mind getting their hands dirty in order to set the function up for success into the future
Relevant degree (Finance, Commerce, Data, Engineering)
SQL (or at least a willingness to learn in the first few months of the role)
Benefits:
Competitive salary on offer, plus equity options
Flexible working hours and a hybrid remote/office work model
In-house chefs that cook delicious breakfast and lunch for us each day!
In house gym and personal trainer
Generous parental leave policy
Pet-friendly offices
Sponsored social clubs and team events + fun and quirky celebrations
We mean it when we say we want to create a workplace that you love coming to. Our culture is unlike anywhere else and our offices are designed with workspaces for every mood, to help you do great work. At Canva you can be part of a company that is growing rapidly, building a product that users really love.
Being a Force for good.
One of our core values at Canva, “Being a force for good” means we are actively working towards a world that isn't just good for a small few, but one that’s good for everyone. We believe deeply that bringing together diversity of thoughts, perspectives and expression is key for building the best product for our equally diverse community. To achieve this, we need to constantly work towards making Canva the best place to work, for everyone.
Apply Now

Exciting role
How will I help?
As an Analyst, you will be responsible for the Credit Risk Data and Control activities relating to WIB’s Corporate and Institutional clients. You will be responsible for the Credit Risk Data and Customer Data Management ensuring credit decisions are correctly recorded in Credit Risk system and product source systems.
You will be responsible for the Control and Management of WIB Facilities ensuring credit facility and risk attributes are recorded in line with credit and facility documentation. Additionally, you will be responsible for Facility Exception Management investigating and remediating misalignment of facility attributes between credit system and product system.
You will be exposed to an extensive range of the WIB products and will develop strong operational knowledge of WIB processes and related credit exposure systems, including the processing of Credit Submission Approvals, establishment and maintenance of WIB facilities accordance to Facility Documentation and reconciliation of Exception and Audit reports. Additionally, you will gain a solid understanding of the credit policies, reporting requirements and the end-to-end Credit Cycle process across WIB.
What is in it for me?
In a word, lots! As well as job flexibility and the financial benefits for being part of the Westpac team (like special banking, wealth, and insurance offers) you will be paid well, and trained so your career can grow as you do. You will also be encouraged to take part in our fun community projects as a paid volunteer. Importantly you will play a significant role in the future of a business that has been around for 200 years.
What do I need?
You will have 5+ years operational banking experience and/or 3+ years operational risk management experience. Also, the ability to review Facility Documentation to capture Facility attributes and borrower structure of Facilities.
You will have working knowledge of WIB Products and Policy as well as Credit cycle process from origination to post Approval.
What is it like to work there?
We aim to provide one big, supportive team of people who love helping others succeed. As an equal opportunity employer, we are proud to have created a culture and work environment that values diversity and flexibility- and champions inclusion.
How do I Apply?
Start here. Just click on the APPLY button.
As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply.
The health and wellbeing of our employees is our top priority. We have developed clear standards to ensure our people are confident, safe and healthy whether they are working from a Westpac Group site or working from home. These are based on expert medical advice. The health and wellbeing of our employees is our top priority. We have developed clear standards to ensure our people are confident, safe and healthy whether they are working from a Westpac Group site or working from home. These are based on expert medical advice and Safe Work Australia guidelines.

You are motivated and passionate about insights analytics
We are a high performing team in the Business and Private Banking space
Together we can deliver an exemplary experience for our stakeholders and the Group
Do work that matters

The Business Banking Analytics, Data and Decision Science (BB ADDS) team uses data and analytics to identify our customers’ needs and safely deliver insight, contact journeys and innovative solutions to improve their financial wellbeing.

See yourself in our team

The Analyst role will provide reporting and communications to business stakeholders and management. You will perform analytics to inform business and distribution strategy, identify trends and contact opportunities, prepare reporting with insights and recommendations and be responsible for the central management of our customer communications strategy. Being the front door and central management for our Next Best Conversations (NBCs).

Key Responsibilities

The role will be instrumental in ensuring the Business Analytics teams support our frontline staff in their day to day operations, ensuring they are equipped to support businesses with conversations that matter and help in their financial wellbeing.
Working collaboratively in cross-functional Scrum teams with Marketing, Product, Analytics and Business Segment colleagues, you will be responsible for leveraging the Group’s data assets to provide insights, design multi-channel customer journeys and develop always-on campaigns that transform customer engagement by delivering tailored customer communications – the right message to the right customer, at the right time, via the right channel.
You will deliver to deadlines by managing multiple priorities in a fast-paced, agile environment where you will build these customer journeys in the form of Next Best Conversation customer decisioning & contact strategies.
You will synthesise qualitative and quantitative data and facts from various sources to identify relationships and patterns, drawing logical conclusions about customer needs and how best to meet them – and help drive the business and distribution strategy, identify trends and contact opportunities.
You will research/understand customer needs and identify relevant analytics and data points that will enable us to contact each customer on the right topic, at the right time, and via the right channel.

We’re interested in hearing from people who have
Exceptional communication, stakeholder engagement and presentation skills with good attention to detail
Have demonstrated Insights and Analytics background and skills
Relevant experience in using data and analytics to drive business results, preferably in the Financial Services sector
Excellent analytical, numerate and logical reasoning skills with the ability to navigate complex systems and large data sets
Experience of and/ or a desire to work within an Agile / Scrum environment
Flexible approach and ability to deal with change and develop new ways of working to drive continuous improvement
If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you.

Join a team responsible for providing expert advice in the area of climate risk
Play a key role in ensuring regulated entities manage the financial risks of a changing climate
Join a genuinely flexible, family friendly and inclusive culture with hybrid office and home working
The effects of a changing climate pose financial risks, as well as provide for new business opportunities, to all APRA-regulated entities. These financial risks will continue to be a focus of APRA’s efforts to increase industry resilience, and to ensure effective action is taken to manage these risks.
The Climate Risk team provides expert advice on the management of climate change financial risks to APRA supervisors, and engages domestically and internationally on climate risk. Its key focus is the understanding, governance, management and disclose of these risks by APRA-regulated institutions.

We’re looking for analysts to join the team, where you will:
Play a key role in contributing to APRA’s development of relevant prudential standards, guidelines and methods to assess and influence the climate risk policies and practices of APRA-regulated institutions
Promote best practice in the industry, work closely with key stakeholders and peer agencies both domestically and internationally
Represent APRA at international bodies, and coordinating APRA’s response to relevant international work
Maintain a network within the Australian and international industry, including stakeholders outside APRA’s regulated entities
Scope and develop APRA’s policy framework in relation to climate risks
Provide internal coordination of APRA governance bodies
Develop briefing notes, speeches and synthesising knowledge for senior leaders
Produce and deliver presentations to a range of stakeholders, internal and external
Lead project and other ad hoc initiatives, leveraging an aptitude in strategy, critical thinking and innovation
You are someone with:
Excellent business writing and verbal communication skills, with the ability to synthesise large amounts of information and identify emerging risks as they relate to the financial system. The capability to exercise sound judgment and problem solve while being able to work collaboratively with stakeholders at all levels of the business, in a professional team environment. A positive mindset and willingness to offer new ideas and a fresh perspective.
Undergraduate or higher qualifications in a finance-related discipline, or in a quantitative or business strategy discipline with application to climate risk and finance, are essential. Prior experience in insurance underwriting, banking & risk, investment, or modelling of physical and transition climate risks would be beneficial but not essential.

Where you'll be working
Western Sydney Local Health District (WSLHD) is responsible for providing primary and secondary health care for people living in the Auburn, Blacktown, and The Hills Shire, Holroyd and Parramatta Local Government Areas (LGAs) and tertiary care to residents of the Greater Western Region. We are committed to our vision of 'better health services for the people of western Sydney and beyond' and to the delivery of health care or related services in line with our core values of collaboration, openness, respect and empowerment.

What you'll be doing
The position is responsible for management of the renal and transplant unit database and the ANZDATA registry. RISC is a product developed by the old SWAHS ITD to meet the information needs of Renal Dialysis and Transplant Services. The Data Manager collects information on ANZDATA and also enters the data on paper forms and electronically yearly and in real-time. It also collects information on pancreas transplantation. The position requires use of the database both to interact with the ANZDATA renal database and to produce the annual Pancreas Transplant Registry report.

The position is required to assist the Clinical Director and other senior staff in the preparation of reports/presentations and in the collection & reporting of clinical activity information.
People with disabilities who meet the selection criteria are encouraged to apply; and where required, WSLHD will implement reasonable adjustment consistent with industry standard.

Must have high level analytical skills in statistical software such as SAS, R, STATA
Must have high level database management skills in MS-ACCESS, EXCEL, SQL and business intelligence software.

Working for AMP
Working for AMP means being part of a company that values diverse thinking, encourages collaboration, and promotes innovation. It’s an environment that offers challenging and exciting work as well as opportunities for professional growth. We’re flexible enough to allow you to make the most of your life, both professionally and personally.
We are looking for those that have the courage and agility to navigate changing and complex environments so that we can deliver the best solutions for our customers. We value people with integrity, an innate willingness to help others and an eagerness to perform to the best of their abilities. We’re transforming our business, and we need people like you to join us on this journey.

The opportunity

Enterprise Risk Management is the second line of defence in AMP’s risk management framework and is responsible for developing the risk management framework, overseeing, and challenging the first line’s implementation of the risk management framework and optimisation of risk and return and reporting to senior management and the Board.

The Compliance Analyst role is responsible for supporting the Group Regulatory Risk (GRR) Team in overseeing AMP’s engagement with regulators, to ensure the enterprise is operating in accordance with its regulatory obligations and regulatory risk appetite. The role sits within the Group Chief Compliance team, supporting consistent and effective regulatory engagement and compliance across the enterprise.

As an analyst, you will help support the management of the GRR record keeping system (“Regulatory Commitments Register”) to document, track and prepare reports on all regulator engagements (commitments, requests, responses, meetings, and other interactions). Through review and analysis, you will also be able to provide analysis and insights from our regulatory interactions. This role is pivotal as it will help support the GRR’s partnership with key and senior stakeholders on all regulatory matters, driving and executing change and process improvement, and influencing outcomes to ensure effective and efficient management of regulatory risks.

If you love risk, data and have a strong understanding of the regulatory obligations entities in the financial services sector, this role ties all these elements together.

You will be trusted to
Assist in communicating and embedding a consistent regulatory relationship strategy particularly under the strengthening breach reporting regime
Maintain the Group regulatory commitments register
Reviewing correspondence to regulators; providing internal review and challenge; and assist with the Commitments Register
Ensuring timely responses, monitoring/reporting of actions and maintaining a central and complete file for each review for future reference
Monitor, identify, report, and facilitate remediation of incidents of non-compliance with the Group Regulatory Engagement Policy
Identify and raise issues
To assist in the implementation and ongoing support of the GRC system including using GRC to generate insights through its reporting capabilities
Be alert to current regulatory risk events, trends, and emerging issues, and proactively collaborate with the GRR team to help support the knowledge sharing across the Group to support our positioning as a central hub of excellence for Regulatory Risk matters


You will bring to the role
Bachelor’s degree in law / risk management / finance / governance / audit / commerce, are desirable but we will consider candidates that are in their final year of study and/or demonstrate relevant work experience
A resilient and growth mindset.
Strong communication skills with keen emotional intelligence, time-management and prioritisation abilities, and an ability to collaborate.
Excellent attention to detail and analytical skills with an ability explain complex matters to broad audiences.
We will consider all candidates with the relevant experience in compliance, regulatory or risk areas in lieu of tertiary qualifications
Demonstrated experience in data management, ideally in a risk, compliance or legal role or similar type function (strong transferable skill sets, or experience will also be considered)
Strong Intermediate - Advanced skills in Excel, pivot tables and macro are highly regarded
Experience with ServiceNow will be highly regarded
A clear understanding of the broader regulatory environment impacting Financial Services, including a strong understanding of the strengthened breach reporting requirements; or demonstrated experience in navigating and understanding new areas or heavily regulated industries


Wellbeing & Benefits
As a company that values wellbeing, we offer a range of great benefits to support you financially, professionally, and personally. These include access to a wide range of flexible working options including the ability to purchase extra leave, retail discounts, Employee Assistance Program, competitive home loan rates, leading superannuation contribution, discounted financial advice and personal insurance. For further information please visit Careers - AMP

AMP recognises individual differences and welcomes people from a variety of life and work experiences. The diversity of our people is core to our ability to innovate, grow and to fulfil our collective aspiration of helping people to own their tomorrow. A natural curiosity, a respect for differences and a growth mindset are valued at AMP.

About The Role
The Data Analyst’s primary role is to be responsible for the building of automated and manual reports using descriptive statistics, extracting and transforming data where necessary. They support the Production team in visualising reporting outputs using platforms, tools and dashboards, maintaining data platforms to ensure data integrity, and ensure Domains have access to accurate data.

This role is part of the Reporting, Analytics and Insights team to enable our clients’ timely access to trusted information to drive data driven actions and decision making. The team is building a strong culture of collaboration and key to this success will be a strong understanding of the importance of the business context and connecting the analytics expertise to business SMEs.

Responsibilities
Manage data inputs into systems appropriately so greater capability is built within the business with further transparency that comes from a single source of truth.

OFX is continuing to hire with most interviewing and on-boarding done virtually due to COVID-19. We welcome conversations around flexible working arrangements for this role. Please indicate in the application questions what working arrangements would be your preference.

G’Day. Nice to meet you. We’re OFX, a global provider of online, international payment services for our personal, business and partner customers. Founded 20 years ago and headquartered in Sydney, OFX has grown to become a truly global company. We’re now trusted by customers all around the world and have grown to over 350 employees with offices in Sydney, London, San Francisco, Toronto, Auckland, Singapore and Hong Kong. We are a publicly-listed company, listed on the Australian Stock Exchange (ASX: ‘OFX’)

Purpose of your role
You will play a critical role on our marketing team to drive growth, with a focus on the optimization of the entire customer journey, to ensure our marketing activity drives our customer and commercial targets. You will be pivotal in turning OFX’s client & behavioral data into insightful and actionable information, and ensure this information is acted upon by communicating effectively and proactively with stakeholders. Your passion for providing insights and consulting the business will see you dig deep into data sets in order to effectively story tell, providing ‘why, how and clear recommendation of ‘what’s next’.

What you do
Identify opportunities to drive market share, profitability, growth, channel strategy and customer engagement through marketing and customer insights.
Provide a portfolio view and regular reporting of customer and marketing metrics to drive visibility of key marketing performance indicators as well as actual performance to target.
Work with key stakeholders in the marketing team to size opportunities and support in the development of business cases, including modelling the outcomes and developing the full P&L – this includes marketing, customer engagement, product, UX, digital, website, CRM and data science teams.
Work and closely with Finance team to business case marketing initiatives and impact of incremental investment.
Assist CMPO with board reporting.
Continue to refine and expand our channel strategy across all mediums: SEO, SEM, display, social, PR, content, email.
Monitor, analyse, and report on KPIs to ensure marketing initiatives are driving profitable short-term and long-term results.
Understand and validate that ‘data source-to-report’ is reliable, understandable and consumable.
Develop a programme of continuous improvement through structured and measurable experimentation – insight-to-productionisation, including segmentation, data modeling and predictive analysis.
Use web analytics and business intelligence tools such as Google Analytics or Data Studio to develop dashboards that understands our customers and exploit those insights in campaigns.
Ensure customer data is strictly used in accordance with OFX’s legal and regulatory requirements in the markets it operates in.
Think strategically, analytically and creatively about new ways to reach customers and increase relevance.
Provide pre and post campaign analysis to determine opportunities or realize uplifts.

What you bring
Qualifications
Degree qualified in a Finance, Statistics, Mathematics or Business-related discipline highly desired.
Knowledge, skills, experience
5+ years of commercial experience, working cross-functionally with a mix of experience in areas of data and analytics, product, marketing, sales and/or finance.
Excellent stakeholder management skills and ability to present findings and recommendations to all levels of the business, through verbal and written findings.
Experience in working with online marketing programs with CPC, CPA, and CPM cost models.
Deep understanding of performance marketing, content strategy, and analytics. A data-driven strategist who focuses on a rigorous LTV/CAC approach.
Advanced experience in working with analytical tools such as Google Analytics.
Advanced experience in working with data visual BI tools such as Data Studio or Tableau.
Advanced skills with SQL, Excel and BigQuery.
All related products in Google Marketing Platform, Social Media, Google Ads, Salesforce Analytics (Marketing Cloud & Pardot) are desirable.
G-Suite and Microsoft office products.
Thorough understanding of various online and offline marketing funnels.
Very data driven and should be curious about and tell stories using data.
Sensitivity to potential trade-offs between performance and branding.
Strong sense of ownership and determination to get things done.
Curiosity and eagerness to learn and grow.

What it's like working at OFX
We’re OFXers because we want to make a difference. We see challenges as opportunities and we’re not afraid to roll up our sleeves to get stuff done. We’re committed to making things easier for our clients, pushing boundaries and continuing to move with the times so that we can continue to inspire confidence every day and through every transaction.

We operate as one team, cross-functionally and globally to drive outcomes that deliver excellence for our customers. We're curious self-starters who love learning and sharing our knowledge with others. We embrace change and use our initiative and resilience to overcome challenges.

Global markets move fast and so do we. We work across borders and time zones, which helps make the world feel a little smaller. From San Francisco, Toronto to London, Dublin, Sydney, Auckland, Hong Kong & Singapore, there’s always a colleague to help.

We promote an environment of reward and recognition, OFXers are encouraged to celebrate their peers’ effort, technical expertise or support through a range of channels and awards.
Giving back, we encourage OFXers to give back to causes and communities that are important to them. We celebrate this with an annual Make a Difference (Volunteer) Day, that OFXers can use together or individually.
We have a strong and diverse workforce and we're committed to further developing this workplace culture to create an environment of trust, mutual respect and teamwork. We're proud of the breadth of cultural diversity represented by our employees and we aim to celebrate this each year by engaging in employee activities across our offices.
Always keep learning. Drive your own learning with LinkedIn learning, which all OFXers have access to. We offer a variety of other learning programs and encourage cross functional and soft skill learning.
We take pride in having a work/life balance and flexibility; we encourage employees to work productively and efficiently. Our OFXers enjoy Birthday leave to celebrate their birthday however they choose.
Our Good Vibes employee-led committees organise events to keep our employees engaged inside and outside the office. Whether it’s participating in our team social events, end of year celebrations (currently being hosted virtually). Our team wants you to feel welcome!

Job Title: Senior Market Risk Analyst - Interest Rate Risk
Job Description:
This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced Non-traded Market Risk professional to our team based in Sydney and work on an established and funded project within the Market Risk team. Using your experience and knowledge of Interest Rate Risk in the Banking Book (“IRRBB”), and financial product modelling, you will play a key role in designing and delivering significant changes to the balance sheet risk methodologies and models within non-traded market risk.
Working closely with the existing Interest Rate Risk team, data experts, and software developers this role will play a leading role in a project to deliver new regulatory requirements under APRA’s IRRBB capital standard (“APS117”), including an Expected Shortfall model. The team has already delivered a data and cashflow modelling solution, so core focus of the current phase of this project will be the design & delivery of the quantitative models (risk calculations), end to end automation, and use of data visualisation tools to enhance reporting.
To succeed in this space you will have:
strong quantitative capabilities to support model design and validation approaches across both market data and financial product modelling
understanding of regulatory frameworks – Basel or APRA (“APS117”) – and key IRRBB concepts, including Earnings at Risk (EaR)
experience implementing or working with balance sheet modelling software such as QRM
knowledge and experience in interest rate risk policy, management and oversight
Experience in any of the following is not essential but would be highly desirable
experience implementing Value at Risk (VaR) or Expected Shortfall models
experience working with large data sets, including use of tools such as SQL, Alteryx, Python, and visualisation tools (Tableau/PowerBI)
design and delivery of strategic modelling tools, including testing
Macquarie offers a unique opportunity for Non-traded Market Risk professionals with a range of portfolios and strategies beyond the traditional mortgage and deposit balance sheet. This provides a great opportunity to further develop your current knowledge while being a key part of a major transformation project within an industry leading organisation. Initial contract is 12months, but with a large pipeline of change across Market Risk strong performance in this role is likely to create opportunity for extensions.
About the Risk Management Group
The Risk Management Group (RMG) is an independent, centralised unit responsible for ensuring all risk across Macquarie are appropriately assessed and managed. Its divisions include Behavioural Risk, Compliance, Credit, Financial Crime Risk, Internal Audit, Market Risk, Operational Risk, Regulatory Affairs and Aggregate Risk, and RMG Enterprise Support.
Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths, and in combination with our inclusive environment, it enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. From day one, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us, please apply. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways.
We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you, and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.

About Macquarie
A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.
Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups, disciplines, sectors and borders. With 16,000+ employees and offices in 32 markets around the world, we’re a truly global organisation.
You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives, ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us, you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.
Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.

About Us:

Zinfra partners with companies across the utility and infrastructure sectors to deliver maintenance, operations, engineering, and construction services. For our partners our work is crucial to maintaining the safety and reliability of their electricity and gas transmission and distribution assets.
About the role:
We are currently seeking an Application Support Analyst to commence with us on an Full Time 12 month fixed term contract to join our Data & Analytics team.
This role will report directly to the Systems, Data, and Process Team Lead.
The primary focus of this role is to support the Data and Analytics team in the Gas Services Group. You will ensure all tasks related to data transfer from field mobility system to organisations core ERP are completed in a timely manner by working collaboratively with others.

Your responsibilities will include:
Data processing and management of work order closeout within a strict timeline.
Liaison with different business units to resolve any exceptions preventing work orders from being close out.

Catholic Education – Diocese of Parramatta (CEDP) is a system of schools committed to responding to the needs of students in a world that is changing rapidly. With 5 thousand passionate employees located across 83 primary and secondary schools, our purpose is to transform the learning and unlock the full potential of each of our 40 thousand plus students. We are always on the lookout for top talent to help us achieve our strategic goal of inspiring the future, through quality catholic schooling and by strengthening the professional lives of our employees.
To ensure that we continue to meet the needs of our diverse stakeholders, the internal People & Culture function at CEPD is undergoing a transformation. With a focus on delivering efficient services across school, head office and leadership teams, we are seeking P&C Insight Analysts to join our team.
About the opportunity:
As part of the established People & Culture team, the P&C Insights Analyst reports to the HR Operations & Analytics Manager. The focus of your role will be to drive analytics and insights to influence the People & Culture strategy. More specifically you will:
Partner with key stakeholders to develop specific reports to pull specific data relating to key challenges to meet the demands of the business
Develop and implement data collection systems and reporting frameworks and other strategies that optimise statistical efficiency and data quality to meet system needs
Interpret data, analyse results and provide business-friendly, actionable reporting and insights
Identify, analyse and interpret trends or patterns relating to key workforce indicators in complex datasets
Respond to reporting and data analysis
Provide executive, annual and ad-hoc reporting requests
Maintain the integrity and quality of the data in CEDP systems and project deliverables
Ensure accurate, timely and secure data management to support self-service analytics
Combine data from internal and external systems to create meaningful workforce insights
About you:
To be successful in this highly rewarding role you will demonstrate alignment to the values of CEPD along with:
Tertiary qualifications in the relevant area of study
Ability to work across large scale application systems such as (SAP, Success Factors, Oracle, Salesforce or similar)
Ability to work independently and adapt to change
Demonstrated experience in Human Resources
We believe that our employee community is a key strength of our organisation and we aim to attract the best talent to achieve our strategic goal of being leaders in quality, faith-based education and an Employer of Choice in our sector. Our leaders create inclusive teams and value the individual contributions of our employees. We champion quality education and lead the way in innovation and inspiring the future. We also offer competitive remuneration, salary packaging, parental leave, flexible work, wellbeing programs and professional development.
Interested?

Data Analyst (Remote)


Not Doppler - Sydney, Australia


Not Doppler are on the lookout for a Senior Data Analyst to join their growing team! Founded all the way back in 2005, Not Doppler are a privately owned game development studio with staff spread across the globe. To-date, their games have been downloaded over 300 million times and they are currently working towards the global launch of two new titles with even bigger ambitions.


As their first in-house Data Analyst, you will get to play a key role in helping establish a data-driven culture within their company, as well as helping drive upcoming games towards their ambitious goals.

This role is available to all candidates globally remote, or alternatively they can offer relocation support to anyone interested in joining them in their studio in Sydney, Australia.


Your role and responsibilities will include...
Helping define and design in collaboration with product managers and data engineers on the optimum in-game events structure and custom dashboard requirements
Monitoring & Analysing KPIs, providing key insights to the product teams
Conducting a deep dive and running ad-hoc analysis on game economy, new features, and live ops events. Using your insights, you’ll provide recommendations to improve the performance and balancing of these features into the future, including running and monitoring A/B tests
Supporting the User Acquisition efforts of the business, by providing analysis and predictive modelling support of cohort KPIs like retention, LTV and ROAS curves
Driving forward-looking analysis to help identify opportunities to improve growth of our mobile products.
Helping identify and define user segments based on quantitative metrics, for better targeting of in-app promotions and offers
Embedding a culture of leveraging dashboards and analytics amongst the broader game development teams



The skills and experience you'll need...
3+ Years professional development as a Data Analyst or in similar roles in the mobile game industry. (Not Doppler are very open to candidates with much more experience than the minimum 3 years, and can pay competitively based on relevant experience)
Strong comprehension of freemium business models, with an understanding of what drives commercial success for mobile apps
Comprehensive SQL knowledge
A high competency with visualisation tools
Proficient communication and visualisation skills
Investigative mindset and highly motivated to uncover the root cause of business problems
A confidence in working autonomously, and managing your own schedule



Bonus points if you have...
Experience with Google Cloud Platform, including Firebase and BigQuery
A familiarity with Mobile Measurement Partners like AppsFlyer, and other third-party mobile app/games analytics solutions
Statistical Modelling expertise, or data-centric programming skills such as R or Python.
Machine learning background
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in relevant field
An interest in food and/or cooking, as one of their new titles is heavily leaning on this theme!

About Us
Questas Group is a group of diverse industrial companies providing design, sales, trade retail, service & repair, installation & commissioning and large scale projects across hydraulic, irrigation, pump and engine product lines to the mining, construction, agricultural and general industrial sectors.
Private equity backed, Questas Group operates throughout Australia and employs 700+ people. Questas Group businesses include Berendsen Fluid Power, The Hydraulic Warehouse, CCA Hardchrome, Beasley’s Hydraulic Services, Pacific Hydraulics, Water Dynamics, Malcolm Thompson Pumps, Nordon Cylinders, Swanson Industries, Meadow Industries, EPG Engines, Aussie Fluid Power, Hardchrome Sales and Rathmann Engineering.

About the Opportunity
Questas Group have recently developed an exciting growth strategy and value creation plan. As a result, we are now seeking an experienced Performance Business Analyst to support the strategic initiative owners with tracking and reporting a number of clearly defined input and output KPIs on a weekly/fortnightly/monthly basis as well as their bottom-line EBITDA impact.
This role will see you responsible for maintaining and further developing Business Performance Analytics and Dashboards currently in Power BI whilst also providing support with developing financial models and documenting business cases for new strategic initiatives.

Your responsibilities in this role will also include;
Support strategic initiative owners with tracking and documenting weekly and monthly input and output KPI scorecards (actual vs target and variance)
Document a monthly KPI scorecard for the Group Board pack
Update project plans and Gantt charts for prioritised strategic initiatives on a weekly basis
Monitor the overall progress of prioritised strategic initiatives and attend weekly or fortnightly Steering Committee meetings for each initiative
Maintain and further develop Business Performance Analytics and Dashboards in Power BI
Review and refine the performance KPIs that have been identified for the prioritised strategic growth and business improvement initiatives
Identify existing data sources in the Group ERP system and CRM system to analyse and report on agreed input and output KPIs
Develop simple, effective new data capture templates and tools as required to support performance reporting for selected KPIs that currently do not have data available
Complete ad-hoc analysis (as required) focused on sales data, operational cost data, product profitability and customer profitability to support strategic initiative owners
Develop financial P&L models with clear assumptions to forecast the monthly sales, operating expenditure and EBITDA impact associated with the prioritised strategic initiatives.

About You
To be successful in this role you will possess;
5+ years experience analysing financial, operational and sales data in a for-profit commercial business with 4+ years of experience working with a B2B industrial products/services business in Australia that operates workshops or manufacturing facilities
Bachelor Degree in Business, Commerce, Accounting, Data Analytics, Data Science or a relevant related discipline
Extensive experience developing and maintaining business dashboards in Power BI including the administration and data collection and extraction management.
Experience building clear, visual KPI dashboards in Excel and clear charts that illustrate weekly or monthly performance trends over time
Skilled in identifying and documenting clear insights from data analysis
Experience building financial models with clearly laid-out assumptions to validate expected revenue growth; cost of goods; gross margin; operating expenditure; and EBITDA
Essential to have an expertise in Power BI and experience working with other intelligence/KPI dashboard tools is beneficial
CPA/CA or working towards completion is desirable.

What's in it for you?
This is an exciting opportunity to forge a rewarding career within a growing and progressive business. This position offers an attractive remuneration package commensurate with qualifications and experience, together with a stable work environment offering potential development opportunities.

If this sounds like the role for you then we would love to hear from you!

Client Operations Manager
The Client Operations Manager (COM) is the champion for our clients. In this role, the COM acts as the daily interaction point to our clients for the Global Support and Services (GSS) organization. The COM will fully understand the business operational workflows of their clients, and have in-depth knowledge of their clients’ business needs and challenges. With this expertise, the COM will effectively advocate on behalf of their clients, to resolve issues in a timely manner, and thus exceed client expectations by providing extraordinary customer service.
Responsibilities:
Specific job responsibilities may include, but not limited to the following:
Exceed client expectations by using product, technical and client expertise to effectively solve client issues in a timely manner.
Coordinate investigations and responses by the team, for issues requiring Knowledge Team investigation and collaboration. Fully own escalated issues from inception to resolution, to ensure resolution times meet client expectations.
Develop in-depth knowledge of client business and operational workflows by working closely with client operations and production teams. Contribute knowledge of client business practices to overall Data and Analytics knowledge management (KCS articles, test cases, etc).
Engage in early stages of client lifecycle, to share ownership of key implementation decisions; influence decisions with an eye towards, post-implementation operations and long-term client success. Maintain ownership of decision logs after implementation.
Effectively advocate on behalf of client needs to GSS leadership, as well as leadership in other Data and Analytics areas (Research & Development, Managed Services, Instrumental Engineering, Product Management, OMNI Digital Services, etc).
Understand and contribute to the immediate and 3-month horizon needs and objectives of clients. Own current client temperature and work closely with client Relationship Manager on mid-range client goals.
Maintain daily communication with clients.
Proactively identify opportunities to increase client satisfaction and overall value of Data and Analytics suite (training, new projects, sales opportunities, etc).
Participate in on-call rotation, to help manage critical client issues reported outside of normal business hours, which includes weekends (expected participation is approximately 2 weeks per calendar year).
Travel:
The COM role is not expected to be travel-intensive and is estimated to have up to 10% travel. Depending on the needs of each client and the training plan for each COM, the travel requirement may increase as needed.

Qualifications
Qualifications:
The ideal candidate will possess some of all of the following trails:
BA in Finance, Accounting or IT. Advanced degree preferred.
5-7 years of experience in the investment, private wealth and/or financial services industry.
Excellent communication skills.
Self-motivator with a strong work ethic, initiative, critical and strategic problem-solving skills.
Detail-oriented with strong organization skills.
Must be able to quickly gather and analyze data.
Excellent multi-tasking skills with the ability to thrive in a dynamic working environment.
Collaborative interpersonal skills; ability to work within teams.
Proven ability to build strong relationships, both with colleagues and with internal and external clients.
Expertise in the investment management industry.
Experience using Data and Analytics products is preferred.
Flexibility to support market hours and do some after-hours work when necessary.

As a Risk Analyst, you will be part of a large well run, Financial Crime Operations team within a domestic Bank that has a global reach. This position exists to facilitate and manage escalated SWIFT and Trade transactions that relate to sanctions in order for the bank to manage its obligations under various legislative instruments and international regimes.
As part of the Sanctions Operations team you will be required conduct due diligence on escalated Economic & Trade Sanctions related transactions to eliminate any sanctions concerns on behalf of the Group.
Responsibilities:
Receive and review escalated Sanctions alerts (System and Manual Alerts)
Maintain accurate data to RTM (Real Time Management)
Respond to Complex Enquiries (International Payments and Operations) emails
Conduct due diligence on transactions in line with sanctions regimes
Contact Business Units, Relationship Managers and/or Customers to obtain information required to complete the due diligence assessment
Ensure up to date documentation is maintained for all transactions
Carry out a daily review of the recent changes in the Sanctions Register
Keep up to date with current Sanctions Trade Escalation Reference List sent by Group Sanctions
Take accountability for delivery against SLA relative to transactions that are being assessed
You:
1-2 years experience working in a Banking or corporate environment, Sanctions experience highly regarded
A willingness to learn and take on new skills
Well developed written and verbal communication
Ability to work well under pressure and within tight time frames to adhere to Service Level Agreements/Cut Off times
The role is initially 12 months but is highly likely to extend or go permanent for the right candidate. The team operates Monday to Friday on a rotating roster between 7am-8:30pm. It will be based from home initially and then in brand new Parramatta offices opening next year.
This role gives a great opportunity to join a fun and professional team and learn about Sanctions, a very in demand skill set in the Australian market.

Working for AMP means being part of a company that values diverse thinking, encourages collaboration and promotes innovation. It’s an environment that offers challenging and exciting work as well as opportunities for professional growth. About the role

We are looking for a Technical Business Analyst to join our team and look after the BAU requirements and feature enhancements for the Group Risk and Compliance (GRC) module within ServiceNow. You will also be required to assist with projects that arise in relation to integrations, upgrades and regulatory compliance. This is an initial twelve month fixed term contract.

Our ideal candidate is someone who embodies a passion for continuous improvement and enjoys working in hands-on roles, solving problems, communicating with stakeholders, and working in a collaborative environment. Previous experience with ServiceNow is required.

Key Responsibilities

Gathering requirements, leading workshops to capture current/as-is process, gap analysis and ability to create/assist in data mapping
Refining requirements and creating user stories with proper acceptance criteria, grooming and maintaining the backlog and making sure that requirements are signed off by stakeholders and understood by the development and testing team ready for the sprint
Writing requirements documentation ready for estimation for budget and project sign-off
Providing feedback on feasibility and potential options/solutions
Advising on effort, potential risks and dependencies as well as developing risk mitigation tactics
Assist in showcasing and demonstrating new features and enhancements and assist in any further documentation and training.

Capabilities & Experience

Demonstrated experience as a Technical Business Analyst on large programs and projects within Superannuation, Banking and Financial Services

Knowledge of ServiceNow modules, and specifically the GRC (IRM) module would be extremely beneficial
Experience working with Risk and Compliance teams

Excellent listening and communication skills, both written and verbal

Wellbeing & Benefits

As a company that values wellbeing, we offer a range of great benefits to support you financially, professionally and personally. These include access to a wide range of flexible working options including the ability to purchase extra leave, retail discounts, onsite wellbeing centre including a gym (Sydney Office), Employee Assistance Program, competitive home loan rates, leading superannuation contribution, discounted financial advice and personal insurance.

Inclusion & Diversity
AMP recognises individual differences and welcomes people from a variety of life and work experiences. The diversity of our people is core to our ability to innovate, grow and to fulfil our collective aspiration of helping people to own their tomorrow. A natural curiosity, a respect for differences and a growth mindset are valued at AMP.

Message to recruitment agencies and search firms
AMP does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruitment agencies and search firms. Please do not email or send unsolicited resumes to any AMP employee, location or address. AMP is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Who are we?
Blue Knot is the National Centre of Excellence for Complex Trauma. Our mission is to empower adults to recover and build resilience from complex trauma. Our vision is to reach the 1 in 4 Australians who are impacted by childhood trauma and those impacted by other forms of complex trauma.
We offer several services to achieve this including counselling helplines that operate seven days per week, development of cutting-edge publications and guidelines including a library of fact sheets, videos and resources and we provide professional development training to organisations and individuals on complex trauma, trauma informed practice and vicarious trauma.
For more information about Blue Knot and what we do, please visit our website: www.blueknot.org.au.
About the role
Reporting to the Deputy CEO, this is a full-time position designed to provide data analytics support and advice. You will work closely with all departments across the organisation to meet their data needs including recommendations for improvement.
The duties you will be undertaking include:
Provide data analytics support and expertise to all departments at BKF
Working with BKF departments to ensure that their business requirements are accurately documented and help to formulate requirements
Undertake data cleansing for implementation of new systems
Provide assistance and support for new systems from design to implementation and then support business as usual operations
Provide support and advise around data integration
Provide documentation and training on systems to relevant teams
Provide general support and training to staff on systems and programs
Create and maintain resources/programs/systems for internal use to assist and improve efficiency and effectiveness
Work with business partners to identify and analyse various work procedures and processes
In partnership with the IT/Project Manager, act as a resource to provide support, guidance and information to all departments on systems projects
Actively participate and collaborate on IT and data projects
Liaise with internal and external clients to ensure IT and data projects are efficient and effective
Provide data modelling for all systems, processes and procedures as required
Provide support on projects including the application of project management principles to spec, develop and implement project plans and their execution
Working with large data sets to provide analysis and de-duping records
Review, assess and recommend options for collecting, sharing and using data across the organisation
Reviewing systems and processes to evaluate and recommend improvements to increase efficiencies, performance, functionality and compliance
Ensuring the quality and integrity of all systems and data, for projects and business as usual
Provide ad-hoc support directly to the IT / Project Manager
Undertake ad-hoc duties as requested

It is important that candidates applying for this role understand that they will be exposed to traumatic content from time to time. Support and training is available to employees to assist in managing vicarious trauma.

Degree in STEM or similar
2-3 years of experience in a similar role

Knowledge of project management principles and their application
Excellent communication skills, particularly around documentation of business process
Good knowledge of data modelling

High level administration, organisational and problem-solving skills
Experience in prioritising a heavy workload with competing business priorities
Proven ability working to deadlines
Proven ability to work collaboratively
High attention to detail and accuracy
Professional and strong work ethic
Ability to work autonomously
Strong time management skills

Who is Equifax?
Equifax is a leading global data, analytic and technology company, supporting customers across 24 countries. We have been serving the Australian and New Zealand markets for over 60 years. Through continuously adapting to our environment, not only have we remained a market leader, we drive and challenge ourselves to do better to help our customers live their financial best.
Our people are what makes us great at what we do - we see every member of our team as an integral piece of a jigsaw. We celebrate differences and recognise that each person brings with them unique talents and perspectives. We provide our people the support and flexibility to manage their work-life balance. At Equifax we genuinely care about our people and our ability to come together as #OneEquifax.
The perks of being an Equifax employee within the Data & Analytics team?
There are lots of perks of being an Equifax employee – we offer additional leave days as we recognise the importance of taking time out, whether that’s to catch up on some rest, celebrate a birthday, or give back to our community by volunteering. We are committed to the wellbeing of our people and provide them with discounted health cover through BUPA, access to comprehensive hearing services and discounts, and offer 24/7 support through our employee assistance program. Our leadership team fosters a culture of ownership, they will lead, coach, mentor and listen. We support one another to feel confident to speak up and hold each other accountable to work with integrity.
Our success is our people, for we are truly united by our purpose and are encouraged and challenged every day to bring new ideas to help our customers make more informed decisions. Our outcomes focussed culture encourages thought leadership and innovation to ensure our ongoing success.
We are supportive and revel in working together on exciting projects. We see ourselves making an impact by utilising cutting edge/statistical modelling tools across hundreds of rich data assets and collaborating with some of the best data minds in Australia. Working within our diverse D&A team will provide you opportunities to gain exposure across all phases of the D&A lifecycle and work with some of our largest blue-chip customers.
What you’ll do:
The Data Analyst as part of the Data Quality & Linking team plays a key role in the day to day management of Equifax’s core data assets developed to support our product offerings to the market. Playing a key role in the team’s data steward responsibilities, they will work closely with Product, Sales, Technology and other Data & Analytics teams to drive data quality and coverage of each the data asset to be market leading.
The Data Analyst will perform in-depth analysis to drive data quality improvements of their allocated data assets in alignment with the product team’s strategic recommendations. Furthermore, Equifax is currently undergoing a global data transformation journey whereby data assets are being migrated to the cloud environment. The Data Analyst will support the team’s data stewards in defining business requirements for the transformed state, as well as assist in certification efforts to ensure the data exchanges being created are fit for purpose for use by our Product and Data & Analytics teams.
What are we looking for?
Minimum 2 years of analytical experience in the finance/banking industry or similar
Excellent interpersonal skills, combined with the ability to relate on all levels through the organisation
Demonstrates technical competence and business acumen
Experience with data visualisation and data storytelling (e.g. Tableau)
Statistical skills (advanced statistics or analysis techniques)
Knowledge and in-depth understanding of relational database management systems
Strong numeracy skills
Demonstrated experience and competency using SQL and at least one of the following: SAS, R, Python, Java, or similar.
Extra points for any of the following:
Cloud technologies (e.g. Google Cloud Platform)
Success attributes of an Equifax employee; does this describe you?
Accountable
Brave
Curious
Collaborative
Individualist
Trustworthy
Dedicated
At Equifax, there is no such thing as the 'perfect candidate'
Seeing responsibilities and competencies laid out on paper can be confronting. At this stage of the application process, sometimes imposter syndrome can creep in and mess with our confidence. Please know, we list these items to give you an opportunity to show us your potential and how you can grow and transform with us.
Your ability to demonstrate that you possess/have the real potential to develop the required capabilities, knowledge, experience and qualifications to perform in our roles is what we would like to hear from you. Where possible, you should support your claims with specific examples of what you have done and how you did it.
However you identify, and whatever background you bring with you, please apply if this is a role that would make you excited to come to work every day!

Organisation/Entity: Transport For NSW
Job Category: Manufacturing, Transport & Logistics
Job Location: Chippendale, NSW, AU, 2008
Job Ref No: 15564
Employment Type: Fixed Term Full-Time
Salary Range: $118015.0-$132176.0
About us

Transport for NSW (TfNSW) is the lead agency of the NSW Transport cluster. Our role is to lead the development of a safe, efficient, integrated transport system that keeps people and goods moving, connects communities and shapes the future of our cities, centres and regions. We work with several government agencies to coordinate metro, train, bus, ferry, light rail, road and maritime services, always keeping the safety and comfort of our customers at the heart of what we do.

About the Team:

The Safety, Environment and Regulatory (SER) Division, is responsible for engagement programs, insights and projects that drive future focused safety and sustainability outcomes across Transport for NSW.

The Opportunity:

We are currently recruiting for a Road Safety Research and Data Analyst to join the Centre for Road and Maritime Services branch on a Fixed term full time basis for 12 months.

This role is responsible for the delivery for all camera programs and monitoring delivery outcomes to identify opportunities for enhancement of program delivery. Reporting to the Manager, Safer People, the purpose of the role is to provide accurate information regarding crash and other relevant data to assist in road safety behaviour research and policy development using Geographic Information Systems and other spatial packages.

On a day to day basis you will be responsible for, but not limited to:

Converting crash and GIS data into useful information for the basis of research into behaviours, attitudes and practices.

Ensuring research staff data needs are defined and understood and presenting data that meets those needs in an accessible format.

Completing work in the period allocated, requiring close attention to project timetables and milestones, and the capacity to organise work and meet deadlines.

Balancing priorities within total workload when involved in Division wide and Departmental wide projects.

Working cooperatively with staff from other Divisions and Operating Agencies in policy development and projects undertaken.

Maintaining familiarity with the extensive range of research, policy and Government initiatives impacting on Department for Transport.

Exercising judgement when representing the Division and Branch on committees, working parties and related forums.

Please click here to view a copy of the role description.

About You:

We are looking for someone with a strong data and analysis background who is able to interpret and deliver on data insights, as well as work with our internal and external stakeholders to provide key information and communicate verbal and written responses within tight timeframes and increasing deadlines.

The successful candidate for this role will maintain a high degree of confidentiality and discretion to ensure sensitive information is not compromised. They will represent the organisation in an honest, ethical and professional way and encourage others to do so and demonstrate professionalism to support a culture of integrity within the team/unit which will set an example for others to follow and identify and explain ethical issues.

How to apply

To apply for this position, please submit your resume and answer the questions that are asked as part of the online application process.

Salary and Benefits

The salary for this position is Transport Grade 8 ($118,015.00 to $132,176.00) per annum plus superannuation and annual leave loading.

Applications close: Friday, 13th August at 11:59pm

We are the community we serve

We are committed to being an inclusive, diverse and flexible workplace where differences are valued. We welcome people of all backgrounds, experience and abilities.

We enable our people to work in ways that work for them and their teams. Working virtually and from different locations including regional locations, staggering work hours and job sharing are just some of the ways our people can work flexibly.

Please contact the Talent Specialist below if you require any adjustments to be made to how you interact with us throughout the recruitment process or would like to discuss flexible work options.

For any enquiries, please email Jimmy Desai at JIMMY.DESAI2@TRANSPORT.NSW.GOV.AU.

Find out more about Transport for NSW at https://www.transport.nsw.gov.au/about-us

About us

Sydney Metro is a fully automated rapid transit system which offers a new generation of fast, safe and reliable train services. Sydney Metro also leads the development of vibrant station precincts to meet customer and community needs, transforming the way Sydney travels and helping shape the future of Australia’s largest city.

About the team

The Corporate Service team within Sydney Metro supports the whole organisation including Operational and Project teams with best-in-class IT, Technology, Procurement, HR, Financial Management and Communications functions. We partner closely with the business as well as with senior stakeholders, media and community groups to drive performance, build relationships and manage our exemplary reputation.

The opportunity

Right now, we have an opportunity for a Reporting Analyst to join us in Finance reporting to the Senior Manager, Management Accounting.

The primary purpose of the role is to provide a range of financial and management reporting services to support high standards across financial, budget and funding matters. The role works collaboratively across internal stakeholders including involvement in reporting of finances and monitoring of financial information.

What you will be involved in:

Working closely and managing the financial performance of a Division within Sydney Metro including the identification of risks at an early stage across a large, diverse and complex organization to continually improve financial performance and minimise financial risks.
Liaise regularly with the Management Reporting Team to assist the development of high quality management reporting packs and enhance understanding, identify trends and resolve issues.
Support the analysis of financial performance, budgets, forecasts, forward estimates and other financial and performance metrics to provide input to the consolidated Delivery Management Budget for Sydney Metro.
Adapting to a dynamic work environment as it evolves and progresses through substantial change

About you

You are tertiary qualified in a Finance discipline from a recognised tertiary institution with demonstrated experience in finance programs (SAP), and be looking for an opportunity to utilise your finance experience and work in a team with a supportive culture to develop your career.
You have demonstrated experience in financial analysis and management reporting, with advanced computer literacy. Ideally, you are on the pathway of getting CA or CPA, you will have a can-do-attitude and have professional communication skills both written and verbal.

Bigger challenges. Bolder ideas. Global impact. At Viasat, we’re on a mission to deliver connections with the capacity to change the world. We’re the company behind the world’s fastest satellite internet service, with technology that’s helping to bridge the digital divide and improve life for our customers around the globe. By providing powerful new ways for people to connect with one another, gain greater access to education, entertainment, medical research, commerce, and much more, our team is empowering millions of customers worldwide.
We’re growing rapidly and looking for passionate, innovative professionals to join our team and connect the world to more. You’ll work in a collaborative and inclusive environment that values diverse perspectives and continuous learning. This position is based in our Sydney office.

Job Responsibilities

Viasat is seeking an experienced Logistics Analyst to support Viasat’s Australian logistics and fulfillment function. Your responsibilities will be diverse, but you will be empowered to use your initiative and skills in a variety of functions. As the Logistics Analyst you will liaise with internal departments, external customers and assist with the management of Viasat’s third party distribution (3PL) centers and transportation providers with end-to-end logistics processes that enable the movement of product throughout Viasat’s Global Supply Chain. This individual should have the ability to collect and analyze data to help improve the organization's supply chain activities, monitor inventory stock levels, and support the supply chain and local service and operation teams.

As a Logistics Analyst you will be responsible for managing inventory fulfillment, transportation management, and logistics process improvement opportunities. You will be expected to review import/export documentation, forwarding and invoicing instructions based upon the customer or partner profile to ensure that products are delivered in a timely manner, with proper documentation to the receiving party and in compliance with all governmental regulations. You will be analyzing strategic savings opportunities through system tools, evaluation of cost reduction opportunities, negotiations with brokers, international freight forwarders, transport companies and escalation management with our vendors and providers.

In addition, you will:
Coordinate and process PO’s
Maintain key reporting metrics and analysis
Solicit and prepare transportation quotes
Schedule freight moves leveraging established global 3PL networks
Prepare all necessary transportation documents required to process inventory moves and sales orders
Provide product movement updates to all internal and external parties as required
Ensures 3PL providers are executing all transportation moves in accordance with established service agreements
Collaborate with third party logistics providers, carriers, and freight brokers to maintain and continuously improve service levels and costs associated with third-party transportation
Support accounts payable department to reconcile freight invoices
Support the management team with their initiatives and special projects
Work closely with finance, program management, supply chain, compliance, and operations teams.
Actively support operational process controls through regular activity and training with the Viasat Compliance Team, Product Management, Logistics, Sales, Finance, Marketing and Legal to keep the company compliant with trade and distribution regulations.
Contribute to continuous improvement within the area of responsibility through data analysis and creation of metrics
Ability to both lead and act as a member of a team
Assist management and logistics managers in the development of procedures and processes which improve Viasat’s ability to meet product system and customer requirements
Communicate with peers and supervisors regularly, document work, meetings, and decisions
Analyze, maintain, and participate in the process for manage inventory control activities
Provide support in the evaluation of quotations received from third party partners to assure that all pertinent information is available; best price, and service
Participate in the development of new services and systems, continuously look for ways to improve workflow and ensure the supply chain systems are on a continuous path to improvement
Other job duties as assigned *

Requirements
Australian Citizenship
3+ years of experience in a logistics & distribution, Supply Chain Management, or related responsibility (i.e. Demand Planning, Supply Planning)
Fluent in English
Strategic thinker with strong analytical skills, and research skills.
Knowledge of import/export regulations and GST.
Proficiency in MS Office Suite
Strong organization, oral and written communication skills a must
Excellent follow up and customer service skills
Exercises judgment within generally defined practices and policies
Ability to work with little or no direction, can work independently and collaboratively as a team member to meet goals while maintaining an organized and systematic approach to task completion
Permanent position 100%

Preferences
Bachelors in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Procurement or related field
Excel, Oracle or a comparable ERP inventory management tool, and Transportation Management systems knowledge preferred
Knowledge of reporting and analytical tools, such as Alteryx Tableau and OBIEE
Knowledge of import/export regulations and GST a strong advantage.
Knowledge of Salesforce an advantage
High analytical aptitude capable of interpreting data to identify trends
Advanced excel skills a plus
Willing and able to travel domestically and internationally
