About Us
At Optus, we are striving to become Australia’s most loved everyday brand with lasting customer relationships and truly believe digital is one of the keys to unlocking our vision. When we consider how we interact with our customers, our vision is at the forefront of our thinking.

About the Team
The Analytics Team at Optus are leaders in driving value out of data. We enable stakeholders to make informed, data based decisions to build connections with our customers, deliver digitally engaging experiences, improve business processes and explore new innovation opportunities while maintaining the highest data privacy standards. It's our collaborative culture that’s focused on growth and development with an entrepreneurial spirit that makes us unique. We love helping data tell a story and unlocking the value of data to help make better decisions for our business and our customers. Every day presents a new opportunity to create rich insights, learn new skills and work across the organisation to do good things with data for our customers.

About the Role
As a key member of the Analytics leadership team, the Associate Director of Data Analytics leads the data insights generation business for Optus Consumer. You will own the Analytical Asset & Data Insights Roadmap, gathering input from business stakeholders, aligned to our business strategy with a specific focus on creativity, innovation and value. By working with our Analytics Community and stakeholders to improve data literacy across the organisation, you’ll drive the adoption and utilisation of data insights to help solve business problems and build strong connections with our customers.

More specifically your responsibilities will include:
Coordinating our strategic analytical investments and scaling insights/solutions across Optus
Building strong, trusted advisor relationships with all stakeholders to foster a collaborative and innovative culture moving from a traditionally transactional engagement model
Regularly updating ExCo Steering Committees to provide visibility of the impact that Analytics is having on achieving our vision and delivering on the strategy
Pragmatically developing analytical assets and data insights for business problems that appropriately balance insight richness/quality/timeliness/performance/value
Aligning the technology ecosystem, data environments, analytical methodologies & analytical assets to the Optus strategic roadmap
Working in an Agile environment, this role has Chapter lead responsibilities and accountability for a current team of 8 data insights experts
Ensuring team members have a growth oriented, proactive, innovative and entrepreneurial mindset
Ensuring chapter members have appropriate technical competencies/soft skills to perform their roles to a high standard, providing necessary coaching support and plan for future talent needs through enablers including the Analytics Community/OptusU
Maintaining an appropriate working knowledge of Optus products, lines of business and processes to ensure that any insights/solutions developed are contextually appropriate and valuable to the organisation
Negotiating with IT/vendors/third parties to ensure that appropriate technology enablers and data assets are available and leveraged effectively across Analytics

About You
We are looking for the following skills, experience and attributes:
Tertiary qualifications in a STEM or business discipline
Leadership experience in an Agile environments
Driving and embedding change across large organisations with multi-disciplinary teams
Advanced communication skills using different mediums and to a variety of audiences with varying levels of technical competency
Sound leadership, coaching and mentoring skills
Sound negotiation skills
Advanced time/project management skills
Visualisation tool vendor certification (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, etc)
Self-service data preparation tool vendor certification (e.g. Alteryx, etc)
Agile certification (e.g. SP, SSM, SA, POPM, etc)

Why Optus ?
We offer all kinds of benefits, such as:
Work collaboratively in an open agile environment
Discounts with over 400 companies Australia wide (Technology, Retail, Home, Fashion and more!)
Mobile & Internet discounts, Novated Car Leasing, and other Financial benefits
Training, Mentoring and further learning opportunities
Staff buses to and from campus at Epping & Wynyard train stations
Up to five days of Volunteer Leave per year

Blended Ways of Working
We understand that flexibility means different things to different people. We are proud to offer a variety of options to work in different ways, such as flexible hours, partial remote working, job share and part-time. Please talk to us about how we can make this role work for you. Our flexible hybrid remote model lets our people work across home and one of our offices across Australia. Optus is an inclusive, multigenerational workplace where people at different life and career stages can feel valued and supported. We recognise and appreciate that we're at varied phases in our work and our lives. That's why we do all we can to offer the flexibility needed to manage time and family commitment.

An exciting opportunity exists to join Macquarie’s newly formed Financial Crime Intelligence group as a Transaction Monitoring Analyst.
This represents a fantastic opportunity to grow your career and take your Financial Crime and industry knowledge to the next level.
In this diverse role, your focus will be to review daily alerts in relation to the Transaction Monitoring Program for various retail and institutional banking and finance products in compliance with Macquarie's Anti Money Laundering /Counter Terrorism Financing policy. You will assess customer transactions to identify and investigate any unusual patterns or behaviours. In the event you discover suspicious activity you will compile a case for review by the Anti Money Laundering Manager and assist with its submission to the regulator (AUSTRAC).
Your primary responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
The critical analysis of transaction and account alerts
Extracting, understanding and interpreting Transaction Monitoring data
Liaising with senior stakeholders to present findings
Carrying out customer screening and research
Compiling reports for regulatory organisations
Drafting alert disposition notes outlining lines of inquiry and actions taken
Maintaining records for correspondence received by law enforcement agencies
Using banking systems and software to pursue lines of inquiry in relation to customers, source of funds, beneficial owners and related parties
Identifying trends and themes for intelligence purposes ,if any
If you are an experienced analyst with an inquisitive mindset this will be the ideal role to showcase your skillset and be part of a fast paced, agile team. You will have the chance to expand your knowledge of the Financial Crime arena and liaise with a range of stakeholders.
To be successful in this role you will have:
Strong technical and analytical skills
Knowledge of Financial Crime processes and procedures, preferably in financial services
High attention to detail and a problem-solving mindset
Strong excel skills and financial services analytical (data) experience
Ability to multi-task priorities and manage deadlines
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
A high level of initiative and a commitment to delivering superior outcomes
If you are ready to take the next step in your career in Financial Crime within a team that values development, growth and inclusion, please submit an application online.
About Banking and Financial Services
Banking and Financial Services is Macquarie’s retail banking and financial services business, providing a diverse range of personal banking, wealth management, business banking and vehicle finance products and services to retail clients, advisers, brokers and business clients.
Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths, and in combination with our inclusive environment, it enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. From day one, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us, please apply. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways.
We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you, and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.

About Macquarie
A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.
Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups, disciplines, sectors and borders. With 16,000+ employees and offices in 32 markets around the world, we’re a truly global organisation.
You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives, ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us, you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.
Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.

Job no: BFS-959289
Work type: Permanent - Full time
Location: Sydney
Category: Mid-level, Data & Analytics, Risk Management, Other
Group: Banking and Financial Services
Division: BFS Central & Operations
Recruiter: Katrina Samuel
Opening Date: 10/8/2021

Join a movement in which everyone can win. We started a movement in which everyone can win – shoppers, retailers, society, and every person on our team. To play fair, trust people, and reward them for doing the right thing. We are obsessed with our product. We see and feel the impact of our work as more and more people gain financial freedom and retailers grow across the globe.

Afterpay is offered by more than 65,000 of the world’s best retailers and has more than 10 million active customers globally. Afterpay is offered by top fashion and beauty retailers across the globe - including eBay, The Iconic, Gap, Myer, Foot Locker, Adore Beauty, Mac Cosmetics, Kathmandu, and many others. We are currently available in Australia, New Zealand, the United States, Canada, and the United Kingdom, where the brand is called Clearpay.

The Opportunity
As Afterpay’s Risk Operations Analyst, you'll be a part of the Global Risk and Data team focusing on Merchant Risk. Using best practices, you will identify and mitigate all merchant issues we face. You will focus on SMB onboarding escalations for financial risk review to identify fraud, merchant fit, and the business model of merchant applications. You will also assist in the prevention, detection, reporting, and mitigation of high-risk merchant issues using a variety of tools, including Office, G Suite, Salesforce, Zendesk, and SQL.

We are much more than our job descriptions - we are our energy, our ideas, our everyday drive. Here’s where you will begin…

Reviewing merchant onboarding applications with high elevated risk from a financial risk perspective.
Preventing, detecting, investigating, reporting, and mitigating high-risk merchant account activity to minimize Afterpay’s exposure to merchant-related loss from fraud, credit, brand, and regulatory risks.
Communicating with your peers and cross-functional partners regarding risk trends, patterns, insights, and other high-risk merchant activity.
Communicating and consulting directly with merchants to mitigate issues as needed.
Challenging the status quo working collaboratively as well as independently on projects focused on improving internal methods, policies, and internal tools.
Prioritising and triaging workflow as daily demand requires.
Assisting with building and maintaining reports as needed or assigned.
Performing various risk-related duties as assigned.

Who are you?
Like us, you’ll be deeply committed to delivering positive outcomes for customers and passionate about shaping the future of Afterpay. You like to keep it real with your actions, be brave with your decisions, do the right thing for all our stakeholders, and shape the future with excitement.

Minimum 2 years of experience in transaction review in Risk operation (Financial Technology, Bank, Payments, and/or E-commerce experience preferred).
Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal, with strong capabilities to articulate extensive investigation results and action plans with the cross-functional team.
Self-starter, intellectually curious, and comfortable operating in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment.
Passionate problem solver and strategic thinker with strong analytical and creative problem-solving skills. Able innovatively work your way around roadblocks.
Comfortable with making complex decisions with potentially large financial implications.

Working for us
At Origin we have a strong purpose and values that challenge us to find the answers to the big energy questions. Every person that works with us helps us reach that goal. If you bring good energy to Origin, you’ll get it in return. A challenging career. An exciting industry. And the support to grow and explore your potential.

THE ROLE
This is a unique opportunity to join the financial risk team based in Sydney. The team builds and operates risk & analytics models covering various energy markets, primarily oil & LNG. Working within the Financial Risk Group you’ll be responsible for:
Running risk models
Managing data requirements for risk modelling to ensure timely and accurate data
Reconciling model inputs and outputs
Liaising with key stakeholders to develop and enhance risk reporting tools

IS THIS YOU?
You’ll need to be an excellent communicator, experienced in obtaining key inputs and assumptions by liaising with various teams. A proactive, analytical approach will be necessary in this role to then identify issues or areas for improvements in existing data/model methodologies. At least 2 years of professional experience in an analytical function, ideally risk management
Advanced Excel spreadsheet & VBA skills
Programming experience in one or more of Python, Matlab, SQL, Tableau
Understanding of risk models like VaR, options pricing & Monte Carlo simulation
An interest in financial markets generally is essential. Experience in energy markets is beneficial although not essential.

A great team to join
It's an exciting time to join Origin. Together we’re powering a cleaner, smarter energy future for Australia and beyond, always looking for better ways to deliver for our customers – and for our people.

Origin’s Future Energy and Business Development team is shaping tomorrow’s future energy innovations. We’re investing in new energy solutions; partnering with global start-ups and trialing new technology and business models. We’re driven to lead the transition into a low carbon, technology-enabled world which embraces a more decentralised and digital future.
That’s why we need passionate, curious and customer focused people, who are excited by the challenge of finding new ways of working, new ways of delivering and shaping a new energy future.

Origin. Good energy
At Origin, our focus is on getting energy right for our customers, communities, and planet. Because we know it’s up to us to shape the future of energy. Today, we serve more than 4.2 million customers, are one of the most significant energy producers in the country and listed in the ASX Top 50 companies.

Job Title: 2022 Mastercard Launch, Associate Analyst, Business Development & Digital
Job Description:
Our Purpose
We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.
Job Title
2022 Mastercard Launch, Associate Analyst, Business Development & Digital
Who is Mastercard?
We are the global technology company behind the world’s fastest payments processing network. We are a vehicle for commerce, a connection to financial systems for the previously excluded, a technology innovation lab, and the home of Priceless®. We ensure every employee has the opportunity to be a part of something bigger and to change lives. We believe as our company grows, so should you. We believe in connecting everyone to endless, priceless possibilities.

The Mastercard Launch program is aimed at early career talent, to help you develop skills and gain cross-functional work experience. Over a period of 18 months, Launch participants will be assigned to a business unit, learn and develop skills, and gain valuable on the job experience. Successful candidates will be assigned to a business unit within International Markets and rotate for a duration of 2 x 9 months each for a total of 18 months.

Role:
Work with the team to deliver targets for customer enrollment on Digital Solutions
Work on projects to gain awareness of Digital trends and product offerings.
Develop strong internal relationships within Mastercard to enable the customer to achieve their business goals and differentiate Mastercard from the competitors.
Work with account managers and country managers across the division.
Effectively work with the team to engage financial institutions, account managers and delivery team to support the successful launch of the solutions/services.

All about you:
Education:
Graduating seniors - Class of 2021
Students pursuing a Masters/bachelor’s degree (all majors welcome to apply)

Energetic and enterprising individual
Display high degree of initiative & agility

Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
Advanced Word, Excel and PowerPoint skills
Attention to detail
Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Languages:
English required

Every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security. Business Analyst Job Description

Review, analyze and evaluate business systems and user needs. Document requirements, define scope and objectives and formulate systems to parallel overall business strategies.
May require an associate's degree in a related area and 2-4 years of experience in the field or in a related area. Familiar with relational database concepts and client-server concepts. Rely on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals.
Responsibilities:
Determine operational objectives by studying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formats
Construct workflow charts and diagrams; studying system capabilities; writing specifications
Improve systems by studying current practices; designing modifications
Recommend controls by identifying problems; writing improved procedures
Define project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases and elements; forming project team; establishing project budget
Monitor project progress by tracking activity; resolving problems; publishing progress reports; recommending actions
Maintain user confidence and protect operations by keeping information confidential
Prepare technical reports by collecting, analyzing and summarizing information and trends
Contribute to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed
Validate resource requirements and develop cost estimate models
Conduct and coordinate financial, product, market, operational and related research to support strategic and business planning within the various departments and programs of the client group
Interpret, evaluate and interrelate research data and develop integrated business analyses and projections for incorporation into strategic decision-making
Plan and coordinate the development of primary and secondary market research studies in support of strategic planning and specific marketing initiatives, as required and presents findings of studies to client committees
Perform daily, weekly and monthly reviews and analyses of current processes using operational metrics and reports
Review a variety of areas including operations, purchasing, inventory, distribution and facilities
Understand and communicate the financial and operational impact of any changes
Suggest changes to senior management using analytics to support your recommendations. Actively participate in the implementation of approved changes
Create informative, actionable and repeatable reporting that highlights relevant business trends and opportunities for improvement
Conduct insightful, ad hoc analyses to investigate ongoing or one-time operational issues
Requirements:
Bachelor's Degree in appropriate field of study or equivalent work experience
Microsoft Access and/or SQL experience strongly preferred
Ability to impact operations and effect change without being confrontational
Detail oriented, analytical and inquisitive
Ability to work independently and with others
Extremely organized with strong time-management skills
Experience with SAP and Power BI

Software Design
Analysis
Teamwork
Software Maintenance
Process Improvement
Microsoft Access and/or SQL experience
Big Picture Thinking
Work Well Under Pressure
Communication
Problem Solving
Critical Thinking
Relationship Building

Excellent new opportunity within our Risk Management Group’s Operational Risk & Governance Division providing line 2 guidance and oversight of Corporate Operations Group’s Business Services, HR and Central Divisions. The role is both exciting and intellectually challenging, it will deepen your understanding of operational risk, and how risks are effectively managed. It offers you a unique opportunity to gain a deep understanding of the various risk disciplines and the controls to mitigate these.
You will work closely with senior business and risk management leaders across the group and help implement the Operational Risk Management Framework. You will review and evaluate new business and change initiatives; ensuring that key operational risks are identified and managed, along with challenging the scope and outcome of business risk reporting, targeted assessments, significant incidents, key risk indicators, projects, and assurance activities. You will also have the opportunity to share insights and learnings on the risk profile, trends, and material and emerging risks from across the Group and industry.
As you will sit within a broader Operational Risk team, you will have the opportunity to influence other enterprise operational risks and support effective oversight across a range of risk management frameworks. The role of Operational Risk in Macquarie is to form an independent view of Macquarie’s operational risk profile and effect change in operational risk management and culture across the Macquarie Group.
We’re looking for a risk analyst with experience in Operational Risk or complimentary discipline. You will demonstrate a solid working knowledge of implementing non-financial risk management frameworks, possess a strong commercial acumen and have an analytical mindset to make sound recommendations on operational risk issues.
You will effectively be able to build relationships and influence stakeholders locally and globally. Our risk management group are respected for their focus on collaboration, proactivity, seeking positive outcomes and diversity of thought.

If you are passionate about Risk Management, have strong attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high quality outcomes, then we want to hear from you!
About the Risk Management Group
The Risk Management Group (RMG) is an independent, centralised unit responsible for ensuring all risk across Macquarie are appropriately assessed and managed. Its divisions include Behavioural Risk, Compliance, Credit, Financial Crime Risk, Internal Audit, Market Risk, Operational Risk, Regulatory Affairs and Aggregate Risk, and RMG Enterprise Support.
Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths, and in combination with our inclusive environment, it enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. From day one, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us, please apply. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways.
We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you, and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.

About Macquarie
A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.
Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups, disciplines, sectors and borders. With 16,000+ employees and offices in 32 markets around the world, we’re a truly global organisation.
You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives, ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us, you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.
Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.

Evolving Transport

Transport for NSW is delivering an unprecedented $72.2b investment into a truly game changing Future Transport strategy. We are also evolving, bringing together new and existing transport modes, cutting edge technologies and getting smarter at how we do it. We are changing to deliver more connected journeys, greater satisfaction and safer transport for our customers, both now and for the future.

The Division

The Regional and Outer Metropolitan division is focused on understanding the particular needs of regional communities across NSW and delivering customer-centred integrated transport services and infrastructure.

The opportunity

We have a Permanent Full Time opportunity for a Data Analyst to join the Customer Service Experience and Planning branch within the Regional and Outer Metropolitan Division. This role support the collection, maintenance, analysis and presentation of transport performance and customer data to contribute to organisational decision-making for customer groups and support the development of the network to improve safety and customer outcomes.

This position accommodates remote and flexible work practices across NSW, with the opportunity for you to work out of your nearest Regional or Outer Metropolitan office.

What you will be involved in

The successful candidate will be responsible for preparing reports and presenting results and analysis in formats suitable for a range of audiences to inform and support decision-making. Additionally, this role will be accountable for;

Interpreting data and outcomes to highlight business problems, risks and opportunities;
Developing analytical models to estimate the impact of different scenarios to assist with the business decision making process;
Where assigned, leading the analytical activities for pricing revenue proposals, working with analysts within the team to understand business requirements, to deliver the necessary data and insights required to enable those requirements to be met;
Supporting the development of, and apply, local data governance guidelines and procedures to support compliance;
Monitor the ongoing health of local analytics systems and report any resource and data quality issues to support continuous business improvement.

About you

To be successful in this role, you will be someone who thrives in a fast paced, highly complex environment. You will have well-developed analytical, research and problem solving skills and a thorough understanding of statistical principles and their application as well as a desire to constantly develop yourself and a willingness to learn.
Attention to detail, initiative and a can do approach are essential. You will have demonstrated high level computer skills and must be highly proficient using Microsoft word, excel and PowerPoint. Tertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline or equivalent demonstrated experience is required.

It is essential that as an integral part of a customer focused part of the business you will model the behaviours aligned with excellent customer service in all aspects of your professional engagement.

This is an exciting opportunity to be a part of a growing Division that values regional NSW and strives towards excellent outcomes for regional communities!


Salary and Benefits

Transport Grade 6 ($92, 982 – $102, 280) + Super

Interested?

Joining Transport for NSW, you’ll have access to a range of unique government benefits in a flexible work environment like no other. If you’re ready to step into this meaningful and rewarding role, we want to hear from you!

To apply for this position, please submit a resume and answer all questions within the online application portal.

Close date: 11:59PM Friday 27 August 2021.

?We are the community we serve

We are committed to being an inclusive, diverse and flexible workplace where differences are valued. We welcome people of all backgrounds, experience and abilities.

We enable our people to work in ways that work for them and their teams. Working virtually and from different locations including regional locations, staggering work hours and job sharing are just some of the ways our people can work flexibly.

About the Team
The analytics team at mozo.com.au is responsible for providing our marketing, commercial and content teams with the data they need to monitor and manage our day-to-day operations, and for finding and presenting insights that deepen our understanding of our audience and our business. We are a very small team with a flat structure.
Job Purpose
As one of two Data Analysts in the team, you will share responsibility for various ad hoc and project analytics tasks while being the main analyst responsible for the maintenance and development of our data pipelines. With responsibility for the data quality,
engineering and development aspects of our business data, our decision-makers look to you for confidence in the numbers and in the delivery of the numbers, as well as looking to you to help add new elements to our analytics capabilities and ensure that all new projects take analytics and data considerations into account.
You manage and maintain our daily business intelligence data pipeline, ensuring we have processes and checks to limit the risk or error or downtime. You investigate issues that do arise and fix them, liaising with other analysts and developers as needed.
You work closely with business stakeholders and with the other members of the analytics team to develop new metrics and tools. This will include improving and extending Tableau dashboards, developing ways to track and analyse new metrics including on-site behaviours, metrics to support the rest of Future Australia, working with the Research team on product data ingestion, and other projects as they arise.
Key Responsibilities
Maintain our critical business intelligence data pipeline.
Undertake further evolution of the BI pipeline: to reduce maintenance efforts or reduce reliance on the IT team, to include new metrics or new lines of business, or to align with Future group reporting & analytics where it makes sense to do so.
Implement checks and procedures to ensure all business data is accurate and that data issues are resolved quickly.
Support the rest of the analytics team with ad hoc analysis and issue resolution.
Ensure that all new business projects take account of data needs, ensure that data definitions and data flows are documented, and play a role in project requirements and project testing to ensure that everything that needs to be tracked is tracked, controlled and surfaced.
Over time, help to evolve our analytics practices from being descriptive to being predictive & prescriptive, including helping to develop data science experiments and models.
Develop and manage other data pipelines as required by other parts of the business, eg product reference data ingestion.
Roll up your sleeves and tackle whatever comes your way.
Requirements
Essential skills & experience
Manipulation of large datasets
Exploratory data analysis
Designing appropriate data schemas
Documentation of data definitions, relationships and flows
Using SQL to extract and transform data
Using Python scripts to extract, transform and process data
Logical thinking
Self organisation
Excellent written & verbal communication skills
Preferred experience
Tableau dashboard preparation and maintenance
Google Cloud Platform
AWS
Benefits
What will I get in return?
As well as our standard benefits, we have a number of awesome perks available to our staff including:
A share in our success- every member of staff receives a profit pool bonus at the end of our financial year
Flexibility to work from home
Free digital magazine subscriptions and access to back copies of our print magazines and bookazines
Regular staff socials arranged by our wonderful Employee Community & Culture committees
Huge opportunities to learn and develop whether through professional qualifications, exposure to incredible business projects or informal lunch & learns, hosted by your colleagues
We are Future
Connectors. Creators. Experience Makers
Future is a global multi-platform media company and leading digital publisher, with scalable brands and diversified revenue streams. We are dedicated to connecting over 300 million people worldwide with their passions, through expert content, world-class events and cutting-edge proprietary technology. We have big ambitions to transform media and change people’s lives.
We have a market-leading portfolio of over 220 brands spanning across technology, gaming, TV & entertainment, women’s lifestyle, music, sport, creative and photography, home interest and B2B. You may have heard of us…
But a stellar heritage isn’t enough. We continue to grow our portfolio and launch new brands, restlessly looking to improve, innovate and push the boundaries of what can be done. We develop leading-edge technology which is disrupting the media marketplace.
Together, we’re exceeding the expectations of everyone we exist for – our audiences, clients, staff and shareholders. In a short space of time, Future has transformed into an innovative global media platform.
We reap the rewards too, of course, with a fun and creative place to work with endless opportunities to forge a career. We believe in teamwork that transcends location, so we don’t have a Future HQ but a globally connected workforce across the UK, US, Europe and Australia
Every kind of talent is celebrated here.. We hire for person not for the role, looking for people who share our ambitions to be bold and innovate, making Future a global success story.
Let’s do this!
To apply for this role, please submit your CV and a covering letter explaining why this is your dream job!
Inclusion & Diversity
At Future we are passionate about ensuring that as a business, we are continuing to promote diversity and inclusion not just in our recruitment processes, but everything we do.
Future is an equal opportunity employer and we will continue to ensure our recruitment process will be free of bias and our workplaces are inclusive, positive, free of discrimination and respects all backgrounds and beliefs. Our culture is underpinned by our values which will continue to ensure that all applicants, current and future employees are treated with respect and fairness.
We are continuing to be inclusive in our approach to flexible working, ensuring that we are making adjustments where required and providing our employees the tools and support to enable them to grow and flourish in their careers.

Company Name: NSW Department of Communities and Justice
Job Description:
Division: Information & Technology
Location: Sydney, NSW, AU, 2000
Req ID: 27739
Business Analyst, Information and Technology

Temporary opportunity (up to 12 months)
Sydney location
Clerk Grade 7/8

We are hiring a Business Analyst to analyse existing systems, applications and functions within NSW Trustee and Guardian to ensure strategic ICT objectives are met.

About Us

At NSW Trustee & Guardian, we protect, promote, and support the rights, dignity, choices and wishes of our customers. Whether we’re writing a Will, acting as an executor, attorney, trustee, guardian, or financial manager, we’re here for critical moments in our customers’ lives. Join our dedicated NSW Government agency and make a difference in the lives of over 45,000 people each year.

About the role

The Business Analyst reviews and analyses the organisation’s business intentions, services, processes and information needs to identify changes that lead to business improvements. The role also builds and maintains key relationships with users, technical staff and stakeholders to determine and resolve issues.

The Information Technology division is driving digital innovation and the way we interact with our customers through the development of digital products, IT support, cyber security and information management services.

In the role you will:

Translate business requirements into technical specification including data models and functionality of end user apps (e.g. Business Intelligence solutions)
Identify gaps in current availability of data to delivery solution and propose recommendations to address these including new definitions, metrics, dimensions or metadata
Work with different teams to identify future data needs to deliver target state or models as per customer needs
Conduct investigative work to identify appropriate and practical solutions which meet the needs of the business, align to enterprise standards, and ensure that the team can deliver outcomes
Ensure technical specifications communicate user requirements in technical terms for submission to development teams
Interpret and translate analysis results into quality technical specifications and or user stories that are insightful, clear and succinct
Develop a deep understanding of system functionality and design as well as target state outcomes to ensure that technical specifications are aligned, feasible, sustainable and scalable

This is a temporary role in accordance with the Government Sector Employment Act 2013 for a period of up to 12 months.

What we offer

As a NSW Government organisation we offer competitive benefits and opportunities to employees including:
Base Salary $97,443 - $107,864 plus employer’s contribution to superannuation and annual leave loading
Full-Time (35 hours per week)
Flexible and remote working arrangements considered subject to negotiation and operational requirements
Ongoing career development and support
Generous leave entitlements including flex leave
Health and wellbeing benefits including Fitness Passport

About you

You will bring excellent stakeholder engagement skills, ability to influence and quickly build relationships. A commitment to working collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders to influence business process improvement, support and monitor strategic delivery and promote organisational efficiency and effectiveness.

Essential requirements

Similar relevant experience in a business analyst role
Understanding of NSW government and NSWTG’s key services and client base.

For detailed information on the key accountabilities and capability framework please

Applying for the role

Only applications submitted online will be accepted for this role. To apply please click the ‘Apply Now’ button located on this page.

When applying you will need to:

Supply an updated copy of their resume (maximum 5 pages) and a brief cover letter (maximum 2 pages) that outlines your skills and experience relevant to the role and its capabilities.
Answer all pre-screening questions on the application form and provide answers to following targeted questions below:

Targeted question 1: Outline your experience gathering user requirements for ICT projects.
Targeted question 2: Describe your experience working with programmers, to develop solutions that align to technical requirements.

The above will be used to shortlist applicants for interview. For further information about how to address targeted questions please visit:
https://iworkfor.nsw.gov.au/writing-your-job-application#answer-targeted-questions

Contact: Jamien Broder, Senior Manager Development and Digital Products, by email on jamien.broder@tag.nsw.gov.au or by phone on 0419 804 913.

Closing Date: Friday, August 27th 2021 at 11:59 pm

For any recruitment enquiries please email: linda.tummarello@tag.nsw.gov.au.

A talent pool may be created for future ongoing and temporary roles and is valid for a period of up to 18 months in accordance with the Government Sector Employment Act 2013. Being placed on a talent pool is a great opportunity to be considered for roles throughout this period.

Appointments are subject to reference checks and may also require the following checks/clearances:
National Criminal History Record Check in accordance with the Disability Inclusion Act 2014

IMPORTANT: To ensure recruitment at the Department of Communities and Justice continues without interruption during the COVID-19 pandemic, some interviews and assessments may be performed using alternative methods.
This may include video interviewing, telephone interviewing and online assessments. If you are successful following review of your application, you may need to perform assessments and/or interviews via online platforms using a PC, laptop or smart phone. By doing so, we will be adhering to the strict social distancing advice currently in place.

You may be asked to complete a Health Declaration Form in later stages of the assessment process.

Great opportunity for an experienced Data Analyst to make a meaningful impact in a Royal Commission. The findings and recommendations of this report will create a lasting impact on the lives of Australians and will be highly progressive in achieving social justice. This is an Identified position and we would love to hear from Aboriginal/ Torres Strait Islanders or candidates who have strong experience working with First Nations’ people.

The role:
Provide timely, rigorous and accurate analysis of data, including large unit record datasets, in a form that is easily and quickly understood by its target audience
Build partnerships and collaborate with policy and legal teams across the Commission, to translate quantitative and qualitative data into a format and narrative that supports evidence-based policy
Report on publicly available data and data obtained via notice
In consultation with policy and legal teams, develop data-related content for hearings, issues papers, other external Commission documents and the final report
Demonstrate agility and resilience in response to changing demands. a high workload and tight timeframes
Contribute personal expertise to projects across the Commission – for example, expertise may include in the areas of aged care delivery, policy developed, legal, economics, data, health, management, workforce and medical
Undertake data and metadata acquisition, security, governance, curation, access, dissemination and interpretation
Duties:
Significant experience in data management and analysis to support business functions and policy outcomes.
Previous experience working with data/statistical software such as SAS and Excel to analyse large administrative and survey datasets.
Strong strategic thinking and communication skills
The ability to uphold and model the APS Values, Code of Conduct, Employment Principles and AGD Performance Expectations.


Please note this role is with a Federal Government client and applicants require Australian Citizenship.

Company Name: Partners in Performance Services Pty Ltd
Job Description:
Join our Innovative and Dynamic Global IT Team
Permanent Full-time
Flexible Working Between CBD Office and Home Location
Partners in Performance (PIP) is a global management consulting firm with its global Head Office located in Sydney CBD. We work hand-in-hand with our clients to deliver sustainable results in business performance. Our firm has real scale and a demonstrated track record with reach across Australia and New Zealand, South East Asia, Africa, North and South America, Europe and the Middle East.
ABOUT THE ROLE...
Reporting to the Senior IT Manager, this business critical role is primarily responsible for providing 3rd level application support and maintenance services, as well as delivering technical changes to PiP’s line of business applications such as Salesforce, OpenAir, NetSuite, Concur, UP Start, etc.
Key Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Provide 3rd level support and maintenance activities
Work with the IT Helpdesk team to troubleshoot issues and resolve defects
Document, design, testing and rollout of bespoke solutions based on business needs
Lead requirements gathering sessions
Manage development work with vendors and third-party providers
Ability to cite gaps or improvements with in-place applications
Adhere to PiPs Change and Release Management procedures at all times
Ensure a high level of customer service is provided to the end user
Proactively communicate with key stakeholders to understand requirements and priorities and manage their expectations accordingly with regular and timely updates
Ability to work solo on a project
Highly desirable skills:
Experience working in a ‘Software as a Service’ (SaaS) environment is a definite advantage
Experience working with Salesforce would be advantageous
Experience working on system interfaces and data mapping
ITIL Certification
ABOUT YOU...
As an experienced IT Business Systems Analyst, apart from your strong analytical and problem-solving skills, your other strengths include; excellent communications skills (both verbal and written), superior customer focus with the ability to build strong relationships across a wide audience both internally and externally.
Required Skills:
Between 3 to 6 years’ total prior experience in a similar role
Prior administering ERP systems (NetSuite or similar e.g. Oracle, SAP) involving system support, configuration and maintenance
Strong understanding of finance principals/processes (invoicing, expenses, payroll, GL, AP, AR etc.)
Demonstrated knowledge and experience in business process analysis and implementation of bespoke solutions
Proven experience supporting integration of ERP system with PSA system and/or other applications
General knowledge of programming languages i.e. JavaScript, XML
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; ability to work creatively in a problem-solving environment
University degree in relevant discipline (computer science) or related industry experience that demonstrates similar competencies
Ability to transform business requirements into functional requirements
Excellent customer service skills; ability to form relationships both externally and internally
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Join Us
Partners in Performance is passionate and committed to attracting, developing and retaining highly talented people and supports a rewarding and values-driven culture. In this role, you will have challenging work that will really make a difference to your stakeholders across a variety of areas. If you are interested in being part of a global, high-performing, cohesive IT team and are committed to outstanding performance, then we look forward to hearing from you.

Who we are: Fueled by a fundamental belief that having access to financial services creates opportunity, PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL) is committed to democratizing financial services and empowering people and businesses to join and thrive in the global economy. Our open digital payments platform gives PayPal’s 392 million active account holders the confidence to connect and transact in new and powerful ways, whether they are online, on a mobile device, in an app, or in person. Through a combination of technological innovation and strategic partnerships, PayPal creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility when sending payments, paying or getting paid. Available in more than 200 markets around the world, the PayPal platform, including Braintree, Venmo and Xoom enables consumers and merchants to receive money in more than 100 currencies, withdraw funds in 56 currencies and hold balances in their PayPal accounts in 25 currencies.
Job Description Summary: Delivering on the regulatory requirements for PayPal Australia Pty Ltd, this position is responsible for supporting and providing analytics across the second line oversight of the Risk and Compliance Management Program in Australia, driving a data-driven approach that meets both the PayPal global framework and all local regulatory requirements.
Job Description:
Job Responsibilities:
Supporting business partners in the development of controls for reviewing new products and features and other business initiatives.
Assist in conducting assessments of applicability and impact of new and/or changes to Austalian regulations and regulatory guidance.
Support the business in the implementation of regulatory change management initiatives.
Provide support for local regulatory interactions, examinations and adhoc requests.
Assist in execution of risk assessments and provide effective challenge to the first line of defence.
Provide ongoing support of issue management and remediation efforts.
Assist with the development of policies, procedures and/or guidelines.
Assist with the preparation of periodic reports summarizing the business units’ risk and control environment for senior management, committee and Board meetings.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams; strive to deliver exceptional and responsive service by providing risk and compliance management expertise in a clear, solution oriented and customer-focused manner.
Assist with the support maintenance of risks in line with risk taxonomy, framework and assessment process.
Assist with the analysis of prioritization of risk mitigation.
Escalate timely and actionable information to key stakeholders.
Qualifications/ Education/Experience/Skills:
Strong knowledge of global financial institutions, money service business, and/or banking compliance, including significant knowledge of anti-money laundering, data protection, anti-corruption/Foreign Corrupt Practices Act, and consumer protection regulations.
5+ years of experience in a large organization including demonstrated experience in building risk and compliance frameworks.
Experience with regulators and the regulatory exam process, ideally for non-bank financial institutionss.
Law degree preferred.
Ability to navigate across multiple geographies, including global shared services functions that reside outside Singapore.
Ability to communicate complex matters in a simple and clear manner.
Has a keen eye for detail and can provide insights through analytics of data.
Ability to take ownership of outcomes and the ability to work with business unit teams to confront issues and drive performance.
Strong problem solving and operational process skills and attention to detail.
Excellent ability to analyze regulatory risks in complex business processes, and recommend controls to mitigate those risks.
Excellent presentation skills with the ability to successfully work multiple issues at one time.
High energy and creativity, an entrepreneurial spirit and the desire to work in a growing and changing environment.
Ability to work within a matrixed environment, and cross functionally with operations and technology functions.
Ability to operate with strong integrity with the ability to handle projects of a sensitive and confidential nature.
Strong computer knowledge; excellent MS Word, Excel, Visio, and PowerPoint skills.
Behaviours:
Partnership – organisational awareness, engages widely with peers and seniors across PayPal.
Innovate – leads effectively in a dynamic, fast-changing environment; challenges convention.
Deliver Stand out Results – develops decisive strategies that deliver tangible results.
Execution – focuses the business area on strategic priorities; operates clear, simple systems.
Enable and Grow Talent – builds capability and a succession pipeline.
Leadership – contributes to the business leadership agenda; sets business area vision.
What we offer?
Be a part of a dynamic entrepreneurial team shaping the payments landscape in APAC.
Concrete experience with strategic thinking and on-the-ground drive and execution.
Future career opportunities with international exposure via PayPal’s network of global locations.
A supportive environment that allows our employees to thrive and learn.
Interested?
From the moment that you join our team we aspire to make your employment experience an outstanding and engaging one. We are passionate and proud of our company. It is this vigor and attitude that helps us execute well, every day. If you are enthusiastic and thrive in a collaborative and friendly environment then we invite you to learn more, explore opportunities, and discover a place for you.
We're a purpose-driven company whose beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We hold ourselves to our One Team Behaviors which demand that we hold the highest ethical standards, to empower an open and diverse workplace, and strive to treat everyone who is touched by our business with dignity and respect. Our employees challenge the status quo, ask questions, and find solutions. We want to break down barriers to financial empowerment. Join us as we change the way the world defines financial freedom.

Unit Pricing Analyst

Great team environment
Invaluable on the job learning supported by skilled professionals
Opportunity to lead initiatives

About the Division

The Unit Pricing Team resides in the Investment Control function and plays a strategic role in enabling the execution of product, investment and client initiatives on behalf of the NM Super - Super Directions Fund. The team is a key control function and enabler for the Product and Investment Divisions and has responsibility across the breadth of investment operations activities including Unit Pricing, Transition Management, Vendor Management and Governance and Oversight.

About the Role

Reporting to the Unit Pricing Manager, the purpose of this role is to provide support to the end to end investment management process including unit pricing and leading organisational initiatives involving Investment Control.

This will entail performing a series of checks on the unit prices, which are calculated by BNP. The role also provides a key support function for projects and transitions within AMP by providing technical subject matter expertise on investment management processes. In addition, the role will incorporate a focus on key enterprise projects and transitions, continuous improvement initiatives, exploring and implementing efficiency gains and enhancing the member experience.

The successful candidate will need to demonstrate an aptitude for clear, logical thinking and excellent numerical, reconciliation and analytical skills. They will have strong technical unit pricing expertise and have the ability to build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders.

More specifically your responsibilities will be:
Reviewing the accuracy of unit prices provided by BNP
Verifying reasonableness of product cash flows processed by AMP each day
Understanding of tax, fees, spreads, benchmarks and other standing data that could potentially impact unit prices
Data interpretation and analysis
Reporting and analysis for other functions within AMP on a timely basis
Process and control design/improvement and implementation
Providing technical unit pricing expertise to support AMP projects and transitions

What we look for in you:
Degree - Accounting/ Commerce/ Finance
Financial Services industry experience (ideally 7+ years)
Superannuation fund or Investment Management operations end-to-end experience (ideally 7+ years)
Custodian experience (either working at or with a back office outsource provider)
Advanced Excel

To be successful in this role you will need to demonstrate an aptitude for clear, logical thinking and excellent numerical, reconciliation and analytical skills. You will be an excellent communicator with the ability to build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders. You will have strong technical unit pricing expertise and will be proactive and enjoy leading and delivering initiatives that add value to the business.

You will be a team player and take pride in the quality of your work and are able to deliver within tight timeframes and with competing priorities.

Wellbeing & Benefits
As a company that values wellbeing, we offer a range of great benefits to support you financially, professionally and personally. These include access to a wide range of flexible working options including the ability to purchase extra leave, retail discounts, onsite wellbeing centre including a gym (Sydney Office), Employee Assistance Program, competitive home loan rates, leading superannuation contribution, discounted financial advice and personal insurance.

Inclusion & Diversity
AMP recognises individual differences and welcomes people from a variety of life and work experiences. The diversity of our people is core to our ability to innovate, grow and to fulfil our collective aspiration of helping people to own their tomorrow. A natural curiosity, a respect for differences and a growth mindset are valued at AMP.

Message to recruitment agencies and search firms
AMP does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruitment agencies and search firms. Please do not email or send unsolicited resumes to any AMP employee, location or address. AMP is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Join an award-winning transport and tourism company

Transit Systems is looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst with strong analytical, attention to detail, and problem-solving skills with a robust financial background.

Looking for an exciting new work environment?
We encourage you to apply!

About Us

Transit Systems is Australia's largest private operator of metropolitan public bus services, completing more than 285 million customer journeys per year. Transit Systems has built a reputation for its ability to collaborate with Government and improve public transport solutions for customers.
Transit Systems is a subsidiary of Sea Link Travel Group, Australia's largest tourism and marine transport company. Carrying more than 285 million passengers a year in different locations around the world, our Group has over 8,840 employees operating more than 3,500 buses and 114 ferries in New South Wales, Victoria, Queensland, South Australia, Tasmania, the Northern Territory, Western Australia, London and Singapore.
For more information about Transit Systems, please visit our website. http://www.transitsystems.com.au
About the Role

Reporting to the General Manager Fleet, Innovation & Business Intelligence, you will be responsible for driving business improvement and enabling key decision makers by developing, maintaining & presenting accurate financial business intelligence models and reports to both internal & external stakeholders.
You will also be required to work collaboratively with our Business Development team in preparing bids, financial reviews and other due diligence for new business opportunities.
About You
The successful candidate will have the following skills and experience:
A strong understanding of financial modelling that enables senior executives to make data-based decisions.
Strong analytical, problem-solving skills, and a willingness to work with others to find solutions that deliver improved business outcomes.
High-level reporting and presentation skills and meticulous attention to detail.
Sound knowledge of corporate finance and financial reporting.
Experience in preparing financial models for tender bids.
Ability to work effectively to deadlines and support others to meet tight deadlines.
Track record working in small, fast paced project teams.
Performing cost-benefit analysis on BAU and other projects aimed to optimise the performance of the organisation
Collaborating with management and co-workers to drive improvements
Assessing the efficacy of adopted strategies
Consulting with relevant stakeholders and management to map strategic goals and pathways to ensure success
Conducting interactive presentations and preparing reports for effective communication of data and intelligence to a diverse audience
Qualifications
You will hold a relevant tertiary qualification in finance, business, data science, or equivalent.
Minimum 3 years’ experience in a similar role with tertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline
Advanced Tableau, PowerBI skills or a similar business intelligence tool
Intermediate SQL skills including SQL Server Reporting Services
Advanced Excel skills
CPA/CA/CFA qualification will be advantageous
Experience in the Bus Industry will also be advantageous

To be considered, you must be entitled to work in Australia and be prepared to undertake pre-employment checks including a criminal history check and medical assessment.

We are requesting your resume and a cover letter explaining why you are the best person for this position.

Please fill in as much information as you can in track record section of the application and pay close attention to the questions.

Applications close on 3 September 2021

SeaLink Travel Group is committed to achieving a diverse workforce and encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

Job Title: Media Research Analyst, Strategic Communications, Sydney
Job Description:
About the Role

We're looking for an enthusiastic self-starter to join our team to provide media analysis and research reports to our clients and internal teams.

As a Media Research Analyst, you'll be responsible for compiling daily media coverage reports and for other research tasks as required. The internal title will be As Needed Research Analyst.

You'll be joining a leading Strategic Communications team working with high-profile clients from many different industries. We provide our clients with a suite of services, including financial communications, corporate reputation, transaction communications, and public affairs in all the major markets around the world.

We've advised Boards and governing councils of industry representatives and not for profit organisations on strategies to strengthen and improve their communications capabilities and have acted as trusted advisors to high profile business and community leaders at critical times in their careers.

What You'll Do

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:
Media monitoring and identifying trends in the media
Creating and curating media lists
Conducting research and creating report papers
Demonstrates a high level of integrity and asks the necessary questions to manage firm and client data responsibly.
Understands FTI's values, Code of Ethics and the Strategic Communications Rules of Practice and demonstrates a strong commitment to applying these concepts in daily interactions with colleagues and clients. (Additional information about FTI's values, Code of Ethics and the Strategic Communications Rules of Practice can be accessed here .)


Qualifications & Experience

This is a casual position - approximately three hours each weekday, with an early start - and may suit a final year University student or someone looking for flexibility in their career.

We want to hear from candidates who are motivated to learn and are not afraid to ask questions. To be successful, you'll need:


A strong interest in news and current affairs
The ability to work in a fast-paced environment to tight deadlines
An eye for detail, backed by solid research and analytical skills
Efficient communication skills, verbally or in writing
A strong work ethic and an ability to be a self-starter

Our Benefits

Apart from the well-structured career path and collaborative team environment, our employees enjoy a variety of perks and benefits. Our benefits include, but are not limited to:
Attractive remuneration
Medical insurance program (corporate membership) for individual and dependent(s)
Employee Assistance Program ("EAP") - free to all employees and their immediate families


About FTI Consulting

What makes us unique? With more than 6,250 employees located in offices in every corner of the globe, we are the firm our clients call when their most important issues are at stake. Regardless of what level you are, you will have the opportunity to work alongside and learn from top experts in your field on high-profile engagements that impact history. Our culture is collaborative, and we value diversity, recognition, development and making a difference in our communities.

FTI Consulting is publicly traded on the New York Stock Exchange and has been recognised as a Best Firm to Work For by C onsulting magazine and one of America's Best Management Consulting Firms by Forbes . For more information, visit www.fticonsulting.com .

FTI Consulting is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, protected veteran status, religion, physical or mental disability, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, or any other basis protected by law, ordinance, or regulation.

#LI-MŚ1

Job Title: Senior Analyst, Risk Governance and Insights team, Sydney
Job Description:
This is a great opportunity for a Senior Analyst to become part of our Risk Governance and Insights team in Sydney. The team forms part of the Operational Risk & Governance Division, within our Risk Management Group and has responsibility for group-wide and entity risk governance and risk reporting and insights.
You will play a lead role in preparing insightful Group-wide operational risk reporting for senior management and Board, covering the effectiveness of Macquarie’s Operational Risk Management Framework and detailing the risk profile of the Group. Your work will link into strategic change initiatives across our risk management framework, providing you with an opportunity to build networks with risk professionals within our Risk Management Group and across our Operating and Central Service Groups.
To be successful in this role, you will have excellent analytical and technical skills and enjoy working with unstructured data in a fast paced, change-orientated environment. You’ll be a confident communicator, tenacious and agile with a proven ability to sustain high levels of performance in a dynamic environment.
If you are looking for a new and exciting challenge, we would love to hear from you!

About the Risk Management Group
The Risk Management Group (RMG) is an independent, centralised unit responsible for ensuring all risk across Macquarie are appropriately assessed and managed. Its divisions include Behavioural Risk, Compliance, Credit, Financial Crime Risk, Internal Audit, Market Risk, Operational Risk and Governance, Regulatory Affairs and Aggregate Risk, and RMG Enterprise Support.
Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths, and in combination with our inclusive environment, it enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. From day one, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us, please apply. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways.
We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you, and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.

About Macquarie
A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.
Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups, disciplines, sectors and borders. With 16,000+ employees and offices in 32 markets around the world, we’re a truly global organisation.
You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives, ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us, you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.
Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.
