Cbus is looking for a talented senior analyst who will be responsible for shaping and implementing Cbus’ Stewardship activities to join our award winning Responsible Investment team. The position will work closely with the Head of Stewardship and Policy to improve ESG practices among investee companies, as one tool to protect and enhance long term value creation for our members.

The candidate will be tertiary qualified, ideally with solid company engagement and / or voting experience, or equivalent. You will have well developed communication, collaboration, influencing, analytical and research skills, be well organised, exhibit an ability to meet deadlines and prioritise, and have a positive attitude and growth mindset. The key focus of the role is to develop, implement, communicate and continuously innovate our strategic approach to voting and engagement program. The role offers career path and development opportunities.

Key tasks will include:
Assisting the Head of Stewardship and Policy in analysing and developing the strategy for voting and engagement
Managing AGM & EGM voting and drive improvements in consultation with relevant equities teams
Supporting and taking an active role in direct engagements with listed companies
Representing Cbus, leading and actively supporting collaborative engagements
Undertaking data analysis to support monitoring and reporting to internal and external stakeholders
Managing and driving improvements in reporting progress and the effectiveness of engagement and voting strategies – including, regular, monthly and annual reporting to the Board, Investment Committee and externally
Assisting the Head of Stewardship and Policy with member queries and media responses as required
Experience in stewardship or a relevant responsible investment role is required.

Why Cbus?
You can be part of an award-winning organisation that is genuinely committed to delivering workplace diversity, inclusion and flexible working arrangements as an enabler of our purpose - to act in the best interest of our members and maximise their retirement outcomes.

Like to know more about working with Cbus? Listen to some of our videos with members of the Cbus team on our website. You will also be able to download the full position description from our website - www.cbussuper.com.au/about-us/careers.

About Cbus
Cbus is one of Australia’s largest industry superannuation funds and the national industry fund for the construction, building, infrastructure and allied industries. Established in 1984, Cbus provides superannuation benefits to over 775,000 members, has assets over $65 billion, and accepts contributions from more than 170,000 employers.

Applications Close: cob 25 August
Please note that this is a full time role based in Melbourne or Sydney.

Agencies, please note: All Cbus vacancies are managed by our internal Talent Acquisition Team. Should external assistance be required we will only reach out to our preferred agency partners, Thank you.Join a recognised leader in Responsible Investment/ESG, Key position shaping, leading and implementing RI strategy, Growing Investment Team - Lots of Career Development (Melb/Syd)

About the Company:
One of Australia's leading financial services organisations are looking to hire an intelligent, talented and personable professional within their Analytics and Data team. Boasting state of the art offices in Sydney, our client is increasingly transforming into a data centric leader within the financial services area. This role requires a enthusiastic and young individual who thrives on the ability to have end to end control. You will receive guidance and active career encouragement in your day to day role as well as the opportunity to work with a contemporary data warehouse. Your role will be to work as an active member in a dynamic team environment where you will receive a myriad of attractive benefits.
The ideal candidate will:
Have the ability to target customers and convert this into customer selection rules
Make insightful recommendations on marketing volumes and marketing strategy though and data insights
Have a high level of skill in SQL and R or Python to perform detailed analysis
Actively look for room to improve in the areas of standardisation, automation or simplicity.
Possess strong statistical experience. This is essential!
Required Skills:
Experience in working with large scale data sets
Advanced knowledge of SQL
Ideally 3-5+ years commercial experience
Degree heavily focused on Statistics
To be part of one of Australia's most recognised companies and to work in a fast paced, dynamic, fun and friendly environment - with ambitious plans. Please apply immediately with an up to date CV.
Recruiter: Leon Young
Email: lyoung@morganmckinley.com
Please note only candidates who are currently in Australia will be considered.

Position Title: Performance and Optimisation Analyst
Reports to Performance and Optimisation Manager Location Surry Hills- Sydney
Why does my role exists to: Drive analytical solutions to collaboratively support the Woolworths teams across BAU, project and adhoc insights projects.
What am I accountable to deliver? How will I be measured?
Lead the strategy, design and testing of analytics implementations. Transform analytical output into actionable insights, build clients materials, and engage clients throughout the process (scoping to delivery) Respond to ad-hoc analytical requests from internal stakeholders Ensuring quality control and oversight of reporting outputs. Responsible for providing deep dive campaign insights to increase incremental sales and optimise campaigns. Working with marketing teams to create a strategy to improve targeting of BTL campaigns and increasing their return per contact by doing deep dive into campaign performances.
Manage the pipeline of work requests to ensure delivery within agreed timeframes Deliver reports and insights in a timely manner. Respond to ad-hoc analytical requests from internal stakeholders Internal satisfaction benchmark for key stakeholders/reporting audiences. 80% of internal clients are satisfied/very satisfied with the service and results delivered Achieve Program Analytics & Reporting KPIs Represent information in a format designed to make explicit the value in the data, in an easily understandable and meaningful way for the business
Who do I need to work with? Internal Data Science team Program Analytics and Reporting Team Campaign Execution Team BTL Marketing Team Solutions Team Squad members & Chapter leads Other internal stakeholders
What knowledge and experiential requirements do I need to be successful?
Knowledge
5+ years of experience working as a data analyst or data engineer. Experience in retail and/or marketing is preferred. A degree in a quantitative area e.g. Actuarial, Maths / Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Physics etc is preferred. Ability to maximise the value derived from data by presenting it in a format that is easily understood by the business Highly skilled in writing complex SQL constructs. Experience in SQL performance tuning

Knowledgeable and experienced in using SQL, Python, Google Suite (Sheets, Slides), Excel, PowerPoint, Tableau, GCP. Experience in working in complex, multi-stakeholder environments. Experience in leading and mentoring junior analysts. Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise, analyse and disseminate significant amounts of data
What are the key competencies for the role?
Role
Excellent written and verbal communication. Strong negotiation and influencing skills. Lateral thinker and present with excellent interpersonal attributes. Works well under pressure to deliver results whilst maintaining values. A self-starter. Able to work with minimal supervision. Able to articulate ideas and deliver in a way that is clearly understood and achieves outcomes. Financial acumen and ability to analyse information, identify trends and prioritise issues, then make effective decisions. Strong ability to solve problems and produce consistently excellent results. Attention to detail. Ability to identify and fix gaps in the data. Innovative and not content with the status quo. Always looking for ways to simplify processes and automate. Ability to manage internal and external stakeholder relationships. Ability to confidently provide business improvements.
Leadership
Innovative, strategic thinker, customer focused, able to deal with ambiguity, self-motivated. Highly collaborative with a range of stakeholders to deliver business outcomes. Articulates vision and set appropriate goals Responsive to team/group needs Sound interpersonal skills to work hand in hand with internal teams and stakeholders Manages time, prioritises and delegates effectively Cost and results focused.

The Trade Desk is a global technology company with a mission to create a better, more open Internet for everyone through principled, intelligent advertising.
Handling over 600 billion queries per day (more than 100X the query volume of search globally), our platform operates at unprecedented scale. We have also built something even stronger and more valuable: an award-winning culture based on trust, empathy, collaboration, and ownership. By working together across typical dividing lines, we are better as a team than any of us could be apart.
Do you have a passion for solving hard problems at scale? Are you eager to join a trust-based, globally-connected team, where your contributions will make a meaningful difference?
Come and see why Fortune Magazine consistently ranks The Trade Desk among best small-medium sized workplaces globally.
The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst is a key contributor and subject matter expert on the Business Intelligence team, driving a culture of data-driven decision making within our Marketing, Operations, Finance and Sales Teams . This role requires working cross-functionally to understand evolving business needs and requirements. Will be responsible for designing and developing reporting capabilities, presentations, and models to guide the strategic decision making of stakeholders. They also use advanced analytics techniques to guide business decisions and proactively identify opportunities and threats.
What you’ll do:
Surface insights from multiple data sources to support complex operational analysis. Execute and/or coordinate critical analytics initiatives providing an interpretation of findings and the implications to The Trade Desk
Provide analysis of key performance indicators (KPIs) across business areas, regions, and offices. Develop key relationships across regions and offices to determine actionable insights for leadership
Proactively seek and frame opportunities and identify business risks for The Trade Desk
Develop solutions that proactively improve operational efficiency for stakeholders
Act as a consulting resource for data architecture and data model creation across the enterprise
Design, develop, populate, and maintain forecast models, ranging from global revenue to specific region and product KPIs
Collaborate with Finance and Sales to share information for forecasts and ensures all forecasts are completed with the highest level of diligence and precision.
Participate in, and lead cross-functional teams whose members include Marketing, Sales, Operations, Product, Technology, People Analytics, and Finance
Perform other duties as assigned
Who you are:
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (Economics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, etc.) or equivalent experience
8 - 12 years of analytical experience in Revenue, Sales, Operations, or Business Analytics
Must have experience with Microsoft Excel (expert level) and ability to create PPT presentations conveying compelling data-driven stories
Excellent critical thinking skills and proven track record with presenting quantitative information to stakeholders at all levels of an organization
4 - 6 years' experience in one or more programming languages, such as SQL/R/Python
Experience with business intelligence (BI) tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
Experience integrating data across disparate sources and platforms
Forecasting and Market Research experience preferred
Experience with ETL frameworks (SSIS, Informatica, etc.) a plus
Able to successfully handle multiple competing priorities. Innovative, and outcomes obsessed
Ability to present clearly and concisely to a diverse group of business and clinical stakeholders
Ability to work in rapidly growing environment, with excellent attention to detail, multitasking and organizational skills
Ability to build consensus across cross-functional and across geographic teams
Must possess a 'can-do' attitude with the ability to work well with all levels of internal management and staff
Ability to convey technical topics to non-technical audiences
Ability to handle high levels of pressure and apply critical decision making with constantly shifting priorities
Ability to work independently and with a team on simultaneous tasks in a fast-paced environment with emphasis on accuracy and timeliness
Ability to understand complicated problems and supply concise and relevant answers
#LI-SW1
The Trade Desk does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firm recruiters. Fees will not be paid in the event a candidate submitted by a recruiter without an agreement in place is hired; such resumes will be deemed the sole property of The Trade Desk. The Trade Desk is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

Job Title: Underwriting and Risk Analyst, Australia Branch
Job Description:
Posted date 13 August 2021
LocationSydney, New South Wales
Job Type Permanent
Industry Reinsurance
Contact NameJohn Killick
Contact Email john@sklactuarial.com.au
THE COMPANY
RenaissanceRe Holdings Ltd, through its operating subsidiaries, is a leading global provider of reinsurance and insurance products.
What RenRe does: Non-Life Reinsurance Underwriting of all lines of insurance risk in the Australia Pacific region including pricing, model assessment and client responsibility for those contracts.RenRe like to provide thoughtful insight into the delivery of their products.
The RenRe team shares a passion for providing exceptional service, innovation, creativity and a strong belief in the entrepreneurial culture which is a cornerstone of their competitive advantage.
This is backed by robust analytics and strong financials.
THE OPPORTUNITY
Reporting to the Senior Underwriter in the Sydney Branch, this is a wonderful opportunity for the successful candidate to build an exciting career in risk analytics and/or underwriting.
The candidate will benefit from strong support and guidance from a motivated team that is vested in your success.
Opportunities exist to get involved in different lines of reinsurance business and build strong and lasting client/broker relationships.
Domestic and international travel is an exciting element of this position.
POSITION SUMMARY
Integral to the underwriting process, you will initially support and over time be responsible for the analysis and underwriting recommendations of assumed risks, systems, and model development, analysis and support, and resource for new product development and portfolio analytics across all lines of the portfolio being Property, Casualty and Specialty.
Excellent analytical skills, proficient knowledge of statistics and computing skills are essential.
EXPECTED SKILLS/KNOWLEDGE/EXPERIENCE
Developing an understanding or basic knowledge of risk fundamentals and metrics such as expected loss, exceedance probability, VaR, TVaR etc.
Proficient in Microsoft Excel and knowledge of other statistical or GIS software is beneficial
BSc in Natural Sciences, Mathematics, Actuarial Studies, Physics, Computer Science or Engineering discipline is strongly preferred.
Computer programming skills such as SQL, Python, R preferred.
Some insurance/reinsurance experience is beneficial including basic understanding of insurance/reinsurance structures and financial terms and conditions. Familiarity with industry leading risk modelling software is preferred.
Excellent written, verbal communication and interpersonal skills are essential.
TO APPLY
Send your current CV and a Cover Letter explaining how you meet the requirements of this exciting role to john@sklactuarial.com.au.
By reply, you will receive a more detailed overview of the role including Principal Accountabilities in Analytics and Underwriting.
Visit www.renre.comto find out more about this leading Global Reinsurer.
Any direct applications will be forwarded onto SKL to be included with all applications.

Job no: 498094
Work type: permanent full time
Location: Sydney
Categories: Information Technology
BI Developer / DBA
Are Media is the home of Australian magazines. Our extensive portfolio includes some of the country’s longest-running and most-loved brands, and boasts magazines, websites, videos, social, review sites, podcasts and experiences. This includes Australian Women’s Weekly, New Idea, Marie Claire, Gourmet Traveller, House & Garden, Wheels and many more.
About the role
We are looking for a BI Developer/DBA to help the Development Team maintain and further develop areas such as database administration, ETL, operational reporting, and business intelligence.
The Development Team is responsible for delivering and maintaining internal business applications, data warehouse solutions and integration with vendor supplied systems.
There will be different challenges: some operational, which include administration, performance tuning, troubleshooting; and some project-related, which covers design and development.
Skills and experience
You should:
Be passionate. We love delivering great solutions, and we hope you do too.
Have at least 5 years' commercial experience administering and performance tuning SQL Server databases.
Be proficient building ETL processes using SQL Server SSIS.
Have experience designing and implementing reporting & business intelligence solutions using SSAS tabular models, DAX and Power BI.
Have good communication and documentation skills.
Experience with cloud-based database services such as AWS RDS will be highly regarded.
The successful candidate will deliver solutions and 3rd level support according to standards covering technology, methodology, and processes as well as meeting requirements defined by the business stakeholders.
Why Are Media?
Join a values-based organisation built on respecting all, inspiring creativity and collaboration with others. Excellent employee benefits package including: discounted gym and swimming pool rates at Park Street CBD; regular beauty perks; discounts at cafes, restaurants and retail stores; as well as access to Are Media’s learning and development offerings.
Are Media is committed to a diverse, respectful collaborative and inclusive workplace. We know and value the success this brings for everyone; we welcome and encourage applications from diverse backgrounds.
Please and send your CV via the link.

The role
We currently have an outstanding opportunity for a Senior Business Analyst to join our Business Systems team. Reporting to the Delivery Lead or Senior Lead Business Analyst, and as a member of the Delivery Team, you will be responsible for providing business analysis and support expertise to the IOOF Group.

Key responsibilities
Engage with the business to understand project priorities.
Facilitate workshops to understand the business goals and epic / story level detail.
Write stories that can be turned into code and tests by our project teams.
Provide support to developers and testers within the team.
Define and refine our business analysis processes.
Develop and maintain domain expertise.
Support the risk identification and planning activities.
Support the Product Owner to translate the solution for business readiness.

To be successful in this role you will possess
Proven experience as Business Analyst in an IT or business focused domain.
Excellent analytical skills for both business and technology solutions to enable the development of business process and/or technical solutions, including documentation of business problems in a clear concise manner.
Extensive stakeholder management experience; with the ability to build relationships, including experience working with diverse groups of professionals/experts to deliver measurable results, preferably in a high profile, full-service financial service environment.
Highly developed skills in guiding, influencing and developing relationships with a diverse client and stakeholder base; in delivering results through others.
High attention to detail and accuracy, continuous improvement orientation.
Business process mapping, re-engineering and service orientation, including system functional / non-functional analysis and business case or feasibility study preparation.
Ability to multi-task in a fast paced dynamic environment and under pressure.
Domain knowledge in pension, super and investments.
Sound knowledge of the BABOK (CBAP / Agile accreditation preferred).
Understanding of Agile and Waterfall methodologies.
Previous experience working on transition / data migration projects in the superannuation industry.

Benefits
In return, we offer development opportunities at an ASX top 200 company
A professional, supportive and friendly culture
A range of corporate and life style benefits


The Business
IOOF is one of Australia’s largest financial services companies and we offer a full range of products and services, including financial advice, platform management and administration, investment management and trustee services. The IOOF Group has been helping Australians secure their future since 1846. During that time, we have grown substantially to become a leading provider of quality financial services. We now manage and administer more than $200 billion of client monies and are listed on the Australian Securities Exchange in the ASX top 200 (ASX:IFL).

To Apply

Applicants will be required to provide evidence of their eligibility to work in Australia, and at a minimum be required to undertake police and basic credit checks as a condition of employment.

Please note that applications from agencies will not be considered at this time.

IOOF is an inclusive and equal opportunity employer. We encourage applications regardless of race, ethnicity, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or an adjustment during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request.

Given IOOF is currently undergoing an Organisational Design process, please be aware that it is anticipated that organisational change will occur.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
Discover requirements using workshops, interviews and document reviews.
Document business requirements & conceptualise business processes & workflows.
Analyse the business requirements and facilitate the design of solutions to meet business requirements.
Assist Software Developers/Vendors to clarify and elaborate on the requirements.
Review user stories and functional specifications, testing plans and outcomes – ensure all relevant scenarios and business requirements are captured and tested (including negative scenarios).
Investigate and resolve problems in close collaboration with the system developers and functional/business users.
Participate in delivery of tasks in projects managed by the businesses or CTI, where there are technology and operational deliverables.
Accurately capture and manage project requirements in accordance to Project Plan in relation to Vendor deliverables across the life cycle of origination, fulfilment and servicing. Resolve project queries and assist in gathering of data required in relation to Vendors, for project development and planning.
Engage with Finance, Procurement and Vendor RM on vendor governance, pricing, project costing, vendor project resourcing and capacity to deliver against project plan and timelines and other contract management considerations. Provide updates and assessment of associated costs to the Project Manager.
Assess, document and communicate to Stakeholders (including Vendors), end to end process impact and ensure they are understood.
Identify, manage and resolve matters escalated by vendors and stakeholders relating to the projects, and meeting with Vendors as required.
Develop Business Continuity Plan (BCP) for new product/white label partners at BCP site.
Assist in business readiness by providing updates to changes in systems that impacts processes/controls so that the respective functions can ensure the appropriate controls are considered in the updates of Policies and Procedures.
MIS Reporting. Regular communications to management of project status
KEY COMPETENCIES / SKILLS
Strong Stakeholder Management skills – ability lead others to define requirements and technical solutions that meet end to end stakeholder needs
Business Analysis — experienced in identifying, analysing and documenting business requirements. Able to identify the opportunities, risks and constraints presented by the current and potential technical solutions and business processes and determine the most appropriate solutions to business problems.
Written & Verbal Communication — communicates confidently, clearly and effectively when speaking and in writing. Persuasive with details and facts.

Deliver on our Premiers priority for digital transformation and be part of a high-profile digital program


Ongoing full-time role - Clerk Grade 7/8
Salary package up to $121070/annum
Sydney – CBD location ( remote working across NSW)

The Department of Customer Service (DCS) is a service provider and regulator, focusing on delivering first-class customer service, digital transformation, and regulatory reform to create better outcomes for the people of NSW.
DCS has proudly introduced many innovations in service delivery and is continuing to adopt contemporary tools, techniques, and systems to improve customer outcomes and operational efficiency.
DCS is currently undertaking an ambitious digital transformation of government services, underpinned by the Digital Government Strategy.
We support flexible working practices with staff working remotely during this time.

About the Project:

The Licensing Program is key to DCS’ vision to be the world’s most customer centric government. It is our aim to engage through delivering smarter, user orientated digital solutions, reducing red tape, enhancing business productivity and protecting NSW communities.

The Licensing Program delivered by the NSW Department of Customer Service (DCS) is one of eight Lighthouse Programs, with a vision “To be the world’s easiest regulator to engage with through delivering smarter, customer centric digital solutions, reducing red tape, enhancing business productivity and protecting NSW communities.” To achieve that, about 130 existing licence ‘schemes’ will be digitised. This will be achieved by moving away the existing Siebel system into a new state of art licensing platform “Amanda”. As part of this transition all license information will be migrated from the existing Siebel system into the new Amanda system in a phased and agile delivery approach.
The existing Siebel system is a on on-prem solution, with and underlying database in MS SQL Server. Due to the complexity of the data and the scope of the project, additional source systems with varying source types are likely required to be included as part of the data migration execution. The target system Amanda is deployed on Microsoft Azure cloud with its underlying database as MS SQL Server.

DCS is looking for a Data Quality Analyst to join the recently established data migration team and be part of the exciting and challenging journey ahead.

Responsibilities:

Engage with Business users, application development team, and current systems teams in defining data quality requirements.
Understand the source and target systems from data quality requirements perspective and Identify the data quality rules.
Develop the data quality profiling code/scripts using SQL’s, stored procedures, Data Quality Services (DQS), Talend DQ.
Execute the DQ scripts to identify and analyse data issues
Create Data quality assessment reports and dashboards.Drive data working group meetings to prioritize and remediate data quality issues.
Devise and implement data enrichment and remediation solutions.
Develop and execute data quality scripts as a readiness check for trial migrations, dress rehearsal and production migration to pre-empt issues during migration.
Develop and implement data reconciliation.
Providing ad-hoc support to ensure that best practice is followed.
Measuring and reporting to management on the progress of data quality improvement.
Developing good relationships with users across the product teams and interacting with them to resolve any data quality issues.

Requirements:

Ability to review, analyse and manage large volumes of data.
Expert knowledge in writing SQL code and queries is required.
Expert knowledge in Microsoft Office with advanced knowledge of Excel is required.
Expert knowledge in tools like DQS, Talend DQ is preferred.
Should be able to generate graphs and produce presentations of professional standards.
Outstanding attention to detail and a meticulous approach to work.
Experience in data quality in data migration projects is preferred
Knowledge of Siebel would be beneficial but not essential.
Experience in regulatory licensing domain would be considered an advantage.
Ability to be flexible and adaptable to changing priorities.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Salary Grade 7/8, with the base salary for this role starting at $99,431.00 base plus superannuation

As a start-up business inside one of Australia's largest retailers, WooliesX aims to bring the best of Woolworths to our customers, powered by our team, technology and data. With an industry leading technology team, backed by analytics, we’re resourceful and willing to experiment. We are currently expanding our agile capability, across the whole of WooliesX.

What we are looking for:
The role of the Commercial Analyst within the B2C Tribe is to measure, track, and optimise performance of merchandising & trade activities across our multifaceted eCommerce business. Partnering with teams within the Commercial Practice, you will be delivering data-driven insights related to sales & profit, range, and pricing & promotions within our core Customer Value Propositions (CVPs).
What you’ll do:
Provide insights to inform strategic decision making by analysing various commercial lenses in both digital and offline platforms
Build reports and customised data models/dashboards to track & evaluate performance of commercial activities such campaigns & promotions, proof of concepts (POC), and more
Work across multiple systems in content management, financial reporting, & BI
Collaborate with BI team on dashboard requirements, use cases, and designs
Support data & insights requests relating to category management, product availability, and digital trade planning
Being embedded within our Connected Interfaces squads and ensuring they keep analytics at the forefront of their thinking - from utilising the insights provided to ensuring anything that is developed can be tested
Prioritise and respond to ad-hoc analytical requests from internal stakeholders
Be an advocate of analytics and collaborate within the Analytics & Insights Chapter to promote knowledge sharing
What you’ll bring:
5+ years Commercial experience in an Analyst or Retail (Buying, Pricing, Replenishment Planning) role
Strong data visualisation and communication skills (both written & verbal)
Strong SQL, data analysis, and modelling skills
Experience with BigQuery, Tableau, and PowerBI highly desirable
Able to synthesise large amounts of data from a variety of sources
A self-starter – able to work with minimal supervision, able to deal with ambiguity, and self-motivated
Comfortable working in complex, multi-stakeholder environments
Challenges the status quo and existing assumptions in order to promote innovative thinking and new solutions
Adaptable, collaborative, high attention to detail, improvement orientated

An attractive remuneration package - including base salary, super and annual bonus.
Added benefits - Including staff discounts, flexibility to work from different sites, healthcare, social club and much more (Site dependant).
Tech options - Woolworths are the largest employer of Google Apps in Australia, are early adopters of Agile and have BYOD options too.

Training and Education - We pride ourselves in helping you realise your potential and give you the opportunity to be innovative.

Role Summary:
We are currently seeking an experienced and professional Network Insights & Strategy Analyst on a permanent basis. Reporting to the Network Strategy Manager, your primary responsibility will be to provide strategic and economic assessment on potential opportunities / risk and development of solutions to be implemented for the online delivery and collection network. You will act as a key liaison across all related operational, logistics and development functions.
This is in conjunction with working with operational teams to deliver a cost effective solution, and communicating them clearly to stakeholders, facilitators and wider Woolworths team.
As part of this role, the Network Insights & Strategy Analyst will be responsible for:
Strategy Development
Support the long term development of an efficient, robust and competitive network by leveraging experience and industry knowledge to run a number of To-Be scenarios options and evaluate the impact in terms of capacity, cost and service
Engagement with the relevant stakeholders to ensure the required information and stakeholder expectations are captured accordingly

Collaborate with technology release managers (local and group) to coordinate delivery of minor enhancements and defect fixes

Project-based opportunity - fixed term full time for 12 months
Based in Sydney or regional NSW - we offer flexible working arrangements
Salary RC Grade 6: $127,559 - $141,442 + Superannuation + Annual Leave loading
Conduct advanced business and financial modelling and analyse complex workforce data sets

About us
NSW TrainLink is a multi-mode transport provider connecting communities across NSW. We are part of the exciting and unprecedented investment in integrated transport infrastructure and services, delivering benefits for our customers and communities as they travel across NSW as well as to Brisbane, Melbourne and Adelaide.

The opportunity
Right now, big things are happening in NSW TrainLink. There’s unprecedented investment in integrated transport as we deliver against a long term transformation blueprint which positions us to deliver even better outcomes for communities across NSW.
We are seeking a Senior Business Analyst to support key workstreams relating to the Enterprise Agreement and a broader transformation agenda. You’ll play a pivotal role in establishing a range of workforce analytics and modelling, financial models, and in preparing critical and complex information to a confidence level that enables executive decision making.
You’ll be part of a dedicated project team, partnering with stakeholders across Transport for NSW. Your expertise will be in high demand and you’ll be well positioned to provide professional advice for other transformation programs.
This position will be a full time fixed term position for 12 months.

About you
In addition to possessing relevant tertiary qualifications, you have highly developed business and financial analytical skills and are experienced in workforce data analytics, including the preparation of modelling, dashboards and process maps.
You are energetic, adaptive and comfortable working within the variability that can be associated with Enterprise Agreement bargaining in a complex environment. You are highly inquisitive and a keen problem solver who is excited to challenge the status quo and look at things differently.
You are highly skilled at organising and presenting complex information to suit the needs of different stakeholders.
A background which relates to rostering and payroll analysis, particularly as they apply within a large, dynamic operational context, would be highly competitive. Experience relating to rostering and payroll in particular would be highly valued.
You must be comfortable and confident to work independently, and to interface with the business through digital platforms if working remotely.
Importantly, you are motivated by a desire to make a real difference, for our people in NSW TrainLink as well as for our customers in Regional NSW.

Salary and benefits
The salary for this position is: RC Grade 6: $127,559 - $141,442 per annum plus superannuation and leave loading.

NSW TrainLink is committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible workforce who reflects the customers and community we serve. We offer employees challenging and rewarding work with opportunities for career progression, learning and development and work-life balance. Other benefits include:
Free travel on Government trains, buses and ferries
Flexible work practices

Interested?
Joining NSW TrainLink, you’ll have access to a range of unique government benefits in a flexible work environment like no other. If you’re ready to step into this meaningful and rewarding role, we want to hear from you.
Don’t miss out! Apply today to register your interest.

How to apply?
To apply for this position, please submit a resume and answer the pre-screening questions set up on the application form.
Applications close: 11:59PM; Wednesday 1st September 2021

We are the community we serve

We are committed to being an inclusive, diverse and flexible workplace where differences are valued. We welcome people of all backgrounds, experience and abilities.

We enable our people to work in ways that work for them and their teams. Working virtually and from different locations including regional locations, staggering work hours and job sharing are just some of the ways our people can work flexibly.

Please contact the Talent Specialist below if you require any adjustments to be made to how you interact with us throughout the recruitment process or would like to discuss flexible work options.

For any enquiries, please email Dawn Grundy at DAWN.GRUNDY@TRANSPORT.NSW.GOV.AU.

You will use analytical and problem-solving techniques to extract information from various stakeholders, and author and update documentation, and deliver requirements to support the Consumer Bank's Remediation programs in the initial discovery and execution phases for the remediation of issues.
Consumer Remediation Team
Office location - Barangaroo
Fixed-term CTR until September 2022

How will I help?
You will play a pivotal role in the Consumer Remediation team by working with stakeholders as directed to elicit, analyse, communicate, validate and manage requirements for changes to business processes, reporting requirements, information management and data. You will use analytical and problem-solving techniques to extract information from various stakeholders, and author and update documentation, and deliver requirements to support the Consumer Bank's Remediation programs in the initial discovery and execution phases for the remediation of issues. You will evaluate, analyse, and communicate requirements on a continuing basis, including the delivery of monthly status reports to all appropriate parties. Key responsibilities will be to assess change impacts to requirements when new needs or possible solutions are identified ensuring alignment with scope, change strategy and project timelines and obtain agreement on and approval from stakeholders of requirements evidenced via sign-off without direction or guidance. Documentation of requirements in accordance with team practices is a requirement of the role.
What's in it for you?
You will build your profile internally with a range of stakeholders and be part of the future of a business that has been around for 200 years. You'll be working for an organisation that supports development, internal career moves and flexible working (open to candidates-based interstate). Along with competitive salary, you'll receive Westpac’s generous benefits and a whole array of customer discounts.
What do I need?
We expect you to have proven analytical abilities, practical experience generating process documentation and reports. Be an excellent communicator with the ability to translate data into actionable insights and have a strong working knowledge of relevant Microsoft Applications, including Excel and Visio. Knowledge of Westpac and St George processes and systems is an advantage but not essential. You will have the ability to turn quantitative and qualitative analysis into business insights, opportunities, and solutions. Product knowledge of Mortgages, Deposits and/or Credit Cards and loans is desirable. You enjoy collaborating with others to solve problems, perform to a high-quality standard and have exceptional communication and stakeholder management skills. Financial industry and previous experience in remediation programs is highly desirable.
What is it like to work there?
We aim to provide one big, supportive team to help us reach our vision to help Australians succeed. As an equal opportunity employer, we're proud to have created a culture and work environment that values diversity and flexibility and champions inclusion.
The health and wellbeing of our employees is our priority and we will ensure that physical distancing requirements are met in all our workplaces as long as required.

Who is Equifax?
Equifax is a leading global data, analytics and technology company, supporting customers across 24 countries. We have been serving the Australian and New Zealand markets for over 60 years. Through continuously adapting to our environment, not only have we remained a market leader, we have also challenged ourselves to do better to help our customers live their financial best.
Our people are what makes us great at what we do - we see every member of our team as an integral piece of a jigsaw. We celebrate differences and recognise that each person brings with them unique talents and perspectives. We provide our people the support and flexibility to manage their work-life balance. At Equifax we genuinely care about our people and our ability to come together as #OneEquifax.
The perks of being an Equifax employee within the Client Implementation team?
Our people are important to us and we are devoted in ensuring that lives outside of work are supported and a successful work-life balance is achieved. We offer additional leave days as we recognise the importance of taking time out, whether that’s to catch up on some rest, celebrate a birthday, or give back to our community by volunteering. We are committed to the wellbeing of our people and provide them with discounted health cover through BUPA, access to comprehensive hearing services and discounts, and offer 24/7 support through our employee assistance program.
Our leadership team fosters a culture of ownership, they will lead, coach, mentor and listen. We support one another to feel confident to speak up and hold each other accountable to work with integrity.
What you’ll do:
The Client Implementation Analyst will provide end to end support and guidance for onboarding of small to medium clients to specific products and services offered by Equifax. In this role you will also provide technical and business support to Equifax’s API channel, support the Sales and Product teams with customer inquiries/issues across various platforms and take part in training on new platforms and transformation journeys from existing API to a new API.
What are we looking for?
Minimum 2-3 years’ experience in a similar role
Excellent communications both written and verbal
Strong background in troubleshooting – experience around REST API and familiarity with Cloud concepts
Basic knowledge of XML, JSON, REST Services
Proven ability in working in a fast-paced environment where priorities are changing
Extra points for any of the following:
Experience working within Financial Services
Business Analysis and/or Project Management related qualifications
Success attributes of an Equifax employee; does this describe you?
Accountable
Confident
Curious
Team player
Trustworthy
Positive
Dedicated

Job Title: Machine Learning Data Engineer: Advance Analytics
Job Description:
George Weston Foods make and supply some of Australia & New Zealand's favourite and most innovative brands and products. GWF's product range is diverse and includes leading brands of breads, baked goods, smallgoods, dips, flour, milled products, animal feed and hygiene solutions. We are one of ANZ's largest food manufacturers employing over 6000 people, across 50+ sites.
GWF is a wholly owned subsidiary of Associated British Foods plc, a diversified international food, ingredients and retail group with sales of £15.4bn, 133,000 employees and operations in 53 countries around the world.

The Role:
Reporting to the GWF Head of Advance Analytics & B.I., this role will support GWF business units to develop and mature their Advance Analytical capabilities through development of machine learning, data pipeline integration activities and the development/maintenance of machine learning models.

On a day-to-day basis, you will:
Work collaboratively with business stakeholders to design, build and support the production of predictive data model pipelines, data-modelling and machine learning related activities.
Design, build and maintain data integration pipelines for predictive models at varying levels of use cases, complexity, and business areas.
Provide innovative and Best Practice solutions to Data Integration and Machine Learning builds, whilst also developing complex SQL data-models to support Machine Learning and/or Tableau Visualizations.
Collaborate with Senior Data scientist on design, build and maintain predictive models at varying levels of use cases, complexity, and business areas.
Enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems, as well as, selecting features, building, and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques
Upgrade and be the subject matter expert in Predictive Modelling/Advance Analytical Platforms and manage upgrades and system.
Communicate, present and collaborate with multiple stakeholders and external suppliers to drive delivery of BI initiatives.
Collaborate with the IS Operations and Delivery teams to ensure effective stakeholder management during project delivery and business escalation support for change/issue management.
About You:
Bachelor's Degree in Business, Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field
Minimum 5+ years of hands-on experience in building and maintaining predictive models using Python, R scripting and SQL
Minimum 3+ years of data integration, data modelling and working on large databases.
AWS Qualified Associate or Certified Professional
A passion for building relationships, with strong written and oral communication skills to build effective relationships with stakeholders at all levels of the organisation
Highly self-motivated with an analytical outlook and strong problem-solving skills and the ability to exercise mature judgment.
Curious and creative by nature, demonstrating learning agility whilst driving a continuous culture of improvement.
Strong planning and time management skills, with the ability to self-prioritise to manage multiple tasks at once.
What's on offer at GWF:
You'll join a supportive team where you can broaden your experience in a fast-paced environment. We offer a competitive remuneration package, flexible work environment, free product daily, company paid parental leave, income protection insurance through our default Super fund, discounted private health insurance, access to novated leasing and study assistance.
Sound like a good fit? Apply now.. We'd love to hear from you!
Our people are the heart of business and are led by our four key values; Safe, Courageous, Trusting and Collaborative. By supporting their ability to work effectively and providing them with the tools they need to succeed, we are ensuring that we are the kind of company where talented people of all backgrounds want to work. Across our organisation, we're creating a workplace where collaboration is important, courage is rewarded, trust is expected, and a strong safety mindset is the norm.

Join an innovative, agile and collaborative team as a Business Analyst and help us support exciting enhancement projects for Originations of our Cash Management Products.
The team is responsible for the originations, enhancements and ongoing support of several cash management products / accounts.
In this role you’ll work closely with the Product Owner and Scrum team to refine and write user stories and support the delivery of features across technology and business teams.
You will have the opportunity to collaborate with a range of both technical and non-technical stakeholders across multiple levels, and your structured approach and analytical thinking will be crucial in managing multiple inflight features at various stages of refinement and delivery cycle.
We are looking for a BA who is comfortable spanning conversations from product strategy to architecture, and integration with our 3rd party vendor solution.
Our success is measured as a team and you will be willing to use your diverse skills and approach to work collaboratively to get things done and achieve team goals.
To be successful in this role you will have:
a minimum of 3 years’ experience as a Business Analyst (banking experience highly regarded, specifically originations)
exposure to XML, Integration tools such as webMethods or java and experience working with SOAP services, rest apis, xsds and json
a strong focus on quality and previous experience in functional and end-to-end testing
experience in collaboration tools such as Jira for backlog refinement and planning
excellent stakeholder management skills
strong analytical skills with the ability to define efficient solutions based on input from business
strong written and verbal communication skills
an inquisitive, open mindset and challenge the status quo where required
About Banking and Financial Services
Banking and Financial Services is Macquarie’s retail banking and financial services business, providing a diverse range of personal banking, wealth management, business banking and vehicle finance products and services to retail clients, advisers, brokers and business clients.
Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths, and in combination with our inclusive environment, it enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. From day one, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us, please apply. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways.
We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you, and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.

About Macquarie
A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.
Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups, disciplines, sectors and borders. With 16,000+ employees and offices in 32 markets around the world, we’re a truly global organisation.
You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives, ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us, you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.
Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.

About the role:
We currently have an opening for a Supply Chain Analyst, who will help identify and analyse improvement opportunities across the Fuels and Infrastructure business.
This is a highly visible role within the Fuels Pricing and Optimisation team and supports a range of supply chain projects such as: infrastructure investments, analysis of shipping import capabilities, terminal and tankage optimisation, analysis of costs and capabilities to support sales tenders, and/or other strategic projects.

Key objectives:
Engaging broadly with stakeholders across the F&I Business to identify and/or assess opportunities for analysis to support business decision making
Framing and conducting key analysis to answer critical questions, test the impact of proposed initiatives, and understand key scenarios or risks
Building and leveraging expertise in Ampol supply chains, including an understanding of operational factors, business processes, and competitors’ capabilities
Thinking commercially across the supply chain to identify the best financial outcomes for the total business
Engaging with our data science team and/or data experts to identify new ways of solving problems through data analytics
Communicating and engaging with different audiences and experts regarding complex analytical projects
Demonstrating your ability to build relationships, influence decisions, and drive strong business outcomes

About you:
Tertiary qualification in Engineering, Business, Finance or a related discipline, supported by direct exposure within bulk commodities, import supply chains, and/or fuels. Applicants with indirect but relevant experience through consulting will also be considered.

Your developed knowledge (4yrs+) includes a strong foundation in business problem solving, an understanding of business processes and core analytical skills.

Job Segment: Business Analyst, Payroll, Finance, Technology

Business Reporting Analyst | Epping | FTE
Epping Location - Head Office
Full-Time Position
Competitive Salary + Salary Packaging Option
The Role
The Business Reporting Analyst is responsible for ensuring that the Information Services team is able to meet the reporting requirements for the Southern Cross Care (NSW & ACT) business. Reporting into the Application Service Manager, the role will work to gather information from SCC systems and processes to provide accurate and timely business information back to management stakeholders. The role will be expected to deliver information in a form appropriate to the business need whether in standard reports or via dash boarding or other mechanism. The Business Reporting Analyst will look to improve the overall quality of SCC data as well as improve the efficiency of our data collection. This position reports to Application Services Manager.
Key Responsibilities
Business Analysis:
Work closely with the finance and operational teams to ensure that strategic initiatives can be reported on and measured
Evaluate business processes in all areas (admissions, sales, finance, operations) to determine opportunities for improvement in reporting and lead the development and implementation of these reports
Ensure all reporting initiatives are fully documented from the requirements analysis phase through to implementation.
Provide analysis assistance to project teams in terms of anticipating and developing reporting requirements as a result of a new implementation or a new process.
Ensure all reporting developments are fully reconciled and validated prior to release.
Document processes around report creation and deployment.
Maintain and update project documentation where required
Data Extraction:
Assist in the development and maintenance of the data warehouse and associated ETL solutions to draw data into the data warehouse to provide a broad platform for operational and management reporting
Design ETL solutions using SQL, Stored Procedures, APIs and Web Services as appropriate (depending on technology and data source)
Data Analysis:
With the business requirements in mind, analyse data obtained to offer insights and information to assist business decision-making
Utilise skills to match data from external sources (eg. Demographic data) with internal systems data and provide further insight.
Identify gaps in the quality and efficiency of the SCC data set and make recommendations for improvement.
Report Production & Maintenance:
Delivery and development of reports to all levels of the Southern Cross Care business
Drive and deliver reporting to operational teams to surface key KPIs and metrics (eg, profitability, occupancy, workforce metrics).
Secure the reporting framework to allow a single report to provide the appropriate level of data (eg. All areas of the business for senior staff, single region for regional managers, single facility for facility managers)
Create visual reporting to match the operational requirements.
About You
Ideally few years of experience in similar role
Experience in SQL development (to stored procedure)
Experience in business process modelling / analysis
Relevant Bachelor’s degree (Computer Science, Maths, etc)
Experience in Reporting Analyst / Developer background (desirable)
Strong communication and documentation skills with high attention to detail
Analytical and good problem solving skills
About Us
At Southern Cross Care (SCC), we believe that our purpose is to empower older people to "live life to the full". We offer a full continuum of personalised, expert services and adapt to meet the needs of each person and their family, providing aged care services through home care, retirement living and residential facilities. At SCC, people are at the heart of everything we do. We have a passion to provide the best care to our clients and to ensure we care and support our employees in achieving this goal.
How to Apply
This is a great opportunity, so please don't delay your application apply online today. If you'd like more information or to have a confidential chat about this opportunity, feel free to contact us via the details below:
Name: Shaista Ali-Skinner
Phone: 9790 9440

At Metcash, we’re the power behind an independent Australia. For almost 100 years we’ve been proudly supporting local, family-owned businesses – sticking up for the little guys and helping them become the best stores in town. Today we’re Australia and New Zealand’s leading independent retail partner and wholesaler in the food, liquor and hardware sectors. And while we may be large, we’ll always be locals at heart.

We’re constantly working towards making Canva the best place to work, for everyone. We believe deeply that bringing together diversity of thoughts, perspectives and expression is key for building the best product for our equally diverse community all around the world. We celebrate uniqueness and whatever makes you, you and encourage everyone who wants to help us transform the way the world designs, to join us on this journey. We value all different types of experiences. If you don’t think you quite meet all of the qualifications, we’d still love to hear from you.
About Us
At Canva, our mission is to democratise design and empower creativity for anyone and everyone, on every platform. Inspired by a team of talented thinkers, an amazing culture and a remarkable growth trajectory – we’re out to change the world, one design at a time.
Since launch in August 2013, we have grown exponentially, amassing over 60 million monthly active users across 190 different countries who have created more than 6 Billion designs. We are one of the world’s fastest-growing technology companies and we have only achieved about 1% of what we want to do.
The business systems sub-group of the Information Technology (“IT”) group drives secure and scalable adoption of technologies that enable Canva’s scale. This is a new group where you will be on the ground floor of a rapidly expanding team as we aim to radically innovate the foundational infrastructure of our technology supporting these critical groups.
We are hiring for many Business Systems Analyst roles across Finance, Legal, People (HR), Sales, B2B Marketing, and User Voice (Customer Support) for all systems across these teams.
What you'll do:
Partner with the leadership team within your Group to establish the optimal systems roadmap that supports the successful execution of their group goals and objectives
Configure systems in line with best practices to support 3-4x the number of employees and users we have today
Lead critical implementation projects of new and existing systems that are prioritized and aligned with your Group's leadership team
Manage the technical backlog for systems in the group and own steering committee meetings with team leads that effectively drive aligned prioritization of technical improvements
Create and maintain technical documentation of all systems under your ownership to enable seamless change management as we scale
Ensure that our data architecture of new and existing systems in in line with the metrics and Data group best practices so we can enable a data driven culture with our teams
Partner with other cross functional technology leads / teams to create and monitor integrations; making sure integrations run successfully / resolving issues
Working with third party system vendors, developing relationships and ensuring strong service delivery
Lean in with team members to assist with development of process documentation and business requirements where needed to ensure quality delivery of system improvements
What we are looking for:
You have a strong desire to build for scale, and are passionate about how technology can solve complex business problems that simplify the lives of our employees and users
You will know how to operate and be successful in a high growth environment, and thrive on problem solving and dealing with ambiguity, willing to get your hands dirty when needed.
Your interpersonal and communication skills are first class, allowing you to develop strong professional relationships.
Being a Force for good. One of our core values at Canva, “Being a force for good” means we are actively working towards a world that isn't just good for a small few, but one that’s good for everyone. We believe deeply that bringing together diversity of thoughts, perspectives and expression is key for building the best product for our equally diverse community. To achieve this, we need to constantly work towards making Canva the best place to work, for everyone.

Job Title: Financial Services Technology Consulting, Data & Analytics
Job Description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

EY is the only professional services firm with a separate business unit (“FSO”) that is dedicated to the financial services marketplace. Our FSO teams have been at the forefront of every event that has reshaped and redefined the financial services industry. If you have a passion for rallying together to solve the most complex challenges in the financial services industry, come join our dynamic FSO team!

The opportunity

We are growing our Data & Analytics team in FSO and now is an exciting time to join us on this journey. We are looking for people to join our diverse team who are passionate about technology & data with financial services experience. If you are a Consultant at the start of your career through to Director looking for your next role across the whole breadth and depth of Data & Analytics from next generation solution architecture, large scale data and technology delivery through to data risk, controls and governance, we would love to talk you. These opportunities are in Sydney and Melbourne.

You could be:

Working on a team to help our clients to find solutions to their most complex business challenges
Using your energy, enthusiasm and storytelling skills to convey the big idea to our client and our leadership while not forgetting the important details
Use critical thinking and problem-solving skills to design and develop cutting edge Data & Analytics solutions
Designing, building and implementing some of the largest data and cloud solutions in the market
Collaborating with your team and clients to develop the data & analytics strategy of tomorrow, today
Cross Pollinating with other EY competencies and teams such as business domain SMEs, technology teams including Cyber, Digital and Emerging tech to deliver large scale client transformations
Helping us grow a DnA FSO that is inclusive and diverse and that builds a better working world for our people

We are looking for team members to join us who are interested in any of the roles below:

Data Engineering and Development
Data Architects
Cloud Architects
Data Modellers
Data Regulatory & Controls Experts
Data Governance
Data Operations & Data Management
Technical Business Analysis & Data Analysis

Skills and attributes for success

Passionate about solving big complex problems using data and technology
Working with diverse and inclusive teams of talented people solving client issues
Financial Services experience (either industry or consulting and appropriate to your level)

We would love to talk to you if you want to hear more about a career in consulting or are considering a move back after taking a break from consulting or your career.

What we offer

Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Continuous learning: personalised career development including coaching, experiences and formal learning so you’ll develop the mindset and skills you’ll need to thrive in the future.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

At EY, you’ll be rewarded and recognised based on your performance and our comprehensive benefits package can be tailored to your individual needs.

We hold a collective commitment to foster an environment where all differences are valued and respected, practices are equitable and everyone experiences a sense of belonging. If you require any adjustments to the recruitment process in order to equitably participate, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application via contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or phone +61 3 8650 7788 (option 4).

We understand the importance of social distancing at this time so our recruitment and onboarding process may be managed virtually so we can continue to prioritise the safety and wellbeing of EY people, clients, guests and the broader public.

The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.

The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by EY or by their external third-party provider. Regarding this role, the minimum salary for Consultant is $90,000 including 10.0% superannuation.

EY | Building a better working world

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Senior analyst role performing complex financial modelling
Influence decision-making and strategic direction of the university
Fixed term parental leave contract for 13 months attracting 17% superannuation
Job Summary.
A pivotal role at the university, maximising stakeholder consultation and process improvement to optimise data analysis that informs organisational strategy.
Look to the future
The University of Newcastle stands as a global leader distinguished by a commitment to equity and excellence. Our vision is to be a world-leading University for our regions and creating a better future for our regions and the globe. Underpinned by this vision are our values of excellence, equity, engagement, and sustainability.
When we look ahead, we are motivated by the opportunities we see. We are driven by the challenges we need to solve, and we are stirred by the future we can imagine.
Be challenged and imagine with us
The Financial Services team enable strategy implementation, by providing responsive and quality financial products and services to business and governance functions across the university. In addition to Financial Planning and Analysis, the team is responsible for the Corporate Accounting and Treasury functions, Finance Business Support and Advisory services and Procure to Pay.
The Lead Finance Analyst will:
Actively engage with many stakeholders across the divisions and schools of the university;
Create data models to enable efficient analysis of large volumes of data from disparate data sources e.g. for course viability projects, pricing, prospective student marketing and student admissions;
Understand business drivers to be able to deliver impactful and actionable insights;
Create dashboards and reports for senior leaders and committees; and
Build relationships and develop collaborative partnerships across the University.
This is a fixed term parental leave contract for 13 months and is based at the Callaghan campus.
How will you inspire us?
You will be adept in handling large amounts of data from multiple sources and likely have a financial analysis or business analytics background. Experience in accounting or working with financial data is required and you will be a highly skilled user of Excel and Power BI, Tableau or similar business intelligence reporting tools. Activity-based costing experience is essential to success in this role.
As the role requires true collaboration with multiple stakeholders, advanced communication skills are paramount and include an ability to explain financial concepts to non-financial audiences in both formal and informal settings.
You will need skills to create data models for efficient capture and analysis and must have a critical-thinking mindset that drives process improvement.
For additional information on the position contact Gavin Ward 49217385 or via email gavin.ward@newcastle.edu.au.
Why commit to us?
The University of Newcastle is a Top 200 University in the world by QS World University Rankings 2021and a Top 10 University in Australia.

We provide opportunities for all people regardless of their background and experience, and this philosophy is reflected across all that we do.

You will be joining a Portfolio that has been established to support the delivery of changes into the Customer Engagement business. The Portfolio has several inflight streams across the ATM, Cash, Mobile and Customer Care Platforms, with more initiatives in the pipeline. 12-month FTC Contract
Reports to Project Director
Support the delivery of changes into Customer Engagement (CE) business
How will I help?
You will be joining a Portfolio that has been established to support the delivery of changes into the Customer Engagement business. The Portfolio has several inflight streams across the ATM, Cash, Mobile and Customer Care Platforms, with more initiatives in the pipeline. As the Senior BA, you will analyse and transform data to support the delivery of outcomes and reporting within one of these streams while ensuring it holistically aligns to other changes within and external to the portfolio of work.
Duties and responsibilities include:
Help drive the data and reporting needs of the program, specifically business cash deposits
Partner with key stakeholders to understand the ‘business problem’. Partners with other reporting resources to understand the data architecture and origins.

Identify potential business options to realise business improvements.
Contribute to and manage activities for planning, development, enhancement and implementation of broader phases of projects and systems

What’s in it for you?
You will play an important and significant part in the future of a business that has been around for 200 years. Our vision is to become one of the world’s great service companies. So, we will back you in the development of your career, with internal career prospects and flexible working. You will also be backed by a fantastic team of people in a can-do, supportive structure.

What do I need?
You will have strong Business Analysis experience having worked on large and complex programs of work within the finance industry (or any other highly regulated environment). You will have a good understanding of AGILE and Project Management tools with the ability to manage multiple priorities and context switch. You will have a growth mindset and you’re not afraid to constructively challenge the status-quo.

Experience in implementing banker and customer centric changes
Excellent written & oral communication skills with demonstrable ability in a variety of techniques to express technical information to non-technical readers / listeners
Acute interpersonal awareness and high degree of credibility with natural ability to communicate and build trust to forge strong relationships
Good understanding of methods for capturing, documenting, and reporting requirements
Familiar with project and service delivery cycles & experience in adapting approaches and methodologies to achieve quality & timely solutions for the business

What’s it like to work there?
As well as good pay and a great culture, joining the Westpac family means you will get some of the best banking, wealth, and insurance benefits in the market. We back our employees by helping them work towards industry-recognised qualifications, using online learning, training modules and career planning tools for you to grow with us. We will even pay you to do volunteer or community work. As an equal opportunity employer, we are proud to have created a culture and work environment that values diversity and flexibility and champions inclusion.
The health and wellbeing of our employees is our top priority. We have developed clear standards to ensure our people are confident, safe, and healthy whether they are working from a Westpac Group site or working from home. These are based on expert medical advice and Safe Work Australia guidelines

About Us
Established in 1999, Law In Order is one of the most recognised outsource service providers to law firms and legal teams specialising in legal technology support services. With offices across Australia and India, we are looking for a motivated sales professional to join our high performing sales team in Sydney.

The Opportunity
The Data Analyst will be responsible for designing and implementing a suite of Power BI reports and dashboards for companywide departments. They will utilise the latest data technology to bring together data across operational, financial, job management system, salesforce, and other associated systems. The role will also ensure data accuracy and consistent reporting, by designing and creating optimal processes and procedures. This role offers the opportunity to gain experience with technologies and make difference to the business.

Roles and responsibilities

Reporting to the Business Intelligence Lead you will:
Be the SME for POWER BI development and administration.
Acquire data from primary or secondary data source and maintain databases/data system.
Execute the development and validation data to support reporting.
Implement Data Warehousing and take ownership of the data integration from disparate data sources.
Dashboard reporting including financial and statistical data.
Explore available data by applying analytical techniques to provide insights.
Support with business cases, business requirements, functional requirements, test plans and test cases, data flow diagrams, ERD diagrams, APIs.
Assist with integrations between varied systems and data sources.
Significant experience in data modelling, analysis and reporting using Power BI
Experience in financial data modelling and reporting
Extensive experience with ETL processes, SQL Query and ERP systems
Ability to write code in Python or R
The Ideal Candidate

We are seeking a dedicated and technically savvy operator who is solutions focused and a strong team player. You will also possess:
Tertiary qualifications in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, computer science or a related quantitative field.
Extensive experience in POWER BI, SQL and advanced Excel skills
Experience with DAX and M language.
Experience in Python, R or other programming language.
High level of initiative and customer service delivery skills.
What we will offer you
This is a great opportunity for an experienced Data Analyst who enjoys working in a well-established and respected organisation with a supportive team to drive the delivery of key projects. In return you will be rewarded with the satisfaction of designing and building data ecosystem from the ground up and the opportunity to grow in the data sciences field. We support and encourage ongoing training for all our employees and provide opportunities to undertake training courses and certifications in your chosen field.
Some of the many benefits we offer our people include:
Corporate employee discounts and offers
Employee reward and recognition program
Birthday leave and Lifestyle & Wellbeing leave
Social & friendly culture
