About us

Sydney Metro is a fully automated rapid transit system which offers a new generation of fast, safe and reliable train services. Sydney Metro also leads the development of vibrant station precincts to meet customer and community needs, transforming the way Sydney travels and helping shape the future of Australia’s largest city.

About the team
The Operations, Customer and Place-making team ensures Sydney Metro is equipped to deliver integrated, reliable, customer-focused and efficient services. We are also managing large scale place-making projects, designing and developing thriving precincts where community members can gather, connect, shop, work and play. We are proud of what we have achieved so far and excited for the full vision of Sydney Metro to come to life.

The Opportunity
We have opportunities for a Customer Experience Analyst to join our Customer Experience & Analytics team, which is responsible for owning and delivering on customer experience (CX) requirements across all Sydney Metro projects. We are currently working on the biggest public transport projects in Australia, and Sydney Metro is committed to putting the customer at the centre of their design, construction and operation. Our CX team members are dedicated to using our Customer-Centred Design (CCD) toolkit to create the best possible journey for all Sydney Metro customers.
You will be part of the team that is at the forefront of the design and delivery of an easy and seamless experience for our customers. The role will provide support for our project-focussed CX teams, running data analysis and insight generation. The role will include responsibilities across research, measurement, project coordination and continuous improvement. As a Customer Experience Analyst, you will be championing the customer and assisting with the delivery of an easy experience for all Sydney Metro customers.

Please click here to view a copy of the role description.

About you
You will be an experienced analyst with outstanding data management skills and a superior ability to wrangle Excel models and PowerPoint decks. You are passionate and vocal about all things customer. Ideally you will have solid skills and experience with customer insights and qualitative or quantitative research. You will use your highly developed communication skills, your planning and time-management skills and your proactive approach to collaborate with multiple internal/external stakeholders to support the team in a complex multi-project environment.
You will be a current CX analyst looking to move into a role where you are involved in the ground-up design of customer experience, or a Business/Operations Analyst looking to change to a customer-focussed role. Your willingness to learn CX methodologies in the context of major infrastructure projects will be pivotal to your success in the role.

Salary and Benefits
The salary for this position is Grade 7 ($103,965 - $116,441) per annum plus superannuation and leave loading. For more information on employee benefits at Sydney Metro please click here.

Interested?
Joining Transport for NSW, you’ll have access to a range of unique government benefits in a flexible work environment like no other. If you’re ready to step into this meaningful and rewarding role, we want to hear from you!

Job Title: Data Engineers | Technology Consulting - Data & Analytics
Job Description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

The opportunity

We are seeking Data Engineers at Senior Consultant and Manager level to join our EY Data and Analytics team in our Melbourne, Brisbane or Canberra office. This role is offered on a flexible, full-time basis.

EY DnA is the data and advanced analytics capability within EY Asia-Pacific, with over 500 specialist employees working across multiple industry sectors.
We implement information-driven strategies and systems that help grow, optimize and protect client organizations.
We go beyond strategy and provide end to end implementation of real-life data environments and have some of the best architects, project managers, business analysts, data scientists, big data engineers, developers and consultants in the region.

Your key responsibilities:
Be able to clearly explain data and analytics strengths and weaknesses to both technical and senior business stakeholders
Develop and maintain strong effective working relationships with key management personnel and internal client base including data engineers, BA’s and directly with the services/businesses
Responsible for developing batch ingestion and data transformation routines using ETL tools or other ingestion techniques
Responsible for developing real-time ingestion and data transformation routines using Kafka and similar technologies
Responsible for migrating data from legacy data platform to cloud data platform
Present data in graphs, charts, tables, etc. and designing and developing relational databases for collecting data.
Keep a track of trends, patterns and correlation in case of complex data sets.
Be involved in all aspects of the project life-cycle, including strategy, road-mapping, architecture and implementation to gain maximum exposure to set you up for a successful consulting career.

Skills and attributes for success
Configuration and coordination of data pipelines across projects
Data pipeline development, including Azure Data Factory, AWS Kinesis, Spark (ideally 3+ Years)
Migration and transformation of large complex data sets from legacy systems like Teradata to cloud platform using Azure tools and other ETL tools like DataStage (ideally 5+ Years)
Data and Reporting Platform development on environments using technologies such as Microsoft Azure, SAP BW, Teradata, PowerBI or Cognos
Previous experience working on large data engineering and migration programmes.
Previous experience working with data, data environments, databases, large data sets possibly in a consulting environment
Strong problem solver, someone comfortable to challenge the status quo
A strong background in coding with possible experience with Python, SAS, SQL or R
Project delivery toolset experience in one or more batch ETL tools (such as DataStage, Informatica, Microsoft SSIS, Azure Data Factory or Talend) OR open source data integration tools (such as Kafka or Nifi)
Knowledge and experience in end-to-end project delivery, either traditional SDLC or agile delivery methodologies (or hybrid approaches)
Australian Citizenship and the ability to obtain security clearance – due to the nature of this role, this is essential .

Ideally, you’ll also have
Experience in engaging with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Consulting experience and background, including engaging directly with clients
Experience in a delivery role on Business Intelligence, Data Warehousing, Big Data or analytics projects
Exceptional communication, documentation and presentation skills

EY | Building a better working world

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by EY or by their external third-party provider. Regarding this role, the minimum salary is $90,000 including 10% superannuation.

Job Title: Business Analyst – Business Consulting and Strategy
Job Description:
Role: Business Analyst – Business Consulting and Strategy
Salary: SNSW Grade 7/8 – The package includes base salary range of $92,788 - $109,396, plus employer's contribution to superannuation and annual leave loading.
Status: Full Time/ Ongoing
Location: Haymarket

Service NSW is making it easier for people and businesses across NSW to access government services. Since launching in July 2013, we have successfully transformed and streamlined NSW Government service delivery with cutting edge digital solutions and an award-winning culture of passion and teamwork.

Our customer-centric solution offers simpler and faster access to government transactions through our digital channels, a 24/7 phone service and an expanding network of service centres. We currently partner with over 50 agencies to offer over 1,000 NSW Government transactions.

About the role and team:

We are seeking a business analyst to support the provision of strategic advisory services to stakeholders across Service NSW. In this role, you will use a variety of methods and data sources to provide strategic solutions to pressing business priorities, and work cross-functionally with stakeholders across the organisation to deliver sound, evidence-driven recommendations in a fast-paced environment.

You will be working with a dynamic, multi-disciplinary team who values diversity of thought and promotes collaboration. We constantly look for ways to improve and we are quick in evolving our way of working. We welcome applicants from a range of disciplines. The critical requirement is a demonstrated history of navigating ambiguity and complexity to deliver clear strategic advice with proven outcomes for organisations or clients.

In this role, you will:

Contribute to the development of business strategies and evidence-driven advice to help senior stakeholders navigate complex operational and strategic problems
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand and analyse solutions to business problems
Collect, collate, and analyse data from diverse sources
Develop presentations, papers, and briefing notes
Assist with the coordination and facilitation of working groups or project teams to achieve business outcomes

To be successful in this role you will demonstrate:

Commercial awareness with strong problem-solving skills and can formulate solutions in an ever-changing and highly fluid environment
An ability to thrive in a collaborative environment and your capacity to develop long-term productive working relationships with key stakeholders
An enthusiasm to embrace diverse thinking, with demonstrated experience in working across cross-functional teams
Strong project management skills with a particular focus on taking ownership of the tasks or outcomes assigned
Strong analytical skills, with the ability to evaluate quantitative and qualitative data, extract pertinent facts, draw logical conclusions, and generate actionable insights to present to senior management
Competence in developing professional and attractive presentations for a diverse range of audiences
Strong verbal and written communication skills.

What would be highly regarded, but not essential:

Experience in consulting or strategic advisory roles
Tertiary qualification in a related field such as business, strategy, mathematics, economics, or any field with a significant research focus (e.g. STEM fields, Social Sciences, etc)
Experience in quantitative research and analytics fields such as statistics/econometrics, financial modelling, and data science

To apply: To apply for this opportunity, please provide a copy of your CV and a cover letter (no more than 2 pages) highlighting how you meet the above criteria.

What will your typical day look like?
In this entry level role, you will assist in the preparation of a wide array of visas relating to Australian migration, with a focus on business migration. You will be involved in research, preparation and finalisation of visa documents and work closely with businesses and assignees to provide advice, updates and an all-round great experience. You will work closely with the national Deloitte immigration team and our network around the world to service clients in a timely, professional and efficient manner. You will be provided with extensive on the job training, mentoring and coaching, and have a fantastic opportunity to grow and develop with our world class immigration practise.

About the team
With global growth comes greater employment complexities - that’s where we come in. Deloitte Global Employer Services (GES) help multinational corporations navigate multifaceted immigration, tax and labour laws. Combining tax research and data analytics, we give advice on global compensation, Visa and work permits, employment taxes and policy design for international assignments.

Enough about us, let’s talk about you.

At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia’s borders. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in a variety of ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.

Through the creation of endorsed employee-led diversity networks which promote cultural, disability, LGBTI+, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and gender equality, we’re leading the way to shape an environment where everybody can thrive.

Belonging, Loyalty & Respect, Honesty & Ethics, Forgiveness & Praise, Ambition & Humility, Tolerance & Compassion, Responsibility and Honour.

MinterEllison is renowned as one of Asia Pacific's leading legal practices. What sets us apart is we are driven by a strong sense of purpose: we endeavour to build authentic and enduring relationships with our clients, our people and our communities. Through our leading-edge innovation and our collaborative legal and consulting specialists, MinterEllison is redefining the boundaries of what it means to be a law firm.
MinterEllison was placed in the top 25 best workplaces in Australia and in LinkedIn’s 25 Top Companies in Australia for 2019—the highest ranking of any law firm.
The Team
This role will sit within the Program Management Office and will be responsible for the analysis activities throughout the project lifecycle to ensure requirements are well articulated, delivered and meet project objectives. The Business Analyst will identify and investigate efficiency improvements, conduct current state & future state analysis and requirements whilst prioritising activities to ensure project are delivered with optimal return on investment for the firm.
Your Role
An exciting permanent opportunity for an experienced Business Analyst to join our Program Management team based in either Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane or Adelaide. You will have the opportunity to be involved and contribute to exciting projects as the firm embarks on various transformational projects.
In this role you will have the opportunity to:
Collaborate with a broad range of functional areas and teams relating to business analysis, process change, technology solutions and people's work practices.
Lead workshops and interviews to conduct business process analysis and gather requirements.
Analyse, review and recommend improvements to existing processes to drive efficiencies in project delivery.
Conduct gap analysis and present summary of findings
Create AS-IS and TO-BE process maps
Provide input into any required data mapping and translation activities
Create business requirements documents and partner with technology experts to translate into functional specifications
Write text requirements or User Stories complete with Acceptance Criteria; which can easily be understood by the development team
Create and manage requirements traceability matrix and product backlog
Provide requirements prioritisation guidelines and influence prioritisation to achieve the best outcomes for the firm
Provide analytic support by coordinating data extraction from various databases and data interpretation
Support in conducting business process impact assessment and change impact assessments
Partner with development and analytic teams to provide reporting on software solutions
Conduct workshops and technology demonstrations to seek sign-off on business requirements, new processes and technology solutions
Participate in test planning and execution
Support in ensuring project outcomes remain aligned to strategic objectives
Ensure timely escalation of issues and risks, and project change requests
Ensure templates and other project artefacts that assist with current and future program delivery are captured and shared
Transfer knowledge and learnings to the project team and other stakeholders
More About You
We welcome applicants who possess:
3+ years' experience in a related business analyst role
Experience working on large or complex projects
Strong analytical and process improvement skills with experience in delivering efficiency improvements from analysis phase through to implementation
Experience developing and implementing processes
Experience in completing AS-IS and TO-BE process mapping in multi stream complex business environments
Understanding of the Software Delivery Lifecycle
Experience working in an iterative fashion, following an agile framework
Knowledge of Business Analysis Body of Knowledge (BABoK)
We also highly value applicants who:
Build and foster trusted relationships with a broad range of stakeholders
Proactive & collaborative team player who has capability to work autonomously in a complex environment
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
Resilience and a commitment to excellence
Flexible, adaptable and self-motivated approach responding to changing business priorities
Drive continuous improvement through innovation across policy, process, and systems
Pragmatic and solution oriented mindset during high pressure situations
Who we are:
We make diversity in all its forms central to collaboration. We know that when we bring together diversity of thinking, skills, experience, gender identity, backgrounds and orientations, we get better results. This is why we offer agile and alternative working options to encourage balance, wellbeing and support for sustainable ways of working. We offer up to 20 weeks paid parental leave for the primary carer within the first 24 months following birth or adoption, and a range of social, financial and health benefits, including free gym membership – all with no minimum tenure.
We welcome applications from people of all ages, cultural backgrounds, genders (including if you identify as transgender or gender diverse), sexual orientations, as well as people living with a disability or who have family or carer responsibilities. We particularly encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people to apply for roles with MinterEllison.
We are recognised as a WGEA Employer of Choice for Gender Equality in Australia and hold Gold employer status with the Australian Workplace Equality Index (AWEI).
How to apply:
We love to deal with you directly, so please submit your CV and cover letter for consideration by clicking on the 'Apply' button below.
If you would like further information, to tell us about any adjustments you might require through the recruitment process or if you are trans or gender diverse and want a confidential discussion, please contact Alexandra Hussain, Resourcing Solutions Consultant at alex.hussain@minterellison.com
Agency submissions will not be accepted without prior express approval from the MinterEllison recruitment team. All agency candidates must be submitted through our on-line portal to be valid.

Analyst, Investment Objectives & Reporting

Opportunity to join a top 5 Australian investment manager
Help NSW government family clients meet their investment objectives
Advocate on behalf of clients across the broader investments team

TCorp provides best-in-class investment management, financial management, solutions and advice to the New South Wales (NSW) public sector. With over A$111 billion of assets under management, TCorp is a top 5 Australian investment manager and is the central borrowing authority of the state of NSW, with a balance sheet of A$117 billion. It is rated Aaa (Stable) by Moody’s and AA+ (Stable) by S&P.

TCorp champions and protects the financial interests of the state and delivers sustainable returns and financial efficiencies that allow its clients to achieve their broader business objectives.

TCorp delivers this through its expert team, ability to anticipate the future needs of the state and with a deep understanding of the unique needs of the NSW Government family. We work exclusively for the NSW Government and public sector entities and our work and influence delivers positive impact for the people of NSW.

Our Investment Management division constructs and manages client-centric investment portfolios for the NSW Government family. With over $111 billion of assets under management, TCorp is a top five Australian asset manager, placing us within the top 100 in the world. Through careful engagement with our clients, understanding their needs and bringing together our investment beliefs and comparative advantages, we deliver appropriately designed solutions. This results in the best possible risk adjusted performance for our clients.

Reporting to the Head of Investment Objectives & Reporting, this role will contribute to the building of TCorp’s investment advisory capability by supporting the development of investment reporting, analysis, and client communications in line with the team’s strategic initiatives.

Key accountabilities in this role include:

Conduct quantitative and qualitative analysis to support investment advice to clients on return objectives, risk appetite and benchmarking
Prepare high quality reports and presentations, consistent with policy and client needs
Support other members of the team in engaging existing and potential clients on TCorp’s Total Portfolio Approach
Work collaboratively on projects and tasks
Maintain an ongoing understanding and clear articulation of the drivers of client performance versus expectations

Key capabilities required to be successful in this role include:

Ability to communicate effectively (both verbally and in writing) with the senior management team and from time to time with external parties (including clients) on a range of investment issues
Strong quantitative analysis and problem-solving skills
Strong solution and outcome focus
Ability to use initiative and research to analyse and interpret information from a variety of sources
High attention to detail and process
Ability to work in a team and independently
Ability to manage competing priorities to ensure deadlines are met

The successful candidate will hold a relevant tertiary qualification; at least 3 years’ relevant industry experience; knowledge of investment management disciplines; experience working in an investment consultant, asset manager or asset owner; knowledge and experience of diversified portfolio management and multiple asset classes; and knowledge of Australian and international investment markets’ operations and practices.

At TCorp we actively collaborate with our stakeholders to achieve the best outcomes for our clients and the state of NSW. We aim to build an inclusive culture so we can benefit from each employee’s unique perspective and contribution. We also understand the importance of flexible working and we support our people to balance their commitments and thrive both professionally and personally.

Please submit your application via our careers portal and include a cover letter setting out how your background and capabilities align to our selection criteria and how this role fits with your career goals. Please also note your salary expectations (base and Super) in the relevant section of the portal. No agency candidates please.

Organisation/Entity: Transport For NSW
Job Category: Planning
Job Location: Sydney, NSW, AU, 2020
Job Ref No: 10912
Employment Type: Permanent Full-Time
Salary Range: $103965.0-$116441.0
Permanent full time opportunity based in Sydney, flexibility offered
Be part of a proactive team oriented environment and forward thinking organisation
Exciting opportunity to work in a dynamic and collaborative team that values your contribution

Agency Overview
At Transport, we’re passionate about making NSW a better place to live, work and visit. Our vision is of a connected roads and public transport network that has higher capacity and gives people the freedom to choose how and when they get around, no matter where they live and work. Right now, Transport is delivering an unprecedented $72.2b investment into a truly game changing Future Transport strategy.

Great people come from all walks of life and at Transport for NSW we are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible workforce which reflects the community and the customers we serve.

About the role
We have an exciting opportunity for a Planning and Portfolio analyst in the Product and Solutions team within the Customer Strategy & Experience branch. The primary purpose of the role is to establish and manage the Digital Products dashboard to provide fact-based information and metric tracking to ensure that Product Managers are informed to make better decisions, determine effectiveness and quality of initiatives and assist with prioritisation of products and product features. This involves coordinating support services in a climate of constantly changing and competing stakeholder requirements and priorities. You will be a part of a team which works together to provide the best possible service to various teams within Transport that are working towards improving the lives of customers and communities by making their journeys safer and efficient.

What you would be involved in:
The ultimate purpose is to provide excellent service that delivers value and meets system and operational requirements. The role involves working on:
Contribute to strategic planning that balances multiple demands and initiatives from across the Transport Cluster, with sensitivity to relationships with stakeholders and impacts on project delivery
Work with the Product Managers to enable them to prioritise, review and monitor their initiatives
Conduct research, and source, collate and compile information to support analysis of associated data and enable informed decision-making.
Respond to ad-hoc requests for product usage and other requests for internal usage and reporting
Model collegiate and collaborative behaviours to achieve the greater good for the community, celebrate a diverse workforce, create an environment where people can innovate and thrive, and support people’s wellbeing.

About you
You are a self-driven, proactive, motivated and autonomous analytics practitioner. The applicant must be able to demonstrate skills such as accountability, judgement and decision making, customer service capability, advanced knowledge and skills in data analytics tools and data visualisation, personal timekeeping and management skills and an ability to adapt. Experience in in interpreting complex data and conveying information to non-technical users in a large complex environment will set you up for success.
For more information on this position, view the role description here

Our commitment to diversity
TfNSW are committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture across the Transport cluster, planning for and promoting diversity. We welcome and encourage applications from diverse community groups and ages including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander, LGBTQIA, people with disabilities, women and other diversity groups. TfNSW recognises the benefits that such an approach brings for our staff and customers in delivering the future of NSW.

Benefits
Joining Transport for NSW, you’ll have access to a range of unique government benefits. These include flexible working arrangements, professional development opportunities, health and wellbeing programs, and a program that helps you stay connected with work before, during and after parental leave. If you’re ready to step into this meaningful and rewarding role, we want to hear from you!

Transport Service Grade 7 $103,965 – $116,441 plus employer’s contribution to superannuation and annual leave loading

How to apply
To apply for this position, please submit a resume and follow the instructions in the application process.

For more information on how to apply for a role in the NSW Public Sector please click here or for more information on Transport for NSW please click on link provided.

Should you have enquiries about the role, please contact Shefali Uppal on shefali.uppal@transport.nsw.gov.au

Applications close: 11:59pm, 29th August 2021


Job Segment: Research

About us

Sydney Metro is a fully automated rapid transit system which offers a new generation of fast, safe and reliable train services. Sydney Metro also leads the development of vibrant station precincts to meet customer and community needs, transforming the way Sydney travels and helping shape the future of Australia’s largest city.

About the team
The Operations, Customer and Place-making team ensures Sydney Metro is equipped to deliver integrated, reliable, customer-focused and efficient services. We are also managing large scale place-making projects, designing and developing thriving precincts where community members can gather, connect, shop, work and play. We are proud of what we have achieved so far and excited for the full vision of Sydney Metro to come to life.

The Opportunity
We have opportunities for a Customer Experience Analyst to join our Customer Experience & Analytics team, which is responsible for owning and delivering on customer experience (CX) requirements across all Sydney Metro projects. We are currently working on the biggest public transport projects in Australia, and Sydney Metro is committed to putting the customer at the centre of their design, construction and operation. Our CX team members are dedicated to using our Customer-Centred Design (CCD) toolkit to create the best possible journey for all Sydney Metro customers.
You will be part of the team that is at the forefront of the design and delivery of an easy and seamless experience for our customers. The role will provide support for our project-focussed CX teams, running data analysis and insight generation. The role will include responsibilities across research, measurement, project coordination and continuous improvement. As a Customer Experience Analyst, you will be championing the customer and assisting with the delivery of an easy experience for all Sydney Metro customers.

About you
You will be an experienced analyst with outstanding data management skills and a superior ability to wrangle Excel models and PowerPoint decks. You are passionate and vocal about all things customer. Ideally you will have solid skills and experience with customer insights and qualitative or quantitative research. You will use your highly developed communication skills, your planning and time-management skills and your proactive approach to collaborate with multiple internal/external stakeholders to support the team in a complex multi-project environment.
You will be a current CX analyst looking to move into a role where you are involved in the ground-up design of customer experience, or a Business/Operations Analyst looking to change to a customer-focussed role. Your willingness to learn CX methodologies in the context of major infrastructure projects will be pivotal to your success in the role.

Salary and Benefits

Interested?
Joining Transport for NSW, you’ll have access to a range of unique government benefits in a flexible work environment like no other. If you’re ready to step into this meaningful and rewarding role, we want to hear from you!

To apply for this position, please submit a resume and answer all questions within the online application process.

Applications close: 11.59pm, Sunday, 5 September 2021

?
We are the community we serve

We are committed to being an inclusive, diverse and flexible workplace where differences are valued. We welcome people of all backgrounds, experience and abilities.

We enable our people to work in ways that work for them and their teams. Working virtually and from different locations including regional locations, staggering work hours and job sharing are just some of the ways our people can work flexibly.

Please contact the Talent Specialist below if you require any adjustments to be made to how you interact with us throughout the recruitment process or would like to discuss flexible work options.

Job Title: Test Analysts | Technology Consulting - Data & Analytics
Job Description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

The opportunity

We are looking for two Test Analysts ideally with proven experience in business and data analysis to join our team.

EY DnA is the data and advanced analytics capability within EY Asia-Pacific, with over 500 specialist employees working across multiple industry sectors. We implement information-driven strategies and systems that help grow, optimize and protect client organizations. We go beyond strategy and provide end to end implementation of real-life data environments and have some of the best architects, project managers, business analysts, data scientists, big data engineers, developers and consultants in the region.

Your key responsibilities
Create and maintains test plan including test cases based on requirements
Develop test scripts
Execute test scripts and documents outcomes of testing
Liaise with developers, analysts, and designers and raise defects as appropriate.
Implement continual improvements through improving testing processes and practices and test automation

To qualify for the role you must have
1+ (ideally) years of experience in data and analytics
Experience in query and ability to interrogate data e.g. using SQL
Demonstrated experience in documenting requirements
Strong written and verbal communication skills, along with strong attention to detail
Australian Citizenship and the ability to obtain security clearance – due to the nature of this role, this is essential

Ideally, you’ll also have
Experience writing test cases and performing testing

What we offer
Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Continuous learning: personalised career development including coaching, experiences and formal learning so you’ll develop the mindset and skills you’ll need to thrive in the future.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

At EY, you’ll be rewarded and recognised based on your performance and our comprehensive benefits package can be tailored to your individual needs.
We hold a collective commitment to foster an environment where all differences are valued and respected, practices are equitable and everyone experiences a sense of belonging. If you require any adjustments to the recruitment process in order to equitably participate, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application via contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or phone +61 3 8650 7788 (option 4).

We understand the importance of social distancing at this time so our recruitment and onboarding process may be managed virtually so we can continue to prioritise the safety and wellbeing of EY people, clients, guests and the broader public.

The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.

EY | Building a better working world

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

World Number 2 in Wine and Spirits. Unrivalled portfolio of iconic brands
Personalised Career Development: Supported & empowered to achieve
Flexi Work: Product allowance: Bonus Wine education: Summer hours: Tastings
Sydney or Adelaide
Deliver digital business improvements for Sales & Marketing focused on consumer experience; Join an energetic, dynamic team; Sydney/Adelaide Location
The Pernod Ricard way
We have our own way of doing things. We call it conviviality ! It is our way of being and something unique you feel and experience when working for Pernod Ricard.
We are committed to conviviality which means you will be Empowered to perform , supported to succeed, and acknowledged for the value you bring. You will be Proud to Belong to our Pernod Ricard family.
All this is combined with our Commitment to care with a strong focus on sustainability and responsibility where our “Good times come from a Good place” and the only trace Pernod Ricard leave behind is conviviality .
Be part of something bigger
We are an international family with over 19,000 employees spanning 73 countries, Pernod Ricard are world number 2 in wine and spirits industry. We have an unrivalled portfolio of iconic spirit, wine and Champagne brands such as Absolut Vodka, Chivas Regal, The Glenlivet, Jameson, Mumm Champagne, as well as Jacob’s Creek, Brancott Estate, Stoneleigh, Campo Viejo and Kenwood wines.
Our employees are our brand ambassadors and our employees are at the heart of our company.
Your unique contribution
We have an exciting opportunity available to join our IT Solutions – Sales & Marketing team as a Business Analyst. This position can be located either in our HQ Barangaroo office in Sydney or in Adelaide close to our wine producing area.
You'll be collaborating across Pernod Ricard Winemakers assisting with the delivery and execution of digital solutions within the Sales and Marketing team to help them excel. Some of the projects are address the CRM, ecommerce, improve consumer experience and digital data.
If you have an inquisitive mind, thirst for knowledge and initial experience within ECRM this is your opportunity to join a Global company and have the mentorship and development to accelerate your career.
Analyse and design business solution improvement initiatives across the full life cycle.
Manage the validation process e.g Development of testing scenarios; System and integration testing ; Acceptance testing of the end-to-end solution including sign-off.
Lead project working teams, specific to each business solution, managing work efforts, managing the schedule and communicating with team members.
Provide on-going operational support to current digital applications within sales and Marketing.
Support senior management decision-making by developing a commercial focus to ensure IT add value to the organisation.
Your perfect blend of Talent
As well as having an impressive blend of entrepreneurial spirit, mutual trust and ethical commitment: you will also bring
Relevant tertiary qualifications e.g. IT / business systems / computer science with formal business analyst skills.
Strong project management skill.
Understanding of the different aspects of the Systems Development Life Cycle.
A self-starter with good personal organisational skills and ability to work to deadlines.
If you have previous experience working with ECRM, consumer interface CMS, digital data or a consumer experience BA role this would be an advantage .
Become a creator of conviviality
If you want to work with people who acknowledge you and the value you bring, then Apply now! You too can be part of the Pernod Ricard Way
“Only those with full, unrestricted working rights in Australia will be considered for this position”
Pernod Ricard “MyBlend of benefits”

Serious Stuff
EAP: Skin Checks: Flu Shots: Carer’s allowance: Life Insurance:
Feel Good Stuff

Date: 20-Aug-2021

Location:
Sydney, NSW, AU

Department:Description:
Job Requisition ID: 19120

Do you have a dual background or experience across Commerce, Finance AND Data Analytics, Business Intelligence and Visualisation? Then our M&A Analytics team is the perfect place to take your career to the next level!

What will your typical day look like?

This opportunity has arisen in a context of expansion – new service offering. We are looking for an Analyst or Senior Analyst to join or team of six. We are currently hiring in Sydney and will look at building a team in Melbourne in the forthcoming months. This role is critical with respect to providing analytically focussed financial Due Diligence and M&A transaction support to our clients. The ideal candidate for this position will be able to bridge the gap between visualisation and financial analysis expertise. You will play a pivotal role in delivering the visualisation capabilities of our M&A teams.

Develop an understanding of the target business and its drivers

Perform interpretation and analysis of information memoranda and business plans

Develop static and interactive data visualisations to communicate business insights to clients

Ability to build visualisations and supporting analysis of historical trading quality of earnings working capital cash flow etc.

Clearly and effectively communicate requirements, timelines and insights to both internal Deloitte team members as well as clients

Manage project timelines and client deliverables effectively while collaborating extensively with clients and other Deloitte teams

Liaise with data science and fata architecture teams to optimise client data for visualisation

Enough about us, let's talk about you.

You will ideally have:
Completed an undergraduate degree in Finance, Accounting, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or Engineering with outstanding academic credentials

2-5 years of experience in a Finance/Commerce role with exposure to Visualisation - this is provided as a guide only, please don't let it limit you if you think you have something to add to our team

Knowledge of financial statement analysis (CPA-CA/CFA an asset)

Ability to ETL client data to facilitate analysis/ visualization; strong knowledge of SQL Tableau or Qlikview and other BI tools

Proven analytical skills and systematic problem solving in addition to ability to manage analyse and present findings from large volumes of data

Ability to develop and present new ideas and conceptualise new approaches and solutions

Why Deloitte?

At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia’s borders. We value difference and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in a variety of ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.

We’re committed to continually building a safe and respectful workplace, where all our people feel appreciated and accepted. Job Title: Senior Business Analyst – Business Consulting and Strategy
Job Description:
Senior Business Analyst – Business Consulting and Strategy

SNSW Grade 9/10 – The package includes base salary starting at $114,429 plus employer's contribution to superannuation and annual leave loading.

Location: Haymarket

Employment Status: Full-Time / Ongoing

We are seeking an all-rounder Senior Business Analyst to apply a strategic approach to identifying and assessing business transformation opportunities, as well as to collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to co-design funding and strategic solutions for the business.

Working in the Business Consulting and Strategy team, you will collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to apply a strategic problem-solving mindset to pressing business priorities. You will help teams navigate complexity in operations, funding matters, and operating model reform in a way that creates meaningful results for our customers and NSW Government.

The key to your success will be demonstrated experience in driving strategic thinking and creative problem-solving in a fast-paced and ever-evolving environment. You will be adept at conceptualising frameworks to guide decision-making and using appropriate constructs to organise ideas and data to inform recommendations to a senior audience. You will be deeply collaborative, with a flair for applying cross-disciplinary reasoning and problem-solving skills, supported by an evidence-driven, research mindset. You will also value diverse thinking and will have demonstrated experience in working with cross-functional teams to co-design solutions and influence action.

This role offers the opportunity to work with senior leaders in our business and to guide the future of Service NSW. There will be the opportunity to coach members of the team, with the expectation to ‘roll-up your sleeves’ in meeting team goals when the occasion arises.

We are looking for someone who:

Is highly analytical with an ability to communicate complex concepts in a concise and compelling way

Is proficient in using data to inform decision-making

Has a flair in creating presentation packs that are fit for audience and fit for purpose

Enjoys a collaborative environment and developing long-term productive working relationships with key stakeholders

Preferably has a tertiary qualification in a business-related field or any discipline with a significant focus on research (e.g. STEM, Social Sciences, etc.), but is not essential

Service NSW encourages its employees to continually develop their careers through professional support and development opportunities. We offer flexible working arrangements to ensure a life-work balance for our staff.

Have we got your interest?

To apply:

Please provide a copy of your CV and a cover letter of no more than 2 pages that explains why you are suitable and interested in this role. Before you apply, please also see the role description attached and ensure you address the core capabilities outlined for the role.

Applications close on: 9:59 am, 3rd September 2021

For further information about this opportunity, please contact the Hiring Manager: Miguel Galsim at Miguel.Galsim@service.nsw.gov.au or about the Service NSW recruitment process, please contact Swathy Mohan on swathy.mohan@customerservice.nsw.gov.au

A talent pool will be created for future ongoing and temporary roles and is valid for a period of up to 18 months.

Employment to Service NSW is subject to a satisfactory national criminal record check.

Service NSW is passionate about building a culture that values and supports diversity and inclusion. Service NSW encourages applications from people with disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, LGBTQI and people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.

People with a disability are strongly encouraged to apply and we welcome a discussion regarding workplace adjustments to help maximise everyone's opportunity to fully participate and contribute. If you are a person with disability and need adjustment in the recruitment process, please contact the Recruitment team via email on csrecruitment@customerservice.nsw.gov.au.

At Service NSW we deeply value our customers and our teammates. We are an inclusive, diverse, caring and respectful team and a place where everyone can bring their whole self to work.

We pay our respects to Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and Elders past, present and emerging and acknowledge the traditional custodians of the land, waters, culture and community we walk, work and live.

Company Name: Braithwaite Steiner & Pretty Pty Ltd T/a Odgers Berndtson

Job Description:
Organisation/Entity: Transport For NSW
Job Category: Research and Analysis
Job Location: Sydney, NSW, AU, 2000
Job Ref No: 28081
Employment Type: Permanent Full-Time
Salary Range: $103965.0-$116441.0
About us

Transport for NSW (TfNSW) is the lead agency of the NSW Transport cluster. Our role is to lead the development of a safe, efficient, integrated transport system that keeps people and goods moving, connects communities and shapes the future of our cities, centres and regions. We work with several government agencies to coordinate metro, train, bus, ferry, light rail, road and maritime services, always keeping the safety and comfort of our customers at the heart of what we do.

Evolving Transport

Transport for NSW is delivering an unprecedented $72.2b investment into a truly game changing Future Transport strategy. We are also evolving, bringing together new and existing transport modes, cutting edge technologies and getting smarter at how we do it. We are changing to deliver more connected journeys, greater satisfaction and safer transport for our customers, both now and for the future.

The Division

The Regional and Outer Metropolitan division is focused on understanding the particular needs of regional communities across NSW and delivering customer-centred integrated transport services and infrastructure.

The opportunity

We have a Permanent Full Time Opportunity for a Business Intelligence Specialist to join the Customer Service Experience and Planning Branch in the Regional and Outer Metropolitan division. This role will provide assistance with strategic business intelligence analysis to support organisational decision-making.

This position accommodates remote and flexible work practices across NSW, with the opportunity for you to work out of your nearest Regional or Outer Metropolitan office.


What you will be involved in

The successful candidate will partner with key personnel throughout the business to source required information and facilitate the provision of appropriate and consistent information and intelligence to support measurement, analysis, comparison and decision-making. Additionally, this role will be accountable for;

Partnering with external stakeholders to provide quality information in a timely manner as agreed, and managing their expectation and requirements.
Developing and testing business reports, visualisations, user interfaces, data models, queries and related artefacts for agreed business requirements.
Designing and customising dimensional models, data schemas, metadata, and report models to accommodate business-specific processes, data and requirements.
Supporting the development and preparation of materials for Executive Management Team and prepare draft documents, including briefing notes, responses, proposals, presentations, etc. to inform and support decision making.
Translating complex technical issues into business terms and collaborate with internal and external clients to support the development of functional strategic plans.
Delivering ad hoc research business analysis and strategy development exercises as required.
Modelling collegiate and collaborative behaviours to achieve the greater good for the community, celebrate a diverse workforce, create an environment where people can create and thrive, or support people’s wellbeing.

About you

We are looking for a customer centric data analytics professional, with a demonstrated background in working with the business to solve problems. As the Business Intelligence Specialist, you will have experience developing design and analysis standards to deliver, value added reporting in a cost effective manner.

Collaborative and flexible in your approach to work, you will exercise initiative and constantly strive to further develop yourself professionally. Ideally possessing a background in community or strategic engagement, you will have strong communication skills and ability to translate complex technical issues into business terms to support the development of functional strategic plans. A working understanding of data warehousing, modelling and analytics would be viewed favourably. Adept at time management and stakeholder engagement, you will be comfortable undertaking qualitative and quantitative research to identify trends and inform on the determination of business priorities.

It is essential that as an integral part of a customer focused area of the business you will model the behaviours aligned with excellent customer service in all aspects of your professional engagement. Tertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline or equivalent demonstrated experience is required.

This is an exciting opportunity to be a part of a growing Division that values regional NSW and strives towards excellent outcomes for regional communities!

Please click here to view a copy of the Role Description

Salary and Benefits

Transport Grade 7 ($103,965 - $116,441) + Super

Interested?

If you are looking for an environment in which you can contribute to creating a legacy of achievement that will last for generations, and enjoy a flexible and diverse working environment which values collaboration and personal development, then we’d like to meet you.

Find out more about Transport for NSW at https://www.transport.nsw.gov.au/about-us.

To apply for this position, please submit a resume and answer all questions within the online application portal.

Close date: 11:59PM Friday 3 September 2021.

We are the community we serve

We are committed to being an inclusive, diverse and flexible workplace where differences are valued. We welcome people of all backgrounds, experience and abilities.

We enable our people to work in ways that work for them and their teams. Working virtually and from different locations including regional locations, staggering work hours and job sharing are just some of the ways our people can work flexibly.

Please contact the Talent Specialist below if you require any adjustments to be made to how you interact with us throughout the recruitment process or would like to discuss flexible work options.

For any enquiries, please email Caitlin McDougall at CAITLIN.MCDOUGALL@TRANSPORT.NSW.GOV.AU.

Find out more about Transport for NSW at https://www.transport.nsw.gov.au/about-us

COS can offer you not just a job but a career and incredible exposure and growth.

Why work for COS?
We're a family business with family values and our staff are key to our success. We're passionate about providing a productive and safe environment with modern facilities. We value the personal development of all staff, and there are many opportunities for you to grow.

This is a great opportunity to play a part in working for one of Australia's true success stories.

One of Australia's leading Insurance companies is looking for a Finance Business Analyst to join their team.
The successful candidate will join the finance program - IFRS!7 project that will be focussing on the data analysis stream to translate the actuarial business requirements into data specifications for the finance sub-ledger system.
The successful candidate will have a strong background in insurance/compliance with extensive exposure to IFRS 17 and USGAAP/ SOX
Duties include:
Plan and facilitate workshops to elicit function and data requirements for a number of business stakeholders including accounting and actuarial teams
Define and consolidate business requirements for the IFRS 17 implementation and formulate the functional design for solutioning. This will require coordination with IT, actuarial and finance teams.
Communicate and assess major risks and issues that may potentially occur during the IFRS 17 implementation.
Skills:
Strong understanding of IFRS17
Preference will be given to candidates from an Insurance background
Proven and advanced VBA experience
Apply today!
This assignment will be 6 - 12 months contract with a possibility to go permanent.

Fantastic Innovative Start-up Enviornment
Career & Development Opportunities
Awesome Culture

OUR STORY
We’re embarking on the worthy ambition to help Australians take control of their money. You’ll be a key member of the 86 400 team lifting the bar on delivering more value to customers through innovative features and a transparent approach. We’re mobile first and designing for people who embrace digital and want a better banking experience.

YOUR WHY
You believe that Australians need to do business with companies that genuinely put customers interests first and you want to be on the frontline of introducing them to it. You get out of bed in the morning excited about designing products, managing product experiences and driving superior customer and commercial outcomes. You are passionate about raising the bar in the financial services industry and and believe it starts with supporting the product team to develop, launch and manage deposit accounts and payment experiences.
This role reports to the Head of Digital Products.

HOW YOU’LL SPEND YOUR TIME AT 86 400
You will work closely with the Digital Products Lead and Digital Products Manager to deliver exceptional customer experience and support the management of the end to end lifecycle of our customers and digital products.

Key accountabilities include:

Key SME for the Contact Centre and Banking Operations team, answering questions in relation to products and processes, helping to resolve customer issues, complaints and briefing the team on upcoming changes and how to respond.
Continuous market scanning and benchmarking keeping across key competitors.
Provide regular and adhoc reporting and insights on customers including usage, feedback and utilisation to better understand customer behaviour, issues and opportunities.
Resident expert for tagging and tracking of performance across our digital products eg Google Analytics, Appsflyer, Ask Nicely etc
Work closely with the Growth & Marketing teams to optimise new customer growth, and ensure that our onboarding funnel is firing
Manage the end to end process for digital product contents changes, app stores and other related platforms
Work with internal teams and Vendors (Yodlee) to resolve issues relating to key digital products such as connected, digital wallets and energy switch.
Manage regular customer comms with Product Manager and Marketing, including delivery of emails, push notifications and SMSs, tracking results and suggesting areas of improvement
Support the management of our risk and compliance environment by following processes, staying up to date and applying any new regulatory or compliance requirements.

WHAT MAKES YOU TICK
You have a talent and passion for solving customer problems
You have an understanding of the current and emerging digital product ecosystems with a passion for Fintech
You have an analytical mind and like to understand more from data
You love the operational stuff and understand that the everyday experience is the ticket to the game
You are good with numbers and can navigate your way around reporting systems
Your studies have provided the foundation for your success with a Business or Technology degree under your belt
Curious nature and willingness to learn
Ability to driver change in a fast paced environment and you have a knack for working across teams to solve problems
You understand the regulatory environment

VALUES. EVERY SECOND
Customer. Customer - We put the customer’s best interests at the forefront of everything we do. We believe financial success will follow customer success.
Agile and Brave - Constantly collaborating in new ways to create something genuinely innovative.
Value Each Other - We respect everyone’s contribution, embracing a common goal and championing individuality.
Frank and Authentic - A high performing team who say what we mean and mean what we say to create a strong team culture.
Show Up - We bring our passion, positivity and sense of fun every day to embrace the challenges of changing the banking game.

If you are looking to look for an innovative company which adds value, then this is the role for you. A competitive package is on offer for the successful candidate.

Visit: www.86400.com.au

Please note: no agencies will be accepted in the recruitment of this role. We would like to take this opportunity to thank all candidates for their application. Our standard is that every candidate receives an outcome email or other written communication as a minimum.

Join a supportive and growing team!
Take ownership over projects with access to large amounts of data!
Attractive salary package with bonus potential!

BizCover who?

You haven’t heard of us? We dominate the SME business insurance market by having an online platform that makes comparing and buying business insurance a super easy process. Not to toot our own horn but we have been recognized in Deloittes fast 50 companies as one of the fastest growing technology companies and Westpac’s top 20 businesses of tomorrow - #killingit

So What?

As a rapidly growing Insuretech company we have an abundance of data to work with and we need a data-driven Analyst to join our growing team of data fanatics! Collaboration, knowledge sharing and being a creative problem solver is the key to success in this team, so we are looking for a likeminded analyst to grow with us!

What you'll be doing?

As a Data Analyst you will be using data to identify, measure and achieve positive value across BizCover's operations, spanning our digital front end, customer touch points, and our value-centric customer processes.

Day to day you will be –
Working through the whole analytics lifecycle and partnering with different teams to operationalise your recommendations into the value streams across our operations.
Identifying value-based or analytical recommendations for improvements across the value chains.
Shaping narratives and telling stories with data to key stakeholders using analytical tools to interpret data and derive insights, paying particular attention to trends and patterns valuable to provide impactful conclusions and recommendations.
Helping BizCover be data-driven by collaborating with data users and consumer to develop new measures and prototype visualisations
Working with Data Scientists, assisting them with your knowledge of BizCover data and process, helping build the right feature sets to make business-relevant decisions and optimisations.
Migrating legacy analytics products to the new technology stack, such as moving output data used in PowerBI from Excel to a database table.
Working within a dream data stack – Snowflake, DBT, PowerBI, and AWS.
Who we want

To be a good fit for our team, we want creative problem solvers who ask “why”! You’ll be expected to take ownership of a piece of work, engage and collaborate with others when needed, and are comfortable presenting your results to an audience.

The Essentials:
3+ years’ experience in a data driven analytics role

Inclusion & Diversity
AMP recognises individual differences and welcomes people from a variety of life and work experiences. AMP does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruitment agencies and search firms. Please do not email or send unsolicited resumes to any AMP employee, location or address. AMP is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Job Title: KYC Operations – Client Onboarding Analyst - Associate
Job Description:
Position Overview
Details of the Division and Team:
Operations supports the management of all sales and trading transactions, in the areas of client on boarding, trade capture, settlement and reconciliation.
Spread across multiple product and business areas (Derivatives, Securities, Global Finance & Foreign Exchange Operations, Loans, Trust and Securities, as well as cross functional entities), Operations strives to do things smarter, faster and more effectively. It meets the technical and operational challenges of processing transactions worth hundreds of billions of Euros every day, across multiple time zones in all the major currencies and markets. Through Operations, we seek to grow profitability by means of efficient trade processing, offering world-class services and minimizing operational and reputational risk.
Client On boarding provides comprehensive Know Your Client, New Account Opening, Client Reference Data Analysis and Services and Data Management solutions within relevant DB systems for the various business units.
In accordance with Anti-Money Laundering Requirements, Banks, such as Deutsche Bank AG ("DB"), are obliged to perform Know-your-client (“KYC”) reviews on all new clients they adopt. These checks and reviews are made in strict accordance with regulatory requirement and the bank’s internal policies
The role involves verification of the Client data, performing due diligence checks on the Clients, reviewing KYC documentation performing the risk assessment of the Client, liaising with the Business/Compliance, advising on KYC and regulatory requirements and signing off on new client adoptions
What we will offer you:
A healthy, engaged and well-supported workforce are better equipped to do their best work and, more importantly, enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace. That’s why we are committed to providing an environment with your development and well-being at its center.

You can expect:
Competitive salary as well as pension, insurance contributions and salary packaging
4 weeks annual leave, plus additional and well-being leave
Parental leave benefits including Childcare Assistance Payment
A range of flexible benefits including the Online discount program, employee referral program
Your key responsibilities:
Manage new client adoption and regular review stream (as required), to ensure that all requests are approved in accordance with regulatory requirements and the bank’s internal policies. Responsible for ensuring timely, complete and accurate processing of KYC.
Responsible for client communications and query management.
Responsible for verification of client data.
Handle all customer and stakeholder related processes regarding request, verifications and modifications
Ensure the escalation of operational, regulatory and other risks to line manager; contributes to the development and implementation of mitigation or control solutions.
Demonstrate and enhance knowledge, expertise and experience of legal and regulatory requirements, control frameworks, operational processes and policies across the COB space.
Maintain strict discipline and rigor around deliverables.
Your skills and experience:
2 - 4 years of relevant work experience (AML/KYC/compliance related) within corporate financial services industry.
Sound understanding and experience/knowledge of Control, Compliance, and Investigation would be an advantage
Sound knowledge of AML/KYC regulations (FATCA etc.)
Experience in interpreting regulatory guidelines and assessing risk scores and entity types
Sound understanding of end to end KYC process
Capability to take full ownership of tasks, while displaying a mature and confident approach with all stakeholders (i.e. internal and external)
Strong client service skills
The candidate will need efficient oral/written communication
Excellent team player with strong communication and inter-personal skills
Ability to work to tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Proactive and results driven approach to ensure completion of all tasks and ultimately the improve our clients’ DB experience
Strong time management, organizational, planning and follow-up skills; ability to multi-task effectively
Eye for detail and able to scrutinize existing processes and identify gaps
Change/Continuous improvement mind-set and interest to question status quo

How we’ll support you:
Flexible working to assist you balance your personal priorities
Coaching and support from experts in your team
A culture of continuous learning to aid progression
A range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your needs
Training and development to help you excel in your career
About us and our teams:
Deutsche Bank is the leading German bank with strong European roots and a global network. Click here to see what we do.
Our values define the working environment we strive to create – diverse, supportive and welcoming of different views. We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. We build talented and diverse teams to drive business results and encourage our people to develop to their full potential. Talk to us about flexible work arrangements and other initiatives we offer.
We promote good working relationships and encourage high standards of conduct and work performance. We welcome applications from talented people from all cultures, countries, races, genders, sexual orientations, disabilities, beliefs and generations and are committed to providing a working environment free from harassment, discrimination and retaliation.

We are actively interviewing for this position. APPLY today to secure your new role. Got questions? Contact Alana on 02 9236 4500.

Job Description

Atradius Australia is looking for a self-motivated Credit Risk Analyst/ Underwriter to join the Risk Services team in Sydney. This is a great opportunity to join a growing part of the Atradius business and develop your skill set in a customer focused, collaborative environment. The role will include the chance to travel across the Australia, New Zealand region and you will be instrumental in delivering first class customer service to our customers and brokers.

From a regional perspective, the role will provide the opportunity to be part of the Asia Pacific Footprint, a growth area for Atradius and a region that is expanding its reach from both a Business Unit and Risk Services perspective.

Applications are invited from qualified/experienced candidates that are looking to expand their knowledge and broaden their horizons in a new role. To succeed you will already be able to evidence strong analytical, customer service and communication skills as well as possessing those characteristics that fit soundly within our Atradius Competencies & Values

In this position your key responsibilities will be:
Analysing credit risk of SMEs, large enterprises and listed corporations across Australia, New Zealand, and the Pacific Islands for domestic and global clients.

Responsible for setting appropriate strategies on companies/ groups and to underwrite credit limit decisions.

Managing a number of trade sectors with the view to becoming an expert in those industries.

Building relationships with brokers, customers and buyers in the region.

Presenting detailed review reports to the credit committee on large size cases.

Assisting in formulating and updating credit rating strategies for the responsible markets

What qualification should you have? The ideal candidate will have the following profile:

Required qualifications:
University graduate with a bachelor degree or above focusing in finance, accounting, economics or business administration;

Minimum of 2 years of work experience in a relevant field;

Strong analytical skills and ability to work independently;

Team-player and a good communicator;

Willingness to work under pressure with strong self-initiative;

Strong customer focus;

Excellent writing skills and fluency in English is a must;

Candidates with good knowledge of the local market and industries in preferred.
Candidates will need to already have a relevant Visa to work in Australia

What do we offer?

A dynamic, international and challenging work environment

Training and support to reach your full potential including the opportunity for continuous professional development

Attractive terms and conditions, including competitive salary, pension package and a range of flexible benefits and rewards

A flexible working environment in line with the Atradius Australia Hybrid Working Framework

Challenging tasks with individual development and training opportunities

Do you have any questions about our offer?

[hannah.walters@atradius.com], Human Resources, is available by e-mail at [job.projectmanager.email].

I am Atradius! - Do you want to know who we are?

Get to know Atradius colleagues in this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NnsgT04OpTU&t=4s

Atradius is a global provider of credit insurance, bond and surety, collections and information services, with a strategic presence in over 50 countries. The products offered by Atradius protect companies around the world against the default risks associated with selling goods and services on credit. Atradius is a member of Grupo Catalana Occidente (GCO.MC), one of the largest insurers in Spain and one of the largest credit insurers in the world.

Job Title: Data Assurance Specialists - Tech Consulting, Data & Analytics
Job Description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

The opportunity

We are looking for Data Assurance Specialists ideally with experience in banking, wealth, super or insurance to join our Data and Analytics team across Sydney and Melbourne at Senior Consultant, Manager and Senior Manager levels.

EY DnA is the data and advanced analytics capability within EY Asia-Pacific, with over 500 specialist employees working across multiple industry sectors.

We implement information-driven strategies and systems that help grow, optimize and protect client organizations.

We go beyond strategy and provide end to end implementation of real-life data environments and have some of the best architects, project managers, business analysts, data scientists, big data engineers, developers and consultants in the region.

Your key responsibilities

Create project plans for data migration and separation process, including mapping risks and potential impacts
Create framework and guidelines for treatment of data
Facilitate workshops with business and technology teams to gather business rules for data assurance services
Work closely with the data assurance platform team to implement and execute data assurance rules
Build and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders across clients and internal EY service lines
Collaborate across various internal as well as client teams to stay aligned on program updates and make informed decisions on project activities
Present and obtain endorsement for relevant artefacts by business and technology stakeholders
Assure data to be migrated using various different techniques
Obtain endorsement from the business on completed assurance activities

Skills and attributes for success

To qualify for the role you must have

Strong business and data analysis skills
Strong workshop facilitation and communication skills
Demonstrated ability to interact effectively with senior internal and client stakeholders
Data migration experience
Experience working with offshore teams
Intermediate to advanced skills in SQL, Microsoft applications (e.g Excel, MS Project)

Ideally, you’ll also have

Data migration experience specific to divestments
Insurance, Wealth and Superannuation experience, and an understanding of assurance concepts and processes
Data quality and profiling, and data reconciliation experience
Experience working with Agile teams and experience working with multiple BI and database technologies will be beneficial

What we offer

Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Continuous learning: personalised career development including coaching, experiences and formal learning so you’ll develop the mindset and skills you’ll need to thrive in the future.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

At EY, you’ll be rewarded and recognised based on your performance and our comprehensive benefits package can be tailored to your individual needs.

We hold a collective commitment to foster an environment where all differences are valued and respected, practices are equitable and everyone experiences a sense of belonging. If you require any adjustments to the recruitment process in order to equitably participate, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application via contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or phone +61 3 8650 7788 (option 4).

We understand the importance of social distancing at this time so our recruitment and onboarding process may be managed virtually so we can continue to prioritise the safety and wellbeing of EY people, clients, guests and the broader public.

The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.
EY | Building a better working world

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by EY or by their external third-party provider. Regarding this role, the minimum salary is $90,000 including 9.5% superannuation.
