The Opportunity

Are you ready for the next move in your finance career? Are you keen to become part of a truly global team? Do you enjoy working with a wide variety of stakeholders? If so, then a role as an IT Risk & Controls Analyst role with Zurich Financial Services Australia could be just what you are looking for.

The Role

As an IT Risk & Controls Analyst you will provide independent and objective assessment as to the design and operating effectiveness of our in scope Internal Controls over Financial Reporting (ICFR), in accordance with our Internal Control Integrated Framework (ICIF) Risk Policy. You will have active participation in the development of internal business and technology controls throughout the company by ensuring compliance with our ICIF methodology.

In this critical role you will support the Head of Financial Governance in the development and delivery of the identification, analysis and testing of IT application controls, automated business controls and IT general controls supporting financial reporting risks. You will monitor technology services provided by external parties and shared services and contribute to ad hoc projects as and when required. Moreover, you will be responsible for monitoring the delivery of results as well as outcomes against milestones and liaise with external auditors to provide testing evidence. This is a pivotal role in our Finance function and will best suit an individual who can think outside of the box and manage competing deadlines that all have critical business outcomes.

In this challenging, varied and highly visible role you will work with a variety of key stakeholders including Risk Management, Compliance and Audit. You will also liaise with external Auditors.

Your Experience

You will have a strong risk and controls background with tertiary qualifications in accounting, finance, technology or a related discipline. You will also be studying towards, or hold a CA, CPA or equivalent. Insurance and/or Financial Services experience will be held in high regard and Big 4 experience will be a distinct advantage. IT risk & controls experience is a requirement of this role.

Are you interested in working for a company that values its people and put's its customers and employees at the heart of everything we do? Are you looking for growth opportunities beyond simply a career? Then Zurich could be just the place for you!

Our people are the heart & soul of Zurich. Together we are committed to delivering on our purpose - Let’s Create a Brighter Future Together!
Our ambition is to become one of the most responsible and impactful businesses in the world. To get there we hire and develop the best talent available. With Zurich, you can expect to work on challenges that will help you grow and to collaborate with a diverse and inclusive global team.
People are Zurich’s most important asset. Their varied skills, perspectives and experiences drive innovation. And they reflect the breadth and diversity of our customers, suppliers, communities and investors around the world. We are committed to attracting and retaining talented individuals from a variety of backgrounds and experiences. Zurich does not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, religion, national origin, sex, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information, age, disability, protected veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, pregnancy or other characteristics protected by applicable law.

Job Title: Data Analyst (Consultant/Senior Consultant), Quantitative Services, Tax
Job Description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

The opportunity

Working in the Sydney QS practice you will have the opportunity to develop and work with people across all our service lines (Strategy & Transactions, Consulting, Tax, Assurance). The Sydney QS practice includes professionals with a broad range of technical competencies and is a global leader in the development of many emerging digital applications for our client’s asset based technology issues. We are committed to building a better working world.

Your key responsibilities

Apply the latest analytic and automation tools and technologies and focus on:
Automation procedures within the physical asset base and ledger systems of our clients.
Artificial Intelligence programs to automate processes and make decisions relating to complex rules-based environments.
Digital cloud-based platforms enabling a new generation of data analytics and services that can be provided across the business of our clients.
Use analytical software to access, transform, integrate, analyse and visualise client data across a range of project and asset information.
Deliver results by using data analytics to deal with large, disparate volumes of data, to gain crucial insights quickly.
Develop data governance and master data management frameworks to help our clients improve their data quality assurance processes.
Establish relationships with client personnel at appropriate levels and consistently deliver quality client services.
Drive high-quality work products within expected timeframes and on budget.
Working directly with our clients, you will help to enhance their ability to use and interpret project and asset information, as well as providing input into their strategic initiatives and programs.

Skills and attributes for success

To qualify for the role, you must have

A degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, Actuarial Studies, Engineering, Statistics, Accounting or a related discipline

Ideally, you’ll also have

A demonstrated ability to clearly and concisely present data, conclusions, and recommendations such that they bring insight and improve clients' decision-making processes.
Experience with BI and visualisation tools.

Job Title: Risk Surveillance Frameworks and Operations Senior Analyst
Job Description:
Join an expanding Frameworks, Operations and Reporting team working across our global Risk Surveillance Program. As part of this initiative, we are looking for a Senior Analyst with experience in data analytics and a strong risk mindset. Proficiency in the use of PowerBI and Alteryx would be beneficial.
As a Senior Analyst in our Sydney office, you will report into the Data and Reporting Lead for Risk Surveillance Frameworks, Operations and Reporting and collaborate with global Risk Surveillance and broader Risk Management stakeholders to deliver insights into Risk Surveillance data. This would include trend analysis, and business and management reporting across Firmwide trade, e-Communications and voice surveillance programs.
This is an exciting opportunity to use your analytical and communication skills, along with an investigative mindset, to develop insightful dashboards and reporting that contribute to the overall Risk Surveillance Governance Framework.
You will work with the latest developments in surveillance technology and be given space to create and innovate analytical solutions. This role requires a bachelor’s degree and demonstrable experience in utilising both Power BI / Alteryx. Familiarity with surveillance and/or compliance concepts is beneficial but not essential. If you are ready to explore this exciting new opportunity further, apply today.

Its divisions include Credit; Prudential, Capital and Markets; Market Risk; Operational Risk; Compliance; Quantitative Applications; and Internal Audit.

Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups, disciplines, sectors and borders. With 16,000+ employees and offices in 32 markets around the world, we’re a truly global organisation.
You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives, ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. Job Title: Consultant / Senior Consultant, Tech Business Analyst - Data Risk & Controls, Technology Consulting
Job Description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

The opportunity

We are looking for a Tech Business Analyst – Data Risk and Controls within the Technology Consulting – Data and Analytics team in our Sydney office

EY DnA is the data and advanced analytics capability within EY Asia-Pacific, with over 500 specialist employees working across multiple industry sectors.

We implement information-driven strategies and systems that help grow, optimize and protect client organizations. We go beyond strategy and provide end to end implementation of real-life data environments and have some of the best architects, project managers, business analysts, data scientists, big data engineers, developers and consultants in the region.

Your key responsibilities

Work closely with senior stakeholders (both internal and external) to understand their business requirements to identify their challenges with data that can be addressed using various Analysis techniques
Conduct deep-dives with Business SMEs to evaluate risks, controls and issues; identify inherent risks, threats, pain points, control gaps and weaknesses.
Develop and maintain strong effective working relationships with key management personnel and internal client base including data engineers, BA’s and directly with the services/businesses
Uplift of the risk & controls environment through identification and remediation of control gaps, addressing banks’ finding ahead of Board deadline
Be able to clearly explain data controls strengths and weaknesses to both technical and senior business stakeholders
Facilitate design workshops with executive stakeholders to calibrate and agree outcomes, material risk ratings and new issues and observations to be raised at Board level.
Keep a track of trends, patterns and correlation in case of complex data sets.
Be a part of a culture that focuses on delivering excellence for our clients and work with an awesome team of people to work with and access to cutting edge technologies.

Skills and attributes for success

We’re looking for people with strong Consulting experience. You will need passion for a career in data analytics, where you will provide a consultative service on a variety of data driven decision making projects within a fast-passed consulting environment.

Extensive experienced in the banking industry delivering data governance, data risk and control, data lineage, data quality, regulation frameworks and processes.
Proven track record partnering with key stakeholders across risk management, compliance, technical IT teams and the business, driving outcomes and improving cohesion.
Exposure to data / data environments / databases / large data sets / lineage
Analytical mind set / someone that challenges assumptions
Knowledge and experience in end-to-end project delivery, either traditional SDLC or agile delivery methodologies (or hybrid approaches)
Exceptional communication, documentation and presentation skills
Ability to lead a team and collaborate with other business units.
A good team player who shows flexibility and a pro-activeness to deliver on relevant outcomes.
Strong problem solver, someone unhappy with the status quo.
Prior Consulting/Banking experience is highly desirable.

Ideally, you’ll also have

Experience in engaging with both technical and non-technical stakeholders on data risks and controls discussions, e.g. BCBS 239, APS 114, AML
Strong consulting experience and background, including engaging directly with clients
Experience in a delivery role on Business Intelligence, Data Warehousing, Big Data or analytics projects

What we offer

Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Continuous learning: personalised career development including coaching, experiences and formal learning so you’ll develop the mindset and skills you’ll need to thrive in the future.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

At EY, you’ll be rewarded and recognised based on your performance and our comprehensive benefits package can be tailored to your individual needs.

We hold a collective commitment to foster an environment where all differences are valued and respected, practices are equitable and everyone experiences a sense of belonging. If you require any adjustments to the recruitment process in order to equitably participate, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application via contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or phone +61 3 8650 7788 (option 4).

We understand the importance of social distancing at this time so our recruitment and onboarding process may be managed virtually so we can continue to prioritise the safety and wellbeing of EY people, clients, guests and the broader public.

The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.

EY | Building a better working world

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

#LI-ANALYTICS

Regarding this role, the minimum salary is $90,000 including 9.5% superannuation.

The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by EY or by their external third party provider.

Enterprise Services (ES) is responsible for the world leading application of technology and operations across every aspect of CommBank, from innovative product platforms for our customers to essential tools within our business. We also use technology to drive efficient and timely processing, an essential component of great customer service.
CommSec is recognised as leading the industry in IT and operations with its world-class platforms and processes, agile IT infrastructure, and innovation in everything from payments to internet banking and mobile apps.
Your Team:
The CommSec Business Solutions, Analysis and Design team operates in the following key areas to support our Customers :
1. Business Solutions Consulting: formulating and delivering ideas; proposals; concepts; business cases; and requirements for solution estimation and delivery
2. Project and IT Delivery: responsible for the end to end management of IT projects via in-house software development and/or engagement with our external Clients and software providers
3. System Development: responsible for the delivery of Development Services for IT projects for CommSec
Your core responsibilities include:
The Senior Technical Business Analyst will support the business during the Discovery and execution phases of initiative design and Solution delivery; deliver clear, concise technical delivery direction to their delivery team. They will support Developers, Testers and Product Owners through the execution of initiatives.
Elicitation of business goals and requirements, population of coherent prioritized portfolio and product features and backlogs
Continuous review and management of the prioritized portfolio and product backlogs
Ensure business needs are properly modelled, analyzed and reflected and any impacts to benefit benefits are captured and agreed
Identify business requirements for enhancements to systems and/or business processes
Ensures best business requirement practices
Works closely with stakeholders and organizational change management to identify impacts to business processes as a result of system or application changes
Solution Design, Delivery & Risk
We are interested in hearing from people who possess…
Demonstrated delivery experience as Technical Business Analyst
Sound level of proficiency in key capabilities – IT SDLC processes, Agile delivery, written documentation/specification skills
Ability to engage and interact effectively with business stakeholders
Advanced SQL Server experience and skills
Elicitation of business goals and requirements, population of coherent prioritized portfolio and product features and backlogs
Ensure business needs are properly modelled, analysed and reflected and any impacts to benefit benefits are captured and agreed
Experience with data quality, data management and governance
Identify business requirements for enhancements to systems and/or business processes
Partake in reviews of business requirements and solution designs with relevant stakeholders and leadership to obtain agreement and sign off of proposals
Oversees the analysis, testing and deployment of the prioritized business requirements
Perform analysis of systems, data and processes, and conduct reviews of systems and processes to ensure continuous improvement, in both project and “Business as Usual” scenarios
Recommend changes to processes and systems, with measurable business benefits, based on current and future customer needs, industry trends and new technologies, knowledge of the system, analysis and performance and oversee the management and execution of any enhancements made
Complete relevant project work stream deliverables including quality control/sign off for area of accountability
Manage relationships with internal/external suppliers, where required
Financial Services Industry Experience (highly desirable)
From here you’ll go
This role is something you can really own and deliver. It will be a challenging and exciting opportunity that will be very rewarding throughout. If you are a Senior Technical Business Analyst with proven experience and interest in data specific projects, would love to hear from you. Apply today!
If you're already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest), you'll need to apply through Sidekick to submit a valid application. We’re keen to support you with the next step in your career.
We're aware of some accessibility issues on this site, particularly for screen reader users. We want to make finding your dream job as easy as possible, so if you require additional support please contact HR Direct on 1800 989 696.

Job Title: APAC Data Analytics and Enablement Lead, Assurance (Financial Services)
Job Description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

The opportunity

We are looking for an experienced Manager to join the APAC Financial Services Office (FSO) Digital Assurance team in our Sydney or Melbourne office to Lead a new virtual team of Data Analytics professionals across approximately 10 countries in the APAC region.

This role joins our Assurance Digital team to continue to build our data extraction and analytics capabilities for our digital audit initiatives. You will be using your ETL capabilities and project management experience to support obtaining external financial data for use by audit teams in a dynamic client facing data analytics team, whilst taking the lead on inspiring and fostering a community though a virtual environment across different geography, language and cultures in the APAC region.

Your key responsibilities

You will deliver results by using data analytics to deal with large, disparate volumes of data to assist your client group gain critical insights. Your ability to evaluate, identify and extract data from complex IT systems will ensure success in this role. You will have a chance to work with large/listed clients and the latest data systems to enjoy a truly rewarding and successful career at EY.

Some everyday responsibilities include:

Managing multiple stakeholders including, monitoring and reporting on local and Area activities and reporting against targets
Contribution to performance management and monitoring of local market teams
Deployment of global tools across the FSO Assurance APAC network
Contribution to certification of new solutions and UAT testing of Global solutions
Delivery of training both classroom and large-scale webcast
Helping audit teams and clients to identify and extract required data from complex IT systems
Extract and transform a variety of client financial data for use in our state of the art audit tools dedicated for audit data analytics in consultation with the audit teams
Self promote the extraction capabilities of the team to the business and meet market agreed targets for data extraction.
Using analytical and visualisation software to access, transform, integrate, analyse and visualise client data to help solve real problems and provide real business insights through identification of anomalies and unusual patterns and trends in data
Leading the local market team to manage and deliver on a portfolio of data extractions
Manage audit innovation projects and use programming tools/ robotics software to automate manual audit tasks for efficiency and cost savings
Work with local and APAC area wide counterparts to efficiently deliver standard and high quality data analysis
Develop systems skills on a range of client ERP/ financial systems
Analyse complex data including bespoke analysis
Identify opportunities for further work and areas of interest / added value to clients

Skills and attributes for success

We are looking for people with a mix of Business, Accounting and Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics skills.

Demonstrated ability to develop data mapping/data lineage documents and design the ETL process to extract data. Experience with any ETL tools like Alteryx and Monarch
Demonstrated ability to display complex quantitative data in a simple, intuitive format, and to present findings in a clear and concise manner. Experience with visualization tools preferred, including Spotfire, PowerBI and/or Tableau
Sound working knowledge of MS SQL Server/ SQL Server Integration Services and/or other database and analytical tools
Sound working knowledge of MS Excel and all MS Office Suite products
Experience with transactional data (loans, securities, deposits etc.), general ledger reconciliation a plus.
Project management experience – managing multiple projects with conflicting demands, timeframes and stakeholders
Strong writing and oral communication skills, including presentation & soft skills for communicating with senior management, working in project teams and with clients
Analytical skills working with financial and non-financial data
Influencing skills
Ability to confidently report on progress, key issues, blockers and success to leadership
Experience managing multiple stakeholders across geographies.

Ideally, you’ll also have

Experience with Python/ R or other programming languages is a plus
Experience with AI/RPA/Automation is a plus.
Experience of audit and financial accounting processes/systems preferred
Experience using data analytics for auditing purposes preferred.

What we offer

Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Continuous learning: personalised career development including coaching, experiences and formal learning so you’ll develop the mindset and skills you’ll need to thrive in the future.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

At EY, you’ll be rewarded and recognised based on your performance and our comprehensive benefits package can be tailored to your individual needs.

We hold a collective commitment to foster an environment where all differences are valued and respected, practices are equitable, and everyone experiences a sense of belonging. If you require any adjustments to the recruitment process in order to equitably participate, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application via contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or phone +61 3 8650 7788 (option 4).

Looking for a BI consultant with expereicne across SQL and SSRS for a intial six month contract with the view to extend.
Analyse user transactions and processes and research trends.
Gather and process structured and unstructured data, validate data quality, and develop and supporting data products.
Architect and implement the workflows with varying demands of throughput and latency.
Define and implement data stores based on customer requirements and system requirements.
Evaluate performance and take steps to optimise all parts of a given data stack and implementation.
Ensure data quality and implement tools and frameworks for automating the identification of data quality issues.
Recommend improvements to processes, technology, and interfaces that improve the effectiveness of the team and reduce technical debt.

12 month contract offering a variety of challenge, experiences and opportunities
Based in St Leonards with flexible work options offering work/life balance
Work for an organisation which is focused on delivering positive healthcare

Healius is an Australian publicly listed healthcare company providing of Pathology, Diagnostic Imaging and Day Hospital services. We share a mission to improve health and well-being for all, through a commitment to excellence in consumer-centred healthcare.

Based in St Leonards with flexible work options, this 12-month contract position will have working with the project team that is delivering our new Workforce Planning solution within our fast paced, large scale people business, during a time of growth and transformation.

Roles and responsibilities include:
Ensure user requirements are gathered, scoped and fully documented
Scope the existing environment and develop a plan that incorporates each practices requirements and processes
Effectively communicate changes to stakeholders and include in specification documents
Develop functional specifications within user requirements and promote clear direction to ensure effective design documentation is developed
Translate user requirements into user cases, models and diagrams that help develop concise documentation and testable requirements
Ensures user requirements, functional specifications and traceability matrices are kept accurate and up to date throughout the project lifecycle, including design, development and delivery.
Operating 2,200 pathology collection centres and 102 laboratories, 145 Imaging sites and 15 Day Hospitals, Healius employs close to 12,000 people across Australia.

What sets Healius people apart is their tremendous energy and enthusiasm for the healthcare sector and we are more focused than ever on creating a more engaged and collaborative working environment.

Further to this, on offer here is:
Variety of challenge, experiences and opportunities as you join a small team of that deliver high quality outcomes across a complex business environment
Both personal and professional development opportunities as you learn from experienced professionals, work closely with senior leaders and assist with delivering a key project
Flexible work arrangements offering work/life balance in an organisation with clear mission and values
Work for an organisation which is focused on delivering positive healthcare to all Australians
As an experienced Business Analyst, you will understand how to develop user requirements and functional specifications in a complex business environment and build functional specifications, test cases, test reports and operations procedures.

Further to this you will need:
Ability to understand data; transformation, mapping and cleansing rules and techniques
Configuring and running relevant software tools
Strong written, verbal and interpersonal communications skills
Ability to meet deadlines in a high-pressure, multi-stakeholder environment
Previous experience with Kronos Workforce Systems is desirable
